Reviews.Author: Stephy L.
Reviews.Content: The first few times that I came here, I all had a bad experience. However, since I have turned 21 and came upon their happy hour, I absolutely love this place! I am here like every week now due to happy hour for their food and drinks. I love their strawberry beer, so for anyone who doesn't really like beer and wants something sweet, I recommend trying it. It tastes like strawberry and you can't taste the beer. I always always get their truffle fries, not just one, but two each time I got with just my boyfriend. We also get their wings, traditional, firecracker style. It's amazing, I highly recommend trying it. We also love their sashimi. These three items, the sashimi, wings, and truffle fries fill up two hungry people! Do expect to wait for happy hour if you come on a Friday! Otherwise, Monday-Thursday is not too bad. I recommend getting there around 5:30pm so you have time to look over the menu and order. It is also not too early for dinner, since you can take your time eating and be done by 7pm! The night is still young to go out! Customer service is amazing here. All the times I have gone, I have gotten such wonderful service. Keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Author: Shauna S.
Reviews.Content: The Yard House probably wishes I'd take a few days to calm down to give them a review, but I'm going to be fair. Really, based on my experience last night alone, I would give them no stars, however because I was part of a large group, I will be a little more forgiving.I was part of a group of 12 (originally). They arrived around 6:15pm on a Wednesday night to get a table. I arrived with a friend at 7pm, and we ordered a beer from the bartender. That experience alone took much too long, but we laughed it off and waited with friends for a table. Around 8pm, I started to wonder what was going on, how long this would take. It was around this time that we had to add three people to our table reservation. I understand that once we added the extra people, there would be an extended wait. But we had already been waiting almost two hours. We didn't get a table until 9pm. When we sat down, my friend noticed there was a drip in the ceiling above her. It was dripping on her shirt, in her hair, and in her purse. There was a small puddle on the floor. I noticed a manager standing nearby, so I told him about the drip. He informed me that they were renovating the keg room above our heads, and that was probably causing the drip. And? He says to me, "there is an open seat at the end of your table, would you like me to move your friend to that seat?" Um...are you kidding? No. I would like you to do something about the drip. Eventually my friend suggested we just move the table over a few inches, which solved our problem.We ordered food, and FINALLY ate around 9:30pm (ahhhh I'm starving by this point). I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad and was completely not impressed. It was "good," to be fair. I had had it here once before, many years ago, and didn't remember a ginormous amount of fried onion string rings on the top of the salad. I mean, it literally looked like a whole side order, just dumped on top of my salad. It was almost disgusting how much of it there was. I removed them, and ate the salad, which was fine.My friend ordered the Poke appetizer, as she had before. When I finished eating, I noticed she had eaten everything off the plate except the poke. She said there was something off about it. Thankfully, when we told the server, she had it taken off the bill. A different manager (a female - very nice) came over to tell us that she was looking into it, and would take it off the bill. Honestly, by 1015 when we left, I was not very happy, and not satisfied. Shockingly, there were STILL people waiting for a table at that time on a WEDNESDAY night! Ugh. Not worth it. Especially with all the great restaurants on Santana Row. I wouldn't come here for anything other than a beer again.

Reviews.Author: Patricia G.
Reviews.Content: Second time visiting this place. The wait wasn't too long for a table seeing how it was a Saturday while the World Cup was playing. Once we were walked in to be seated though we saw many available tables. I don't know why don't use them instead of the "30-40" min wait which was closer to 15min. It was my husbands first visit so selecting a beer from the vast menu was fun. We ordered the steak and shrimp plate which they were very easy about switching grilled shrimp to a nice tempura fried one they have. I ordered a garlic noodle plate that came with crab shrimp and lobster. Honestly the seafood was good. It didn't have a string garlic taste which I was hoping and they throw more noodles on there than I'd like. But all in all pretty good service. Excellent food and they won the last star from us bc they noticed it was his birthday when they ID him so they brought a molten lava cake out.

Reviews.Author: Hanh T.
Reviews.Content: The food was mediocre; nothing special but nothing bad. It should be 2 stars, but 3 for the service. I got the beer sampler and hated all of it. It was too bitter for my liking.

Reviews.Author: Charis S.
Reviews.Content: nice. beautiful place and convenient location on the Row. Besides, the restaurant opens until 11ish at night which is awesome for a bunch of friends to hangout. Pretty dark room lights and always hella packed maybe not my fav parts.

Reviews.Author: Subeo V.
Reviews.Content: Yard house is so far my favorite bar, i love all of their appertizer. The rose garden beer smells great and tatse perfect. I tried all of the cocktails, and only do not like Southern bells. The steak is also very juicy. Even though there is always a long line, but i am always craving for their garlic noodles and calamari. Love them!!

Reviews.Author: Jae L.
Reviews.Content: The beer is good of course. Food is mediocre. But the service sucks.

Reviews.Author: ID X.
Reviews.Content: This place is always a hit or miss. I decided to give it another try and it was really good. But I went again and it was beyond terrible. I really enjoyed their lobster garlic noodles but unfortunately when I went again it was tasteless and disgusting. I don't know why they cannot set a high standard for their customers. Servers are either nice or seriously rude. A lot of them look like they hate their job and will mug you as you eat. I won't be back.. I don't wanna pay for a hit or miss 50/50 chance experience.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie R.
Reviews.Content: This place is almost always on point! Large food and beer menu which is always great! Strawberry beer is one of my favs! Food: Cuban sandwich Chicken lettuce wrapsGarlic noodles Crab cakes Their whole Gardein menu is AMAZING. Totally taste like meat, but none in it!I love coming here, but stay clear on game days if you don't like big crowds! If you do, it's a fun time to come!

Reviews.Author: Shannon P.
Reviews.Content: I had the vodka shrimp pasta with the truffle fries. I also tried the Moscow mule drink. Tasted kind of like a mojito, minty and nice. The pasta was pretty good too, pretty flavorful and buttery. The truffle fries were great and service was good. Great place to drink. I love the appetizers!

Reviews.Author: Kim D.
Reviews.Content: We came here during happy hour from 3pm - 6pm on a weekday. We ordered Kung pap calamari: love it, something totally different than the normal fried calamari that I normally see. The spicy thai chicken pizza was really good. Blue crab cake, boneless wings and chicken garlic noodle which was our least favorite, it was plain and we had better elsewhere.The environment here is good, service is great.

Reviews.Author: Maria O.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on the Yard House to celebrate our 24th anniversary dinner as it reminded us of the establishment with the same name in Long Beach (of the same affiliation, I believe). I had the pan seared ahi tuna and it was heavenly! My husband had the parmesan crusted chicken and he absolutely loved it. I had the Black Orchid martini, and although I find it too sweet for my taste, it complimented my entree. My husband's mango mojito, on the other hand, was surprisingly refreshingly delish. If you're looking for a more intimate ambience, this is not it. This place is hopping. Will definitely go back, although I hope we get another server. Our server was talked too fast and we feel quite on the impatient side. Didn't even ask my husband if he wanted dessert!

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: I love Yard House!I mostly go when it's happy hour to have their yard size cider beers and happy hour food. The first time I went I got raspberry cider beer with chicken nachos, sushi and wings and everything was delicious. I sat at the bar which wasn't too long of a wait if you don't get there on time usual one person can sit down untill sits start to clear. This yard house kind of has a strange waiting area it's not big enough which makes crowding near the door. There's alot of shopping and good stores nearby. You can even probably have dinner here and then go to other bars nearby.

Reviews.Author: Anh T.
Reviews.Content: The drinks are awesome. There's literally something here for everyone. I got the black xantus. It's seriously is like liquid chocolate. I really like that there are seasonal drinks which means there's something here for everyoneI had the cuban sandwich and it was SO GOOD. It had a dip like a french dip sandwich which complemented the sandwich very well. I was so full at that point though because we all had appetizers. On the kids menu, the mac and cheese was way lacking. I've had better from a box. I asked for curly fries and some how the server heard garlic fries. I got charged an extra dollar for fries i didn't wanted. When we mentioned it to him he said, "we don't have curly fries here". Lame.

Reviews.Author: Gill P.
Reviews.Content: Great Beer huge selection on tap. Great for adults and kids. Ambiance with a nice modern feel

Reviews.Author: Karm P.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Choices of beeeaa especially when u got a 100 of them  haha come check this place out in Santana rowhas good beer, drinks and Food.......J.P is an awesome server very helpful and overall a nice guy.

Reviews.Author: Adrian V.
Reviews.Content: For someone that doesn't drink beer, you would think it wouldn't be a good idea to go to a place known for its large selection of beers.  But their excellent menu of American fusion cuisine makes it any enjoyable visit for even those non beer drinkers.  Plus, they have vodka so what's there to complain about.  First, I love the location of this YH.  Located in the heart of Santana Row and across the street from Valley Faire, you can make it a day of upscale shopping before enjoying a some exceptional food.  It has a very casual atmosphere but it does tend to get a little busy at times.  I went there for lunch and I was able to snag a seat at the bar.  But the next day we went for a late dinner, and we waited about an hour for a table.  On both occasions the wait staff didn't seemed to be overwhelmed and still attentive contrary to the other YH I have been to.Great food, great location and great atmosphere makes the YH a must visit when in the area.

Reviews.Author: Ellen H.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It is usually busy so that is the down side but the meals and beer selection is phenomenal.I get the carnitas street tacos with spicy rice and beans. It is a great portion and well presented.We also tried the cheese dip, it was a great start to the meal but they do skimp on the chips.Our server Laura was very attentive and so sweet. She made sure we had a great dining experience from beer tasting to how our day had been.. We shall return for our go-to meals!

Reviews.Author: Jaimee A.
Reviews.Content: The main reason for my attendance at yard house is their happy hour! They have great deals on their food and drinks! I'm not much of a beer drinker and only like fruity beers or pale ales. They have this great strawberry beer and watermelon beer. Great for summer! Their foods are American fusion and are reasonable when it comes to happy hour.The quality of their food isn't that great so I wouldn't come here to pay regular prices. The service is also so-so. I've had really attentive waiters and not so attentive. For instance, when I came with a group of girlfriends we ordered our first round that took forever. When some of my friends asked for a second round, it took a while again. I accidentally dropped my utensils on the floor when the food arrived and when I asked our waitress multiple times for another set she forgot. I ended up grabbing a clean set from a nearby table. Better quality food and better service would keep me coming back

Reviews.Author: Hen A.
Reviews.Content: santana row location...new and glorious modern interior...steel, glass and wood...smell of beer in the spacious airy inner...no happy hour on saturday...meaning no crowds...sweet potato fries golden crispy deliciousness...truffle fries cut extra skinny and crispy...truffle flavors and herbs good...deschutes black butte and rogue dead guy next.. $6 to over $7 beer goblets...blue moon mimosa for the ladies...drink prices adding up fast and furious warning...good place to people watch and socialize....grab a snack and a drink...no more beer by the yard..thank goodness...such a big mess anyways...half yards still available

Reviews.Author: Megan P.
Reviews.Content: I always like the Yard House because they have a menu that can satisfy any group. Their beer and food selection is large and the happy hour specials are a great deal. Coming with a group and sharing a bunch of appetizers during HH works out nicely since you get a lot of food at a good price.This particular location is always packed since it's on Santana Row but the service is usually friendly and pretty fast once you are seated. I usually come here for an early dinner or late lunch to avoid the long wait. Yes it's a chain but they consistently are good so I will continue to come here.

Reviews.Author: Lucy D.
Reviews.Content: Happy Hour: the appetizers and drinks make for a great and cheap meal.Service: the people working here always are energetic and is extremely helpful to all their patrons in picking out food and beers that compliment your food choice.Drinks: the selection of alcoholic beverage is great, they have a wide selection to fit any person alcoholic taste bud. I love how they have the manly beers and fruity drinks for the ladies.Food: Surprisingly the food is just as good as the drinks. At my first visit, I thought I would be getting deep fried bar food like Applebee's but Yardhouse offered a more fancier servings of typical american comfort foods. The Mac and Cheeese in particular is delicious.Cons:Wait times: if you go on weekends it really takes about 30 minutes to an 1 and half to get seated. And unfortunately they don't they accept reservations even if you have a large group.

Reviews.Author: Peter N.
Reviews.Content: Monday and we are currently waiting for our food, it's been 30 minutes. I wish tyrone was waiting us because this guy is not going to get a tip.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Decent. It was as good as I expected.Got the truffle fries, mac and cheese, and moscow muleThe fries were good, but could have used more truffle flavorMoscow mule was greatMac and cheese was cheesy and good. Could have used a bit more meat though

Reviews.Author: Lynn A.
Reviews.Content: Being freshly 21 - my friend and I decided to drop by for happy hour yesterday. We got a few drinks like the timmermans strawberry beer and the honey kolsh. I really enjoyed the strawberry beer - it was light and easy. The honey kolsh had a bittersweet taste to it but was also pretty light compared to other beers. We also ordered three appetizers - fried calamari, the onion ring tower and the blue crab cakes. Huge portions on the first two - but the crabs cakes only came with two pieces and reminded me of overpriced chicken nuggets. I would have given four stars if it wasn't for the service. Our server who shall remain unnamed was unprofessional to say the least. After we were seated, he asked if he could get us anything and we said two waters to get started. That took about ten minutes - seeing that it wasn't busy at all, I found that an unreasonably long amount of time.  He also failed to inform us about the happy hour specials.  He checked our IDs after we ordered our drinks and commented that I had JUST turned 21 with a blank expression after staring at my ID for quite some time. Our server was also unfamiliar with the menu - being that it was our first time there, we didn't know that the strawberry beer didn't come in half yards - but apparently he didn't know that either because he came back to the table after another 10 minutes to inform us that it wasn't available in half yards. Speaking of coming to our table - he came to check and chatted with us once. He did however come by stare at us about five times without saying a word. I don't know if this is a norm for servers here but we felt kind of uncomfortable with him doing so. We also had to ask for our waters to be refilled while we noticed that other servers would just come up to other tables to refill their water glasses. When it comes down to it, the food was great, the drinks were good, but the service definitely needs to be adjusted.

Reviews.Author: Nisha G.
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed in this place. My husband was very excited to go here for his birthday because of the great beer selection that we heard that they had. When we got there they put our name down on the list but couldn't seat us till all of the party arrived (total of 14) which is fine as long as we were on the list. 10 minutes later everyone was there so I went in to let them know that we had all arrived and they told me it would be about 2 hrs and even at that we were not guaranteed a table. Why the hell would we stay there for 2 hrs or longer and not know if we would ever get a table??  Why not let us know the first time I went in there that they would not be able to take a large group. Why waste our time. I could have tried to find somewhere else to eat instead of having everyone go there. In the end it all worked out great.....we went across the street to "The Cheesecake Factory!"If you do go here make sure you make a reservation or you will be waiting 2 hrs too!!!

Reviews.Author: Ana Silvia V.
Reviews.Content: Great place for groups. Nice atmosphere. The traditional chicken wings are the best I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: M P.
Reviews.Content: Last night a group of us went to Yard House to  celebrate my friend's birthday. We were all looking forward to it. There was a bit of a wait which was no problem we just got some drinks at the bar in the mean time. We got seated shortly after and the bartender told my friend she could transfer over her bar tab to the table. Super convenient, right? Well this is where the night takes a turn for the worst.The waitress says they can't find the tab and this is an ongoing battle for about 20 minutes or so while she and her manager look for it. The waitress tells us she gave the bar tab to the manager and the manager lost it. We offer to tell her our drinks (after my friend had already told her the name our tab was under AND gave the waitress her credit card AGAIN) so she can add them to the tab but she says not to worry about it, it's 'good karma' coming back and we don't have to pay for the drinks. AWESOME! We're stoked especially since it's my friend's birthday and that's an added bonus. However, an hour later the waitress comes back and says the manager found the tab and now we have to pay for it. WHAT? That's absurd. You can't say our drinks are free and then renege on that an hour later. That's horrible customer service. You as a manager should deal with it and realize it was your mistake and deal with the repercussions. If you say your customers drinks are free, don't come back a ridiculous amount of time later and say "oh jk! you have to pay!" especially on someone's birthday.This ruined our whole Yard House experience which is a shame because I grew up going to the Yard House in Long Beach, CA every year for my birthday! I looked forward to it every year. But this definitely makes me think twice about going to Yard House now. Not only did you ruin my friends birthday but left a bad taste in my mouth when it comes to this restaurant. I don't know if I'll ever return. Unlikely. Shame since the food always delivers. It's not the food that keeps people coming back, though, it's good customer service.

Reviews.Author: Vee L.
Reviews.Content: I think I'm addicted to the chicken strips and truffle fries. The sweet potato fries are bomb toooo! The maple bacon whatever sauce that goes with the sweet potato fries is delicioussssss. I usually come here only during happy hour with my friends. Pretty much everything on the happy hour menu is pretty good. I've never not liked anything I'd ordered here. So far I've tried all the fries, street tacos, poke, lettuce wraps, california roll, turkey pot pie, sliders, mac n cheese, calamari, and so much more I can't remember right now. If you order the pot pie, you probably want to share it with someone. I like eating family style here since the portions are so big. It gets pretty busy on the weekends, so expect a long wait.I've also always had good service here and I've never had a problem with anything. It's a great place to come hang out with your friends before or after shopping in SRow.

Reviews.Author: Linh D.
Reviews.Content: Do you love beer? If yes, this place has over 100 beers on tap and the food here is delicious. If its your first time here, ask your sever/bartender how to read the beer menu. All the beer are put into their beer family which is great. So if you like wheat beers, all the wheat beer are in one section. The been menu also tell you the alochol percentage and who makes the beer. FYI you can have two free samples of beers. Happy Hour 3pm-6pm Monday-Friday or 10pm-close Sunday-Thursday nights. With half off on certain appetizers, this is a win. Their chicken fingers, onion rings, nachos, and calamari are really good. If you like burgers, try the pepper crusted gorgonzola burger. It topped with mushroom, onion and baby spanish.

Reviews.Author: Katherine N.
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Yard House restaurants in Southern California. It's my go-to spot for happy hour because of the awesome selection and prices (1/2 off select appetizers, pizzas, and drinks). However, this location doesn't stack up and it's disappointing to have to give it a 2-star rating. 2.5 stars would be more accurate but Yelp doesn't do half star ratings (yet). After catching a movie, I came here for dinner with friends on a Friday night. My party of 4 anticipated a looong wait. It turned out to be a a little over an hour, which is not so bad when you're at Santana Row and you have good company to pass the time with. However, once inside, we were seated at a table close to the bar and had a near-impossible time hearing each other and our waiter. I was really hoping for a booth but they were all full. Throughout the night, I felt like I was at a concert and I'm pretty sure I sounded like a broken record saying "WHAT??" a million times. Maybe I'm just getting old but this place is a few decibels too loud at night. I never had this issue when I went to the Yard House location in Irvine or Newport for dinner though. As for the actual service, it was alright--the place was super packed so our waiter didn't check up on us as often as I'd like--but it was definitely marred by the noise level. At least one thing is constant from location to location and that's the food. If you don't go during happy hour, it's a bit pricey $$. For appetizers, we shared the fried calamri, bearnaise sliders, and ahi sashimi. We also ordered a bbq chicken pizza and lobster garlic noodles! I especially enjoyed the lobster garlic noodles and would also highly recommend ordering the garlic truffle tries if you like flavorful, shoe-string fries. I didn't order a drink this time but I usually opt for the Southern Belle. This is the only Yardhouse near me but I'm not sure if I'll be returning to this specific location unless it's during happy hour or some random time during the week. Definitely a let-down compared to my past visits. P.S. Bathrooms here were well-maintained from what I saw and reminded me of a Nordstrom's bathroom!

Reviews.Author: Rachel W.
Reviews.Content: I went to Yard House with a group of 8 this evening. We put in our names at 7:45 for a table and were eventually seated at 8:55. The wait wasn't too bad, considering we had a big group and it was a Friday night.I ordered one pint of the strawberry beer and one of the watermelon. Oh my god, the strawberry beer was amazing! My table shared a plate of nachos, which was huge. I got a cup of the chicken tortilla soup and a small Thai noodle salad. Both tasted great, and I couldn't even finish the noodle salad after my drinks and soup! I can't wait to come back here during happy hour when the appetizers/small dishes are discounted.The service I experienced was pretty good. The hostesses could be a little more friendly but our server, Christine, was fantastic. She was super accommodating when we had 2 more people show up  to join our table (because Yard House is extremely weird about that, apparently).Overall: 4 stars for the food, 3 for the pricing/value, 2 for the wait, 5 for our waitress.

Reviews.Author: Shin L.
Reviews.Content: Fast service, great food quality, and love their beer!!We came at around 830ish so there's only five min wait :) Four person shared a pizza, pasta and a salad, with truffle fries and fried calamaries.Except that our server don't really know how to recommend when I asked him...

Reviews.Author: Ruby R.
Reviews.Content: Update 06/15/2014: Went back for father's day. Our server Samantha (Sammy) was super nice, welcoming and very attentive. The food is always great as usual. The portions are HUGE!!! Had the BBQ chicken salad, pizza, burger,s turkey sandwich, garlic fries....yummy... I would like the thank the manager for taking all the feedback and working with his staff on it. Update: The manager was very gracious and resolved the issue based on the feedback. It's nice to know they care about service and their customer. Very professional.

Reviews.Author: Philana C.
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints on the food whatsoever , that sh*t is bomb ! This review really goes to the service who was super irritating lol obviously it's  a hot spot of SJ so I already expected it will be a lengthy wait ( 1hr 45mins ). What REALLY got me was I put my name down on the list ,  lady told me we can walk around and come back in 45 okay fine ... Totally came back to check the stats and this beezy can't even find our party let alone my name  wth yard house I really wanted your truffle fries!  So we ended up going to a different place in the area, it just started to get ridiculous and burned hella time in our night, especially when my friend/date had a flight to catch in a few hours.

Reviews.Author: Melanie R.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times, but I think I'll write about my most recent experience.I went here Saturday evening last weekend with my boyfriend. He owed an "apology" dinner to me. I chose Yardhouse.I ordered what I think was the Southwest Turkey Melt which had melted cheese, turkey and jalapenos on a crisp bread with your choice of a kind of fries. I added on a caesar salad for $3.25 and ordered the truffle fries for my boyfriend.The sandwich was perfect. The only thing I could ask for differently is more jalapenos. But it was amazing as is.The salad was great, with ground parmesan and little baked cheese squares along with the croutons. Those cheese squares MADE the salad. I also got a sparkling raspberry cocktail. It was sweet and delicious, but not that weak either. I'd get it again. My boyfriend ordered a burger of some kind and strawberry beer. He downed both with no leftovers besides my truffle fries he couldn't finish.I had half my meal leftover for the next day and it was still delicious, except for the salad. But duh, salad doesn't really save well.I really like Yardhouse. The food is good, the drinks are good, and the atmosphere is upscale. Beautfiul.

Reviews.Author: Minu M.
Reviews.Content: We went to this place for our girls night. It was a friday and we had to wait 50 mins before we got a table. The choice of menu items is expansive and the vegetarians in our group also had ample choice.We got coconut shrimp as an appetizer, extremely expensive for the 3 pieces of shrimp they served. It would have been $$$ well spent had the shrimp been exceptional, unfortunately they were not.Our table also got deviled eggs, grilled artichoke. None were good enough to knock our socks offI got the house favorite chicken bowl with veggies and rice. It was just brown rice topped with some undercooked meat and veggies. It lacked flavor and after 5 spoons I decided not to ruin my evening further and got the leftovers packed. One of my friends got chicken sandwich which I got to sample. It was undoubtedly one of the best sandwiches I had. Copious amounts of butter might be the reason for it but who cares ? ;) Also, the sandwich is the reason for me to rate this place at 3 stars instead of 2. But my other friends had an even worse experience with their dishes. To find that a spicy thai pizza can be sweet did not go down well with them.

Reviews.Author: Raymond L.
Reviews.Content: Far too many people in line so I had to come back when it wasn't as crowded. I think the food is a little over-rated but I had a good time. The food is pretty good and well as the drinks. I enjoyed the atmostphere and the staff more than I did the food. I woud come here again if they could figure out how to keep the lines moving faster.

Reviews.Author: Sierra W.
Reviews.Content: Whenever my best friend and I go to yard house, we like to order soups, buffalo wings to split, and mac and cheese to split. Sometimes I love their mac and cheese and sometimes it's just OK- depending on who the chef is that day. They make their mac and cheese with different pastas and cheeses along with chicken, bacon, mushrooms, and truffle oil. Almost everything is better with truffle oil. And to top it off- bread crumbs. The wings are packed with flavor along with their soups. I recommend to show up early so you don't have to wait for over an hour.

Reviews.Author: Maggie X.
Reviews.Content: I've been here two or three times, and I just don't get the hype for this place. It's allllllright, and I understand that being located in an ambiance-driven strip like Santana Row can allow an establishment to get away with a lot, but the high prices and lackluster service is somewhat frustrating.Yard House is located towards the opening of Santana Row, and the inside has dim sports bar lighting complete with quite a few flat-screens. It can be dressed either up or down, so you'll get the casual sportswear as well as formal dinnerwear. They're famous for their half and full yards of beer, as well as their extensive beer selection. It's always crowded here, and the wait time never seems to be under an hour at nighttimes. They don't take reservations for weekend dinner dining, which makes no sense to me. I'd understand if they took reservations but imposed a strict deadline, say ten minutes after the reserved time or whatnot. But to not take reservations at all? We had a party of about twenty people, and the lack of being able to reserve was daunting, especially because we were doing a birthday celebration. The bar area also stresses me out to no end. There are bar seats all around, but it's always full. There's no designated place to order, so you have to squeeze in between people eating their food to try and flag down a bartender. Plus it takes at least fifteen minutes to flag anyone down, ever. I feel like it's worse when you're in your early twenties as well, since the bartenders (and waiters, for that matter) treat you as if you're not as important as the older patrons, and it takes such a long time for any attention. Maybe they've had bad experiences from younger parties before, but for an upscale place, that kind of service every single time is just tiring. The beer selection is pretty impressive, and the mixed drinks (especially mules, I think they're called?) were pretty good. Happy hour food is pretty standard, nothing memorable. Maybe the non-happy hour fare is better, as I've been told, but having my cortisol levels shoot up every time I think of Yard House doesn't really make me want to rush back.

Reviews.Author: Theresa P.
Reviews.Content: Very popular place so make sure you go in early or you'll probably have a long wait.  Wait was about an hour for a party of two Thursday night.  Food was great quality and dessert was very yummy.  However, service was really bad.  I'm sure the waitstaff works hard bc it's a hotspot but talk about service without a smile.  I know it's a challenging job but it's important to know that your role  makes the absolute difference in the dining experience for patrons.  Legacy will live where You may not remember how good the food was but they will always remember how you've made them feel.

Reviews.Author: Adam J.
Reviews.Content: I have been craving Yard House ever since I left Southern California. I came here on a Sunday and it did not disappoint. I had a funny, ecstatic waitress that was fun and very informative. I love their appetizers: +Onion Ring Tower+Spinach Dip +Ahi Tuna+PokeCan't go wrong here.

Reviews.Author: Spencer T.
Reviews.Content: This was a disaster. The place is packed like a concert venue and because of that there is a ridiculous amount of background noise. I could barely hear the waiter and the other people at my table. On top of this,  we found a large chunk of old food in one of our water glasses, just absolutely disgusting. The waiter didn't really address this issue, but a cook did come by at a later point. He said 'Sorry,  our dishwasher is broken, we've been having a lot of similar problems'.  The implication here was that all the dishes were essentially not washed properly, that is just totally disgusting.  We left,  and I can say with confidence that I will never eat at the Yard House again.  Save your money and time,  this place isn't worth it,  enjoy one of the countless high tier restaurants in Santana Row (e.g. Pasta pomodoro) that don't serve food on unwashed dishes..

Reviews.Author: Ally T.
Reviews.Content: Love getting the black orchid (cocktail) and the garlic lobster noodles were delish! I also enjoy the ahi tuna tower, onion rings, blue crab cakes, and spinach cheese dip. Great place to stop by for drinks and dinner after a couple hours of shopping!

Reviews.Author: Michelle R.
Reviews.Content: Lunch on a Sunday. 5 stars to the staff for being so kid friendly:*seated us quickly*easily accommodated our double stroller*took orders from the kid's menu first*brought our toddler her food as soon as it was ready*consistently attentive *noticed other servers happily interacting with other active toddlers and young children throughout the restaurant Minus one star* the food. I've been to many a Yard House and the food is always just meh. Had the tomato soup and BBQ chicken pizza combo which was fine but forgettable. I did appreciate that our leftovers were packed for us and clearly labeled with the date. In any case, I will definitely be back when in need of a family friendly meal at the Row.

Reviews.Author: Anitha C.
Reviews.Content: This is the place where some things are great and some things not so great.I would really give it a 3.5.I love love love their tomato soup..it is creamy, it is tasty and honestly I am happy to go there just to have the soup and grilled cheese.The have a lot of vegetarian options especially if you are into the fake meat scene. My husband isn't a huge fan but he still loves their burgers and pastas.What i don't like is the long wait outside and most of the time the long wait after being seated for the menu, water and the food.By the time you leave you feel like you have spend the entire evening just waiting to eat... but I guess it is Santana Row.I think the smart choice would be to go at lunch!

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this location many times but my visit today left me a little angry. Food was great and everything tasted wonderful. The thing that pissed me off this time around is that when the bill came I was charged for the dinner portion pasta which is almost a ten dollar difference. At the time when I was ordering I was never asked what size I wanted, I came at 11:30 am so I assumed they would give me and also charge me for the lunch size. I have never ordered pasta here before so I wasn't sure what to expect. Needless to say I'm satisfied with the food but the servers should really double check with the customer when it comes to lunch and dinner portions. I ended up paying for the full $19 dinner portion since my server was nowhere to be found after dropping the check off. I won't be returning for the pasta anytime soon. And make sure to double check your bill!!

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here a handful of times and this may be a place just to go and drink and NOT eat. They have so many different types of beers that it is difficult to choose from. It is around an hour wait during the evening weekends. There's a bunch of people cussing like crazy at their tables while drinking and watching the games. The waiting area is small and the servers constantly ask you to get out of the way.      I am unfamiliar about any type of exotic beers, but I wanted to try something new so I asked my server to surprise me with a beer that is not dark or bitter and he accommodated me very nicely. I ordered the tacos and they were disgusting. The rice it came with did not go good with tacos, the beans it came with was a mix up of a bunch of different stuff, also gross. The tacos were pretty nasty, nothing like tacos at a taqueria in terms of taste. The other time i ordered a steak which was okay, it's difficult to mess up a regular steak.     I ordered a snakebite which is supposed to be a Guinness(dark) on top and a pear beer(clear) on the bottom, another guy who was not our waiter gives us "their version" of a snakebite. He repeats that this IS a snakebite. I tell him "i don't want this, this isn't what I thought it would be." He then rolls his eyes like he is going to lose money by me not taking it. Then my original waiter comes by and explains how Yard House is dumb by making a snakebite something different from everyone else, and is very polite about it.     Overall I would not come to Yard House for the food. Eat somewhere else, come for three half yard beers and enjoy the company at the bar, or converse with a buddy at a table with some drinks, then eat again somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Susan T.
Reviews.Content: Try the Moscow mules! They are the best I have ever had. Great cocktails and appetizers. Happy hour is amazing if you can make it in time. Half priced appetizers. The spinach cheese dip is pretty unique as it's served with pita chips instead or tortilla. And the shrimp rice bowl is nutritious and does not lack flavor. I'd say all around pretty yummy.

Reviews.Author: Shannen R.
Reviews.Content: This review is looooong overdue and I finally decided to give my piece of mind about this place.My husband and I came on a weekday to get our grub on and to quench our thirst with awesome beer. We walk in, waited about 20 minutes or so, and got seated. We were seated in the corner and it was extremely hot. We asked one of the waitresses that were passing by if we could just sit in one of the vacant tall tables. She had a disgusting look on her face and said, "Really? That's the best seat in the house." My husband said, "This is your best seat just cause the cushions form a half moon shape? YOU sit here and tell me if its oddly hot. There's no ventilation WHATSOEVER. All she could say after that was, "well let me ask my manager" and stormed off.You really have to ask your manager if we can move seats?! On top of it all... the place wasn't even packed so I don't see what the big deal is! Because of that day,  we have never gone back. Yes, yardhouse, maybe you should teach your waiters/waitresses some manners since their parents never taught them any.And guess what you guys?! You aren't the only brewhouses here in San Jose. Rock Bottom Brewery is now my fav go to spot!

Reviews.Author: Jenalys C.
Reviews.Content: I ordered to go .. I wanted some noodles and they were deliciousness. I love pretty much all of their asiany appetizers. Butttt they forgot my dessert in my order and now I'm sitting around with a sweet tooth . Bummer.

Reviews.Author: Brittany C.
Reviews.Content: Love thier happy hour!We always get a half yard and some calamari. Be careful when its a game day, gets very crowded ay the bar. Service is always great! Parking is very close and lots of other bars or shopping in the area.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen N.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I'm getting all of the good servers or what, but I love this place!I've been here on numerous occasions from my birthday which included a party of 20 to just a casual lunch date with my boyfriend and I've had great service every single time!The food is amazing. I recommend the Shrimp Penne Vodka or the Spicy Tuna Roll or the Surf & Turf burger. To DIE for! Also, they have an amazing selection of house cocktails! The Sweet Tart is my personal fave! It tastes exactly like the candy! Also, their beer selection is through the roof. Just go and you'll see what I mean.I would recommend this place all day, every day! But try to go for Happy Hour! Half off most appetizers and 6.50 for house cocktails and you could get a half yard of beer for as cheap as 7.50! So worth it!Honorable mentions for servers are Penny and Deanne(I think that's how you spell it). They were on point and some of the best servers I've ever had!

Reviews.Author: Cristal R.
Reviews.Content: If you dont mind throwing in a couple extra bucks for great quality food and service than Yardhouse is the place to be.I've been here on numerous occasions and even a few birthday parties and I still keep comjng back for more. Let me explain why.Setting: Dim lighting enhances the ambiance for a nice casual dinner (on game days beware, it gets REALLY loud but why not? Go Sharks!)Food: AMAZING!  I cant stress enough how the food is so good! ( but than again it better be for the price). A must try is there truffle fries, I literally cant have a good meal without having these guys on the side. My favorite appetizer is the Ahi Tuna Poke Stack, so refreshing and leads on to the main course. My favorite entrees are the Seared Halibut with Bok Choy and Mashed Potatoes and the Jambalaya.Drinks: They have every imaginable beer on tap! BONUS POINTS!Happy Hour? Yes! half off on well drinks, halfyards, and appetizers.

Reviews.Author: Yaseman K.
Reviews.Content: I usually come here on friday or saturday nights with my friends, and its really crowded. Its a really cool atmosphere and we love coming here. Their pizzas and sweet potato fries are delicious! I love their food, its really good and theres a lot to choose from. Their desserts are definitely worth trying. Peach cobbler is a must!

Reviews.Author: Ramandeep K.
Reviews.Content: Great place, good food. But VERY crowded, has a long wait. Even the call ahead wait list takes for ever.But still its a cool fun place to go. If you like sports, they got tons of TV's all over the bar and around the place. Beer on tap has great choices. Will always repeat.

Reviews.Author: Steve P.
Reviews.Content: Ate here late one night with large group from work as a team event. Great service an food was prettty goid. The downside was the very loud music. Are people no longer suppose to talk in restaurants  anymore?  Of course wall to wall TV's. It a sports bar of sorts but for group dinner way to loud.

Reviews.Author: Trung N.
Reviews.Content: A less than exceptional experience contributed to the lack of accommodations for large groups. Unless you're going with a group of 4 or less, just don't even bother. The wait will be ridiculously long, and the fact they won't take reservations for large groups made my experience even worse.I am actually here at the moment.. writing this review at the restaurant completely frustrated that the table my party is waiting on is being occupied by rude patrons who are just sitting there. They had finished their meal well over an hour ago and just conversing and taking up valuable space. I arrived here at 6:30pm. It is now 7:50pmHere I am with a much larger group with all of us upset and starving. We had a good portion of our group even leave already due to their frustration and they could not wait any longer. I guess our business isn't that important to them if they can't do anything to fix this issue. No idea why I'm still waiting.. perhaps going to give them a chance to display how their food and service is I guess. I'll update the review after that.Update (4 hrs after arriving): decided to cram our now smaller party into a smaller area, because the other rude party is STILL THERE essentially loitering around. Oh yeah... I arrived here 4 HOURS AGO. That other party?.. apparently they've been there for SEVEN HOURS.. and they still haven't shown any indication of leaving any time soon.. HELLO?!? RUDE!!??!!?!?! WTF?!Also ordered food now at least. Yeah.. if the other rude party wasn't loitering around we would've been seated hours ago. BTW, we are down to 16 people because of people in our group had to go. We originally had 30 people planned.Update 2: now 8:57pm. Rude party finally left. Whatever.. Damage is already done. They made the restaurant lose patrons, money, and cost them a great deal of business from larger groups such as I originally had.Final Update: bumped up one star for exceptional service under the circumstances. the food was also a plus and came out delicious. not much else to add for the experience. Horrific wait with rude people.. and sadly the restaurant suffers from that even though their service and food are pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Christopher R.
Reviews.Content: Great food! Excellent selection of drinks. Service was slow, yet it was busy and they explained and apologized throughout. Overall, worth going to.

Reviews.Author: Alan H.
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I came here to get some drinks and I wanted to start off this review with a big shoutout to the bartenders Adam, Justin, and Brian. Excellent knowledge of the drinks as well as pairings and suggestions, and very friendly and were able to keep up a conversation even if the bar was busy. Great work, hope to see them again next time.The food here is excellent. Ordered a rare-cooked Pepper-Crusted Gorgonzola burger paired with truffle fries, with double patties as suggested by Adam. Delicious! Couldn't finish the whole thing, I'll stick with the "kiddy-size" next time, Adam!Started off with a half yard of Black Velvet, and not a Snakebite, which was also corrected by Adam, and then followed it with a Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier Dunkel (what a mouthful, can't even pronounce it myself) as suggested by Justin to pair with my burger.Overall, the food was great, the setting and service is excellent. However, be careful with the drinks, as it'll drive up quite a tab by the time you're finished. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Charles L.
Reviews.Content: This has been my first Yard House experience where I was rushed to leave. Granted, we were there right before closing but I've never been rushed out so early. Food portions were smaller than my usual Yard House in Pasadena, too.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy Z.
Reviews.Content: I love the food and beer at the Yardhouse.  The service is also quite good.  But the location makes this place a nightmare to get into.

Reviews.Author: Brandon M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner on a random Thursday night & it was surprisingly packed! Waited for over 30 minutes for a seat, but no complaints....We were told before hand what the wait was, so you can't really get mad..Happy hour ends at 6 & we got there at 8 so we went directly for their dinner option. Staff: Helpful Waiter broke down the whole menu for us & his personal favorites. Food: Got to us rather quickly. It was 2 of us so we decided to split their sweet potato fries under their "snack" section (just a smaller portioned appetizer basically..)It came with this maple infused bacon mayo sauce to dip in. Which was alrightttttt, waiter hyped it up a bit much. It was good, but it wasn't nothing to die over.Sweet potato fries were kinda mushy but with the dipping sauce it worked. Main Course i got the "PEPPER CRUSTED GORGONZOLA Burger"  it came with:marsala sautéed crimini mushrooms, caramelized onions and baby spinach with fries& waiter told us for just $1 extra we can upgrade our regular fries that came with the meal to truffle fries UMM? YES!. .So of course i had to do that. Burger was heavily seasoned with i believe it was "Montreal Steak seasoning" or something along that line because the flavor was distinguishable. Quality cut of meat with a high but also was the fat content, bun was soaked in the burgers juices. Just an overall really rich meal. - Burger is kind of small just beware. It's about the size of a InNout double double. Maybe a tad bit smaller to be honest..Truffle fries: Delicious, they use shoe string fries which was the only downfall, they toss the fries in Parmesan cheese & then they infuse the truffle oil into the toss according to the waiter. If you haven't had truffle oil before it's an acquired, very strong flavor. Almost get kind of nauseous after eating all of it. Place honestly doesn't really have a negative for me. I had a great experience & would do it again.

Reviews.Author: Amanda K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a low-key kind of "celebratory" late dinner with my housemates and girlfriend. We called in and put our name down for our party of 4, which we were pleasantly surprised we could even do at a busy restaurant like Yard House. When we got there, we were seated within 3-5 minutes! Awesome! (:For drinks, my girlfriend and I shared a raspberry cider (sooo yummy, tastes like juice lol), timmerman's strawberry (my housemate's fave and she first tried it at yard house, too!), and oh gosh I can't remember the exact name, but it was a darker ale that my other housemate got. :( but everyone liked their drinks, was definitely surprised at the darker ale because it wasn't too hoppy.For the food, ordered the Hawaiian Poke Stack (yumyum!), the Chicken Nachos, half rack of ribs, and the Jambalaya. Everything was very delicious and I enjoyed them all! The only thing I didn't like was the creamed corn with the rib plate, but that's just because I don't usually like creamed corn lol. The service is a little slow, but I understand because it's a very big restaurant. Our waiter was really nice and friendly and so was the other server who brought out our food. I also don't like how loud it is, but I liked my experience that night anyway.

Reviews.Author: Nha D.
Reviews.Content: It's no surprise that this place is always a long wait. I've been here before for with friends and they always were full of customers that linger after they have paid their bill.Nothings changed. My friend just came back to SJ and wanted to have dinner here. She called that she wanted to have a party of 30 in an hour (so definitely in advance). And everyone got to yard house about 45min before the hour we asked for reservations. And now it's been two hours and a half and we're still waiting outside and Yard House has not given us a pager. (I gave this place 3 stars but now 2 because I'm freezing outside this place with everyone else)Prior to this. The food is good, you do have to wait because this place is packed. The beer is exceptionally great. And the interior is nice.Almost pushing for 2 hours. I'll be back. I'm hoping when I return we will be seated......UPDATE and now our party is down to 16 people.And after complaining and complaining they are fitting 16 people into a tiny 14 seater booth.....seriously. One of the people doesn't even have a table. His sitting in the corner without a table. (They brought a huge table to compensate but trapped everyone on one side) 2 more people left. We are down to 14 people now.How irresponsible is this. The group before us (the tables we were suppose to have) have been here since 3pm! Had paid the bill and take their sweet time...Drinking Alcohol since then...it's 8:37pm now. And they have children 5 years old or so. How can those kids keep sane? I'll tell you how. By running around the place. These people are not sober how can they drive. Despite some people leaving the group is still spanned out within the three round tables so we can't be seated comfortably yet. It is now 8:47pmHad to send back a dirty cup and we found another dirty cup and didn't bother.We finally ordered food. And the party that was in our spot finally left. Manager was rude did I mention? And his not going to do anything for our group whatsoever. The worst. He didn't even apologize.My meal was good. The seared ahi tuna died a death and was assembled wrong. The sear was amazing. But what the hell did they add a crust on the outside. Gordon Ramsey would shake his head in shame.Bathroom is cold and dark. For us ladies the soap dispenser are all empty and so the soap bottle was on the floor.Our Waiter did an excellent job. The manager needs to learn something from him.

Reviews.Author: Daniel O.
Reviews.Content: Great place, great beer selection.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is It's apart of the S. Row.. Take it as that, it's really difficult to find a fun happening place in the South Bay (few and far between). The restaurant has very expensive rent to pay which it graciously passes down to the customer. I get a little concerned on the quality of a place when there are employees everywhere and when the menu is what.. 8 pages?. To me that says=MONEY. It's  very expensive to keep the ingredients necessary for each dish that is of course if the items are in fact fresh. And not frozen (cough cough).. if it would be possible to cut some of the staff, and focus on core items I would be more inclined on going back...The size of the restaurant is its largest strength. But can ultimately be it's downfall, if it's sales were to slip enough it would be catastrophic for it self. Two beers, one appetizer, "the chicken" and the jambalaya= 70 bucks.

Reviews.Author: Kay P.
Reviews.Content: I love going to Yard House with a couple of friends to grab a drink and a some good food. The food is pretty good The truffle fries are soooo addicting -___- And the mac and cheese is pretty good! I just hate the wait sometimes, but usually when I go the wait isn't bad at all! If there is a long wait though (more than 30 minutes) then we just leave and go elsewhere in Santana Row, there are a lot of differ options but Yard House would be the first.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: The wait is a bit long and when we got seated we felt rushed to finish our food very fast.  I like how they have the shorty option and a wide variety of fruity beers (even though I am a lush). the ahi tuna is still one of my favorite courses.

Reviews.Author: Michele C.
Reviews.Content: The food is alright here.  I've come here multiple times and every time my dish i get is just alright. Maybe I'm just ordering the wrong thing. Although the most recent visit from me here I a couple weeks ago I believe it was a Thursday night I came with my co-workers and I couldn't believe how snobby our waitress was. Probably because my friends and I looked young ourselves and she assumed we would not tip her well. She was fairly young herself looked younger than us, she was Hispanic. She did not make any eye contact what so ever, she seems annoyed and acted like it was the worst job in the world. She checked up on us once at most, and that was to refill ONE water, she didn't' bother to refill my friends cup that was next to me what was 1/3 empty. We were so upset with our service, she would put stuff on our table while walking past but wouldnt say anything and just kind of slam it on there. When we got the check we waited a good 15 minutes so we tried to pay up front but you're not allowed too. I would give her a 0.5 star if I was able to.

Reviews.Author: Danny K.
Reviews.Content: Yard House has a nice selection of beer.  There's no doubt about that.  It's a fun place to go, but for some reason, I end up waiting 30 minutes to an hour every single time I've gone to the Santana Row location, which wasn't my experience at the L.A. Live location.  And that was only for a group of three.  Also, I would highly discourage anyone from going to the Yard House to watch a 49ers game.  First of all, you can't hear any of the audio from the game, and to make matters worse, they blare some pretty crappy music.  The flat screen tv's are pretty small and located far away from ideal viewing angles.  If you are serious football fan, these are the kind of things that would drive you crazy.On the plus side, the food is pretty decent.  I had a turkey burger with a 21st Amendment Brew Free or Die IPA which was a nice combination.  The service was also pretty good.  They made the rounds regularly and I never felt like I was looking for our server.  If you don't mind waiting a long time to shout at your friends over a huge selection of draft beers, check out the Yard House.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: This place was really cool.  There were hundreds of beers on tap and I had no idea what to order.  But the server was awesome and he helped me pick one out based off the kind of beer I normally drink.  The food was good too.  The only problem was we had a reservation for 15 people and they ended up splitting us into two seperate tables.  That was awkward, and they had bigger tables so I'm not sure what the problem was.  I will go back the next time I'm in town though.

Reviews.Author: Victoria T.
Reviews.Content: The food here is always great and consistent and I love their huge selection of beers. My friends and I come here often for drinks and some food and we always receive great service. However, this recent experience on 2/27/14 is by far the worst, keeping in mind that I rarely complain and can usually tolerate subpar services. Our server Erica never once asked as if we needed another round of drinks or any food. We had to flag her down to ask for it. This was not a busy night because she had time to mingle with another group of guys at a nearby table as well as chit chatting with her co-workers. So after a while of eating and drinking we finished our meal AND our drinks. This rarely happens because we always get brought another round. After some time she cleared our table and did not ask if we needed anything else. By this point our glasses of beer were empty and we were sipping on water for quite some time. Normally the waiters would ask us if we would like more drinks before we finished, because it does takes a while for the next drinks to arrive, which is understandable. When she finally came around to take our order for more drinks she just took off right after, and my friend didn't get a chance to place another food order in. She was not attentive at all, unapproachable, and with no friendly demeanor. Maybe she was having an off day, but it doesn't mean she should ignore us. Eventually we found the manager and just wanted to let her know about our experience. I did see that the manager talk to her afterwards near the cashier where our table was. The waitress then decided to talk to her co-workers in front of us about it. How do I know, because they were looking over to our table as they were talking, as if we did something wrong. I just didn't appreciate being talked about while we are still there. That is unacceptable in any business.

Reviews.Author: Trang B.
Reviews.Content: Really good fucking happy hour. Good food, I usually order half the menu. Impressive beer menu if I were into beers. They have ciders for weaklings like me.Love the pineapple express.Service is usually can range between lady who never even gave us water and Tyrone who is fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Caitlin C.
Reviews.Content: While I do love the food (4 starts) the service is poor. We stopped into Yardhouse on a Sunday about 3 weeks ago for an early dinner, it was about 4 o'clock. We were a group of 6 and we didn't have to wait which was nice.We ordered 3 appetizers beers and sodas to start and that's when things went down hill. Our server returned about 15 minutes later to take our order. We asked for more drinks and those came out when we were nearly finished with our food. We had already reminded him 3 times about my drink. He then proceeded to go on break and didn't tell us...thank god there was good company and conversation because another 30 minutes went by before we saw him again. When he did finally reappear he brought us our check and I had to ask for the dessert menu. Not sure why this would irritate him considering the large the bill the larger his tip, but none the less it did.Needless to say if we ever decide to go back we will be hopefully to get another server at which time I will update my review. It really is to bad that a poor server experience can ruin your feel of a place

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: I have been to several Yard House's throughout the US and this one in San Jose is by far the worst. The food was good, but the service is down right terrible. We decided to sample a few beers, which took over 10 minutes to get just one. When we decided on which drink we wanted, our soup and salad arrived after our order was placed. It was then more than 15 minutes and still no drinks. After about 20 minutes, I asked the server when the beer was coming. She had to ask us what drinks we wanted. By then our food came so we said just give us water. Two minutes later, another waiter came by and said he would take care of us the rest of the time. Not once did anyone ask us if our food was good or if we wanted anything else. We received our bill and it took another 20 minutes to pay our tab and leave. So on our way out, we ran into two managers and I explained to them our service was terrible. They didn't seem to care, didn't ask us questions or anything. Long story short, we will NEVER be back!

Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: So far so good!I've not had a chance to try their beers yet but all of the entrees I've sampled were pretty good.Yesterday I had their truffle fries which were tasty (as all truffle oiled fries are) and, while I did like their unique take on them - shoestring style, that did make them a tad hard to eat without a fork once you got through the longer pieces.  But very tasty nonetheless.Also tried their french dip sandwich with a caesar salad (swapped out the fries since we already ordered the truffle fries).  The meat was above average quality (most places don't do the french dip justice and have drier, tougher beef).  It was juicy and well cooked and had some nice fatty bits to it.  The jus was good as well but seemed to have a thickening agent as if it were half au jus and half gravy.  But, still very good!Great selection of entrees, appetizers, and drinks.Wait staff is on the ball and cheerful!

Reviews.Author: Rita T.
Reviews.Content: I came here for my birthday dinner recently. It was a Saturday night so I knew it would be busy. I had a party of about 20 people and I took one star off for not being able to make reservations. We ended up waiting two full hours for our table, luckily we just went to Cocola down the Row and had our dessert before dinner (: Once we were seated, the party started! Our waiters were super super friendly and efficient as well. Their names were Robin and Tyrone. I remember Tyrone because he was an asian guy named Tyrone, haha! They truly made my birthday dinner (I turned 21 by the way) AMAZING. The food was alright, my pear hard cider half yard was good, but their service was EXCEPTIONAL! Impossible not to fall in love with them. Thank you for that!Lobster garlic noodles - not as good as I had hopedMac and cheese - SOOO GOOD! Get this!

Reviews.Author: Samuel Y.
Reviews.Content: I come here for the environment.  A place where you just want to go out with a group of friends and have a nice time drinking beer.  A place where there is a bit of a wait to get a table.  However, if you prefer ordering at the bar, the only wait is to flag down the bartender.  Food here is alright, nothing special but the real reason you are here is to sample their variety of beer while watching sport highlights and catching up with friends.  If you'd like to sample some beers, they can offer you a 2 sample limit per person where it's enough to taste test something off the menu before you commit to it. Personally I enjoy all the house beers and I'll sample from time to time the rest of the menu.  For simply chatting, the nachos are the best bang for your buck while you down your half yard of beer.

Reviews.Author: Ketie A.
Reviews.Content: Beer - Great selection.Food - It's kind of hit or miss.. Sometimes its really well cooked sometimes not really..Service - Good. I haven't had any trouble with the service. Did notice while waiting for a table that the table(s) that were already done were not cleaned and just stayed there for like 10 minutes... at least... while people waiting the table "turn" should be quick.Can't place a reservation. I know you can when it's a large group... but that's not enough in my book. It would be much easier for customers if the rules were a minimum party of 4 or something..

Reviews.Author: Alek I.
Reviews.Content: Chris was nice and apologized for the previous experiences and offered to send me a gift card. However, I stand by my review maybe down the road the food will improve but me rating a place one star is not so I would receive a free meal.

Reviews.Author: Sayoni B.
Reviews.Content: Love this place.. I have been here so many times that now my frnds just keep dragging me out of here.. Only problem is there is no network inside this place so its really hard to wait for anyone..

Reviews.Author: Dan D.
Reviews.Content: Service 3+Food 3+Atmosphere 4Wait 3+Price 3+

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: The food at this location is great. The beer selection is amazing, I have never seen so many different kinds on Tap. The wait is understandable and bearable. What is not up to par is the staff. The host staff upfront is only nice and accommodating if the manager is standing right there, the rest of the time they forget their manners and courtesy quite quickly. I came here with my wife for lunch. They were not busy with many empty tables. I told the hostess that I need a table for two and she said: "OK" Didn't grab the menu or tell me one moment someone will see you. We stood for 5 minutes until one of the hostess grabbed the menus and sat us. The food takes a little while to be prepared and no one ever checks on you. My wife asked for a clean plate and some extra ranch, the guy who dropped it off did not look like he wanted to help. he didn't say a word and was poorly trained to deal with customers. We had to flag down the manager to pay for our meal because I was already late to work. When I asked for a couple of to-go boxes the waitress dropped them off at our table without boxing the food. I guess I should not expect them to box the food, but bringing two tiny boxes for 4 burgers and an appetizer is not intelligent. I guess I expect a whole lot more courtesy and some hint of customer service. The staff is young and inexperienced. I believe that this location deserves better. They food is excellent and I don't like feeling awkward to come back. I will be back, but I expect a better level of service to compliment the awesome food.

Reviews.Author: Timothy N.
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars for my bar experience but 4 stars for my food.I came here with some friends for the happy hour which has pretty decent prices, cheap appetizers & drinks =] So much beer...ugh lol Their truffle fries are like oil bombs...delicious but I could feel my heart slowing down while eating them lolWhen I came here to eat, there was about a 30-45 minute wait, but its cause we came around 7. Our waiter was really helpful and happy...almost a little too happy lolBut I ended up getting the Bacon cheese burger and it was cooked to perfection. They use really good quality meat here. Also had the sweet potato fries with some sort of bacon sauce...they weren't all that, even though our waiter raved them up and said he was addicted to them lolNot a bad place though, burgers were a bit pricey ranged from 11-15 bucks.Definitely a place to check out =]

Reviews.Author: Ankles T.
Reviews.Content: Been here many times but it's been a while since we last here.  Tonight, we went there for dinner and here's our order:Turkey pot pie - hubby think KFC's chicken pot pie tasted betterShrimp rice bowl  - don't care for itShrimp ceviche appetizer- very goodAhi poke bowl  - it was just okAl ordered enchilada stack - it was goodthe bill? $122.89 for 3 of us.  That's included drinks but not tips.

Reviews.Author: Leonard I.
Reviews.Content: Been here a couple of times and have say down, stood at the bar, along with having take out. The atmosphere is nice and friendly all around people usually dressed up when they come here celebrating birthdays or special occasions . Anyways I will start off with the prosPros: usually good service Best times are happy hours because more bang for your buckNice location Good size televisions The beers of course so many choices importedBartenders are good at what they doCONS: to stand at the bar hit or miss with the crowd usually busy or empty depends. Food is average not really that good. During happy hour it's more worth itI will come back mostly for the beer and not really to eat here it seems that Santana row lacks good food they just charge you a lot to make things look good. As I say just cause it looks good doesn't mean it is good

Reviews.Author: Mark M.
Reviews.Content: Good service, good scene, but just average food!Everyone craves the truffle garlic fries here; but honestly, other than those fried chips (which is a bit too oily), everything else is very average.  They try to do to a little bit of everything, but nothing is truly going to wow you here.  No, really.  However, it is a good scene for games here.  This place draws crowds, and when you know there is a main event of something set to go, you can almost bet that you can find a good crowd here where you can easily strike up the convo with someone.  On the other hand, the beers here are also just ok.  Again, nothing spectacular, but you can find everything familiar here.  A safe good scene.  But don't go crazy if you can't find a seat - you ain't missing too much.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is a fun place to get together with a group, enjoy some unique dishes and sound like an experienced beer connoisseur with your friends.With over 10,000 beers on tap (give-or-take a few) there's no shortage of brewing goodness flowing through those doors every day and you'll be sure to find your new favorite beer before you leave.Pair your new favorite hoppy sensation with some of their great appetizers and you'll be one happy person!The only knock I have is on its location, pricing and wait times. Now, any great restaurant, you'd expect a wait because the demand is much higher than the amount of seats available. Fine. But when you go any day of the week, any time after 5 PM you're quoted 2+ hours, that's just nuts. Probably not their fault, I'm sure customers aren't jumping out of their seats as they chew their last bite, but there's other fish to fry here. Prices are a bit on the outrageous side. I said they have unique dishes but even so, all of them are over priced and the bill is always pricey. This could also have to do with its location: Santana Row. That place is a parking lot. Yes, it has parking lots, but they're full, so literally anywhere you drive, you'll be forced to stop within the next 5-7 feet for long periods of time. It also drives the price up.Now, since I don't believe the building can just pick up and roll away, I am a fan of Yard House. Great atmosphere accommodates good food and a tremendous beer selection. Pro tip: Instead of buying a $4 coffee everyday, save that money for about 3 months, and enjoy a nice dinner at Yard House. No, but seriously, ask the waiter about the beer. Why else did you come here? The ones who know their beer really KNOW their beer!

Reviews.Author: Irish P.
Reviews.Content: Great food, classic rock, and never-ending (ok, maybe not) list of beers always has us coming back over and over again.Last week to celebrate me having a second job, Tyler took me out to YH. I love coming here! I was surprised because when we went it wasn't too busy.Our server actually had to leave because it was the end of her shift, so another waitress took over, I think her name was Penny? She introduced herself, but my short-term memory sucks when I'm starving, but that's what it said on the receipt. She looks like JoJo Levesque, but more prettier.We went during happy hour (woo hoo!) so I got a beer. I'm a fruit beer lover, I don't really like IPAs, dark, or bitter beers. I got a Sea Dog Bluepaw. In my boyfriend's words, it tastes like fruit loops! Yeah, it was pretty good. It's a girly beer if you ask me.Throughout the months, I've tried many dishes. From the (mac+cheese)squared to the Hawaiian poke stack, nothing has ever disappointed me. This last visit we had the onion ring tower (which was in the HH menu) for an appetizer and I got the 5oz Blackened Tuna Burger. I liked that Penny notified me that it came with a salad, just in case I wanted fries instead.The onion rings were awesome! Comparing them to Red Robin's onion rings (since they're the only place I know that serves onion ring towers) I think YH's were better. They were skinnier, but I liked them a whole lot because the onions don't fall out of the batter when you bite into it like RR's onion rings do. Would I get them again? YES.My burger came with a citrus soy salad and the dressing on the side. Penny even recommended to save some dressing and dip the burger in it because it tastes really good! I tried it and it was BOMB.com!! The tuna wasn't dry at all and I liked that there was pink in the middle. Yum yum yum!Great customer service always has us coming back and Penny did a great job at giving us that. Guess what? We're coming back on Friday! Yeah, date night for me and the boyfriend.Oh, a good thing to know:Happy Hour & Late NightMonday - Friday 3pm - 6pm Sunday - Wednesday 10pm - Close

Reviews.Author: Liana H.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a couple of times now. While, Yard House is a step up from Chilis, BJ's and Fridays, it is nothing to write home about. Every time I have been here the service seriously lacks. Water is never refiled, beers take FOREVER to come out, and no one ever checks on you. 2 stars for service. Food pushes my overall to 3 stars. The food is good. It isn't amazing, but it gets the job done. I have tried their pizzas, appetizers, some pasta dishes and their tacos. Tacos were probably the best. Try the short rib ones, yumm. Yard House specializes in beer and cider, so definitely order one of those. My favorite is the Raspberry Cider. TIP: Park in the best buy parking garage, it is the closest garage.

Reviews.Author: Dara S.
Reviews.Content: I usually come to Yard House on a weekday during happy hour around 3:30 or so.  There is usually seating at the bar and plenty of seating otherwise.  I love the variety of beer.  The service is consistently friendly and attentive and the food always hits the spot.  I really enjoy their traditional buffalo wings;the sauce has the hot tang that I love. I also really enjoy the poke stack, though the saltiness (soy sauce) can be inconsistent.  For beer, I get a half yard of Sea Dog (the blueberry). It smells sweet, but the taste isn't overly so.Weekend nights are a bit more difficult.  The wait can start at a minimum of thirty-five minutes.  Larger parties during this time usually have a longer wait. The bar is usually packed.  There are also a lot of TVs so game time gets pretty darn crowded as well.  Still always a good time with the right people with a great variety of beers on tap.

Reviews.Author: Hong T.
Reviews.Content: first off did you know you could call in advance and put your name down on the list to get seated without physically being there? awesome!  this was what we did. I arrived here with my FAM to watch the playoffs this pass weekend and the place was packed! When we arrived the wait was at least a 2 hr wait. But since we called in we only waited about 10 mins.We were then seated in the booths with an awesome view of the game right in front of us. Our server RJ came and took our orders.. He was totally patient with the 5 sisters at the table anyone else might have gone crazy. They have an awesome selection of beers and one of my favorites "delirium". The food was pretty good. The chicken nacho were huge and their truffle fries were Delicious! What more can you ask for.. game..fans...good beer and good food.

Reviews.Author: Formicas F.
Reviews.Content: a good, high quality sports bar.

Reviews.Author: Jacklyn L.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Thursday night & was surprisingly busy. No reservations but my party of 5 was seated within 5 minutes! Our waitress, Penny was fantastic. We were celebrating birthdays so she was telling us about good drinks to get off the menu. Suuuuper friendly! Our food came fast & it tasted great. Would definitely come back to try the other entrées! Only reasons for the lack of 5 stars is because it is very loud in there. Had to speak up just to have a conversation. Also, was getting no cell service there. So I had to use the wifi they offer but it was beyond slow and kept cutting out. Other than that, great place!

Reviews.Author: Lux M.
Reviews.Content: Went here for my friend's birthday dinner, party of 10! Had to wait for a couple minutes since you can't make reservations but no biggie !We didn't wait very long anyways, even though they were a little busy.I just wanted to write a review about our waitress,who was so cheerful, and just plain awesome !I wish I remembered her name, cause she deserves 5 + stars for exceptional hospitality.She did get my order wrong for my sea dog blueberry ale, I wanted a shorty, and def. not a half yard, but the music was loud, so she probably didn't hear well, but she promptly corrected my order !She was cracking jokes with us, and was just all around sweet!I hope she makes a lot of tips ! lolMy food was yummy, i ordered the Shitake garlic noodles, and the Mediterranean flatbread.Those oven roasted tomatoes on that flatbread though ! So delish !

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: Traditionally come on a Friday or Saturday night, it's very nice. Probably even worth 5 stars because the servers are usually knowledgeable, efficient, and kind.
