Plus the beer n food, fantastic. No, no, not this Sunday night. My best friend turned 21 recently so we wanted to experience the greatness of Yardhouse.  First off, both beer orders...both wrong? Allagash White suddenly turned into a house hefe? Crazy magical.2nd appetizers, not bad. If we had gotten them within the first hour.3rd dinner, well if it took an hour to get appetizers, it shouldn't surprise you that dinner was about 30 min after that (1.5 hours total). Now we figured that the long wait must mean that the food is extra good, or at least cooked, but shockingly enough...it wasn't. Bacon was raw. There's a level in hell reserved for people that can't cook/ don't eat bacon. During the bacon fiasco and leading into the end of the night out server disappeared for long periods of time and when he did appear had apparently lost hearing in both ears and was the master of avoiding eye contact.  Tip was left, I mean c'mon I'm not a monster (like the bacon hating cooks). Meager. But it was left. In conclusion, reserve your taste buds to only come in on nights when the A-Team is working.

Reviews.Author: Natalie P.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to enjoy some beer and appetizers, this is the place for you. With such a wide selection of beer (and only getting bigger) you really can't just have one glass. The wait on a busy night is usually 35-45 minutes but the wait didn't seem long at all. I've been here several times and I have to say that the truffle fries and garlic noodles are my favorite appetizers. I'm also a fan of their spicy jambalaya. Last Friday when we came here, one of our dishes came out a bit late and the manager quickly came over to apologize and take it off our bill. It was totally unnecessary since we didn't feel like we had to wait that long but it does say a lot about their customer service. Sadly they had forgotten our last order but we left satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Emy B.
Reviews.Content: Came in on a late Sunday afternoon (around 4pm) and our party of 5 were seated right away.  Love that.  We shared a high stack of the onion rings which was very crispy and tasty, served with two dips.  By the way...DELICIOUS Lobster Garlic Noodles!  We also shared the Cuban sandwich that comes with a bbq au jus dipping sauce, very yummy too.  Wish I could comment on having dessert, but we were too full =(The servers are friendly and always are happy to explain anything on the menu.  For the Lobster Garlic Noodles we asked that the lobster be replaced with more shrimp instead which our server (Chris) was happy to have done for us -- my mom doesn't care for lobster.  I personally would've asked for more lobster myself, but that's my mom.We do love coming here after doing the Santana Row walkabout, and then head for home, hopefully not sleepy!

Reviews.Author: James G.
Reviews.Content: Cool place but a HUGE line and wait to get in! Go early!Tons of nice brews on tap. The food  I got (Jambalaya) was good. Seared Ahi appetizer was great, sauce was off the hook! Great mix of food on the menu. Service was great, prices were ok. Nice place!

Reviews.Author: Dee V.
Reviews.Content: We are regulars and love everything about Yardhouse.....ok not everything.  We avoid coming here Fri-Sun nights since it's a zoo! We also make sure there aren't any big games going on because the wait time can get out of control.  BUT, since we avoid weekends, we thoroughly enjoy our visits here.  Menu items to try....especially if you are vegetarian:- lettuce wraps- veggie tacos- Gardein SLIDERS****must, must, must they are so addictive!- Gardein Chicken wings (all 3 flavors are great but we love the firecracker)- Gardein Thai Pizza (unique take on pizza)- all their fries- thin and crispy- Gardein baja salad (the large portion is huge so i'm going to try the smaller size next time)My husband loves their beers and all the waiters are very knowledgeable on their booze.

Reviews.Author: David A.
Reviews.Content: Great beer selection!  They have over 100 taps, most of them are the same but they have a dozen or so rotating/seasonal ones.  They have a menu that lists all the prices for every size of each kind of beer.  The regular prices are about a buck above average in my opinion, but Happy Hour knocks off ~$2, $2.50 off each beer so that makes them about a buck below average.  The Uinta Sea Legs Baltic Porter was my favorite!This place also has just about the best happy hour food I've had. Most of their appetizers are 50% which makes most of them an extremely good deal.  For some of the appetizers, one is probably about the size of a regular meal.  I agree with other reviewers that they probably put more effort into the presentation (which really is nice looking) than the taste, but still no major complaints about the taste.  But what impressed me the most was how nutritionally balanced they were and the quality of the ingredients.We ordered the spicy tuna roll, which was a tower of seared ahi, edamame, avocado, and cucumber, and the kung pao calamari, which was a generous portion of calamari with a light breading and fresh vegetables, in a not-too-spicy sauce with a side of your choice of white or brown rice.  While the seasonings were a little light, the vegetables were very fresh tasting.  The meat and vegetable to rice ratio was about 4:1, which is just about perfect in my opinion.  (At many places it's 1:1, which would be too starchy.)  I appreciate that they provide the option of good solid food available alongside the beer (rather than only starchy/fried foods) as this is a key consideration for me.We also ordered the crab cakes and mushu chicken rolls.  While these were good, they were only decently (and not amazingly) priced.  I did appreciate that they were full of meat and not fillers though.I was wavering between 4/5 stars, but went with 5 because for this place seems to be (a massive bar with some food options rather than the other way around), it's just about perfect.  Beer selection is good and outside of happy hour isn't horribly overpriced, but during happy hour is very well priced.  The food while not "haute cuisine" is definitely a couple cuts above regular bar cuisine, and average priced outside of happy hour and a bargain during happy hour. Also, and especially for how busy this place was, service was very good.  I found a seat at the bar right away, bartenders were attentive (and I heard them explain policies to patrons quickly and matter-of-factly but not rudely), a manager was going around the bar checking with everyone to make sure that things were up to par, and my food was served within minutes.

Reviews.Author: Abhinandan D.
Reviews.Content: Been here a lot. Any occasion. Life is cool here. amazing food and great selection of beer. Great service.

Reviews.Author: Si Si H.
Reviews.Content: They are good for their followup on the issues.  However, I am getting over these issues, slowly.  Although I am still feeling a little scorn, this place can be decent with well trained servers.  And I also did recommend this restuarant to a friend because the food isn't bad, just the servers do make part of the experience memorable or a nightmare.

Reviews.Author: Sam K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing place for food and drinks!I would love to come here for Happy Hour if my schedule permits - still a great place to go to nonetheless.Attentive service creates for a great time to match with the food and drinks.You can't go wrong with their beer selection - the half-yard was a lot of quantity!Would come back here often if I lived in the area, unfortunately I don't. :(Come early!!! The wait can be quite a while during peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Alec M.
Reviews.Content: Sigh.After a less-than-positive experience at the Roseville Yard House, I came into the Santana Row location hoping that we'd have a bit of a better time. While the staff was much better this time around (refills came before our drinks were empty and everyone was smiling and in a good mood), there were still several issues with our food that made for a negative experience. Full disclosure: I was given a $50 gift card by Yard House after my Roseville experience, which was put to use during this visit. Food consistency seems to be a problem between restaurants, because several items that we had at the Roseville location (which we patronize semi-frequently) tasted different/worse in San Jose. The deviled eggs were goopy and the fried chicken was bland and in need of pepper. The pepperoni & mushroom pizza was passable, and my vegetarian tacos were amazing, but the korean beef appetizer came out cold and was sent back. When it returned, it looked like the same entry but microwaved as the plate was hotter than the food was. An ahi steak sandwich lacked flavor and was sent back, replaced by the always-reliable Mac & Cheese squared. I understand Yard House is a chain restaurant, but The Cheesecake Factory across the way and Maggiano's Little Italy down the street both know how to put out large quantities of good food consistently. For some reason, that consistency has never been encountered at Yard House. While I hesitate to say this will be our last time at Yard House (as I said, the Mac & Cheese squared really is good), we'll probably go back to our Santana Row standbys during our next visit. I mean, Fogo De Chao is coming people! Step up your game!

Reviews.Author: Jonamir Ian C. V.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Yard House twice for the truffle fries. They are absolutely delicious -- made with quality truffle oil and garnished with Parmesan cheese, a fulfilling little snack for a night out on Santana Row. An impressively wide selection of beers are also available on tap. I had the House Belgian Amber Tripel, the priciest and most alcoholic of Yard House's offerings (9%). It was worth the goblet size -- refreshing and tasty, plenty of hops. I can't think of a better drink at Yard House to wash down those truffle fries. The first time I stopped by Yard House a friend and I just picked up an order; the second time I just sat at the bar. The service was nothing to write about, but kept up despite how busy it got. Hope to hang out here more! Pretty happening place at Stevens Creek Blvd. and just a really good place for a pint.

Reviews.Author: David N.
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about Yard House! Solid chain restaurant. Spectacular happy hour. Great ambiance. Sanitary ... etc ... etc ... Only con I can think of is the wait to get seated. This place is mad popular so depending on the time (Happy Hour?), it can def be quite the wait.Nothing sensational but you will not be disappointed unless you have the worst of luck and something bad happens to you there... I've been there like 4-5 times this month alone and nothing went terribly wrong happened. *Knock on wood*Note: If you order the chicken nachos off the appetizers, you can replace the chips for fries for no additional cost. Wheres my "easy" button at!? *CLICKKK* That was easy.

Reviews.Author: Albert W.
Reviews.Content: Service is always good hereOrdered Chicken nachos 3* - chicken is dry and the chips are a bit soggyThai chicken pizza 4* - chicken is moister than the chicken on nachos. The peanuts were crunchy but don't care for the dough as muchSpinach cheese dip 4* - the chips are interesting... It looks and tasted like thin pita chips but I like the dipBeerGreen flash Double Columbus IPA - 4*Gilden Daark 9000 Quad - 4*Petrus Winter 9 - 5*Dark Chocolate (that's what the bill showed which I totally forgot what it was) - ?* :pOverall, this is a good place to have beer especially HH. Coming during the HH is a lot better deal especially I don't care for their entrée as much.

Reviews.Author: Ashleigh D.
Reviews.Content: Late night catch up with a friend after I finished shopping. The server was really attentive without being pushy and I like that the cheque separated the orders of each guest (and was really accurate!) - it was the first time I saw this. The beer selection is extensive and I appreciated the "skinny" cocktail choice as as well. In terms of food, we ordered soups, salads, fries and sliders. Nothing that stands out, I'd say the food is just average - but the service is good!

Reviews.Author: Jaime W.
Reviews.Content: Fun, lively santana row restaurant. The menu has a huge selection, including a variety of delicious appitizers as well as hearty portions for their entres. The Yard House seems to be the "pre-game" dinner spot for any day of the weekend on santana row. The wait to get in is pretty intimidating, so I reccomend grabbing a pager at least an hour before you intend on eating. Bottom line: Eat dinner here before the bars.

Reviews.Author: Lien N.
Reviews.Content: The food is good, and they have a great selection of beer. I used to like coming here a lot. However, more recently the restaurant has started playing really loud music. It tends to attract a rowdy crowd, so it can be kind of obnoxious. I probably won't be coming here again.

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: This place is the best!! I always come here and get the "Onion Ring Tower" and a classic cheeseburger w/fries. Never fails^.^

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline R.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time on Black Friday with my friend. It was 21 and up so we were automatically carded at the door. After the card you, they give you a wristband if you plan on drinking alcohol. The place was PACKED. We had to wait a good 20-30 minutes to be seated, and this was around 10pm. It was really noisy and they also had loud music playing. My friend and I were seated in the corner which was nice, because it was much quieter than sitting in the center area surrounding the bar. WE ORDERED:Drinks:1) Pineapple Express (skyy infusions pineapple vodka, malibu pineapple rum, monin mojito, fresh pineapple and mint): Really just a cool name for a pineapple mojito. Pretty decent.2) Southern Belle (jeremiah weed sweet tea vodka, lemonade, fresh strawberries and pineapple): Tasted literally just like an Arnold Palmer, but with alcohol in it. I liked both drinks pretty equally. None of them wow'ed me, but I would order them again.Food:1) Truffle fries: I thought they were pretty decent, but not the best truffle fries I've ever had. I like ooey gooey truffle cheese melted on top of my fries, but these were just like regular fries covered with shredded parmesan, with truffle oil layered on top. They were good and I ate them all, BUT I've definitely had better.2) Mac + Cheese (chicken breast, applewood bacon, wild mushrooms, cheddar, parmesan, campanelle pasta and truffle oil): Obvsly a fancier version of your classic mac n cheese. I really liked it, all of the ingredients combined really spiced up the dish!3) Angel Hair Pasta (roma tomatoes, roasted eggplant, garlic, basil, pine nuts, feta, parmesan and olive oil): My friend got this. She wasn't RAVING about it, but she apparently it was good enough since she finished all of it.Overall, I'd say the Yardhouse is very comparable to BJ's or other micro-breweries. I don't think it was worth the long wait, but it was one of the few restaurants open late at night on The Row. I would be willing to visit again, but it wouldn't be my first choice out of the plethora of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Author: Taryn R.
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not my first visit here, but always enjoyable. My weekend ritual with the mother in law and grandmother lunch in brought us here. The service is always quick, and the staff is friendly. They have a giant array of beers on tap to choose from if you like to drink, as well as a large full service bar. In all my times coming to yard house, the food is very inconsistent. We ordered the onion ring tower. It was good, but not as good as the time before. It lacked flavor, no salt and no Parmesan cheese. And the dips they brought out were half full. So we waited patiently for the extra dipping sauce. They have a great priced lunch menu- half sandwich with a bowl of soup or salad. Sandwiches are pretty big, for only being a half size. Food was good overall, and the server we had was wonderful and always made sure our drinks were always full (which is a huge thing in my book)!My grandma really enjoyed herself and decided she was pretty hip, and was going to pass it on to her friends.

Reviews.Author: Brittany D.
Reviews.Content: I've had some decent happy hours at this place, but I went here for my birthday & I was not impressed. Not only did we have to wait 30 minutes for a table, we had to wait a very long time for food. When you're hungry, it's not a good time. Yes, we came in a party of 13, but they should be prepared for large parties because I see them all the time. The servers were not very attentive & part of me thinks it's because they have a mandatory gratuity on the bill, so regardless of their service, they get a pretty hefty tip (18%). There were two of them serving us, so I don't understand why they didn't make sure we had everything we needed. My friend asked for ketchup & it never came. I was also mistaken with the happy hour, which was my bad, but that meant everything was regular price, so a plate of pasta easily cost $15. They don't even sing to you on your birthday at this place. The food tasted pretty good in their defense, but the portions were pretty skimpy for the high price tag. We got there at 6PM & left close to 9PM. The time spent here could've been better spent somewhere else. I would NOT recommend throwing a birthday dinner here if you have parties larger than 10. Save yourself the money & time by going somewhere else. I had a better experience at Cheesecake Factory down the street.

Reviews.Author: Sandeep K.
Reviews.Content: A great place for drink and dine and de-stress. It's becoming quite the regular for me. It's loud, but beer's great. All around TV for the sports fans

Reviews.Author: Chantal P.
Reviews.Content: Still my favorite restaurant chain and happy hour spot. Things I like about Yard House:-Wide selection of beer on tap-Appetizers always hit the spot (1 appetizer has yet to disappoint me)-TVs everywhere to watch a variety of sports-Hospitable serviceThings you should order:-Cheeseburger sliders-Thin garlic fries-Korean short ribs-Thai chicken pizza-Beeeeeeeeer of your choiceAll-in-all Yard House was put to the test and beats the rest!

Reviews.Author: Christina U.
Reviews.Content: First time here and I can say it was worth the hour 1/2 wait! The food and drinks were amazing! Our waiter was super cute and nice (Joel) . I really want to come back soon! Recommend their lobster crap artichoke dip. Their Gardien chicken salad was super delicious. Skinny Cosmo & strawberry mojito hit the spot. Sort of loud atmosphere but loved that there are TVs everywhere! Watched my team while having a great meal.

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: I always come here for their amazing Monday-Friday 3-6pm Happy Hour!Most of their appetizers are 1/2 off! Their servings are HUGE. For example, their chicken nachos are a little under $6 during their happy hour and can feed up to 6 people easily. Remember to add a pint or two of great craft beers. My favorite is the Timmerman's Strawberry Beer.Service is hit or miss. I guess it depends on what you get.

Reviews.Author: Aileen N.
Reviews.Content: I go to Yard House a lot with my friends during happy hour because they're appetizers are half off. I decided since my experiences with Yard House was been decent I thought I'd go back for their happy hour for my 21st birthday. At the bar itself the bartender was able to be found and he gave us our drinks right away even the one appetizer dish we ordered we go immediately. However right when I got a table for me and my 12 friends the waitress decided to take her sweet time with my table but when I watched her to go the other table it was bam bam bam done. My cousin told our waitress it was my birthday and she just brushed it off. However there were 3 other birthdays in the restraint and all of them got something. I was pretty upset but didn't say anything. Our food took awhile to come out and when we needed refills and more drinks we could find our waitress so we ended up asking this waiter that walked by. When the waitress came back to give us our drinks she didn't look happy. I did not appreciate how she's serving us with a pissed off look. I understand it's crowded and you're probably really busy but you really do not have to treat people like that. My cousins is a waitress too but she doesn't give people attitude or look pissed off even if she's having a bad day at work. When we got the bill everything was put on ONE when before we started ordering at the table we told her we wanted them on separate checks and we reminded her again before she have us the bill. When we asked her to put then on separate bills she looked annoyed. After we paid and everything we asked a random waiter to pack everything for us. He took over 10 minutes to pack everything so my friends just walked out and I followed. The waiter finally ran after me with my food. He was nice and friendly but it just took too long. I don't think I'm returning to this place anytime soon or at all. If the staff is going to be rude I would rather go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Hillary H.
Reviews.Content: I'd like to restore my faith in this place with their excellent customer service efforts...My previous mention was attended to, and I will give this place another chance. Well done YH. :)

Reviews.Author: Donna T.
Reviews.Content: TL;DR?? Did we crash Cinderella's party? Always the grand ball here! This is THE place to get drinks! All kinds of beers and wonderful tasty foods. Food Quality, Drink Quality, Service, Location, Ambiance: AN.B.: Warning: Wait times may be up to 1-2 hoursI have frequented this establishment previously and tried both their foods and drinks to which I heartily adore. The last time, my friends and I arrived to celebrate her 25th birthday. We had a party of approximately 20 people and at 10PM, they quoted us a time of 1 hour. The wait time was shorter in reality and we all headed to the bar to grab drinks. Although tough to flag down the bartenders, I eventually got all my drinks. Guiltily, I tried the Half-Yard of Pyramid Hefeweizen, AMF, Pineapple Express (Skyy infusions pineapple vodka, Malibu pineapple rum, monin mojito, fresh pineapple and mint), Moscow Mule, and the Scooby Snack shot. My favorite had to be the AMF or the Scooby Snack shot! It was quite a night! My party was getting rowdy and I sympathized with the servers. Service was hectic that Friday night and a managerial employee came over to help as well. Most of their drinks were legit and strong and definitely the AMF was packed with a quick punch of drunk.Please try their foods here. I mean these are God's leftovers!!! The SWEET POTATO FRIES with Maple Bacon Cream Dip is simply divine. I literally ate the whole dish by myself in shame haha. Perfect crispy fries with bacon dip, yes please! SHIITAKE GARLIC NOODLES (tossed with butter, garlic & shiitake mushrooms, topped with parmesan & chives) was also very savory and umami. The consistency of the tossed noodles and accompaniments were marinated perfectly. I would definitely recommend these if you are looking for succulent appetizers!For their Main Entrees, I recommend the ANGEL HAIR PASTA (with roma tomatoes, roasted eggplant, garlic, basil, pine nuts, feta, parmesan and olive oil) and SPICY JAMBALAYA (blackened jumbo shrimp, spicy chicken-andouille sausage, red and pasilla peppers pan blackened with sweet crawfish and cajun tomato cream sauce with linguini pasta, jasmine or brown rice) -- taken from their restaurant website (yardhouse.com)There are no better entrees at Yardhouse. Everything else is a lie. The Angel Hair Pasta may not LOOK impressive as the other dishes but it tasted so beautifully melodic. The noodles and sauce were in perfect portions- not dried out or overly oily and slimy. The presentation of the dish was pristine and white. The Jambalaya was a  sweet, tangy treat offered with fresh shrimp and sausages marinated in a bed of sauces and spices. Definitely better than the Jambalaya I had at Elephant Bar. Of course, the location is in Santana Row and the ambiance is casual yet romantic. The dim lighting inside the restaurant provides the mysterious aura for a hearty meal and loving mood.

Reviews.Author: Cindy C.
Reviews.Content: Customer service is extremely important and in their case they didn't nail it this time which is why I deducted a star.My boyfriend and I had finished our movie around 7:30pm on a Saturday night so we knew what we were getting ourselves into when we decided on Yard House. The host was very sweet and told us it'll be a 2 hour wait. She told us to come back at 8:45pm to receive our pager. We came back at the time she said and was told it'll be another half hour - no problem. We waited until our pager buzzed and followed a young lady to our table. We got to the table and it wasn't even cleaned yet. She was nice enough to apologize, but they cleaned up in such a haste that I was actually kind of skeptical to even sit down at that table.The young lady said our host will be with us shortly. It was my first time here so I took a good look at the menu. They had a great selection of drinks - pretty pricey but that's expected. Our waiter finally arrived and he seemed like he was in a big rush. My boyfriend knew exactly what he wanted so he ordered his drink and food. I was still deciding but before I could even ask for my waiter's opinion, he cut me off and said, "I'll come back later and you can take some more time deciding." Then walked off. It's not like I took half an hour to decide. I just needed about 30 more seconds.My boyfriend's drink arrived before I even got to order mine. I finally decided on the Half Yard of the Samuel Adam's Cherry Wheat. The smell was sweet and the first few mouthfuls were great. But once the beer got warm, the bitter after taste was quite overwhelming. We got their famous truffle fries and it was delicious! I will definitely be back for those. We also got the pepperoni and mushroom pizza. It was bigger than expected and I liked it a lot more than I thought I would. The food was not a disappointment for sure. I got to see our waiter maybe a total of 5 minutes throughout the night. What was more odd was when my boyfriend went to the bathroom he came by to pick up our plates and asked me, "Are you guys on your first date?" Uh... kind of inappropriate considering he hadn't said 2 sentences to me the entire night... I told him we were celebrating my birthday actually and he had to ask me if I would like a birthday dessert - which I guess was sweet of him.The dessert was beautiful and it was a great way to end the night there. The only note was that service could have been much better. But other than that, everything else was great.

Reviews.Author: Alarica A.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my boyfriend and it was amaxing! No wait, and the food n service we got was great. We will be coming back !

Reviews.Author: Vivian H.
Reviews.Content: my experience tonight : i ate their food and threw up.DO NOT GET THE CARIBBEAN CHICKEN.its on their house specialties list. I forced it down my throat and TRIED to like it because i didnt want to seem like a difficult customer to our server and chef. But near the end of the night, my friends convinced me to tell our server and even HE said he never liked it... fuck. he said he would have gotten me something else but the kitchen is closed, but he'll take care of the dish for me and take it out of my check. check came out, split. put all our cards and shit on it. took over 15 minutes to get it. my friend had to pick it up and find him. what.the.fuck. we finally got our cards back. and all this time, i had a weird feeling in my stomach. ....and when we finally walk out and get to the garage, i promptly throw up my entire dinner on the floor behind a parked car.fucking awesome.only stars was because my friend's vodka shrimp pasta was pretty good, salads were alright, and our server took my dish off my check even after i ate a good half of it.im only coming back here for HH hour foods. seriously. and the truffle fries

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: I used to really like the food at Yard House since it was solid bar food. However, I was disappointed on my most recent visit. My coworkers and I came on a Friday for Happy Hour/early dinner, but unfortunately missed the HH cutoff at 6pm. I had called ahead to put our name on the waitlist, so that you don't have to wait quite as long when you get there. Just make sure you don't show up late for that time, otherwise they cross your name off. It took another 20 minutes or so from when we arrived to get a table (around 6:30pm), and we ordered:-Sweet Potato Fries (w/Maple Bacon Cream Dip): Disappointing. The sweet potato fries were soggy and limp. The only thing that saved them was the good flavor of the sweet potato, and the maple bacon cream dip, which was still delicious. I wouldn't order the fries again if they were still soggy.-Pear & Gorgonzola Flatbread (Caramelized Onions, Leeks & Balsamic Syrup): Yuck, I didn't like this flavor combination at all. The moisture from the pear makes the flatbread soggy, and there was a sour taste to this dish. Skip!-Lobster, Crab & Artichoke Dip (Maine Lobster, Blue Crab, Artichoke Hearts, Four Cheese Blend w/Chips & Baked Pita): Yuck- I'm not sure how they manage to screw up a dip. It was dry and clumpy, and you couldn't taste the lobster, crab, or artichoke. Skip!-Fried Calamari (w/Spicy Tomato, Tartar Sauce): Not very good- the calamari was also soggy and limp, and there wasn't much crisp to them. I wouldn't get this again.-Coconut Shrimp (w/Spicy Green Papaya Salad, Sweet Chili Sauce, Thai Basil Pesto): One of the better dishes of the night since the shrimp was actually crunchy. -Lobster Garlic Noodles (Tossed w/Shrimp, Crab, Lobster, Shiitake Mushrooms, Fresh Spinach, Dusted w/Parmesan): Pretty good. Their garlic noodles have always been one of my favorite dishes here, and it didn't disappoint this time. Recommended!The service was a little lackluster since it was difficult to flag down our server at times, and they have different people bring your dishes to you. It would've been nice if our server was more attentive and checked in on us more towards the end. We also thought it was a bit weird that a lot of our dishes came out super quickly, but I ordered a dish to go and it took forever to get it. Yard House is still a great place to go if you're a beer lover since they rotate what beers they have on tap, and have seasonal beers available. I'd still recommend coming for their happy hours (M-F 3-6pm and Sun-W 10pm-close) since the discounted appetizers are a really good deal. It's still super loud in here though, so can be difficult to have a conversation at times.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: It was a horror experience.  I was having some beer with friends when one of us becoming sick and had to go to washroom. We were kind of making fun of him coz he had only one beer.  Before my friend even got out of washroom, a waiter came over and ORDER us to leave.  I was shocked! That is the way YH treat the customers? Or they are trying to hide something? since my friend still recovering, we just dun want to waste our time. Paid and move to the cafe next door, he felt better after few more trips to the washroom. then he told us it wasn't the beer that got him, it was the food either the taco or the ahi sashimi. Food poisoning is quite likely. You guys out there. Watch out for YH kind of food and CS.

Reviews.Author: Carena N.
Reviews.Content: Great for HH!!!   Half-priced appetizers and pizzas, $4 pints, $8-$11 half yards, $4-$5 wells drinks, $2 off specialty drinks/wines!Monday - Friday 3pm - 6pmSunday - Wednesday 10pm - CloseLove, love, love coming here for HH!  I don't think you can really go wrong with any of the items on the menu, but my go-to HH items are: Calamari, BBQ Chicken/Spicy Thai Chicken Pizza, Hawaiian Poke Stack, Chicken Nachos, Chicken Lettuce Wraps, Chicken Garlic Noodles, and Traditional Firecracker Chicken Wings.  I don't think the Truffle Fries are on HH, but they are also a must get!  I'm not much of a beer drinker, but they also have an amazing beer selection on tap which you need to try!  The Timmermans Framboise is usually my go to!

Reviews.Author: Julia G.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the more I visit other cool restaurants the less I like Yard House. The food is good, service is ok, but the crowds of people, constant wait and inability to order a table for a big party just makes it difficult to love this place. While I enjoyed my friends company, the WiFi was close to non existing. WHY?! It was such a pain to even check in, and even more to share some pics or cool memories that I'd rather avoid this place in a future.

Reviews.Author: Gautam A.
Reviews.Content: I have been to this yard house plenty of times since they opened. Their food is A+ and the beers are one too many. Try the Gardien menu, if you like to get adventurous with tofu. One experience always remains consistent, excellent service. Every time I go there, I come back thinking that this was the best service. The wait staffs are very attentive, responsive and quick.One thing to note is the long wait times if you go here on a weekend evening not to mention the parking struggle in Santana Row. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Mei Z.
Reviews.Content: I've been here couple times now but I usually only go for the happy hour. The place can get packed depends on the day and time you come. But for sure weekend and evening there's usually a wait. The place is known for the varieties of beer they have. Since I'm not a beer drinker, can't comment on that but their cocktails are pretty good. The appetizers during happy hour are worth going for. Their truffle fries and garlic noodles are a must! The cali roll (its not the common roll form) and ahi poke are also yummy. The atmosphere is nice but can get a bit loud when it's pack. So I would recommend just go for the happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Thao N.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place with beautiful people. This place has louder lounge-like feel to it which is great if you're looking for somewhere exciting to enjoy on a weeknight! I really wish I could have tried food here, it's closed at 11, but too bad I didn't know kitchen closed like an hour earlier. Again, I really wished I could have tried the food because the happy hour menu looked great.I guess I could only judge Yard House by the service & non-alcoholic drinks that I got. I ordered some sort of iced tea & didn't know it was unsweetened so I added a bunch of sugar & could still taste nothing so I exchanged it for an orange juice. May I tell you that I'm not usually the type to ask any server to take anything back, but I really didn't want to pay for something that tasted like water. I absolutely appreciate how quickly they replaced my drink & didn't make a big deal out of it. I definitely will want to be back to try the food because again, it looks mouth-watering!

Reviews.Author: Alexandra O.
Reviews.Content: I loved this place!The onion ring tower is to die for!The martinis are delicious, the service is great. The only complaint I have is that their French fries tasted like they had obviously been sitting around for a while, cold and stale.

Reviews.Author: Philana C.
Reviews.Content: Do you love beer?! If you do, you should definitely make a trip to the Yardhouse! Yardhouse is known for their wide selection of beers on tap. All the different types of beer are located on the first couple pages of their menu. The restaurant itself is HUGE and spacious with TVs showing different sports' channels. Every time I've came here, it's busy like crazy and it gets pretty loud. The wait can be a bit ridiculous though.. I love their happy hour specials! I've been here for both dinner and happy hour. Their menu has so many options for you to pick from. It's a bit overwhelming because everything sounds so good. Food is a bit more pricier; thus, coming in during happy hour is definitely worth what you pay for. Their happy hours are Monday - Friday from 3PM - 6PM and Sunday - Wednesday 10PM - close. Domestic pints are $3.75, crafts and imports are about $4 - $7, half yards about $7 - $10, and well drinks under $5. Really good deal. Select appetizers and pizzas are half-off. Those appetizers come in BIG portions by the way!So far, I have only tried two of their beers: Timmermans Strawberry and the Gulden Draak 9000 Quad. Even though I am not a huge beer fan, surprisingly I actually liked them. The Timmermans Strawberry was basically a strawberry flavored beer. It tasted pretty fruity and sweet. However, I did wish it was a bit more stronger. The Gulden Draak is a very dark beer with an ABV 10.5%. It tasted pretty sweet with a bit of bitterness. Pretty strong in my opinion. Regardless, it was quite delicious. I'm determined to come back and try more of their beer selections!For food-wise, I have tried their fried calamari, onion ring tower, classic sliders, and BBQ bacon cheddar burger with fries. Their BBQ bacon cheddar burger was so delicious, flavorful, and juicy! Same goes for their classic sliders. Their fried calamari and onion ring towers are delicious too. Portions are humungous even during their happy hour specials. I definitely want to try more of their appetizers when I come back!

Reviews.Author: Katherine L.
Reviews.Content: My family and I came here on a Sunday night at around 5 pm and were instantly seated. The hostesses could really learn to manage their emotions better. The four standing there were fiddling around and did not even greet us and the one girl took a moment before registering we were even there. I would give you guys 2 stars for that. However, we were seated shortly after and instantly greeted by Navid, our server. He had a very sarcastic personality and quite hilarious. We were easily entertained and his service was quick and he was very knowledgeable about the menu (both food and alcohol wise). He seemed rather side tracked and counted the minutes until it was time for him to go home. FOOD:*Mac n cheese with a side of fries for the little ones: mac n cheese was like any other but I love the thinly cut fries. They're so much crispier!*Garlic Lobster Pasta: absolutely delicious. I totally recommend this! It was buttery/creamy, savory and had the right amount of mushrooms, shrimp and lobster. *Vodka Shrimp Pasta: Even more creamy, I prefered this over the garlic lobster but honestly, you're safe with either*I totally forgot the beer but Navid will guide you in the right direction.Also a plus, it's a great place to watch sports as there are TVs everywhere. Sunday night football + good food + good company + good beer!

Reviews.Author: Oscar D.
Reviews.Content: came to the yard house excited with their beers and did not know the difference between 2 beers so i asked the waitress and  responded by reading the menu.......so after that i order a california roll and that is exactly what i got... ONE! GIANT! california roll... a big ball of rice with some tuna on top... wtf is wrong you chef this is not sushi... and also mini burgers were shit..

Reviews.Author: Chan Chan T.
Reviews.Content: I was here the other day for the first time and I don't think I will be coming back. When I asked if I could have the truffle oil on the side for my Mac and cheese, the waiter asked, " do we do that?" How would I know? Instead, why didn't he just say he will check to see or just do it. After we ordered, the food came out pretty quick...except for my meal. While my friends had their entrees, I had to wait. I didn't mind waiting, but a heads up when have been nice. The food was ok. I do like how I was able to get half instead of the full meal. The thin cut truffle oil fries were good.

Reviews.Author: Kristin P.
Reviews.Content: It's definitely a favorite place to hang out for my me, my husband and friends. We're always chill out there with several choices of beer as when we be here and it's like a beer tasting your for us. Will come back there soon:-).

Reviews.Author: Ingrid L.
Reviews.Content: This review just for their happy hour. Yard House happy hour is one of my favorite places to eat. All appetizers and pizzas are half off during happy hour. I think there is also a couple other things on the menu. My favorite things to order include their version of a tuna roll. It's not seaweed wrapped sushi but instead it's a tower with layers of tuna sashimi, edamame, and guacamole. The artichoke dip is delicious as well. The pizza great if you want a cheap, filling meal. I've also had their burgers and they are so good!

Reviews.Author: Kristine F.
Reviews.Content: The wait wasn't that long! I went in at 6:45pm for a 5 person table and I was told the wait was 1-1.5 hours. The hostess said to come back after thirty minutes to receive a pager. Conveniently, I had to return something at H&M anyway. Thirty minutes later and with only three people from our party, we were sitting outside perusing the menu when the pager goes off after only seven minutes! I wasn't complaining. Jaimee kindly asked us how our day was going and if we had any plans for the weekend besides dining at Yard House as she led us down the stairs on the left past all of the eager patrons celebrating Friday. We walked to the round booth tucked in the left hand corner of the restaurant where we could see (and hear) everything, including the central bar in the very middle. Pretty good seats for my first time there! Plus, we had room for six instead of the original five. Our super attentive waitress, Brittany, came by and we ordered the highly anticipated truffle fries, coconut shrimp, and ahi poke bowl. Truffle fries are sooo delicious! We ended up ordering two portions! Thin cut fries tossed in slivers of Parmesan cheese and topped with parsley/rosemary and truffle oil, yum. Tastes like garlic too ($4.45). The coconut shrimp was ok; there were three large butterflied shrimp on top of sweet n spicy sauce (~$14). The ahi had some avocado on it-- good stuff and it was less than $7. Our other friends slowly trickled in and we ordered Gardein Mac+Cheese, jambalaya, fish & chips, and parmesan chicken. It's nice to have the Gardein option for many dishes in case you can't eat meat. My Mac + cheese noodles were interestingly shaped like cones, had mushrooms, breadcrumbs, and lots of gooey cheesiness. The half portion is ~$12.45, full ~$17. I'm thankful the corner we were in had adequate lighting so pics turned out well and I wasn't falling asleep like I would've at Maggiano's or Cheesecake Factory. With all the cheering/celebrating groups around us, I finally felt like it was a real Friday. This first visit was the make or break of whether I'd be back. I've heard lots of good things but seeing the line out the door always stopped me from dining here. Service was impeccable, Brittany checked back multiple times during the two hours we were there and was calm and collected while handling several large loud groups (including one with a birthday where they were pretty tipsy). She adapted easily to all the person additions to our table and was very informative about the six beer samplers, which unfortunately is out until Monday, when they'll have a lot more options. None of us ordered any drinks but I'm eager to try the House Tropic and Pineapple Express during future visits. You better believe I'm planning my birthday celebration here in a few months.

Reviews.Author: Judy M.
Reviews.Content: I usually yelp before I eat because I trust my fellow Yelpers.  Having said that, in this one instance, I'm glad I didn't.  Without the preconceptions I was able to take this place for what it was: a somewhat swankier than average sports bar .My apple cider beer was crisp, our server was friendly, and our food arrived quickly despite how busy it was.  We started off with the Hawaiian poke and it was well flavored.  We also ate the California roll.  It was good, but mostly, it was fun/novel to eat. Once you get past the fact that it's not sushi grade rice, you can enjoy it in the way that you enjoy miniature foods--partly because it's unconventional.  The truffle fries were what you'd expect-cooked well and you could actually taste the truffle. The Korean belly tacos were tasty, but it did lack some component. Acid, maybe?  Finally, the moo shoo was more of an egg roll, but the flavors were pretty impressive and complex. If the service and food stay consistent, I'll be back! My curiosity is peaked.

Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delicious, with excellent service! The wait times are a little ridiculous, but typically worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Sandy W.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars because of the happy hour and the half yard sizes. There are so manyyy brew of beer to choose from that you wont know what to get. I love the appetizers, large enough to share with friends. Very nice place to hangout with friends for beer and appetizers oh and you can do shopping afterwards at Santan Row afterwards! The server was very nice too!

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Popped my Yard House cherry last Thursday(I never went the first year they opened because everyone waited forever and a day to get a table.  Apparently they don't do reservations).  At 8pm, they wouldn't give us a buzzer until half our party got there.  After we got our buzzer we waited 15 minutes for a party of 8, not bad considering all the horror stories you usually hear about the wait.  The restaurant atmosphere is really loud, couldn't really conversate with my girls unless I raised my voice or leaned into each other while talking.  The menu is huge!  Tons of appetizers and a lot of entree choices.  Luckily they have half servings for some of the items.  Out of the items we ordered, I tried:**Pineapple express - basically a pineapple mojito.  Yums, but could be stronger!**Spicy tuna roll - this is NOT a sushi roll.  It consists of ahi tuna, avocado, edamame, cucumber, in a drum shape. And SUPER delicious!**Asada Taco and Grilled Pork Belly Taco - Steak taco with pico and guac. It was alright, but not sure if worth almost $6.  For the Pork Belly taco,  I expected it to be super, but it was also alright.  They top it with some kimchi as well.**Mac n cheese - I ordered this because of all the hype.  But it ended up being OK.  It's a cheese pasta (not your typical elbow macaroni pasta) that comes with chicken, bacon, and mushrooms.  I could barely taste the truffle oil unfortunately.**Truffle fries - thin cut fries with garlic and a layer of truffle oil.  These were delicious but half the fries ended up being only and inch long.They also let you taste beer and they bring it to you in a small glass.What was pretty cool at the end, the waitress offered to split our check into individual tabs for 8 people.  Most places either don't let you or you need to let them know before ordering.Overall, OK place and I consider it on the same level as BJ's or any other brewery restaurant.  I probably should come back during happy hour to check out the specials everyone raves about!

Reviews.Author: James P.
Reviews.Content: My review is solely based on their happy hour on Monday-Friday 3-6pm.In my opinion one of the best happy hours in San Jose for those who enjoy drinking beer and have an appetite.They have the widest selection of beer from fruit flavored to your strongest ale. Their staff was extremely knowledgable on their beer and provided great recommendations.You will appreciate the variety of appetizers including but not limited to lettuce wraps, pizzas, wings, sushi rolls, calamari, ect... Oh wait, did I mention they are half off?My personal favorite is the chicken lettuce wraps. It comes with fresh butter leaf lettuce, ground chicken mixed with tofu, pine nuts, green onion, and 3 different sauces that perfectly compliment each bite.Thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Timothy D.
Reviews.Content: This place has so many beers on tap.  It's like beer heaven! I'm sure there are plenty of other beers that they do not carry. Until I drink all the varieties, I will be content for now.I recommend going to this place during Happy Hour only.  The prices can get pretty costly on a regular night.  I came here during Monday Night Football, which was also considered HH throughout the duration of the game.  I'm a big fan of their chicken nachos, margarita pizza, and truffle fries.  Perfect complimentary for my beer.The service for this place sucks, straight up.  Seems like the waiters here are new on the job.  So many mistakes left and right.  Whatever you ask for, they are bound to get it wrong.  Something as simple as getting some water, a menu, or even the beer sizes.  I had like 2 other waiters coming to my table with a dish and asking if we ordered it.  HAHA that just seemed way too funny.  I should had taken it as they would have charged the other table.  This place is exceptional for the beers.  But I would only rate this place 3 stars as service has much room to improve.  Regardless, you will still see me at the next Monday Night Football game.

Reviews.Author: Sheena S.
Reviews.Content: I like coming here with a few of my close girls and my sister. The service is always pleasant and the ambiance of this location is always welcoming. I love the nachos with chicken! Every bite is filled with a surprise and it's so gooood. The fries are really good here too. Not greasy and you get the right taste in every bite. My girls always race about their burgers and pasta, I am yet to try, but I am sure won't be disappointing.  Deff is a fun place to enjoy some good food, come around happy hour time for small sets and drinks, and enjoy sport games on there huge all around flat screens. Thanks Yardhouse [=

Reviews.Author: Wendy N.
Reviews.Content: Perfectly cooked and tender petite filets were delicious.  We each ordered the same thing.  However, my broccolini was overcooked and dry.  My husband's broccolini was cooked just right and marinated lightly with olive oil.  We got there a bit early for dinner (6:15 pm) and only had to wait 10 minutes.  Not bad for a Saturday night in Santana Row.  It's too bad we were both on diets or we would have tried one of their many beers.

Reviews.Author: Linh P.
Reviews.Content: Great place. Great food. Great ambiance. Good to get some drinks with friends. It is really nice inside. They have a wide variety of beer. You can get yard sized beers, hence the name Yard House. I recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Author: Tiffanie E.
Reviews.Content: One of my boyfriend and my favorite places to go for dinner.  I get the surf and turf burger pretty much every time.  It's so good that it's hard to get me to try something different there.

Reviews.Author: Andrew R.
Reviews.Content: Yard House. You can't go wrong. They have a new 'chalk board' series which feature some good craft brews. Service is good and food is awesome. The wait is long so be prepared for that, grab a pager and head to the bar. My personal favorites on the menu are truffled Mac + Cheese, Southern fried Chicken, and the Enchilada stack. The portions are huge and your tummy will be happy. Great place for groups and sports watching. Great addition for Santa Row.

Reviews.Author: Marie T.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere : thumbs upBar: thumbs up: LOTS of beer taps! There are lot's of TVs around the restaurant so you can catch the game from anywhere you are sitting: Thumbs up!Service: Thumbs up!Food: Thumbs down:  "Very American".  The sweet potato fries seemed like they went cheap on the potato. So, my 2-stars is based on the food.

Reviews.Author: Shriya P.
Reviews.Content: Yard house just never disappoints! The variety of beer is just unbelievable and although it is ALWAYS packed, once you find a spot at the bar, it's all forgotten :)There have been nights when we have had to wait for over an hour but given that it is such a popular place, you just have to be prepared to wait for a table! We brought in the new year at Yard house last year and it wasn't as crowded and crazy as most other places on New Year's Eve which made it a pleasant memorable night. The food is not bad either. The Jambalaya is awesome. Some of the dishes could do with a little more seasoning. Definitely order the onion rings and truffle fries!

Reviews.Author: Cindy L.
Reviews.Content: There are four things you need to know about this place:1.  Amazing selection of beer (you can taste before you commit!)2.  Decent food3.  Reeeeeeally slow service4.  Extremely long waitIf there service and wait were faster, this place would rate 4 stars, easy.  And I would be coming back all the time.  It is a great place to hang out and grab a few beers when you want to spend some time there.  Plus, I think I impressed my date with the amazing selection of beers.  Girls....great place to bring your guy.  ;)A bit about the food....the burgers and truffle fries are awesome!  The mac n cheese and the seared ahi salad were decent.  Service is slow, probably because the place is always packed.  If I were you, I'd take advantage of its location, put my name down first, take the coaster, and stroll around Santana Row while waiting the hour plus for a table.

Reviews.Author: T. C.
Reviews.Content: I like this place.. it is great to come with a bunch of friends. . the place is loud and there is tons of TV screens to watch some sports ...the wait can be very long but hey if you have a crown you can entertain each other lolthe drinks are good and the food is great.!

Reviews.Author: Puja S.
Reviews.Content: I've mostly been here for happy hour and the specials are pretty good. The portions are pretty big too (i.e., nachos) for a decent price. But if you come during there non happy hour hours, this place just doesn't do it for me. I feel like I'm paying more than I should for mediocre food. They do have a pretty extensive beer/drink selection. You can even ask for a sample (you get 2 free). And it can get busy here with a long wait time. Just go walk around Santana Row while you wait though. All in all, it's just eh for me.

Reviews.Author: Shells M.
Reviews.Content: I was introduced to Santana Row Yard House about a year ago and I really genuinely like it here. The food is really good and that's what keeps me and my love on coming back. I surprised him on his birthday last year when the Giants won the world series with a cake and candle and he took me here on Valentine's day after he surprised me with Pinkberry and Tiffanys!!! Awww....ok out of memoryland. Things you MUST try:-Blue crab cakes (served with fresh fruit and a papaya drizzle, crazy good combo-who would've thought!)-Kung Pao calamari (it's calamari with a kick! They add walnuts and red pepper with sweet sauce. -1 for the tiny side of brown rice portion. It get smaller each and every time *tsk tsk* )-Sliders (love their turkey and ahi sliders)- Truffle fries (fries with a kick...mmm...truffle....)-Pizza (all of them are yummy!)-Salads Drinks- I would recommend their mojitos and blackberry green ice tea! Both delish!It does tend to get busy but when you're with the right company-honey time does not matter right??I like the ambiance and the fact that the food is cooked instead of frozen and microwaved (ahem Friday's....)

Reviews.Author: Celeste S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Yard House in San Diego every time I go to Comic Con and LOVE it.  This was my first time to this location and happy to report it is just as good. The waiter was fantastic. He gave us honest feedback on items we asked about (including what NOT to get!)  He was very attentive without being always there. Plus he was funny :) I had the seared ahi steak sandwich with truffle fries. It was so ridiculously good. The ahi was sashimi grade. As I write this review, I want it again! Also, it was literally an entire ahi steak. No being cheap on the fish. We started with the hummus appetizer and it was quite tasty as hummus is. There were so many items on the menu that I wanted to try. If you go there hungry, be prepared to review the menu a lot before making your final decision!We went around 11:30am on a Thursday so we got in before the lunch crowd that started coming in afterwards. And I'm sure it gets ridiculously crowded at night (like the SD location) especially on the weekends. But that's the norm for any decent place in the Bay Area nowadays.

Reviews.Author: Yesenia P.
Reviews.Content: Waiting for an hour for our food only to be told that there was a mix up and the food was not ordered!

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: I went there last weekend for a light family lunch. I figured it's me that didn't wave close enough to the sensor at the faucet in the bathroom last time. My bad.  I ordered pizza, hamburger and noodle salad this time. The food is nice.

Reviews.Author: Huong N.
Reviews.Content: This place, since it opened has always been very busy. My friends and I like to come here for happy hour because its pretty cheap. What we ordered:- Poke (sauces on the side)- Sear ahi tuna (sauces on the side)- garlic noodles- tower of onion ringsThere isn't much to eat here due to my gluten allergy but I do enjoy the drinks and what I can eat. Their gluten sensitive menu isn't very sensitive because they still had pizza on that menu and pasta! I sure hope they understand what gluten sensitive more. Coming here on a weekend, you'll be waiting for a good hour or more so I like to come for happy hour on a weeknight. It's busy but there is a very short wait or no wait at all.  It's a close hangout between my friends and I, so I like to visit once in awhile.

Reviews.Author: Pineapple L.
Reviews.Content: Reservation necessary on a Friday/Saturday NIght (can be up to 1.5hr wait!)We had dinner at Yard House on a Sunday Night, there was no problem walking in and getting a table right away. Friendly attentive staff.I ordered the " *PAN SEARED AHI seared rare over jasmine or brown rice, fresh asparagus, chinese black bean sauce and fried basil" it was so delicious!! I'm not a big of  rare fish so While I ordered I asked to have the chef sear the Ahi a little longer, and it came just how I asked, no problem.For desert I ordered the "MINI TRIO SAMPLER mini serving of our lemon soufflé, peach apple cobbler and chocolate souffle" Nice way to end the meal.Left satisfied!

Reviews.Author: Johnny G.
Reviews.Content: whats not to love..a BAJILLION BEERS ON TAP! who doesnt love thatFULL BAR for those bad days at workT.V's GALORE to catch your favorite team play (warriors, raiders and giants please!)But the wait..WOW is it long. It can be 1-2 hours. Nice that its in santana row so I can usually window shop and pretend to be rich (im chinese its not in my vocab to spend so much!)Other then that I think the food is very good to boot also. My favorites is the Steak sandwich. OHhh its OHH SO GOOD. steak cheese bread and tomatoes. IM DOWN!Also the mac and cheese is pretty bomb tastic. must get everything with truffle fries tho! YUMMMS!The Happy Hour menu is ALSO A GREAT DEAL!

Reviews.Author: Jen O.
Reviews.Content: I still love this place, they never let me down. By the way, if you're lucky enough to get placed in Robin's section, you won't be disappointed! She's fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Whitney A.
Reviews.Content: Do you want to try a new beer, something unlike you've tried before? If so then this is definitely the place to go!Yard House has an extensive menu of beers organized into sections based on region or flavors.  They also offer 3 different 6-pack samplers which include 6 5oz glasses of beer and a beer list with descriptions of each you are tasting. I tried the traditional sampler which offered a wide variety of beers from IPAs to Hefe's. The truffle fries are a must try! They are delicious. I have also had and enjoyed the nachos, and the french onion soup was delicious but the cheese blob on top became a little overwhelming. I am also told by my vegetarian friend that this place offers an impressive Garden menu and THE BEST vegetarian buffalo wings she has ever had!

Reviews.Author: Ashley E.
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. The food was cooked perfectly and every dish was yummy. The servers were awesome and totally helpful. We came on a Tuesday night for my boyfriends birthday dinner and only had to wait about 20 minutes. Our server Jennifer was super sweet and so helpful. In conversation told her it was my boyfriends birthday when she asked for his ID. When we finished our meal to our surprise here came Jennifer with a chocolate brownie and ice cream plate decorated for his birthday! We will definitely be back again. Super loud when games are on and front staff girls seemed a bit confused is the only reason i didn't give 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Jen H.
Reviews.Content: Good ol Yard House... Definitely the place if you are looking to drink! They have an extensive beer selection, more than I have ever seen in one place! I like stouts like Guinness and their Young's Double Chocolate Stout is similar ... Rich, but so good!  They even make it as a "beer float" with ice cream on top.. And ya I've tried it (don't judge).  I'd skip their signature mixed drinks.. I've had a couple and waaaayy too over-the-top sweet to the point where I couldn't even drink them. Just stick to the beer.. You can't go wrong. Food: like Cheesecake Factory, they have about 10,000 things on the menu but pretty much everything I've had there has been good.  Their truffle fries are TO DIE.. They are a must!  Some other good items...-Turkey Burger-Mediterranean Flatbread-Onion Rings-Ham & Pineapple Pizza-Angel Hair pasta -Kona Coffee Ice Cream Sundae (OMG)Service:Very hit or miss.  If you eat in the dining room or upstairs tables, service is generally pretty good (but slow).  Sitting at the bar is a totally different story.  The bartenders there.. Hmmm.. On multiple occasions, I have encountered arrogant and flat-out rude service from bartenders.  They either ignore you, act like they're above serving you, or do the bare minimum and then forget about you and go on break or something.  One time my bf asked for a beer recommendation and the bartender just points to his open menu and (with an attitude) goes "the beers are there.. Next to that is where the beers are from".. Um, DUH.  We can read.  Not only was he RUDE, he clearly had no knowledge about his products.   All in all, Yard House is a good place for happy hour or meeting up with friends.  Have a drink, order an app, have no expectations about service and you're good to go :)

Reviews.Author: Javier P.
Reviews.Content: After debating, reading several reviews, tips and recommendations from a few yelp friends, I finally came to the Yard House. I was accompanied by my food buddy. We came here on a Tuesday around 5pm. I was expecting it to be crowded but to our surprise it wasn't. Both the outside and inside looks very nice. Big LED Tv's (I hope they're LED & not plasma lol) located everywhere allow you to view the game from anywhere you sit. They also play real music. While we were here I heard Journey, The Eagles, and a few 80's. Good music equals good atmosphere and a good time. I can't remember each song that was playing but every song was amongst my favorites. My food buddy ordered the Lobster Garlic Noodles. I went through the whole menu and couldn't decide what I wanted. I kept coming back to the Lobster Garlic Noodles but I didn't want to order the same because we always order different dishes so we can try each other's food. So I finally settled for the Lobster Garlic Noodles too. The Lobster Garlic Noodles was amazing. It taste as good as it looks. The spinach, mushrooms, and chives go well with the shrimp, lobster and the garlic noodles topped with parmesan cheese (ask for extra Parmesan cheese). A well balanced dish. Perfect size portion and it fills you up. A bit pricy but well worth it.With our order came sweet potato fries which we didn't order. We got our servers attention and asked if we had someone else's order. He said that whoever brought us the sweet potato fires made a mistake. He could take 'em to the kitchen and most likely be tossed in the garbage or we could have them on the house which we did. The maple syrup sauce that comes with the sweet potato fries is very addictive. You just can't stop eating it. You'll probably end up asking for an extra sauce.Before we ordered real food. We had dessert first. It was her idea and she ordered the Macadamia Nut Cheesecake. Served over a pool of caramel and sprinkled nuts, sits the cheesecake with powdered sugar around the plate topped with a scoop of whip cream and mint leaves for decoration. The cheesecake wasn't as sweet as I thought it would be. It appeared to be fluffy which made it easy to dap into the caramel and powdered sugar. A little bit of everything in every bite. It was also happy hour so got the Hawaiian Sunset Martini. For my taste, it wasn't really all that. Our server was very nice and attentive. Checked up on us regularly. My water never went down because it kept being refilled. The staff was also nice. They greeted us from the moment we set foot in to when we left.I'll definitely come back again soon. Next time I'll try the mac n' cheese and truffle fries.

Reviews.Author: Destiney S.
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I just come for the truffle fries and usually with a mojito accompanied. With that being my order, I've never have bad service whether at the bar or at a booth. I usually go in the early afternoon and it's not to busy. It's my little treat for myself.

Reviews.Author: Marissa K.
Reviews.Content: The BEST happy hour ever.  Monday-Friday from 3pm-6pm, stop by and grab some drinks and appetizers.  PLEASE! I've tried every item on their happy hour menu, yes I've been here that many times!  Some of my favorites include the lettuce wraps, garlic noodles, and sliders, but seriously I really enjoyed all of it.  Oh and they even have brown rice too if you're trying to eat a little healthier. The portions are extremely generous, and I consider most of them entrees rather than appetizers.  And for half the price, just order the crap out of the HH menu. Also, there are a ton of beers and cocktails to choose from. I'm not much of a dark beer drinker but whether you like light or dark, they have it all.

Reviews.Author: Jason M.
Reviews.Content: Great ambience, nice location, nice building...food, not so impressive.Had a great list of beers including some great house selections.  If you are coming for beers then this is an awesome place.  Service was great.The food was not so great.   Onion ring tower is good, nice chipotle dip.  Sweet potato fries are decent with a good bacon sauce dip.  The flat bread with olives, feta, artichokes and tomatoes is decent.  That was interesting, from there downhill though.The calamari is one of the worst I have ever had, perhaps the worst. It should be taken off the menu honestly.  The truffle oil fries were very plain and tasted like a fast food french fry with a little grated cheese on top.  Crab cakes were likewise uneventful.  Also tried the hot wings - I've had dive bar wings taste 10 times better at half the price.  And the entrees....ug.Overall I wouldn't come for the food.  Come for the drinks and people, eat to keep the buzz down, but don't come planning on a great meal.  If the food were marginally better I could've gone 4 maybe 5 because it is a fun place - but the food was out of synch with how nice everything else was.

Reviews.Author: Victoria Y.
Reviews.Content: I really really really like YH. Oh, did I mention I like Yard House?I went to my first Yard House in LA and I've been thinking about it ever since. When I saw the sign go up that it was coming.. I was so excited. Now that it's hear, I go every chance I'm in the area. Whether I'm grabbing dinner or a quick drink I love having so many drink choices :)

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: I love coming here during Happy Hour! Which is around 3:30-6? Everything on the menu is fantastic! Definitely try the truffle fries! So good! It's a great place to eat for dinner, family and friends.

Reviews.Author: Rosie W.
Reviews.Content: Their truffle fries are good but it's the super line cut kind and you don't get very much of it. It would be nice if we had an option for thicker cut fries. I ordered the grilled ham and cheese with tomato bisque. I added avocados to it. The grilled cheese was good, but it was a little on the oily side. It also had blue cheese in it, but it wasn't spread inside, there was just a chunk of it next to the avocado. I thought that was weird .. and I HATE blue cheese so I had to scrape it off but I could still taste it. Yuck. Why should blue cheese be in a grilled cheese? Tomato bisque was on point, creamy and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sonia F.
Reviews.Content: They should clear the tables faster. Lines are long but I see tables left uncleaned for 15 mins. Then left empty .. their gimmick to keep lines long???Love the Happy hour deals. Appertizers are half off from 3-6pm with yards & yards of beers listed (pun intended ;p) As for the quality & taste of food, I will give most dishes 3.5 star with the exception of its 'asian' appertizers. Tried the Ahi tuna years ago once & its enough to deter me from ordering it again. Thought I gave it another chance by ordering a Spicy Tuna Roll. Still below par compared to typical spicy tuna roll. Guess Asian fusion just isn't their forte. Rest assure that I do like Asian fusion, if its done with the right twistBrought mom & friends who were visiting me from overseas and they love the ambience, food and beers. Hip hip hurray!!!

Reviews.Author: Wendy K.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love Yard House!  The food is great and service is awesome (though my server today appeared impatient).  This place is pretty pricey but the seats are comfortable and the craft beer selection is great.I love that it is located at the intersection of Santana Row and Valley Fair Mall.  My favorite dish here is the Country Fried Chicken.  I have only gotten it once - because it is soo unhealthy but definitely an indulgence. I always get the truffle fries here!  They are delicious!!!I have tried the Garlic Noodles (must say I have had better).  I had the tuna stack here once - it was doused in too much soy and I never wanted to order it again.  Other dishes I liked include: Mac n Cheese, Jambalaya, and Tuna Salad!

Reviews.Author: E.Marie S.
Reviews.Content: Great drinks, not so great service.  Pineapple cider is amazing! If you like Berry Burst cider from BJ's, then you will definitely love the Pineapple cider as well. Great seared tuna & crab/artichoke/lobster dip.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: +Huge beer selection (Andre likes to get the strawberry beer)+Atmosphere is perfect for hanging out with friends or watching a game+Half yards! though if you're not chugging it you're probably better off ordering 2 pints instead unless you enjoy the taste of warm beer-Parking can be a pain especially on weekends-The wait can be especially a pain on weekends (evenings are the worst, could be 1-2 hour wait)-Food is nothing special

Reviews.Author: irwin v.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is one of many good bar/restaurant around Stevens Creek/ San JoseThey have great menus and the food were served pretty fast. Lobster Garlic Noodle and Ahi Bowl (Fresh Tuna) are my favorite here. Cons.Sat night. We waited about 2 hours for a table for 5. Overall this spot is awesome. I would go back again. I hope the wait time next time will be better

Reviews.Author: Chi W.
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty cool.  Beer is plentiful and there is a huge variety of it.  Started with a Belgian 6-pack sampler of beer, was fun to try them all!  A couple were delicious, a couple were meh, a couple were gross hahaWe ordered the lobster, crab & artichoke dip to start, which was delicious.  There was a good chip to dip ratio (some places bring you too many chips, too little dip or vice versa lol).  Clam chowder was good, but nothing extraordinary. Mac & Cheese was kind of dry- I've had it before at a different location and I was slightly underwhelmed this time.  Mini chocolate soufflé for dessert was delicious!  I would get it again.  Perfect size, not too huge but not too small- about 10 spoonfuls' worth.  I'd come back for beer and dessert.  Fun environment too, cozy.

Reviews.Author: Kristen B.
Reviews.Content: Friday night the place is packed, the wait can be very long and the bar very crowded but there is a huge variety of beers to try while you are waiting.  We had a larger party and ordered some appetizers before burgers, everything came out great.  Not a huge fan of overcrowded bars so I probably won't come back often but if that is your thing this is a great addition to Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Dwpka D.
Reviews.Content: Great food - I was really pleased that are so many options for vegetarians as well. Well worth the long wait times

Reviews.Author: Mark G.
Reviews.Content: The truffle fries are like crack! Man I just can't stop thinking about it... The environment is nice, but has very very low lighting. Some of the dishes such as the truffle fries are great, but overall food is ok.

Reviews.Author: Jerrica N.
Reviews.Content: I've only been to the yard house twice and my second time was after the yelp San Jose earthquakes event.To my surprise they were still open, I got there around 9:30-10 or so and found out they open late even on a Sunday! Better yet, they even have happy hour at that time! Score!So we ordered a margherita pizza, calamari, artichoke dip and the California roll. I also ordered a strawberry beer, which was fruity and sweet just to my liking! During happy hour apps and pizzas are half off. I really couldn't believe how many people were out on a Sunday night.The waiter was nice and explained where everything was on the menu and suggested a couple drinks that I would like after explaining my preferred drinks.The food came out and it was a lot. The calamari was pretty good, crispy, oily and came with marinara sauce and tartar sauce. I loved the spinach dip and I really liked that their chips were thick and salty. I don't like the cheap-y chips that anyone can grab at the grocery store. I absolutely loved their concept of the California roll. It came out very pretty and looked like a cake!! I also liked that their version had a little kick to it to set them apart. As for the margherita pizza, I wasn't all that fond of it. The tomatoes didn't look appealing and it was rather hard.Loved that this place was open late AND you can't beat their happy hour. Next time I'll try their mac and garlic noodles, which I heard that they're both pretty darn good!

Reviews.Author: Ferdinand L.
Reviews.Content: This place in my book is the quintessential classy/casual restaurant bar.  People come here and it feels like a classier Chili's or something like that.  The menu is on point and the crowd often matches the young and hip demographic of its location.  Frequented by both young professionals, established professionals, and college kids alike, this place has an interesting demographic. But the food tends to be just a smidge on the higher side for the quality of food you get, but I guess thats what you get when you're on the row. Anyways decent place to go eat with friends, co-workers, even family.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: Their truffle fries are soooooo amazing paired along side a Pineapple Express. That is all.The food and drinks are super good, HOWEVER, the service is so slow! I mean for truffle fries and a drink, I shouldn't have to wait about an hour for it to come!!! This has happened to me on multiple visits and I always have to prepare myself for a 1.5-3 hour lunch or dinner. Dinner is okay but for lunch it definitely makes me want to go somewhere else since the food takes so long!

Reviews.Author: Carrie S.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for lunch on a Saturday.There are a lot of things to like about the Yardhouse menu, so that is why I was excited to come here.  They have gluten free options, vegetarian, menu is labeled with healthy options, etc.  Lots of choices and they will customize anything for you.We had a great server, but the food prep took forever.  We know this because the food came out piping hot, and he kept coming back to tell us he was checking constantly for our food.  The kitchen was napping, texting on their phones, or they were short staffed.  Our server gave us a discount after my husband complained that we had parked in 1 hour parking and we came straight into the restaurant after parking our car and still had not had our food yet.  Seriously, it took over an hour get our grub.I have never ordered take out, but maybe this is a better option?

Reviews.Author: Sarika S.
Reviews.Content: A great place to come and grab good any one of the day. Happy hour has great deals and food is always consistent. They also now have a decent selection of soy based food. They also give out up to 2 small samples of beer if you want to try something before you order. Great idea!

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: I come here pretty often to watch sports games or just enjoy the vast selection of beer on tap.  The food is pretty amazing as well, pretty big portions I may add, especially for the pricing.  The prices here are comparable to other places on Santa Row, but no where else could you get a yard-tall beer on tap!Great beer selection, fabulous food, and efficient customer service!Speaking of customer service, I have never had a bad waiter/waitress here, they are always attentive and well mannered.I suggest Yard House to my friends all the time, and usually we go here whenever we are in the area.

Reviews.Author: Sona C.
Reviews.Content: After wrapping up our work in San Jose, we went to Yard house situated in Santana Row before heading back home. This place was literally overflowing with people. There must have been at least 100 people there, most of them drinking from their yard glasses. Very loud inside, we had to switch to shouting mode to talk.I had a flavored Mojito since I don't drink beer, while my friends enjoyed their yard beers. The food was also surprisingly nice for a beer place. The tacos I had were delicious.

Reviews.Author: Karlo B.
Reviews.Content: I actually really like this franchise. They have a beautiful restaurant in a great location, granted parking may be difficult and requires a bit of a walk, but still great location. Inside, there are plenty of seating with variety. You can sit at a table, bar, bar table, round table, and booths. They have beautiful art work and the restrooms are pretty cool. So, there are definitely plenty of things to keep your eyes amazed and loving the experience. The bar is incredible. For a microbrewery, they sure have a lot of other beers other than theirs on tap, which tells me they really want to please their customers and it's true, variety is the spice of life. I think visually, the bar is very mechanical. You could see where all the pipes lead and the colors are pretty metallic, which I do feel is somewhat of a disconnect there and lack of cohesion because the restaurant is very luxurious and modern. The drinks do take a while to come out to you, so be prepared to wait around 10 mins if you're not sitting at the bar.As for the food, it's very good. They have probably the best chicken nachos anywhere and the onion ring tower is toe to toe with the blooming onion of Outback Steakhouse.
