I do suggest only coming here during lunch hour and late night because everything on those specific menus are a bargain! The service is just kinda blah. The hosts are pretty bland. You don't get that warm welcome you do at a Cheesecake Factory, it's more like a hello and welcome from an Applebee's lol. For the most part, all the employees are just okay, but I wish I could light a fire under a lot of them to put some excitement on their faces. My only gripe about this place is that I can never get great reception on my cellphone here. I have AT&T and don't know how it is for other carriers. So this gets really frustrating, but other than that, this place is a go-to for locals and visitors.

Reviews.Author: Kimber C.
Reviews.Content: This update is long overdue. I went back to yard house for my friends birthday. The food was MUCH  better!!! I especially liked birthday desert. I was especially impressed with a business' desire to make sure that every customer has an excellent experience. It is this above and beyond attitude that has me updating my 3 star review to 5. If they continue doing things like they do, they will continue to be a very successful restaurant!!

Reviews.Author: C S.
Reviews.Content: We were told there was an hour wait for 4 on a Friday night - understandable, I suppose, considering how many people love this spot. We enjoyed a few drinks, and an hour and 15 minutes later were finally sat at a table. Our server was a nice guy, but very quiet for the loud atmosphere that he should have tried to speak over.2 Stars for the wait being longer than expected3 Stars for the service3.5 Stars for Food - Ahi Poke appetizer was pretty delish, truffled fries were good, lettuce wraps were good, my entree (fish served on a bed of mashed potatoes with asparagus, bok choy, and a truffle sauce that was more like gravy) came out cold which was a little disappointing but the server took it off the bill and gave us dessert. The truffle in the sauce had good flavor, the fish had a nice crust on top, but the potatoes tasted a little instant. It was great reheated at home the next day. Friend order the scallops, which were cooked well. For dessert, we had what looked like a BJ's imitation of the pizookie, chocolate brownie with a mint chip, carmel and vanilla on top. Nothing overly original but it was good. 4 Stars beer and wine selection

Reviews.Author: Dixie L.
Reviews.Content: **TIP: Happy hours are Monday-Friday, 3pm-6pm ! My friend and I shared:* truffle fries: okay this is just the BEST fries I have ever tasted !! no wonder my friend ALWAYS gets it when he comes here !! The fries are cut super thin so every bite is crunchy and not soggy!* Gardein Bbq Chicken Pizza: I thought this was okay. the chicken was pretty dry for my taste.As for the service: I'm pretty sure our waiter was new because he kept checking on us a little bit toooo much (though that's not a bad thing). The only thing I thought he could work on is to check the bill AFTER he walks away from our table. It's a tad rude to check it in front of us. The check, including tip, came out to be ~$12 and that was for TWO people!! Can it get any better???Overall: Definitely will be coming back once finals are over to party it up !

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Still can't get over truffle fries and specialty fruit beers. YUMz!Come here for Happy Hour. Best meal you'll get for its price!

Reviews.Author: Bruce C.
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Yard House, no matter which one it is. The one in Santana Row is the fifth location I've visited. The YH, regardless of where it is, always has a massive beer selection, decent food (their appetizers trump their entrees) good staff and plenty of opportunities for people watching - these are the reasons why I love them. I went last night (Friday) at around 9:30 and they were packed. They don't take reservations but you should call them on your way there so they put your name on the list - worked for us. We were seated 5 minutes after we showed up. Niceeeeee!Atmosphere:Cool. Clean. Loud. That's how all YHs are. I think it's also the reason most people come back. It's weird, it's one of the only places where you can wear either jeans and a tshirt or business casual and not feel under or overdressed. Their atmosphere welcomes all! Food:I've dined at YH plenty of times. Stick to their appetizers. Most of them are great except for the artichoke dip with crab - I don't believe cheese and seafood make a good couple unless you're talking about a tuna melt. Drinks:Biggest selection of beer you'll find this side of the Mississippi and a full bar with top-shelf liquor. The bar is huge - the signature elongated oval bar every YH has. Try to find bar seating if you're looking to mingle with strangers and make new friends.Service:Always the same - good to great but not amazing. The servers are cool, they don't overly check on you asking how everything is going every 10 minutes. They're always nice. I've never had an issue with YHs service at any location. Price:Not bad at all. Last night my date and I shared an appetizer, she had a pint of beer and I had two Sapphire and tonics. The bill came out to be $38 before tip.YHs is a great place for big parties, first dates, people watching, sports fans and beer enthusiasts. Cheers!

Reviews.Author: King C.
Reviews.Content: What more can a guy ask for. Beer, food, great location. Place is always packed for a reason.

Reviews.Author: 'Johnson R. H.
Reviews.Content: Their Kung Pao Calamari is very uniquely prepared. It is, obviously, deep fried. Then mixed in with candied walnuts, green onions, carrots, celery, red bell peppers, sprinkled with Kung Pao Sauce, and accompanied with brown rice. Nicely done and is a pleasant take on calamari.

Reviews.Author: Zerrilyn P.
Reviews.Content: A trip to the Yardhouse was just about overdue...came here with my friend after having grabbed some gelato next door, and just wanted to kill time before heading over to Aqui's for more booze haha...It was barely 5pm on a Friday afternoon, and the place was already packed, especially the bar! Wtf? Y'all decided to leave work early or what? Haha...anyway, luckily I found one available seat, and the guy I sat next to was kind enough to give up his seat and give it to my friend...I'm not that much of a beer drinker, but hey I'm willing to try anything! My friend knows I like drinks that are fruity and sweet, so when bartender came he asked her if I could try samples of the:-Sea Dog Bluepaw Wild Blueberry--smells like it, but I was so disappointed b/c I was expecting hints of blueberry which I was hardly able to taste...were my expectations too high or something? haha-St. Louise Framboise--so supposedly this is the beer that tons chicks love to drink...well...I don't fall into that category...smells good,and yes it tastes good and fruity, but  I personally think it totally defeats the purpose of calling it a beer cuz I can't taste the beer! I might as well drink some spiked fruit punch or something- he told me so many times what the beer is called, but  I can never remember the name...all I know is that it tastes just like Fruity Pebbles...anyway, this beer was probably the worst tasting for me...it does taste like Fruity Pebbles, and drinking it down was fine, but the aftertaste was effin' horrible...ickkkk...-Cherry Wheat: Finally! Something that I actually liked...smells like cherry, tastes like it too...almost like vanilla cherry coke to me hahaha...I ordered a pint of it and finished itFYI: I almost forgot to mention, I sampled about four beers total, by the time I had wanted to ask for another sample, the bartender told me there was only a 2-beer sample limit, so I commend her for letting me have a couple extra, but honestly though...is that 2-beer limit thing for real?? She gave me a funky look when I couldn't decide what I had wanted to drink yet.  Whoo hoo for customer service! not...Yardhouse you're pretty much known for your plethora of "poisons" are you not? So how do you expect someone to choose what they want to drink from a huge selection if they're only limitied to a couple of samples? Ehh, whatever...that's just my two cents...

Reviews.Author: Greg A.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing for non-hungry beer drinkers. Came here on a Tuesday night, and there was a 45 min wait. That's not a big deal, just a testament to the popularity of the place. Once seated, it was probably 30 minutes until we got food, but man, it was disappointing. My chicken enchilada stack was underwhelming, and my wife was not impressed with her burger at all. However, the beer selection is awesome, and they have a great mixed drink menu. I would recommend having dinner elsewhere, and coming here for a few nightcaps.

Reviews.Author: Alan D.
Reviews.Content: Don't bother getting their entree food here. It's definitely not worth the money. If you're hungry at all, I suggest just getting the truffle fries.What you're really looking for here is a great environment filled with people who are just like you! Yes! They all want a taste of DAT ALCOHOL. This place has hella beer on tap... seriously, don't even think about going here for a steak. DON'T DO IT. IT'S NOT WORTH IT. Instead, GRAB A BREWSKI.I absolutely love sunset wheat, it tastes like a blueberry beer without really tasting like blueberry at all.So absolutely go to Yard House. Grab a beer, have fun with your life!

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: Good selection of good & drinks! But the wait time can get a bit long on the weekends. I think the wait is well worth the food & drinks though. The best drink I've had there was the pineapple express. The onion ring tower we had was delicious. And don't get need started on their food! The burgers are tasty & other entree plates were delish! I will be coming back. I want to try coming back during happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Actually came here for lunch a few months ago but haven't posted the review until now.  It was a Sunday afternoon with no football games on so it was on the quiet side inside.  Had some questions on the beer and my server brought over the two in question so I could make the right choice.Overall the food was fresh and the service was great.  No complaints at all.

Reviews.Author: Calee C.
Reviews.Content: Happy hour! Happy hour! Happy hour! They have a large selection on their happy hour menu for 1/2 the price. Fried calamari was YUMM The spicy tuna roll had an AWSOME presentation and taste to it. It was like one gigantic spicy tuna roll with cucumbers  , edemes seaweed  drizzled soy sauce  wasabi. Pastrami sliders with thin cut fries was also delisiouso ! If u want to hit the happy hour, make sure you go after 10pm.

Reviews.Author: Jagtheesh R.
Reviews.Content: Must go! for good retreats and good vibes when you get inside. Make sure you reserve table atleast 2-3 days ahead, else be ready for a long long wait time.

Reviews.Author: Johnathan F.
Reviews.Content: The food was good, not outstanding but decent food. We had:1. Mac and Cheese - probably the best item we had. The noodles were a little hard around the sides but beside that the taste was good. 2. BBQ Bacon Cheddar Burger - good but not great. It was lacking something but I can't place what. 3. Asada Tacos - my wife liked these but said she wouldn't reorder them because for the price you could get much better.

Reviews.Author: Anjana S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a lot more than what I should have but I just love beer!! I have tried all and I mean all of their appetizer and would most definitely recommend lobster, crab, artichoke dip!! The lettuce wrap is way too salty. Overall, all the appetizers are good. Entrées are a whole different story.  I feel like it's a hit or a miss. I have tried their fried chicken with mashed potatoes  and it was a MISS! Not that I'm against it but the entrées aren't really that appealing to me.But, do not leave this place without trying their kona ice cream d dessert!!!! I'm not big on sweets at all but this dessert is just perfect! Not too sweet but just enough if you have  sweet tooth. The cookie that comes with it is freshly made and super delicious. So two things you gotta try are the huge beer selection and Kona ice cream dessert :)

Reviews.Author: Chanel L.
Reviews.Content: Came here twice, one for actual dinner and one for happy hour. Happy hour is half price off appetizers.  If I lived or worked closer to Santana Row, I def would come here to take advantage of the specials.  I am a stout lover and the waitress recommended me a chocolate stout on a half yard! So gooooood!! But I wish someone would have warned me that when I get closer to the bottom of the half yard, the whole beer comes down faster.  I couldn't gulp in time and spilled all over my white shirt,.. Lucky that I quickly ran to the bathroom and was able to clean off the stains. WOoooT! For dinner we had the Lobster garlic noodles, Ahi Salad, Spicy Tuna Roll and Mac and Cheese!Ahi Salad was my favorite,. seared ahi FTW!! The garlic noodles were also good, real chunks of lobster!! I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Shawn S.
Reviews.Content: They apparently have AMAZING drinks here! Im not big into alcohol so Ill pass on this. The food here itself is pretty standard, thus the three stars. I usually order the onion ring tower and assorted tacos. Out of all the tacos, the korean bbq sparerib taco is probably the best. The other appetizers are meh, EVERYTHING is meh. Whats worth going for here is definitely the happy hour which is from 3-6pm. Half off selected drinks and appetizers! There are also some dishes that are cheaper so definitely check it out. As for taste, don't expect anything "WOW".

Reviews.Author: Aaron K.
Reviews.Content: I usually only come here for happy hour, I mean you get a half yard for 7-10$ talk about a snag also half off select appetizers and pizza and sliders! Today it was just two of us and we split the spinach cheese dip and I got the classic sliders.Spinach cheese dip - I was expecting it to be served with tortilla chips like most spinach dip is served with. But instead it was served with crispy flat bread (guess I should've read the description). Anyways I thought that the spinach dip was just alright I think that the dip itself is a bit greasy and having it with the flatbread made it a bit greasier. I would prefer it with tortilla chips.Classic Sliders - The sliders are just whatever to me but I did enjoy that it came with 4 of them and fries for only 7$ especially since I love fries! The sliders were pretty bland and not a lot of flavor maybe next time ill try the pastrami. Beer - for the beer I ordered a half yard of the Paulaner Hefe-Weizen. I've never had this beer before but I do enjoy it a lot it's not a heavy beer in my opinion and its got a lot of flavor, I'm not really picky when it comes to beer but this one was easy to drink and has a minimal citrus kick to it that makes it tasty. Overall I do enjoy the yardhouse mainly for its atmosphere and the massive amounts of beer that they have on tap! It's great place to come with a friend or friends to have a few drinks and average appetizers during happy hour. I do not know much about the actual main dishes, maybe one day but as a college student ill stick to my happy hour deals =)

Reviews.Author: Raymond S.
Reviews.Content: If you drink beer, you'd think you've died and gone to beer heaven. The food here is also pretty good and same for the service.

Reviews.Author: Johan N.
Reviews.Content: I remember here months ago, I ate here for my 2 cousins birthday, and this place is PACKED, we got here around 5pm ish.. and we had to wait for our seats within 20mins, I ordered their fish & chips.. eh it was decent, anyways what I noticed is that it's a sport bar, so everyone watched football and ate, or chill here, in general it's ok but pretty expensive though..PS: it's also loud here also, with adults here, maybe even kids..

Reviews.Author: cathy f.
Reviews.Content: Great grilled chicken and avocado sandwich e/sweet potato fries.  YummyService by James was exceptional friendly, fastWe were seated right away no long wait which is unusual at thus location.

Reviews.Author: Sultana A.
Reviews.Content: Our server Sheree was knowledgeable, attentive and, most importantly, she made us feel at home!  Great food...amazing service...awesome location!  Gold stars all around!

Reviews.Author: Janelle S.
Reviews.Content: Lobster Garlic Noodles make me happy and their Black Velvet makes me feel pretty. Place gets crazy busy because of its location (Santana Row and across the street from Valley Fair Mall) so the wait can get long depending on what time of day you go. I've been here several times and the service was good. Great place to people watch too!!

Reviews.Author: Gina L.
Reviews.Content: Tried their Seared Ahi Tuna Sashimi last night off of their happy hour menu (late-night HH, big points!), and it was divine, especially for the price!  Their buffalo wings (sauce on side) also hit the spot when you're a little bit boozy.  I wouldn't recommend the saucey ones that they offer on their main menu... it lacks the crispness that I enjoy in wingies.Why only three stars/A-OK rating?  Their French onion soup was such a let down.  It was a Sunday, so I'm not sure if the soup has just been reducing all week, because it was SO SALTY.  It tasted like the jus you would dip your French dip sandwich into.  It was borderline inedible, unless you like really, really, REALLY salty broth.5 stars for their awesome happy hour deals, though.

Reviews.Author: Lillian O.
Reviews.Content: Had a blast with my date. Great crowd, great music, just no resies and a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Wiseley F.
Reviews.Content: I must admit, seeing everyone's pictures of this place on instagram was my primary reason of trying this place. With a combination of a semi classy and sports bar theme, Yard house was born.I've only been here 2 times but I can tell you that the wait for seating can take up to an hour and a half but the food is worth it. The first time I came here, I ordered one of the burgers and it was definitely a tasty burger. The best part about my order was the side of fries, omg, best fries ever!The second time I came to yard house I went for a friend's graduation lunch with his family. We had to wait for a few more people to drive so we ordered a shit ton of appetizers; I remember sampling the nachos and buffalo wings and boy were they good. After a while, all the guests arrived, but I was basically full. Despite that, I managed to eat half of my turkey sandwich and being the rest home.Based on my two experiences, I suggest going for the appetizers because it makes a good compliment to the good company and the sports scene. You can't go wrong with a big plate of delicious nachos! Just beware of the wait times or have someone go early to put your name on the list!

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night, luckily enough there was no wait for a group of 10. They sat us down pretty quickly. It was quite overwhelming by the beer menu. BTW don't forget that each customer gets to sample 2 beers. THANK goodness, I really didn't know what to chose, but they're well known for their fruity ones.Food wise: stick with the appetizers and small dishes. The entres/favorites weren't that great. The mac and cheese wasn't cheesey enough. The noodles were plain. The pizzas were pretty good, a good size for personal pizza. The perk of going with such a large party is that you get to sample everything and never wonder what you didn't order tastes like. DEFINITELY order the truffle fries. You can't go wrong with it. The onion rings were ok, its as simple as it gets.This is definitely a place for drinks and small dishes. I wouldn't recommend if you were starving.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen T.
Reviews.Content: My friend Stephanie S. took me here when I was in the area. When she first asked if I've ever been here, I snootily answered, "PLEASE. I live in LA. We have TWO." In fact, upon closer inspection, SoCal has a lot more than that :PThis Yard House was PACKED. We were told at the front, we can put our name down but it's not guaranteed we will get a table before they stop serving food. After sitting outside at the benches (probably 20 or more minutes?) I looked around and noticed no one was waiting anymore. We went in to check about our table and said our buzzer never went off. Then they asked if we walked too far past the cafe, or other things we did that may have caused the buzzer not to go off. Um, we're pretty sure we were sitting at the bench right outside and didn't move. I don't even think they apologized or cared. Just a meh, well, you can have your table now.  When we got seated, I was looking through their impressive and extensive menu of beer, and I noticed a section that had "fruit beer". I was curious and asked our waiter how it was made (is it fruit juice added? or is it fruit that is mixed in during the malting process?). He didn't understand what I was asking for quite a while, and when he did, he assumed I wanted something fruity and goes on to highlight the "fruity" drinks in the menu. So he gives us some time to look at the menu and I decide that I just wanted a House Hefeweizen. When I order, he goes, "That's not a fruity beer." (Almost in a degrading tone like I'm oblivious and don't know anything?) I'm aware what I'm ordering, thank you! I'll pass on the Capri Sun that you're trying to make us buy!Anyway, dig the place, but not a huge fan of the service here.

Reviews.Author: Shirene N.
Reviews.Content: A handful of reflections on Yard House, SJ :1. The locale is in Santana Row( Read: Get here early on the weekends or wait around like a chump for an hour or two. )2. You won't regret the extra $7-$15 you'll spend on appetizers. ( The Moo Shu Egg Rolls, Coconut Shrimp & Lettuce Wraps are all top-notch picks. )3. Don't sleep on the Mac 'n Cheese..(chicken, bacon and truffles, y'all. )3 1/2. If you are not a beer girl -- but still would like to *awkwardly* drink from the gigantic half yard glass and impress your boyfriend/date/friends/passersby -- they serve the raspberry & pear ciders in those too, cool girl.4. The Jambalaya is a portion perfect for sharing (unless your bf is already 'hangry'**hungry/angry**) and never disappoints.5. Aesthetically pretty impressive in design and layout ( Featuring a center island bar with 360 tap handles all the way around, intriguing art pieces and dimmer/cooler (*interchangeable, here) lighting. )

Reviews.Author: Anthony A.
Reviews.Content: Yard house was really good. I enjoyed my time there with my family after a graduation.  Things went fast and accordingly everything was nice

Reviews.Author: Michi R.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to check this place out and finally for a chance to Tuesday night. I've been reading some of the reviews and I don't know what a lot of these people are talking about. I had a really good experience. I went with my boyfriend, we sat at the bar. The amount of beer they have is insane and awesome! The place was very busy but that's exactly what I expected for a placelike that, to all the people that complain about how busy it is... Duh, it's a big restaurant in Santana Row, I mean, what did you expect? I enjoyed the New York steak sandwich and opted for the garlic mashed potatoes, very tasty! My bf got the pork sandwich, also very good. The highlight for me was the French onion soup, it was really flavorful, probably the best French onion soup I've ever had! The service, despite it being very busy, was very attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back when I'm in the are!

Reviews.Author: kat l.
Reviews.Content: when me and the bf get an opportunity for a night out, we like to try something new. So hungry&craving for alcohol, we decided to head here. we waited about 45 minutes to be seated.. (came on a sunday). our waitress was super friendly and got us started right away. we gave the sampler of beers a shot n had calamari and lobster dip as appetizer. They were SUPER good! However, our entrees..not so much! :/ i tried the maui chicken and my boyfriend got the southern fried chicken..&it was disgusting! at a point i was about to spit out the food but i had to swallow it cuz our waitress came and asked if everything was going well. LOLwe also had mixed drinks and shots of hen w/ pineapple juice. the crowd was awesome, had fun catching a football game in here.Overall, service, drinks and appetizers.. are awesome. Entrees, i'd stay away from. i havent tried anythin else but im kinda afraid to! bleh!

Reviews.Author: Audrey C.
Reviews.Content: This is probably my favorite place to go to happy hour around the bay area. The prices on most appetizers is half off of the listed price (most things are for ~$5-7 with the discount) and the drinks are at a special price as well. Service is always friendly and fast, and if you come during happy hour they always try to get you the prices! If the tables are too packed and you don't want to wait you can try the bar, but usually there isn't much seating. You can order food there as well. Happy hour is Mon-Fri from 3-6 and late night on Sun-Wed from 10-close! BBQ pizza: My favorite thing to get here. It's half off so a whole pizza is about $6!! I love the bbq sauce that they use, it reminds me of an asian taste and it just makes the pizza taste soooo good. Chicken Nachos: Another favorite to get here...and its HUGE! Generous portions of guac/sourcream/chicken/beans. Hawaiin Poke Stack: Great portion as well. Comes with 2 pieces of wonton chips stacked with poke and slices of avocado. Highly recommend if you want something that isn't too oily. Spicy Tuna Roll: This was okay, I got sick of the tuna after a while and there was a bit too much edamame compared to the rest of the dish on here as well. Spinach Cheese Dip: This is soo good as well. Comes out hot and fresh and you can always ask for more chips if you run out! There's also such a wide selection of drinks I can't even begin to say which I've tried. But remember that you can always sample drinks before you get them! A good way to see which flavors of beer you're in the mood to drink that day. They have "samplers" that they sell as well, but these are not at a special price during happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Darien R.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Yard House several times, but haven't got to the review--until now.Yard House is a sports bar version of Cheesecake Factory.  They remind me a lot of each other.  Long waits to get a table.  Large, varied menu.  Pretty tasty food if you know what to order.This last time we went, everybody liked what they ordered.JAMBALAYA - My wife's dish.  She liked it.  I tasted it and it was good for me too.LOBSTER GARLIC NOODLES - My daughter's dish.  She liked it and would order it again.  I tasted it and thought it was OK.  The noodles were thick, and I'm not a big fan of the thick.  Angel hair should be served with that kind of delicate lobster dish (in my humble opinion).SPAGHETTI W/SHRIMP in VODKA SAUCE - Pleasantly surprised.  I saw a picture of this in the Yelp photo album and I liked the look, so I ordered it.  Really good.  The sauce was right on, the shrimp were tender and the noodles were al dente.  Pretty darn good for a non-Italian joint.Prepare for some loudness.  It's a sports bar atmosphere.  And prepare to wait for your table.  Why can't they put some benches outside????Still, I find myself wanting to go back to the Yard House.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth H.
Reviews.Content: The only reason my fiancé and I have been here more than once is that it's literally walking distance from our apartment. The wait is ridiculous - over an hour any time day or night. Bring earplugs, because they turn up the music to club levels. It's so loud that you have to scream over it just to have a normal conversation at your table. The beer menu is vast and varied. The problem with this is that they are constantly changing it and just because you see it in print, doesn't mean you can order it. Have your smartphone ready to look up beers because unless you win the lottery of being served by Joe, the wait staff know exactly squat about them - like when you tell them you're stout girl and they recommend all the IPA's and consistently use the standard of "higher alcohol content = better beer". Don't ask about flavor, texture, dark/light, etc. They have no idea.Don't order appetizers unless that's all you're ordering. All three times we ate here, we ordered appetizers and on all occasions they showed up AFTER the meal. Kind of not the point, guys. Yes, they were as good as the entrees, but at that point you don't even want them anymore.Said entrees are good. Really, really good. They have a wide range of unique flavor pairings that are just delicious. The portions are generous while still being small enough for one person to handle. We've never ordered the same thing twice and haven't had anything we couldn't rave about. We can't say anything about the dessert menu since we never had the room for more food after our meals.

Reviews.Author: Benny H.
Reviews.Content: This place is an utter mess. After waiting 2 hours for a table for a party of six we are finally buzzed in. "Whoops we accidentally gave your table away." Another 15 minutes go by before we are seated. Waitress come by with a frown that would make a baby cry. She takes down a few sample beers we want whilst giving us the evil eye. Not sure what her problem was. That's the last we see of her for nearly a hour. Someone else brings our drinks, takes our order, and brings out our order. Oh, and it takes the food 55 minutes to come out. 55 minutes? Where are we? In the middle of the Sahara desert? Beer selection is great, and the food was good. Has the surf and turf burger, which actually was pretty damn good. Still, I felt like I was being served by 1st graders. Only problem is that with 1st graders I would cut them some slack as they are 6 year olds. Yard House doesn't have the luxury of being able to use that excuse.******UPDATE*******So I was contacted by the mangemenet team and they went above and beyond to make to understand what happened, which is appreciated. So just for that fact I'm giving them an extra star. Not something that happens in the food industry often.

Reviews.Author: Jenna T.
Reviews.Content: Nice place, always crowded, prices are high. This place is just an upscale BJs to me because of the atmosphere and the bar. Their quality of food is alright. I think the prices reflect the presentation of the food rather than the taste and quality of it.Happy hour is still pretty pricey. If you want the same ambiance but with cheaper prices? Just go to BJs. BJs food is just as good and it's cheaper. I would not rave about this place to anyone. Maybe for happy hour, if you want a big tall glass of beer and try their fancy named cocktails. Be prepared to wait though, especially during dinner time. Is the wait worth it? Not really.

Reviews.Author: Minerva L.
Reviews.Content: Chocolate stout beer! YUM! Lot's of good beer! The artichoke and lobster dip is good. Calamari is a hit! The halibut was good with the porcini sauce! Overall, really packed, so go there during happy hour or go super early. We waited a good hour or so for a party of 5. Service was on point, and just good good good!

Reviews.Author: Ankit C.
Reviews.Content: Loved it!I haven't been to a lot of sports bar (yet), but Yard House is definitely a classy one.  The decor is awesome and so is the atmosphere.It might be the occasion of my visit:  Halloween weekend (some people were obviously dressed up), there was a football game going on (add football jocks) and the girlfriend and I managed to find a nice and less-noisy spot for ourselves.The atmosphere of the place made it very hard not to have fun (not that we tried)!We ordered at least 6 different kinds of food and loved all of them.  If you're a vegetarian, then make sure you order the veggie-buffalo-wings.  The stuffing on them is a total winner!!This place also has an excellent collection of beers (I'm from Milwaukee, just take my word).  The server was extremely polite and helped us a lot with our food and drinks and righteously earned a big-fat tip.Sadly we took too long to finish our food and the kitchen closed before we could order dessert.  The cool part is that provides even more incentive for the next visit.If you're at Santana Row and are looking to grab a beer or have some decent food or just want to hang out with friends, then the Yard House is the place!PS: Be sure to make a reservation well in advance. We walked in a week after the first visit and found that the waiting time was 1.5 hours!

Reviews.Author: Anthony A.
Reviews.Content: Pro: Food was great, pricing was greatCons: 45 minute wait for two people, very slow at clearing tables.Other than the seating time it was great for the most part!

Reviews.Author: Josh G.
Reviews.Content: Despite the long wait for seating this place is always really good. They have an amazing beer selection and good food. My servers name was will. Best server I have ever had. He made conversation with me and my girlfriend, checked on us often even when the place was packed and busy. Recommend my new favorite beer, even told me where I could find it outside of the restaurant. Over all an amazing experience thanks to that guy. I will for sure be coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Carmina B.
Reviews.Content: I like their vegetarian entrees, like their veggie nuggets. I get to try it with 3 varieties of sauces, ranging from sweet, spicy and sweet-spicy. My friends enjoyed their lobster-seafood garlic pasta as well.

Reviews.Author: Noel M.
Reviews.Content: I had no idea how large the interior was and exactly how many taps were hiding behind those walls.  Given that, I'm sure this is a fine establishment but it's just not my style.  I feel like cattle, it's a very impersonal experience. With such a large array of brews I want the opportunity to ask questions but with such a crowd face time with the bartender is nearly impossible.

Reviews.Author: Ning T.
Reviews.Content: It's starting to get better as the hype is dying down. The food is just so-so pub fare, but the beer is what sets the place apart. Though they say they have 100 taps, there is really only about 50 beers, which is still a great selection. They also have some YardHouse only brews which are decent. It's a fun place to hang out if you can get seats to just grab a dessert (usually I grab a beer float - ice cream and beer) and beer. If you want an authentic pub vibe, this is not the place. If you're looking for something like BJ's with more selection, then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Laurie S.
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was great! You can call ahead, so we did on a Friday night, and were seated almost immediately after checking in. The appetizers (truffle fries), steak (ribeye and filet), and dessert (macadamia nut cheesecake) - were all incredible. We definitely will be returning!

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: No knock on the business here---service was attentive despite being ridiculously packed, good vibe, and well kept.  As is the norm, a ridiculous amount of brew on tap, although I can't say I was surprised by what they had as most you can find here and there.I do have a few comments about the "clientele" here.  If you've gotten to the point where you've barely stumbled into the bathroom and end up yacking INTO THE FRIGGING SINK, you're probably better suited for a Coors Light vs. that Ruination you thought you could pound.And what's up with the women that come here?  Is there a dress code posted somewhere stating that you have to dress like a $2 skeez to get in?  Not that I'm complaining or anything....

Reviews.Author: Krystal C.
Reviews.Content: Went here with the husband on a anniversary. Very busy location. Our server I believe his name was Blaine. He was awesome. He made sure we were taken care of and provided good service even though it was very very very busy. Good good also! Also we called ahead and put our name in so we waited all of 6 minutes during a normal wait time of 1 hour.

Reviews.Author: Michael N.
Reviews.Content: Love the food here.  It's a good place to watch sports with a group of people. I like the fast service and dont need to wait long for my order.  Only thing I dont like is the bad wifi and phone signal.

Reviews.Author: Grace Y.
Reviews.Content: I was hungry. I had fond memories of dining at the Yard House in Newport Beach. So I came and conquered. I do think that this is one of the best bang for your buck sit down restaurants in Santana Row, if you are into value. Many plates of food were ordered, and many plates of food were consumed.They are HEAVY on the salt shaker here, cheezus! I sent back my bowl of tomato bisque. It was extremely salty and I tried adding the oyster crackers to see if it would dilute the soup a little, which did not happen, so I nope'd right then and there. The server seemed unreasonably bothered that I sent it back. I'm not paying 8 dollars for soup that is inedible, yo. The tacos were pretty good, would recommend for a hungry hungry hippo, but at $5+ a pop, you are better off grabbing a burrito from somewhere nearby.Well, now I'm out of things to say, so I suppose I will stop here. J/k, I'm not going to give you the satisfaction. The end. (really)

Reviews.Author: Cat C.
Reviews.Content: Shorties for a shortie!  I like how they have shorties (half pints) available for those like me who don't drink too much especially beer since it's so filling.  I came here early enough on a late Friday afternoon yet it was still super packed, but managed to find one seat at the bar.  Even tried to get a table on a weeknight before too & the wait was still long.I've been to the one in Vegas years ago & the wait for a table wasn't as long as it is here.  Yard House is a good option for drinks when the wait isn't long while on the row.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie N.
Reviews.Content: I only give it 1 star for the food I ate, lol. Came here on Wednesday at 10pm with my boyfriend and was seated in less than 10 minutes. I understand that it is late, but you signed up for the job - please work it well. Especially if you still serve people until 11pm.Both my boyfriend and I are servers and work in high volume, fast paced restaurants. I can feel my server's (Diana) pain. She refused to give me any service, to the point where my boyfriend even rose his hand to get refills and she later shot back dirty sarcasm about leaving the water pitcher with us. She literally checked on us once, which was when we were halfway through our meal. I think if we needed anything, we might as well said forget it. When she did check on us and my bf asked for a soda refill, she just kept walking.She only tended to her other two tables behind us and literally turned her back on us instead of walking through to pass us. I almost never saw her. She always, always turned her back on us. If she thought because we are both young and wont get her good tips and didn't wanna serve us the way you'd serve anyone, she's wrong. But to make her right, I left her a 0$ tip. Sorry to any cooks, hosts, or bussers that she had to tip out tonight. Cause she didn't deserve a cent. Diana, if you came back to our table I would've told you off myself... But I only saw you twice - thanks for ruining a good day.

Reviews.Author: Bernadette F.
Reviews.Content: Came here after a long day of watch shopping with the boy toy :PFood was pretty good.... Not extraordinary but decent... Beers were yummy and service was great! Would be a fun place to go out  with some friends .... More for drinking than amazing cuisine

Reviews.Author: Brad W.
Reviews.Content: If you're selling yourself on beer, I don't expect culinary perfection.  (And you won't get it at The Yard House.)  But I would expect - you know - really good beer.Great selection of beers here, but unfortunately two of the beers I ordered were German and both were completely flat.  (In other words, an old keg.) Bartender tasted the beer and confirmed this, then happily got me a different beer.  But no attempt to change the keg because - hey, how many people are really going to complain?  One extra star for great location and good ambience.  But food - and beer - disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Jefferson T.
Reviews.Content: Place is a zoo.  Food is OK at best.

Reviews.Author: Srikanth V.
Reviews.Content: Go here for a good selection of Beers and don't expect very good Food. There is always, a minimum of, 1 hr wait for dinner. so, be prepared.What is ok?Appetizers - Fries, Onion rings, Wings (even veggie) (Firecracker), NachosEntrée - Surf and Turf (too little lobster though)What is not so good?Appetizers - Artichoke, Entrée - Fish Tacos (thick batter + little fish), Chicken Rice Bowl (veggie)

Reviews.Author: Tina N.
Reviews.Content: Ashli took my friend and I to our table/booth. Our server, Ivan, was super nice and attentive to our table. He got us everything we needed (except he did forget my lemons) and let us order before happy hour, but we still needed to wait until 3pm to get our food. Who could complain about that?Happy Hour order:- Hawaiian Poke Stack  Original Price - $13.25 &   Happy Hour Price - $6.62- Seared Ahi Sashimi  Original Price - $13.95 &   Happy Hour Price - $6.97- Spicy Thai Chicken Pizza  Original Price - $13.95 &   Happy Hour Price - $6.72- Hummus - Original Price - $4.95- Ruby Red Martini  Original Price - $10.50 &   Happy Hour Price - $6.50Total of $34.54! What! We ordered way too much food for two people, but it was all so good. :)

Reviews.Author: Christina N.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner on a weekday night and it was rather crowded. We had to wait in line for about an hour before getting a table. The food here is pretty decent. I enjoyed my mushroom and beef burger with sweet potato fries. The portions here are US size, so I had to share my meal with a friend since I tend to have a smaller appetite. The calamari appetiser and clam chowder soup were pretty decent too.I liked that they had skinny margaritas for the calorie conscious drinkers.The ambience here is pretty much like a sports bar, and great for a couple of friends chilling over beer with some food and watching the game or just catching up.

Reviews.Author: Erwin R.
Reviews.Content: Tried Yard House during lunch.  Came in with my bro and we sat at the bar.  Lunch time they are pretty busy but it seemed like they were serving everyone correctly.  When we sat down it took about 15 minutes for us to be acknowledged.  When the server finally came by, we were ready to order and decided to order to go because of how long it took.  We ordered:Ahi Poke BowlCalifornia roll (Its like a big rice cake)Roasted Turkey Club with their truffled fries (really good fries)Roast Beef Dip Guess how long it took.... it took about 30 minutes to get everything out.  What a disappointment.  After speaking with the server about the length of time, I spoke with a manager named Brian who asked for my information.  He was kind of enough to wave the bill for the food we ordered.  As nice as of jesture this was, it still was very disappointing that it too so long.  That said.The food was great.  The Ahi Poke Bowl was not bad at all.  The roasted turkey club was huge and filling and the truffle fries are amazing!  :)Try to avoid the the busy hours or get in before anyone else, otherwise you will risk waiting a long time.  Im on the fence and willing to give them another chance again.

Reviews.Author: Bruce's A.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place! Happy hour here is amaze-balls!Their drinks during happy hour along with the food is great quality food that isn't going to dent your wallet. The service here does a lot to make this place work. It is very hectic at times, loud too; but all the waiters, waitresses and bartenders make this place work! Kudos to all of them. They are always very friendly and helpful. The drink selection here is remarkable! You will be overwhelmed by all the drinks! You can sample too! I enjoy the Leinenkugles sunset wheat, and for food, the sliders (any meat), nachos and fries are all must haves! Great food, drinks for days, awesome setting, excellent service, the price is right, stop reading this and go, NAO!!!! (Even if it's 11 in the morning) XD

Reviews.Author: Aileen Z.
Reviews.Content: I honestly love this place especially during happy hour. Half off appetizers hell yea! Chicken lettuce wrap is good and the truffle fries are amazing! The ahi tuna was ok and the calamari was alright as well(: but I would definitely recommend coming here for beers they have a very wide selection!

Reviews.Author: Lisa L.
Reviews.Content: I usually go during lunch time, so expect a long waiting time. Lol, but after that We made our order and drinks. I recommend the calamari :D it's so crispy and good and good to eat while you're waiting on your order to come.Overall, me and my bf had a good time. We talked about a lot of things during the waiting time in between everything, so it didn't bother us.The food was good and fresh.

Reviews.Author: Anu P.
Reviews.Content: My first time at Yardhouse was fantastic! I had recently turned 21 so my sister took me out for drinks after dinner on a Wednesday night. I love that their happy hour is so late because we were able to have our dinner without rushing ourselves and make our way to Yardhouse. Service: Luckily we were seated within 5 minutes and I was surprised at how many people were around on a Wednesday night! Regardless we were seated at a nice booth. We had to flag down a waiter because there was so much going on around us that we weren't even sure that our waiter knew that we needed to be served. Once we asked a waiter, our actual server came over right after and walked us through the menu. She even recommended her favorite drinks and food which was really sweet considering how many people she was probably tending to on this busy night. Our drinks and food came out very promptly and she came by to let us know when last call was too, which was helpful especially if you're not sitting near the bar. Drinks: I had the Southern Bell (jeremiah weed sweet tea vodka, lemonade, fresh strawberries and pineapple) which was a really sweet, lemonade tasting drink. There was VERY little alcohol which was fine because the lemonade was delicious and I just couldn't stop sipping on my drink. I also loved the fresh fruit in the drink as well, they added great flavor! My sister ordered the Strawberry Fields martini which was a little stronger, but from what I remember I enjoyed my taste of it! Food: We ordered a chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream to go with our drinks. Pretty much like a normal pizookie but better because it was a brownie. The brownie was cooked perfectly and was soft and gooey too--heavenly! I will definitely be returning! I loved the vibe of the place--it was upbeat, had great music, and I had a great time. It also wasn't too loud, so you could have an actual conversation. This is a big plus, especially if you go with one other person, you want to be able to hear them!! Anyways, I digress...Definitely check this place out!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie J.
Reviews.Content: Maggiano used to be my favorites eatery at Santana Row, but I almost want to say Yardhouse is better. I love love love their happy hour. They have great selections of eatery and alcohol. Which makes the stomach and the brain happy! So far almost everything I tried here I love!Here are some of the food worth mentioning:1) ahi tuna roll appetizer2) truffle fries3) ahi burger4) thai pizza5) steak!Yummo!!! Too bad their happy hour is only limited to the bar sitting which can be hard to come by during busy hours.Well... I guess I still save maggiano as my favorites pasta place but Yardhouse is one happy place for my stomach without fail.Love!

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere & the best part is the  large selection of beer on tap!Instead of my regular beer  I recall trying their specialty blends on my 1st visit. I fell in love with their Rose Garden, is light and on the sweeter side. I get it every time! So far at this location I've only tried their Lobster Garlic Noodles. I want to try more of their menu, but I enjoy this dish so much I can't bring myself to order something else. Who doesn't love lobster, crab, & shrimp all together!? Plus shiitake mushroom & spinach over the delicious garlic noodles.

Reviews.Author: Evan H.
Reviews.Content: Wow! So this is my second stop on my day off restaurant hopping. A complete 180 in ambiance from cheese cake factory across the road. Louder music, dimly lit and not 3 draft beers but like 100! Not quite as heavily staffed as cheese cake factory if you have been there, but the overall pace of the restaurant is quicker, more bouncy. I'm on a spree of trying California brands so i decided on going with the Yard House house pale ale. It was just okay. For my likings anyways. Great for groups and although very busy, the classic rock music makes for a relaxing feel!I didn't get anything to eat, but if it's anything like the food at the other yard houses, i'm sure it's reasonable and tasty.

Reviews.Author: Kenny N.
Reviews.Content: Great selection of alcohol. Amazing hh. Been here about 4 times. Last night I got the chicken nachos. Huge platter of nachos, the temperature of it cooled pretty quickly though. That's also how I feel about the truffle fries. I usually order those but I think it's just okay. Everything on the menu looks delicious but you may hurt your wallet. I also tried some shiitake garlic noodles which were bomb. Service was chaotic, waitress couldn't find our ticket so we had to reorder but it was no big deal. The wait to get in Is forever on weekends. And you get free lava cake topped with Ice cream if it's your birthday.

Reviews.Author: Edward W.
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect if you love sports and beer.I ordered the BBQ Bacon Burger and the salted caramel butterscotch.The BBQ Bacon burger seemed a little small and didn't come with any veggies. The bbq sauce is on the side so you have to pour the sauce on with every bite. It comes with a side of regular fries that were really thin and I loved them.The salted caramel butterscotch was way too sweet although it tasted good the first few bites in! It was recommended by our waiter, but it may be a good dessert to be split among 4 so you don't have to eat too much of it.

Reviews.Author: Megha A.
Reviews.Content: their food is so good! it's probably one of the only good places to eat on santana row, so that's why you see that line stretching out the door ALL. THE. TIME.  It also has a ton of TVs so if your date's boring, hey! watch the game! =)  the HH is a lot of fun and lively here, but good luck getting a seat!The only two negatives I have are the crazy wait, and the variance in how strong/not strong their drinks are.

Reviews.Author: Li C.
Reviews.Content: Will NOT be going back. Had a late lunch 03/05/2014 at Yard House, Santana Row. Having the hostess seat us must be a disruption to her day, bored look, no hello or follow me, lead us to a dirty table with drink spills, food and grease marks over the seats, took us to another dirty table, not in the mood to play musical tables so we took it and cleaned the seats ourselves, sticky drink marks, grease again......nice. Server GREAT GUY (ginger hair/beard), food was meh, caesar salad was caesarless, rest of order overcooked. Been to YH Palm Springs, Irvine Spectrum, San Diego & Temecula, always good service from the get go, clean, great food/drinks, Santana Row big turn off.

Reviews.Author: Liger G.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the beer selection.  2 stars for the food.  1 star for the super loud music and not so friendly staff who always seem in a rush to get the heck out of there.Truffle fries, fried chicken strips, shiitake garlic noodles, kung pao calamari, onion ring tower, always compliment the beer very well here.

Reviews.Author: Kandice G.
Reviews.Content: This was the alternative place to go to for my valentines day date last year I have to say it was a typical dining place. The atmosphere is nice and makes you feel like a grown up, the food itself was average, and the wait wasn't as bad as other places.  I would go here again, but order from the lunch menu if you can, everything else is overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Beers on Beers on Beers.........yea it's pretty darn awesome. I love going for the afternoon happy hour to meet up with friends to casually catch up. Always nice to kick it and have a fine selection of beers talking about past shenanigans or what's new. The happy hour bar food is decent but coupled with a few beers in you there is really nothing better. No complaints about the service really. It just gets annoying when it's super busy and your waiter/waitress gets swamped but they do their best. I wouldn't suggest doing this place as a first date kind of thing.

Reviews.Author: Kenitha Y.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, but I DO like Yard House. Good happy hour and the food really isn't that bad. I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVVVVVVVEEEEEE the spicy jambalaya over linguine. I get it every time.

Reviews.Author: Charlene T.
Reviews.Content: I come here all of the time for Monday night football. I haven't so much since that ended. They have half off appetizers all day for that event, gets packed though when football starts. I usually like sitting at the bar because drinks are on happy hour as well. They have the best buffalo wings and their pizza appetizer is big enough to feed two. I always order the pepperoni and mushroom, but tried every single one and they're all good. Love the fact that they have a huge selection of beer :) you get to try 3 different ones every visit! I definitely take advantage or that.

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a couple times and the food is always great. This is the perfect place to meet up with friends, even if the wait can be pretty horrible on weekends.I went for my first happy hour yesterday, since I just turned 21 at the beginning of this month! Yard House has very reasonable prices for happy hour and they have a great selection of food and drinks. I ordered a strawberry beer and a half yard of Snake Bite and both of them were delicious. We ordered a couple appetizers off the happy hour menu and I definitely recommend the Hawaiian Poke Stack (SO. FREAKING. GOOD) and one of the pizzas. My boyfriend and I had the BBQ chicken pizza and my friends had the Spicy Thai pizza and both of them were delicious, so you can't really go wrong with any of them. Definitely get the pizzas if you're super hungry and you're using happy hour as a dinner! We also ordered the truffle fries (the only thing we ordered that wasn't on the happy hour menu) and I absolutely recommend getting that!My friends and I had a great time at Yard House. SOOOO many beers so even if you're a not a beer connoisseur, you'll be sure to find something you like. The strawberry beer is great for beer wusses like myself! I had a sip of everyone else's drinks and they were all really good.The service was great too! I think our waiter's name was Blaine and he was a great server. He cracked a bunch of jokes and made our dinner super fun. Definitely come here for happy hour!

Reviews.Author: Ronald B.
Reviews.Content: This place is just too loud- otherwise they would get 5 stars. And the service has been slow at times.All I have so say though is I lOVE the Gardein choices. AMAZING! Quality. Please, please don't take that off the menu. Being in Santana Row is also nice. My wife and I frequently walk over to the Yoghurtland for an after-meal special.

Reviews.Author: Michael R.
Reviews.Content: Oh yeah? How could one ever forget a place like this? When you walk in it feels like beer heaven. (That is if you believe in Heaven).Or Beer "Nirvana" (That is if you Believe In Nirvana), Okay...It's like Beer "Paradise"I think everyone Believes in Paradise. ;)Located in the nestled corner of the ever daunting, money spending Santana Row.You are welcomed by the dark, dimmed lighting that makes you believe you are on a quest for the perfect spot for hospitality, you may or may not find it here.In this treasure trove of a place which disguises itself as the older drunken brother of the "Cheesecake factory" it's impossible not find a beer you would not like,just tell what you like to the bartender, or read the menu. Here are some awesome food item to check out.If you trying to go lite on the stomach.Try the "Lettuce wraps" stir fried, smoked tofu, pine nuts and green onions with three dipping sauces. It's what everyone seems to rave about so may the peer pressure move you to order this too!I had the "CHICKEN NACHOS" Which were kinda blah, I dunno how you could mess up Nachos, but they were kinda off...thus not the five stars you thought you were going to get! I Should've order the "the Korean pork belly" it had "Kim-chi", toasted black and white sesame seeds and red chili threads looked spicy, I wouldn't had some if my friends were so selfish.The place itself is beautiful. for a chain. I'll have to go back for the Mac' and cheese as well.If I ever find myself lost in this place "Santana Row", I might as well stop by the best place to DRAAAANK anytime of the week.

Reviews.Author: Patty P.
Reviews.Content: Great service all the time! Great food! Great Beer!I recommend the Ahi Poke Salad and the enchiladas stack!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: What the hell is with the service at this place?I went here for a work lunch, and there were about a dozen of us, which I do realize is a large party and orders can get confusing, but the service was really bad.  Wrong food, wrong beverages, etc.  The food itself seemed kind of hit or miss. I ordered the blackened swordfish tacos. The first one was pretty good,  but the second was crazy salty.  Appetizers (mac & cheese, some citrus chicken thing, and garlic fries) were decent and not too crazy priced, even for something in Santana Row. When we were trying to decide on a dessert, my coworker asked if I wanted cobbler or cheesecake. I asked, "what kind of cobbler?"  and she responded with "Peach apple."  Then our server totally interjected that it was actually "Apple peach". It was totally weird.  Also, at our table we ordered seven coffees. They brought out three and gave them to one half of our table.  Than we waited, waited, waited, waited almost 20 minutes until we could flag down our server and ask about the coffee. She just said we didn't get any because they ran out of mugs. Umm..... okay. I mean I guess it's possible that a large restaurant somehow does not have sufficient mugs for a party of 12 (only 7 of whom asked for one) but they could at least come over and tell us. I don't know if a dishwasher called out that day or if they're always this shitty.

Reviews.Author: Raghav K.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and beer. Awesome ambience and service seals the deal. Veggie wings, angel hair pasta and onion rings for veggie folks are highly recommended. Long wait time can be frustrating but it's worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Christina W.
Reviews.Content: Pros:Gin & ginger cocktail - I don't normally like gin, but I really like this drink! Sweet, but not too sugary.Great drink selection with beers you can't normally find.Mac & Cheese - savory, good umami flavors with the mushrooms, creamy sauce, thick bacon.Truffle fries - thin, crispy, & really yummy!Cons:Too much selection on the menu. It took so long to look through everything, we could barely decide! I like it better when a restaurant does a few things well. My mom got the filet mignon and was deeply unsatisfied with the flavor and the way it was cooked.If we return, we'll go to the bar!

Reviews.Author: D A.
Reviews.Content: They put avocadoes into Dad's summer salad after he had asked for them to be left out. The next series of events sealed the deal. We told the server about the inclusion of the avocados. He immediately apologized and had the kitchen remake the salad. After the new salad (avocado free) arrived the manager came out to apologize and to check in on the rest of our meals. To top off the experience they took the salad off the bill without any negotiation. This is a level of service I have failed to experience in more upscale restaurants and was much appreciated. Of course service will only take you so far and I appreciated their large selection of beers and good, well priced food. The Yard House is a great place to eat, watch the game and spend time with people. Although I don't get there often, it's my landing spot whenever I do. Thank you for the great experience.

Reviews.Author: Sarah D.
Reviews.Content: Always a fun environment. Usually a wait for this place, it's always busy. Great selection of beers, good location, good food. Lots of options for meals here which is great to mix it up as great for large groups. Just discovered they deliver too! Check this place out, but go before standard dinner time, and on a weekday or else you might be deterred by the wait! Once you try it, you'll understand.

Reviews.Author: P C.
Reviews.Content: Had my usual. Xlnt service and chow. Even received a Veterans Day gift.Pineapple juice, Cuban pork sandwich,  truffle fries and a cup of Tomato Bisque soup. Thanks Yard House!

Reviews.Author: Farrah N.
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to come for happy hour! The prices are soo good and everything on the happy hour menu is scrumptious and perfect for a large party to share.I highly recommend the truffle fries, chicken nachos, and a pizza of your choosing all for half off during happy hour. If you like beer this is the place for you as they have pretty much every beer I've ever heard of on tap and then some. The downside is that typically there is a wait time and service can be pretty poor even though they try hard. They really do get that packed! It's also nice that you can walk off all that food and beer on a breezy evening around Santana Row :)

Reviews.Author: Will S.
Reviews.Content: Racist place. Won't be coming back.Off all my experiences at Yardhouse, from my days when I lived in Irvine to now when it was brought to my hometown, I've never had such a negative experience after facing such a discriminatory act.Came here about a week ago when our party wanted to watch the Superbowl. I called a few days before just to check on the seating process for the big day. I was told that for a party of 6 or more, a majority of our party had to be present. The day of, only 4 out of our total party of 9 were present at first, as some folks were running late. We were told to wait but that there was no guarantee that we would get a table unless ALL of our party showed up. So they told us to wait. And so we waited. And waited. And waited. After a great amount of time waiting we were finally seated. HOWEVER...once seated, we noticed a party seated at a large table next to us with only 2 people. They were waiting for the rest of their party to show up too. And yet, they were seated WAY before us. Within an hour, the rest of our party showed up and yet this supposed "large" party next to us still remained at 2 people. Their whole party didn't show up until HOURS later. REALLY?!! FYI, we were a group of diverse people while this other party was, well let's just say, more privileged looking.We spoke up to the manager, mind you a white male, about this unfairness. When we mentioned that it was racist he rolled his eyes and completely ignored us. What person in their right mind would ignore a customer?! Obviously, he would. When the host, another white male, overheard the conversation, he stated that people lie all the time about their numbers for large parties. Hmm...I wonder what type of "people" he was referring to. Let's just say nothing was done about it. Plus, we couldn't help but notice that other privileged looking large tables around us composed of smaller parties. They were seated in large booths when there were only 2 or 3 of them. And that a bunch of other  possible large parties near the door were left waiting. I'm sorry but I refuse to come back to a place that lacks employees who aren't culturally competent, especially if it's management. It's a disgrace to the business and is by no means acceptable.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: Great Yard House! Love the food. My favorite is the poke appetizer. They have a bunch of beer on tap--a lot of local and sessional choices. The only downside is how crowded it can get. I would recommend after long day shopping at Valley Fair or Santana Row, or if you want to watch the game, but be prepared for the wait!

Reviews.Author: Verona N.
Reviews.Content: I've set up two work lunches for my department at Yard House. The most recent being for a group of 14 last week. I really can't remember much about the first lunch, but it went well enough for everyone to want to go back again. They have every type of beer you can think of on tap which is nice. Their menu is a mile long and is similar to the Cheesecake Factory in the way that it makes it hard to choose what to eat. But at least you know there should be something for everyone.I set up our reservation and ordered our appetizers ahead of time so those of us who arrived at the restaurant on time could snack on something while waiting for the stragglers to show up (+1 start because only 50% of your party needs to be present to be seated). I never understand why people can't get to a group lunch on time. It's not like it's a dinner reservation and we can take our time (not that I condone being late for dinner reservations either) But we do unfortunately need to go back to work at a reasonable time.We had two orders each of the California Roll, Calamari and Crab Cakes. They were all delicious and averaged about $12 each. The CA roll isn't a typical sushi roll but a large serving formed with a ring mold. You end up slicing it like a pie. Interesting concept and tastes fine, but with a group sharing it turns into a mess.As for my main mean, I had a caesar salad and half roast beef dip sandwich. Both were really bad. Really, really bad. The salad had a TON of grated parmesean cheese mixed in the dressing and tossed in the salad. Maybe it would have helped to order the dressing on the side. But there was just so much cheese it created an awful texture and it was really off-putting. The roast beef was very lack luster and flavorless. It also had a really unpleasant texture and the au jus was just missing something. I took a couple bites of both and then just pushed it aside.Lastly, I ordered two mini dessert samplers with mini serving of lemon soufflé, peach apple cobbler and chocolate soufflé. I didn't like any of it. Unlike the Cheesecake Factory, this place does not bring their A-game out for dessert. I'll definitely be back, probably just for drinks and appetizers because that's where they seem to shine.

Reviews.Author: Miriam G.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be brief here. Not going back to this place. Ever.Service was slow. It took good 45mins for the beer to come as our waiters changed 2-3times.We have returned the sweet potato fries as they were nothing but oil trapped in the skin of the potatoes. Tasteless and horrible! I've never eaten worse sweet potatoes in my life.For main, I described what I wanted and I got a completely different thing. Yes, it was still ahi tuna, but not what I asked for.I have food allergies and I specifically asked them not to put soy sauce in my food. The rash that surfaced an hour or two later tells me they didn't really care about my request. What was even worse is that I found:A soy bean (must have gotten lost on it's way to a different salad???)A PIECE OF SOME SPICY CHICKEN/PORK or whatever it was! THAT IS NEVER OK!!! I just hope it wasn't garbage from people's leftovers!!!

Reviews.Author: Daniel S.
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I went to the Yardhouse for an early lunch, right when it opened.I must say, the menu is very large, so it took longer than usual to decide what to order. They also have 110 beers on tap, which is one of the largest selections I've ever seen anywhere.I was really impressed with the quality and execution of the food. Here's what we ordered :16oz Dos Equis on tap12oz Apple Cider on tapAHI Poke BowlFriend CalamariLettuce WrapsRibeye Steak with Jumbo ShrimpThe Calamari was not dried out, it was tender and juicy, but not greasy. I didn't try the the Ahi Poke bowl, as I don't really care for Poke salads very much, but my wife really enjoyed it.The lettuce wraps were better than PF Chang's, they were fabulous. We'll be ordering this again for sure.My steak was cooked exactly the way I ordered it (med), it wasn't an overly fatty cut, and wasn't over seasoned. The mashed potatoes were fresh and flavorful, and the haricot verts were tender (green beans), but still had some crispness to them. Everything was fantastic! I was very impressed with food quality. We will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Lana N.
Reviews.Content: Let me just say, HAPPY HOUR!!  I came here today at 3pm for Happy Hour and it was well worth it.  We ordered:Chicken Garlic Noodles - Great portion size, needed more noodles thoughChicken Strips - Good size portion and crispySpicy Tuna Roll - So...good and a great portionWell Drinks - $4.75Lemon Drop Martini - $6.50Overall it was great service, good food and such a deal, we ended up paying $42 including Tip.  Would definitely come back for their happy hour menu.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine D.
Reviews.Content: First time I waited for 2 hours for a table!. it was around 12 of us. Service was ok. Its the ambiance that everyone comes for I guess. Extensive beer options.

Reviews.Author: Priya G.
Reviews.Content: So I know there are hundreds of reviews on this place already, but oh well - I have to chime mine in also! I had heard that this place has delicious food and was a little skeptical because it seems more of a bar, but I was definitely proven wrong. I've been here once with my coworkers and I just went here last night.Foodwise, let me start out by saying that I love the way the menu is broken up. They have an entire vegetarian menu for all you veggies out there, along with little symbols of what is under 600 calories and vegetarian items throughout the menu. It's also broken up by pizzas, burgers, sandwiches, house favorites, seafood, and more. They list out all their beers and have a TON to choose from - they're known for their beers, incase you didn't know that. When you look at the bar, you'll see a huuuuuge row of them all on tap which is pretty amazing. Anyway, on the menu itself, they have a list of "skinny cocktails" which I love - I've gotten the pure cosmo martini, and all the cocktails under there are 150-200 calories. The first time I went with coworkers, we came for happy hour after work and ordered a bunch of beer and appetizers. For happy hour, they have a lot of really great deals and you can get a bunch of cheap stuff. I forgot the prices, but it's so well-priced and we got a ton of stuff and it was only maybe $20/person, including drinks.The second time I came was with one other friend for dinner, and we had a hard time deciding what to get because the menu is massive. Their selection is just so amazing that it's difficult to narrow down what you want (because you really want everything!) but we ended up sharing: the poke tuna tower (so delicious and is highly recommended by them!), chicken strips (these were good, but not anything special), and the chicken enchilada stack (so so so yummy - we weren't sure how well they could do Mexican food and were pleasantly surprised by it). There were so many other things I wanted to get on the menu but I'll have to save them for other times.The staff is really nice and friendly. Even on a Friday night with millions of people here, they have the place very under control. The nice thing is, we were able to call in advance and put our name down without being there which was clutch. I love the setup and vibe of the place. It has a very cool bar with tons of booths and high tables/chairs. Definitely don't miss out on the Yard House - so happy they opened one in Santana Row!

Reviews.Author: Raymond S.
Reviews.Content: Awesome atmosphere, good service. Always fast, which is nice. Best time is Sunday evenings for happy hour (10pm -midnight) bartenders are awesome. And greatly knowledgeable about their beer. Great place!

Reviews.Author: Dii P.
Reviews.Content: So, I've ate here twice. And both times I appreciated the professionalism and how fast the food came out. The first time I came I was on a date with an amazing guy, so I didn't pay a lot of attention to the restaurant itself (plus this was over a year ago). I ate here again and my waiter was extremely friendly. I'm not sure if it was because he knew the person I was with or what, but I appreciated his enthusiasm after having a long and exhausting day. I bumped this rating down a star because both times I ate hear the food tasted a bit odd. The first time I believe I had pasta and the guy I was with had mac and cheese. This last time I was there I had the Calamari and it was a o-kay. I didn't pay for it so, I can't say too much but If I did, I might have bumped the rating down again lol (meaning the food wasn't that good - basically). I like how up-beat the atmosphere is so, I'll deff come back!

Reviews.Author: Brett M.
Reviews.Content: Great place to grab a drink, there are so many!  I like to come and try different beers randomly by asking for the number of the tap; this keeps it exciting. Make sure to get here early. It is always crowded in the evenings and long waits to get seated. You can try your luck to get a bar seat, but is very difficult.

Reviews.Author: Erika S.
Reviews.Content: Had a party of 20 people for my little cousin's 21st birthday on a Saturday night around 6:30pm (which was suppose to be the plan)... we had called the restaurant earlier to see if we could make a reservation and unfortunately they don't take them.  They did, however, suggest we come about an hour early from our targeted time of 6:30pm to get our name on the list so our wait wouldn't be too long. So we did that exactly.  We kept checking in, and would constantly be told " Don't worry just another 30 mins"...... and I heard that about 4-5 times. After 3.5 HOURS of waiting and having the VERY RUDE female (who looks like a male) manager yell at us and after watching other large parties get accommodated before us, we finally got sat.  I work as a server at a local restaurant and I have never experienced, nor seen, such horrible customer service.  I saw many opportunities for them to seat us, and those opportunities were not taken at all. It was disheartening, especially since all my other experiences here had been great.  I just couldn't believe how they were pushing us aside as if we were not important... and it made it feel like it was a racist thing (since we are a VERY multicultural diverse group). I am going to complain to corporate about this experience because there could have been a lot done to prevent what happened to us. I can't say I will never go here again... but definitely not with a large group on a busy night (which I get is not an easy time to go to a busy restaurant)!!! You suck Yardhouse!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Varun V.
Reviews.Content: Love the gardien wings and long islands! The wait is very long especially on weekends, thats the only downside to this place..

Reviews.Author: Elise G.
Reviews.Content: Second chance, here we go... Meh.  The food was just as disappointing as the first time.  The service from Brian, however was a huge upgrade.  My boyfriend and I sat at the bar for some late night grub and drink.  Belgium Beer 6 pack:A nice sampler for the indecisive.  I really liked the lighter beers.  They were bright and summery and a nice start.  The darker brews were bitter and paired well with the sweet chili sauce I was eating with my coconut shrimp.Coconut Shrimp:Not bad, but not delicious.  It was a huge prawn, deep fried with a thick breaded crust.  The sweet chili sauce was good and I liked the carrot and green papaya slaw.  I probably wouldn't order it again because it was really heavy.Blue Crab Cakes:Gross.  The texture was lifeless.  I had a hard time believing it was crab.  I took two bites and was done with it.  You know the hair you discard from the inside of an artichoke?  It was that kind of texture only deep fried into a patty.For food, this is not the place to go.  The ambiance was not all that great either.  It was a big warehouse with loud music not to my taste, and just felt extremely corporate.  The bartender was cool though, attentive, and down to earth.  If my boyfriend wasn't such a huge fan of the many beers on tap, I would probably never eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Edward M.
Reviews.Content: Late night happy hour is the only way to go. -Nom Nom

Reviews.Author: Tiffaney L.
Reviews.Content: I love Yard House. Where else can I get beer taller than my torso outside of Vegas without going to a frat party? Apparently, many places but that's not the point. it's a great place to grab a drink and food with friends at Santana Row but not have to worry about being dressed up. It's also a wonderful place to bring people you know who love to get drunk, but because it's a family environment, they're forced to be socially acceptable and leave their belligerentness at home. Win win.

Reviews.Author: Jackie H.
Reviews.Content: I know Yard House is popular with the people, and it is always packed. However, it isn't my favorite place to eat. I find the food salty and lack-luster. If you want beer then the Yard House is a great place with great selection. Personally, we go to Yard House all the time with big groups (they have great seating) and I can't understand why we continue coming back. The food is horrible, service is sub-par, and unless you're boozing it up with friends or are on a casual date, I wouldn't exactly recommend this place unless I am strictly recommending it for the beer selection and the experience.

Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: Good food and vast selection of brew! Beware, it does get busy during peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Sumana M.
Reviews.Content: Got sick last night after eating here. We had the following- tomato bisque soup- lime shrimp with brown riceAfter we came home, I had some terrible burps that lasted till the late evening, during the night I couldn't sleep and had terrible stomach pain which then turned into very bad nausea. I then threw up the soup and possibly some of the shrimp as well (this was almost 14 hours later!!) Since I didn't have dinner the previous night it couldn't have been anything else.I forgot to mention that I had only 4 pieces of shrimp and a cup of soup. I have had all kinds of shrimp (spicy, bland etc) before so I'm not allergic to it in anyway.In the morning I still had nausea. Looks like this could be the MSG they add to their food from what other people are saying.Definitely never going back and this place is less than a mile from home!

Reviews.Author: Vianett E.
Reviews.Content: I don't normally eat at chain Restaurants but when I do I make sure that it's worth it. And if they are this good I will return!
