I love coming here when in San Jose the areas is nice and great stop to have lunch or dinner  after a long day of shopping!  I get the Parmesan fries chicken which is amazing the truffle fries are my addiction here some of my favorites! The beer selection is great and if your in the area you must try !!

Reviews.Author: Sam W.
Reviews.Content: The yardhouse has some high points and some low points, in my opinion. The biggest pro is obviously their extensive (and ever-changing) beer selection. They have a TON of beer options, and the menu has them helpfully arranged by type rather than name. It makes it really fun to choose, and there are always some unique and hard to find things. The downside, is the menu is pretty uneven as far as quality and flavor is concerned. Burgers are fantastic in my experience, and their mac and cheese is a must. On the other hand, their steak and fish dishes were not up to par. I definitely recommend this place is you want some good and unique beer. If you go, do the mac & cheese!

Reviews.Author: Katherine C.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is a place where you can:a) hog a comfy booth with your friendsb) follow three games simultaneouslyc) get a $10 half yard or a $6 pizzad) have happy hour two days in a row and still leave happye) all of the aboveCorrect answer: E

Reviews.Author: MH A.
Reviews.Content: Came in a bit before 1045pm  and they stopped serving food at 11. An appitizer wouldve been okay if you want to keep me and my boyfriend in for the drinks. but either the chefs or the servers just got lazy. I dont know but it wasnt right. So we left, and took our money else where.

Reviews.Author: Hepsie C.
Reviews.Content: Food is alright. But service is horrible. Waited almost two hours to be seated and I can tell you the food is not worth the two hour wait. Maybe i'll try again next time.

Reviews.Author: Eddie K.
Reviews.Content: Yard house is nice because it is a reasonable priced restaurant in the ever-ballin' Santana Row shopping center. The beer selection is great and it's always fun holding the half-yard beers. There are plenty of TVs showing just about every sporting even going on and the staff is always great.The one down-side to Yard House is their food, I have to keep reminding myself that people come from the beer not the food, but seeing as this is a restaurant I had to take that into consideration for this review. Beer - 4.5Food - 2Overall - 3.5

Reviews.Author: Sheila E.
Reviews.Content: I'm always passing by this place at Santana Row, and finally decided to try it. They don't take reservations (-1) & the wait can vary depending on your party size. We were seated in 20 minutes (3 people). I ordered a bbq bacon cheeseburger and truffle fries. I was EXTREMELY satisfied with the food and service. I've heard they're known for their truffle fries & I now know why.

Reviews.Author: Denise L.
Reviews.Content: This place is noticeably good for TWO THINGS--BEER & yelling out your conversations. I would have given 2 stars but 1+ for the selection of beer.I love the fact that they have a wide range of beer here that you don't see anywhere else... (I seriously mean that, they have a bible selection of beer here).The service here is definitely a wait, but I get it, I mean it's a full house, but I really don't remember all the servers' names that helped us and I'm a little disappointed that we got swapped with so many different servers.My friend and I got the Crab Cakes, Calamari, and Truffle Fries. The Crab Cakes were totally different. I really like the pairing with the mango salsa. It was sweet and sultry, something I'm not used too, but wouldn't mind trying again.Calamari is is always a good combo when it comes to beer.And the Truffles Fries were just a-ok.  I'm a fan of fries but this one wasn't anything to rave about. It was just "MEH okay" for me.For drinks, we had Hef--who doesn't like a wheat beer?!Raspberry beer--it was a little too tart for my taste buds.and White Russians. My White Russian came out looking like it had been thrown-up compared to the one my friend had ordered. I hope they consider presentation in their mix-drinks; not just the beer.

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Ok YH is at the top of my list. I beyond love their food and the variety of beers!!!!!! I cannot get enough of this place. Their burgers are awesome and the parmesan crusted chicken. anyway I love this place and the atmosphere is fun...

Reviews.Author: Avni S.
Reviews.Content: Yard house is one of the newer restaurants in Santana Row and on the weekend, it is hell trying to get a table. Unfortunately, they don't accept reservations, not sure why but thinking they want to create a buzz by showing they are extremely popular. I was unsuccessful the first time I came there with over a 2 hr wait. I tried again and luckily the wait was just an hour ( even that is too long for my standards but I wanted to try this place out). Atmosphere in the restaurant is nice, it's spacious and reminds me of an slightly more glam'ed up version of BJ's restaurant. When we got seated, I noticed they had a good selection of Vegetarian dishes. I had the gardein penne with chicken, friend had the spicy thai chicken pizza, and we had the gardein beef sliders for the appetizer. The sliders were tasty and love the gardein beef..best soy beef ever! The spicy thai chicken pizza was not spicy at all instead it was the opposite-pretty sweet . The Gardein penne with chicken was flavorful and I'd order that again next time I'm here.  Overall Great hangout Spot! Minus one star for the hella long wait though!

Reviews.Author: Ly Chee _.
Reviews.Content: This place has a huge selection of beer and wine, both local and imported ones that I've never heard of. It has your better-than-average bar fare in addition to a wide selection of vegetarian and gf plates. I felt a bit overwhelmed with both the beer and food selection, but I was fortunate to dine with a large group, so I got to sample various items. Of the items that I tried, the ones that stood out were the blackened swordfish taco and (mac+cheese)2.I recommend taking a peek at the online menu before heading out to YH if you haven't been there before. I think it was possible that I gained 2 lbs from that visit, which I tried to walk off while window shopping the shops along Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Alex G.
Reviews.Content: Located at Santana Row and straight across from Valley Fair mall, Yard House is a very convenient place to go for food. The wait times may vary, but they are usually pretty long. I went on a Sunday night around 9 and the wait time was about 25 minutes. I'd suggest calling into this place before you go to find out the wait time and make a reservation so you don't waste your time.The servers were nice and attentive to our needs which was a good plus.For an appetizer, I tried out their calamari. It was pretty average, but the sauce was the hero which made it a good dish.For the entree, I had a tasty Firestone Double Barrel Ale and an extremely delicious Bearnaise Grilled Burger. My burger was cooked perfectly medium just as I liked it and the tiny fried onions provided a nice, subtle crunch. It was good that the bearnaise sauce was on the side so that I could control how much sauce I would throw onto my burger. The sauce was well made, but I would've liked a little bit more than I had. The fries were also cooked perfectly and complimented well with the burger, as expected.Overall the environment was nice, it seemed like Yard House was the perfect place to hang out with a few friends, even a lot of friends, or even bring someone on a date to. I will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Author: Mohamed M.
Reviews.Content: Very good food and service

Reviews.Author: Becky K.
Reviews.Content: I've had this feeling before... dehydrated... headache... savory aftertaste on my tongue for hours after the meal... gulping bottles of water until the next morning... MSG BOMB'D!I drank 3 full glasses of water during my meal. Not to mention half of a Pineapple Express on top of that. I know this probably doesn't mean anything to you, but during a normal meal, I drink about 2 oz of water and I'm good. The food was pretty tasty... but I think MSG tastiness is cheating (yes, even at Chinese restaurants). Hubbs, me and 2 friends came here for a quarterly hang out session. We decided to get the lobster, crab and artichoke dip with chips to start, which ended up smelling pretty fishy (and I was content having only eaten one chip). Hubbs and I shared the Pastrami sandwich and did a garlic fries / onion rings split. Pastrami sandwich was okay (ruined by The Refuge), and the fries were pretty good (but thinner than I would've liked), with mediocre onion rings. Our 2 friends both ordered sandwiches and a few drinks. For dessert, we couldn't resist splitting the salted caramel butterscotch pudding which ended up being REALLY sweet, with some weird, gritty yellow pudding on the bottom. In the end, our bill was $130 including tip.I don't understand why this place is so packed. It's huge, with tons of tables, and a large bar in the center. I guess since it's in Santana Row, it's a place to see and to be seen by young hopefuls of having their real-life romantic comedy come true. It was a little crowded and noisy for this married woman (and this place was so packed that people kept running into my purse that was hanging from my chair). Sorry to be the 2-star bomb!

Reviews.Author: Camery V.
Reviews.Content: I love that they have late night happy hour, they are probably one of two places who have late night happy hour on the row. Appetizers are half off, and the portions are huge. The kung pao calamari is interesting and really tasty. The lettuce wraps are yummy! The sauce for the firecracker chicken is very savory, keeps you wanting more. If you like tuna, I would suggest trying the hawaiian poke stack, I didn't like it because I don't like avocados but it seems to be a hit with my girlfriends. As for drinks, the cocktails have been way too sweet for me. I'd rather drink a beer in that case. The Leinekugel's Sunset Wheat which tastes like fruity pebbles!

Reviews.Author: Harry W.
Reviews.Content: I took my wife on a date to this restaurant a couple weeks ago on a Friday night. They did not lie to us about the hour and a half wait time they quoted us. It was every bit of that. I don't normally mind having to wait for a restaurant, especially if it's a good one. At the end of the day, I don't know if a 95 minute wait and the bill for 2 people matched the food. The food was really good. I never for a second thought what I ate was unpleasant, but the scales didn't come away balanced for us. I would like to go at another time (not universal date night) and see what I think about it. I would consider changing my 4 stars to 5 if that experience is better.

Reviews.Author: Mark S.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few time since they opened in Santana Row.  The biggest problem with this place is that it is always packed to the brim.  Expect to wait, even for a bar seat.  The food here is not bad, but it is not the highlight of this place.  That of course, is the beer.  They have tons of beer to select from and if you wished to try them all, you would either be a raging alcoholic, or its going to take more than a few visits.  The big turn off for me about this place, aside from the large crowds, is that after 10 (I think that was the time), they start checking IDs at the door.  I find this a little strange for a place that I would consider a restaurant first, a place to get blasted, second.

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went there about a month and a half ago and while we were eating a bartender threw some dirty plates under the bar and splashed sauce all over both of us.  The bartender didn't apologize or even acknowledge that it happened.  Even after I told him he still didn't apologize and just said, "oh I didn't know that got you". After that I decided to tell the manager about his rudeness and all she did was say how great of a bartender he was instead of trying to fix the situation.  She offered to pay for dry cleaning only until I asked for a comped meal..  If they had been at least apologetic I would have understood as I'm in the business I understand accidents happen..  She finally comped the meal but the way we were treated there I don't think I'll go back again even after going there many times and liking the food and environment..

Reviews.Author: Stephen R.
Reviews.Content: We don't frequent this place as much as we used to, but we are still fans.The food is usually very good. The deviled eggs and garlic noodles appetizers are delicious. For entrees i've gotten the garlic noodles, steak and shrimp, and an enchilada (i think). all were very good. I go for the escalade margarita which is ok. They obviously have a huge selection of beers, oh which i've hardly tried.Tons of TVs near the bar, and great ambience with an industrial look and tons of windows overlooking the Santana Row & Stevens Creek intersection.I do need to mention that the very first time I came here I wanted to be adventerous and try the Thai Pizza. THIS IS THE WORST THING I HAVE TASTED IN MY LIFE. I would be really surprised if this were still on the menu. I can' t imagine people eat this regularly. Fushion is almost always a bad idea, and in this particular case, a horrible idea. Through luck though, that meal was free, so thats the only reason i didn't mind too much.Last few times i've been here the service has been great.

Reviews.Author: Denise L.
Reviews.Content: I first visited Yard House with some cool Yelpers I met at an Elite event earlier that night on Santana Row. I was dubious that a chain restaurant could deliver more than average, but I was pleasantly surprised. Service was very attentive; our waitress returned every 15 minutes or so to check on us and see whether we wanted more food or alcohol. Of course, the answer to both of those questions is always, emphatically, YES.So. Many. Beers! A large selection of beers on tap, and the waiters are quite knowledgeable if you ask for recommendations. They also have a list of mostly California wines, but they have a few from New Zealand, Argentina, and Australia. They have cupcake wine! Give it a shot if you've never tried it before. On my first visit, I didn't really get around to sampling many beers because I had an early morning the next day, so I made up for it on my second visit for sure. I definitely did my fair share of sampling! Luckily I came prepared with a DD. :)On to the food. I've only had appetizers here. If you order enough of them, you can have a pretty substantial meal.* Truffle Fries - Sinfully delicious! We must have gone through at least 3 servings of truffle fries, and I could probably have eaten 3 more. *Spicy Calamari - Some calamari went by to another table, and we knew we HAD to have our own batch! That other group knew what they were doing, because that calamari was lightly battered.* Hawaiian Poke Stack - I'm always a fan of poke, especially when drinking. It always seems a perfect balance to alcohol, not sure why!* Turkey Burger Sliders - Okay on taste, but a little dry.* Chicken Garlic Noodles - I thought these were also just okay. Perhaps I'm a super picky garlic noodle eater because I've had them at other places that completely NAIL this dish. Hard to live up to perfect garlic noodles!TIP: Great place to chill for happy hour and get your beer sampling on!

Reviews.Author: P G.
Reviews.Content: This last Saturday was the 2nd time I have been there. The first time, I went during the week so there was no wait for a table and there were only two of us.  The food was delicious and I even took the rest home (I hardly take food home that I don't plan on eating).  The service was good.  I say "good" because there was a moment when he forgot to bring our water and then remembered when our eyes met.  I'm glad he got the picture though with my raised eyebrow.  He obviously grew up with sisters.The second time was this last Saturday.  There was a big group of us having dinner celebrating my 40th Birthday.  Our Hostess was amazingly wonderful.  She seated us within a reasonable time because of the amount of people in our group and because it was my birthday and noone wants to stand around in a dress and high heels for an hour waiting to eat!  We were approached by our Waiter (Jason?) almost immediately to take our drink and appetizer order.  I ordered the Shrimp Ceviche for an appy.  OH MY GOODNESS, DELICOUSNESS!  I make my own Ceviche at home so I'm pretty picky and this definitely topped mine!There was kind of a delay getting our dinner ordered though but then I found out our waiter was leaving for his break and had someone covering for him on top of the crowd in the restaurant, it was just too busy.  Not really an excuse but considering I was in a good mood and enjoying the drinks and company, I wasn't complaining.  Once we got our food ordered (and our regular waiter was back) it got better.  I ordered the Vodka Shrimp Pasta.  HOLY MOUTHWATER!  I darn near finished my plate (and I never finish my plate!)  In fact, I'm craving it right now!  The side Caesar Salad it came with was pretty generous and I even shared it with one of my friends at the table and still had some left over.  THEN...SURPRISE!  The Hostess (not the waiter or covering waitress, but HOSTESS) spoiled me with some dessert.  The Mini Trio Sampler, probably the best dessert I tasted in a couple of months.  I hope I don't get her in trouble by mentioning it was complimentary for my Birthday.  But, that kind of customer service is definitely appreciated and made up for our wait on our food order.  The experience that evening was overall excellent.  I do appreciate that The Yard House is willing to split the bill 10 ways.  Everyone involved in our evening (Hostess, Waiter, Waitress) were very nice and patient.  Patience, on a busy night?!  Yes, they were GREAT!I'm only giving it 4 stars though because of the inability to make reservations for a large group.  Otherwise, I'm absolutely coming back for more very soon!   Keep up the good work, staff!  Your mission to please your customers shows!

Reviews.Author: Long N.
Reviews.Content: I like how they separate the receipt by guest. Easy for us to pay individually :)Great burger. Soufflé. Loud atmosphere. Don't like the wait, and parking's hard to find. I don't drink though :P

Reviews.Author: Uyen L.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how ridiculous the wait still is. The food isn't THAT great, but maybe the large selection of beer is worth it. The dishes that I like are-spicy jambalayatruffle friesahi poke bowllobster crab and artichoke dipmac and cheeseI must say, they have a lengthy vegetarian (gardein) menu. I've tried two dishes from there and both were good! I don't eat meat, so trust me, I know what I'm sayin'. =)Vegetarian-boneless wingsmac and cheeseGo-to (easy to drink) beer-strawberry timmermanpear ciderraspberry cidercrisp apple cider

Reviews.Author: Evangelina B.
Reviews.Content: My first time should have made the best impression to come back for more. That is the key to having a profitable and successful business. I was excited to try this place out with my friends since all of my friends have raved about it. It was a busy weeknight when we went so the crowd was expected. We waited about 25 min for our table which was acceptable. The service lacked but the food was good, not great but good. It surprised me how beautiful it was inside that the service did not match. I would only go back if it was necessary but I won't be planning on it.

Reviews.Author: Marc A.
Reviews.Content: If you are a beer drinker, then Yardhouse is for you. This review is for the service and the dish I had. Being a returning customer I knew what to expect and those expectations weren't necessarily high tbh. My brother picked this place for his graduation dinner and I enjoy any time I get to spend with my family, so I had a great time regardless if the food was subpar. We were greeted by the waitress and her trainee. I can't recall the names, but they seemed pleasant upon first impression. We ordered beverages and appetizers which were brought out rather quickly except for my sisters Pellegrino water which took very long to come out. I almost went to the bar to grab it but after about 10-12 min or so it finally arrived. The boneless wings were very average, almost more deep fried breading than chicken on every piece  :(  and the chicken nachos were actually pretty good and very hearty sized. Happy hour prices so they were half off which was good. I ordered the Grilled Chicken Sammich on a potato bun with lettuce, tomato, pep jack cheese, and bacon. They left off the bacon which sucked, and the way they were coming around every 15 min or so, I didn't feel the need to wait. Besides, I could do without the bacon these days. lol. They also gave my sister the small Tuna salad, when she ordered the big one. They offered to get her a bigger one but she didn't want to wait either, so we chalked that up as a loss. Check backs were very far apart for a night that did not seem that busy at all. I understand that she was a new employee but I think the trainer could've been on her a little more.

Reviews.Author: Darlene A.
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Yard House. I was actually looking for places to have my birthday dinner at, and I came across this on Yelp. It had good reviews so I figured why not give it a shot and try something new!My friends and I came here around 6 and by the look of it inside it was packed! I thought we would have to wait a long time to be seated to our table but we actually didn't even wait that long. The manager who seated us was very sweet and kind. What I dislike about this place is that it's very loud. Since we sat in a round table, it was very hard to talk to each other and listen to what the other person was saying across the table. So basically, all of us just had to yell at each other, and if not, just talk to the person that's sitting right next to us.What I did like about this place was that they had many different varieties of meals to choose from. The menus were literally so big, it was hard for me to even choose what I wanted. I ended up ordering the Hawaiian burger with fries and for appetizers, the Tower of Onion Rings.The food was great but wasn't all that great. It was good, but I actually prefer the Hawaiian burger and the Tower of Onion Rings from Red Robin than here..At the end, the waiter gave me a chocolate soufflé with ice cream and a candle on it and the word BIRTHDAY written on the plate, made out of cocoa powder I'm guessing. It was very nice and pretty and let me tell you, the soufflé was delicious! I loved it! The waiter was also nice and he wished me a happy birthday a lot.At the end of the day, my friends and I had a great time here. I do recommend it to others who haven't tried it here yet :)4 Stars.

Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: When you do something really cool in life, besides the actual brief moment of the experience, so much of what lives on is purely just the memory of the experience.  I am awfully nostalgic and with the right triggers, so many memories of my younger years often glimmer through my mind like a constant movie reel.Essentially I am a product of the 90s.  With that in mind, I really had some major flashbacks when I recently dined at Yard House.  The large Vegas-style set up with dark wood furniture...the huge drinks...the large-portioned pub-style food...and the glaringly loud grunge rock playing throughout the night...all of this immersed me back into the memories of my college days.  When Pearl Jam's "Daughter" was blasting away while we were munching on our burger and garlic mushroom noodles, I told my better half that I really felt like I was in my 20s again.Meal & drinks for two..roughly $60.  Time warp back to the 90s...priceless!

Reviews.Author: Ben H L.
Reviews.Content: Updating my review after a year of beer exploration...Ever since the Yard House opened, there has been a huge movement in terms of craft beer locations and  I discovered other SJ locales like Original Gravity, Wine Affairs, Good Karma, and the newly relevant Harry's Hofbrau with the old school food but the ever evolving beer selections.  I came back here to meet up with a friend and I got a chance to reacquaint myself with the food and beer menu.  I was seated at the bar so I got a chance to see all the taps up close.  Since my friend was running late, I ordered the Mac and Cheese just out of curiosity and because I've heard such great things about it and also some not so great things about it.  It was a $17 risk but hey, I tried it and it was oddly satisfying with the chicken and the bacon but I sensed that it lacked something.   Usually I like my mac and cheese with a bit more gooeyness(less parmesan/more cheddar) and I didn't really pick up the truffle oil in there either.  So that was a minor bummer...As for the beer side, I can't complain about the selection as I only drink ales or stronger...but there are still about 50 something selections that appealed to me, including their special rotating offerings that include Rogue, Dogfish, and Coronado.  It could still make the Yard House a typical beer aficionado's destination but it does it give the best atmosphere for the beer aficionado?  At night, the place is nearly always packed which it makes it loud and impossible to have a conversation.  Added to that, the lighting in there is set at "nightclub" level which means you'll need to use your cell phone flashlight to read the menu if you don't have a light right above your table.  If I could make a request to the  ownership, I'd request an outdoor patio area or a room where the music isn't blasting and the lighting isn't super dim.The Yard House appeals to many people with its large menu, attractive interior decor, and its location on the Row as a trendy place to meet with friends or go out for a special couple's meal.  However, it may eventually start to lose dedicated beer drinkers who may go elsewhere to more comfortable locales that offer brewery weekly  tap takeovers and promotional giveaways like pint glasses and such.

Reviews.Author: Gina G.
Reviews.Content: We went to eat lunch on Super Bowl Sunday. We were seated right away. We ordered the sweet potato fries. They came with maple bacon dip which was delicious. Between the three of us we ordered the Mac and cheese( best I have ever had) fried calamari, pear Gorgonzola flatbread and bacon cheddar burger. They were all really good! The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because we tried to order an anchor steam from the tap and they were all out ....funny being that they tout having such a large selection of beer.

Reviews.Author: Asmita J.
Reviews.Content: i used to love coming to yardhouse when i lived in southern california. unfortunately, this place has turned into an over-hyped, crowded, mediocre place. my family and i came from drinks and finger foods. the drinks were good but the food was unremarkable. i usually loveeee wings, but these we dry and unflavorful. the best thing about the meal (and yardhouse, in general) is the mini chocolate souffle cake. good thing that didn't disappoint!

Reviews.Author: Rebekah T.
Reviews.Content: The Yard House is one of my favorite restaurant chains. This is now the third one I have been to and probably the largest. Even though it was raining, the Yard House was filled and had a long wait for a table.We prefer the bar anyway, so we decided to wait it out while enjoying two half yards of beer. I could only imagine the ruckus if they sold full yards of beer. I went with the Paulander Hefeweizen and I picked out the Speakeasy the Witness for my guy. I mixed them up and enjoyed his beer very much before realizing it was not mine. Once two seats opened up, we decided to order food. We went for the giant 12oz Rib Eye cooked Medium and a Chop Salad. The steak was unbelievably good and so was the salad. The two items were a perfect amount of food for us. With our food, we ordered up a couple fancy brews. I ordered the Tripel Karmeliet for myself and ordered the mister a North Coast Le Merle. Both were very tasty and new to us. I love the Yard House because with the extensive selection, you never run out of new beers to try. I like how they group them by type, flavor and beer style. I also like the quick service and excellent food. For all of that, the Yard House will remain my favorite chain and I look forward to trying new locations out as we travel.

Reviews.Author: Michelle O.
Reviews.Content: 2nd time coming to this Place. 1st visit was with a group of 15+ horrible Experience. 2nd time back in and the wait was about 2hrs guy had said originally it would be approx 30min wait for 2 people...... NOT the caseFood is Great. Tried the Chicken jambalaya and OMMMMMMGGG thats addicting!!!!Drinks are great tried Several all made to perfection!!!! The Beer Half yard was ok. HAPPY Hour after 10 is whay sold me as well.Service SUCKED: As soon as you walk in the door my expectations are to be greeted by the HUGE Quanity of Employees just standing there. -We had to flag the waiter down several times just to order simple stuff. Not much attention was being put on the tables with less than 5 people in our area.- It would be nice if your staff is a little bit more smiley.... The BAR is EXTREMELY BUSY (Main Reason why i came here for the DRINKS) However i do have to mention while here I had seen several business Men come in Waive a few dollars in the air and get immidietly Served.... Not the case with my little short self..... i had to wait even longer for my drinksIm definetly Coming back but hopefully my experience gets better!!!

Reviews.Author: Alice H.
Reviews.Content: Yard house is just an over-priced BJ's/Chili's in the outskirts of Santana Row. I've been here a couple times for the happy hour from 10pm to closing with a large group of friends.Although the restaurant is extremely large the wait for a table take a really long time. Their signature dish (Mac and Cheese)^2 isn't that impressive in my honest opinion.I've also tried their "Korean Tacos" under their appetizer menu for $5 each and it is definitely not worth the money. I'm not sure if they just imagine that other people think it's exotic just because its Korean that they are willing to pay the $5-$6 for a single taco that is lacking in size. I highly don't recommend getting the appetizer tacos.The Chicken Strips ($6 during happy hour) was a weird consistency. It reminded me of "Fish and Chips" which is not a good consistency to have for chicken strips. The chicken should be cooked well, I still ate the dish though because the chicken didn't look undercooked. The one good thing I liked was the skinny fries because it makes them extra crispy which is the way I like them.My favorite thing from going to BJ's was trying the "Strawberry Beer" which was delicious! It doesn't taste too much like beer which is good for me because I'm not too fond of beer. It's a great drink for someone who doesn't want to drink too much alcohol, but wants to sip on a beer without the beer bitter taste.I think this place is a bit overrated in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Salvatore B.
Reviews.Content: Chose this location for a close friends birthday. We had a party of about 14 and asked WAY ahead of time to make a reservation which we were denied forcing us to arrive early (2 hours, luckily the birthday person didn't have to endure our excruciating wait due to their time schedule fumble lol). After receiving TWO estimated times, both after the other consisting of 20 minutes, we finally decided to just go inside (I would have been a lot more fine with things if they said an hour to give them cushion space) and go to the bar as a whole party and coincidentally (I Feel) our buzzer went off after a third of us ordered drinks with the busy yet very attentive bartenders. I myself and 2 others from my party ordered our drinks a bit late so were kind of left at the bar while everybody else was seated. Arriving at the table, there were chairs for Each one of us (obviously) so of course one would expect the table to receive the same amount of menus and silverware as people being seated. One of our waiters seemed a bit "closed mouths don't get fed" if you will with his attitude. I had to sort of lock eyes twice with the guy, get ignored, and call out for his attention. Received the menus, silverware, ordered drinks, ordered food. Was given a heads up by our other waiter, who seemed to have taken over, that they were busy and that things Do take about 15 mins, which was fine and we totally understood. We all WERE Trying to enjoy our drinks as the food was being prepared but, MAN, maybe if we weren't colored we would have been getting less attention from One of the security guards who seemed to be targeting us locking eyes with everyone facing his direction. There was another party who wasn't colored who had the same amount of people who seemed to receive NO attention. After a few people confirmed with each other that they felt uneasy because of that Same security guard, we ALL cheered our glasses to him in hopes of showing him we were there to enjoy ourselves and That Only,  which seemed to have left him feeling caught that he was "monitoring" us making him leave (YES!!!). Surely enough he returned a few times,  when someone in my party asked him why he is so stressed out over us he replied, "I'm here to make sure you guys are cool", my party then asked why he isn't so worried about the other party of the same size and he just stayed quite (what kind of prejudice a** sh*t is that Yardhouse? Just point the cameras at us instead of having some online certified Mickey Mouse breathe down our necks trying to Emmet Till us ruining the experience at your establishment). Food came out pretty scheduled to our waiters word, everything (from what I heard) was on point with the order. Food arrived at the table and OVERWHELMED the amount of space they thought was going to be able to fit all our food (an extra table would have been nice tho I'm not sure it would have fit with the seating arrangement for the busy night?) but yet everyone's food WAS enjoyed along with beverages. About half way through the meal we had to Tetris our plates, and in doing so we found on the table a little flyer indicating big parties such as ourselves to MAKE RESERVATIONS (ain't That some dog sh*t). Our waiter (who pretty much took over) was attentive without being intrusive and kept it 100 without stepping out of his professional environment both verbally and physically which is service I personally feel EVERYone should receive. 2 waiters brought our checks, one of them the attentive waiter and the Other one the ont that I guess forgot about us. We established HOW our checks were going to be split when we ordered, the waiter who forgot about us came back clueless with how the checks were getting split (c'mon cat) and completely messed our totals up. The other waiter fixed our checks and was able to sort of neutralize some of the negativity in our experience. I and the rest of my party REALLY put our appreciation towards our waiter who helped make things better especially due to it being a birthday dinner, I apologize for forgetting your unique name. On the other hand, Ivan got to step that serving game up.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: This place gets a lot of foot traffic because it is on Santana Row and people just love to watch their sports games on their multiple tv screens. The actual restaurant and environment is pretty cool and relaxed, so it is a great place to just chill with your friends while eating food and drinking. A lot of people in their 20s come here to celebrate bdays and watch the game, so you will most likely see a big crowd outside the door on Friday and Saturday nights.However, just basing it on the food, I would say the food is pretty average. Nothing screams outstanding or delicious. The food is good but not great so I wouldnt come here just for food. I guess you are also paying for the sports viewings and to be surrounded by other fanatics. The bar is surrounded by people watching the game, so good luck finding a seat around there!**TIPS**1) Not a great place for food since it is a bit pricey but it is good for watching the game with your buds.2) Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Aileen C.
Reviews.Content: I came for my 21st during happy hour(10-12)!  Got the midori sour, Bj, shot of patron, and Long Island iced teaa.  All were tasty except for the iced tea , noooo tea taste! Oh well, more alchhhh! :). I also got the spinach and artichoke pita chips.  The quality of the pita chips are not as great as the first time I tried the appetizer.  The chips just taste very oily because they are sooooo thin now.At the end, they surprised me with a birthday chocolate soufflé!  :)

Reviews.Author: An N.
Reviews.Content: My friend got a table for 4 around 6:30 on a Saturday and we didn't get seated until almost 8. She even told me there was no parking that I would have to valet. After waiting an hour we just wanted to check since the guy before her just went in. Since the lady had told her that the wait is an hour and 20 minutes that we only been waiting for almost an hour and that we still have 20 more minutes to wait??? Really..so basically they are saying however long they tell you the wait is, that they will make you actually wait that long.The service is actually fast though. We ordered drinks and it came quick. The food came quick too. I ordered the Hawaiian burger which I thought was really good. It had this dipping sauce which complimented it very nicely.

Reviews.Author: Dominique L.
Reviews.Content: I came here for my son's birthday with a large-ish group with two kids under 10 and it was my first time. I was a little skeptical because I had tried to come here before to check out their large selection of beer but on both occasions, I turned around and left because it was just too crowded. I had also heard that the food wasn't all that great and too pricey. After an average wait of about 10-15 minutes, we were seated and all of our drink orders were taken but not delivered in any meaningful order. The beers came out first (which was cool with me), then the little kid drinks and finally after I asked about two sodas that were forgotten, they promptly showed up. Not a huge deal but kind of annoying when you want your drink and everyone else has theirs already. The food ... oh my god, I was pleasantly surprised I ordered the Pepper Crusted Gorgonzola burger and it was SUPER good! Another person in my party ordered the Shepard's Pie and the thing was the size of a medium pizza! As with most Shepard's Pie's, it's mostly pastry but even taking that into consideration, this is the biggest single serving of Shepard's Pie I have ever seen and I was told it was really good. No complaints on the rest of the food either. Since I was there at 2pm in the afternoon and driving, I can't say that I was able to try too many of their beers. I did enjoy the House Honey Blond though. Overall, I was happy with the service, food and beer and the most important thing is that my son had a good birthday. I'm willing to come back and brave the crowds and try some more of their beer offerings. The lack of 5 stars is because of the wait, the drink issue and overall price.

Reviews.Author: Pammy L.
Reviews.Content: The truffle fries and fruity beers are the only things I like here. The garlic noodles on the happy hour menu are SO bland! I had to add lots of salt and pepper to add some flavor.I came during early evening happy hour several times, and the last time I came I felt our server (young asian guy) was rude. When our server came by to say it was last call I asked for another small glass of strawberry beer which he replied "sure, but can you finish your beer first". I was on my FIRST small glass of beer 3/4th ways finished. I felt that was very rude the way he said that as if I'm some child.  If there's some policy where you need to finish your first glass (not those tower glasses) of beer before ordering another one, then please explain this instead of demanding I finish my beer before giving me another one. As a paying customer I don't think it's right for a server to tell any customer to finish their food or drinks.

Reviews.Author: Charisse G.
Reviews.Content: Man, this place is just amazing. Having gone to the one in Irvine, I just had to go here. I got a 3 taco plate: 2 swordfish tacos and 1 Korean pork belly taco with rice and beans. Always amazing and got me super full. I also was feeling fruity in the sense that my mouth was parched and I decided to get a fruity beer. A Timmerman's Strawberry is what I got and it seriously poses as an undercover light beer; refreshing, delicious and I just had to get another. The ambiance here is different from the one in Irvine. I's more lit and their bar looks a bit smaller and they have less TV's :(. Fortunately, for the service, we had a good waitress and she was really attentive to our fat kid needs. Would definitely come again!

Reviews.Author: Andre N.
Reviews.Content: The beer selection is amazing. During happy hour, even more amazing. Food is not too bad either but the beer will keep me coming back. I had the something-long-dunnowhatitscalledbutendedwith- Dunkel. Great beer and goes down easy. Not too hoppy but still had good flavor. I also tried the chicken nachos and the calimari. Calimari will always be calimari but the nachos were good especially since they give you a lot. Service is great as well and always on point. Must be a bitch when it gets really crowded. I definitely need to catch a game here.

Reviews.Author: Brice H.
Reviews.Content: If this place were located anywhere but Santa Row, it would probably be out of business by now.I have been here several times, and constantly find the food to be average at best.  I've had the ahi tuna burger, spicy jambalaya, multiple appetizers, fish tacos, and I always find myself thinking "how the heck do they charge so much for such ordinary food?"If you are a big beer drinker, I could understand liking this place a lot, but even then I would much rather find a true brew pub or another place with a large selection, so you don't have to wait HOURS just to get a table.I would give this place 2 stars based on the food quality/price/wait times, BUT the saving grace is that the servers here are always top notch!  Truth be told it's probably because there is so much money that comes through this place that if they get the right customer they can probably make a killer tip, but even just a broke grad student like myself has received absolutely amazing customer service every time I have come here.In the grand scheme of things I would much rather go across the street to The Cheesecake Factory at Westfield instead of coming to this place.  The last few times I've been to the Yard House it's been on a law school professor's dime, and I'll never say no to free food, but I'll also never spend a dime of my own money on this place, just not worth it IMO.

Reviews.Author: T Lee S.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had took a day off together.  We didn't have the kids and were in the Santana Row area.  We thought, Yard House.  It' always packed when we try to come in the evening, so we decided to take advantage of this time alone and enjoy a good meal with good service.  We arrived at this restaurant and about 11:30am.  They open at 11:00.  When my husband and I arrived through the door, there were 4 employees at the host table.  We were greeted a "hello."  But were not helped, we just stood there.  The employees were obviously having a conversation and were laughing.  So we just waited for about 4 minutes.  Then they dispersed and 1 person was left at the host table.  She says hello and just stares at us (awkward!).  I tell her, "2 please", "oh 2 okay"  hmmmm - I guess she forgot what her job was?  We were seated and a young man came to take our drink order.  He allowed us plenty of time to look over the menu.  Then he came back and asked us for our order.  The next table had a young lady server and she had this whole greeting with the specials, their drinks, the soup, etc.  Oh my- we were impressed!  But we didn't receive that greeting from our own server.  That was disappointing.  Our server was always missing in action.  From where we were seated, we can see the kitchen.  That's where our server was.  He wasn't waiting for the food, wasn't picking up food, nor doing back preparation duties....He was chit-chatting.  We ordered 2 fish entrees that were about $25 each.  They tasted delicious, but not worth the price for a LUNCH!  Way over priced!  To sum it up, not good customer service, not good waiter service, too much free time for the employees, too much socializing for the employees, unprofessional, and over priced food.  For being in Santana Row, I expected better service all around.  This is a restaurant that we will be avoiding in the future.  We'll visit others in area, I'm sure they will live up to their reputation of being in "Santana Row".

Reviews.Author: Mark R.
Reviews.Content: Held back on my review for a couple reasons. My first visit with my homie, we had a really, really, like really cute waitress that happened to be really friendly and helpful so I was ready to give them a review of 5 STARS, best place EVER, nominate them for best everything. So I came back a couple more times and to make my review less biased. I came around 11 with a friend hoping to catch the last call for alcohol and try a couple new half yards, BUT they stop serving half yards an hour before midnight & the "kitchen" was closed. Basically they close down at 11 and not midnight unlike places like BJ's where as long as you get a seat before midnight they will continue to serve you. On another note, Yard house has a HUGE selection of beers and ciders. It's well priced in my opinion but i'd prefer to come during Happy hour from 3pm- 6pm. This place is in Santana row so expect it to be crowded and parking could be an issue sometimes. The bar is average sized & there are plenty of TVs playing Live sports, NBA, NFL, ESPN, etc. It would be a great place to just grab a beer and watch some sports with the homies. But overall worth the visit & definitely coming back!

Reviews.Author: Danreb V.
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd have some people over for dinner and drinks on my birthday.When I got there, I found out they didn't have happy hour that day, because it was Thursday.No happy hour on Thursday.  You've gotta be kidding me.

Reviews.Author: DeDe K.
Reviews.Content: I have been known to be a regular here. I like sitting at the bar. I like the bartenders. I like watching the various sports on the TVs. I like the beer selections, however I would like to recommend a Belgium beer  (Val Dieu Grand Cru') I'd like them to add to their awesome Tap choices. The food here is really good too. I love the 70's/80's classic music that's blasting too. What I don't like... they close way too early! They pretty much kick you to the curb around 11:45pm. And it's abrupt! All of the sudden lights go very bright, music goes off, and a supervisor in a white shirt comes by and shoulder taps you and tells you it's time to leave. And I'm not even drunk or finished with my drink. I don't usually show up until around 9-10 when they have their late night happy hour. Supposedly they are working on the "curfew" with Santana Row. Make it happen Yard House!

Reviews.Author: Steve C.
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE. I've been to the Yard House (Santana Row) several times, but nothing could have prepared me for the ordeal I experienced over the last few weeks. I went in and had two beers and an appetizer ("Firecracker Chicken") at the bar. The bartender told me is was their policy to use my credit card to open a tab. I told her I intended to pay in cash. She said fine. I finished my beer and snack (excellent), and asked for the check. When she brought the check, I reminded her I was paying in cash (about $35).So far, so good.  About a week later I, got a bill on my credit card statement for $73.54! I went down in person the very next day (Friday afternoon) to clear up the mistake. I waited 20 minutes to talk to a manager. He took my credit card went upstairs to the book-keeper, and returned. He apologized, said it was obviously a mistake ($73 for two beers and appetizer?), the signature on the receipt didn't match mine, and I'd be refunded in full in about 5 working days. Okay, no harm done.About a week later, I'd not gotten the refund, but I did get a call from the general manager who identified himself as "Bobby". He informed me that because he had a signed receipt for the $73.54 there was "nothing he could do" and I'd have to pay up. I reasoned with him that since the bill clearly showed two beers and an appetizer, the bill couldn't be $73.54, and he responded that he assumed the rest was a "tip". WHAT???Eventually, I was able to reach the previous manager, who apologized again, this time for the botched communication, and I did get my refund. But I'm NEVER going back to the Yard House again.

Reviews.Author: Elaine L.
Reviews.Content: unique menu

Reviews.Author: Serggio A.
Reviews.Content: This place is ok. I feel this place is really overhyped. The beer is definitely good. The food is a bit overpriced. I have come into here expecting a lot and was disappointed.On the bright side, the truffle fries and the yard long beer is good. Their macaroni and cheese is excellent as well. I have ordered their lobster pasta and that one is pretty damn good. Their appetizers seem to be better than their main dishes.

Reviews.Author: Finla P.
Reviews.Content: One of those places which you will never be disappointed with. Awesome drinks and even better food. No matter what we ordered, it all tasted so good. Service is commendable. This place gets very crowded in the evenings so it's better to reserve a table in advance. This is that place that I would take my non-Californian friends to just so that they see santana row and experience this awesome eating place.

Reviews.Author: Marlene B.
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Yard House 4 times now.  3 out of the 4 times the hostesses had a superior complex and were just plain rude.  Twice I just left and spent my $$$ elsewhere. Some would say why I would even try it a 4th time because I was just asking for a bad experience, however my friend kept saying he'd been there recently and it was great.So the game was on.  Perfect place to go watch a sporting event, as long as you can get near a tv!  We sat at the bar which was great, didn't have to talk to the host and the bar staff is attentive and friendly!If your a drinker (I'm not) there's 50 types of drinks.  The food is kind of pricy for what you get but they have some interesting dishes you don't really get somewhere else.  Watching the bartender make all the drinks for the tables was kind of interesting... never knew so many people drink that much on a Monday night.Anyway, if you can avoid having to talk to the hostess than I think you'll have a great time.  Otherwise I hope you get someone nice who doesn't act like your putting them out by showing up to this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: G C.
Reviews.Content: Reservations - this is a must. Come for a wide selection of beers with some friends and you'll have a blast. If you're unsure about what to get, talk with your waiter/waitress and get some suggestions - with all the options available, there's something for everyone!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: Yummmmmmmm. Beeeerrrrr. Oh- and there's food too, but not as important as the beers. Food was good, service was decent. Went for lunch and it was a business professional/mellow crowd.

Reviews.Author: Vicky S.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I will not write about waiting times or waitress service. We all know what can happen during rush times. it's just natural not everybody everytime will be seated and served promptly. What counts for me is food.First, I WANT TO SEND A MESSAGE TO THE MANAGEMENT:  I kindly ask you, please, to reduce salt in your onion soup. For God's sake, it's gotten out of control! There is so much salt that it burns your mouth!Now I'd like to share my favorites: Burgers and fries! Gorgonzola beats them all, fries are crispy and thin, the way we like them. I would not recommend truffle fries, they are way too oily! Ahi crunchy salad! Nice raw tuna over citrusy salad bed. Penne with chicken! Simple but hearty meal, with creamy sauce. Lobster garlic noodles and porcini halibut are my favorite in fish items.That said, I don't dare to try new items anymore, after several disapointments. This place either cooks delicious or totally disgussing food. It's your luck that counts!AVOID TACOS!!! What the heck is wrong with your tacos? I tried Korean beef ones. It''s a disgrace. It comes with chewy tortilla rings, chewy and totally  tasteless meat and stomach churning bean sauce. I didn't know that it can get this bad! Disgusting!Avoid BBQ chicken salad , unless you enjoy a soup of corn and cheese in a pint of sauce. I think that will be enough for now. Dispite all the mishaps, I still like Yard House and give them 4 stars!

Reviews.Author: Anuj K.
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming factor for this place is the truffle fries.Yard house was an upscale, humongous, hoity-toity (spelling?) place full of people I couldn't imagine talking to.   Also, a 30 minute wait to seat 2 people around 5 pm in the afternoon?  Already too crowded for me. Maybe i've been out of the Bay Area for too long?  After living in Portland and Seattle I was craving some good beer during my visit to the motherland, and I heard that Yard House had a good selection of beer.  Yes, and no.  An extensive menu of beer, but nothing that really made me excited to have one.  I ended up getting an Amber ale that was a-ok from some local Bay Area brewery, and I think I was disappointed at the selection of locally made beers here (however it has been some time since I was there so my memory may fail me). Bottom line, I miss dive bars with less pretentious people and a more reasonable menu (seriously, their food menu is humungous with foods from everywhere!  It was missing focus and theme).

Reviews.Author: Josephine C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5/5 stars for this place. I would've given this place a 4-star but there were things that made it lowered for reviewing.(1) From the start after I met up with friends at Yard House after school today, it went pretty well. Our server was really attentive, making sure we met our needs. The food and my ginger ale came out pretty quickly, too. Love the fact our server kept saying "Sure." to everything we were ordering while writing down our orders. (4-star right here!) This lasted about 3/4 of the time we were there. (2) About 3/4 of the way when we were almost done with our meal, another server came and asked our guy friend if he wanted refill on his water so he said yes. The waiter didn't ask my other 2 female friends if they wanted refills and their cups were nearly empty, so we had to ask the waiter when he came back. Really? We thought it was odd. Service was a bit slow. (This made me downgrade 0.5 stars...)(3) When our bill came, apparently they made a mistake and charged some stuff on the wrong person. No biggie. Small mistake.However, there were GOOD notes to this place.(1) Ginger Ale is a MUST. lol(2) Chicken garlic noodles was AMAZING. Though, the dish contained LOTS of ingredients.(3) Calamari was good. Reminds me of Quickly's. xDNot bad for a first time here. I'll come back to try their strawberry beer everyone raves about. Apparently, this place wasn't the hype all my friends been mentioning about every time I tell them I've never been here before. Now, I have a story to tell.

Reviews.Author: Jennea R.
Reviews.Content: So as much as I want to give this place a bad review, because the wait was SO LONG, I actually really enjoyed myself here once we were finally seated. I called the day before asking if I could make reservations for dinner for 12 people. They only take lunch reservations. But, they told me to come an hour early than the time I wanted the reservation so I could get in around the time of the original reservation. I got there and hour early, me and my party literally waiting for almost 3 hours all together to get it -___-That's the only downfall to this place, and why I give it 4 stars instead of 5. They really need to figure out a system for taking dinner reservations (especially for bigger parties).ANYWAYS, on to the good things.The food was good, service was on point, and the drinks were really good. You can also taste the different beers for free which is pretty cool.The strawberry beer and I think it was the fruit loops beer were both really yummy! I'll definetly come back here again! When I have a lot of time to spare, since it will probably be a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Tim C.
Reviews.Content: Yard House.  To me it's like BJ's older brother or sister; whichever you prefer. There are plenty of choices for beer and a variety of food ranging from burgers to pastas and sandwiches.  It gets lively during the night and they have a relatively discounted happy hour. This one is roughly the same size as the one in Pasadena, and it is on the corner tip of Santana Row meaning you can hit the clubs after some shots. Be warned, it is pricey but the quality and quantity of food surpasses that of BJ's, TGIF, and Chili's IMHO.

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm in San Jose there's a very good chance I might come by Yard House.  It has one of the best beer selections ever and lots of things to eat while you enjoy your beverage.  Service is spotty, even during downtime.  The place is huge and there never seem to be enough people working to keep up.  I just hope that you're not in a hurry to eat.The portions are extremely generous.  Your plate likely has enough food for two or three people.  Take a look at their spicy tuna 'roll'.  The dish nearly takes up the whole plate.  I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup.  I love when simple things are done well and this dish was one of them.Pro tip:  Come during happy hour when appetizers (meals within themselves) are affordable and many drinks are at a bargain.

Reviews.Author: Yeelo N.
Reviews.Content: If you're into beer then this is the place for you!  There's almost everything you can think of on tap.  One day, I'll get through the entire  list.  :)Food is pretty good and during happy hour, prices really can't be beat!  So why only 3 stars?  The wait and the help could definitely be better.  They do a table/server rotation where you never know who your main waiter is.  Last couple drinks I ordered took FOREVER to receive and it wasn't even that busy.  Oh well, I do love my beer so I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Valerie L.
Reviews.Content: The selection of beers they have on tap is out of this world. My go-to is the Rogue Hazelnut, but I decided to try the Youngberry Chocolate Stout the other day and it was surprisingly very good. It had a nice tartness from the raspberry frambroise, and left me with a pleasant bitter taste from the chocolate stout. It was a great mix of the 2 beers. Happy Hour appetizers are well worth it. Their truffle fries are amazing, and the garlic noodles are decent, but I'm a huge fan of the onion ring tower. I'll take bad breath anyday to eat these babies!

Reviews.Author: Joy A.
Reviews.Content: Food is good and moderately priced.Went here for lunch on Sunday with a part of 6 and was seated pretty quickly.  The menu is quite extensive so it was difficult to figure out what to order! They do have a gluten-free menu which was good since 2 folks in our party eat gluten free.Yummy:- lobster/artichoke dip (creamy and tasty)- truffle fries (crisp and perfect!)So-so:- margherrita pizza was not crisp enough so was a bit underwhelmed- edamame was fine but nothing specialOther folks ordered the burger, angel hair pasta, chicken salad, and garlic noodles with chicken -- folks seemed to be pleased with their choices.We will definitely need to check out the menu again. From the looks of the other postings, depending on when you go reservations may be key.Service was okay - not great. The waitress did stop by to check in on us but it was a bit spotty. Hostess was friendly. There are TV's everywhere which is great if you are a sports fan. It is quite noisy so not a place for "intimate conversations" - lol.Bathroom - nice and clean but needed the soap to be refreshed!

Reviews.Author: Donna Z.
Reviews.Content: 1200+ reviews and open just over a year? That's impressive, even for a well-known chain.Since you probably know the rundown already (lots of beer! loud! busy! etc...), here are a few things you may still find helpful if you find yourself entering this eatery at the far north side of Santana Row:-Coming in for lunch? Arrive before noon for easy seating (yes, it's popular even at lunch).-Fully avoid around dinner time. Why? Because happy hour exists. -No matter when you're here, order the tomato bisque.Happy Hour & Late NightMonday - Friday 3pm - 6pm Sunday - Wednesday 10pm - CloseDrink Specials:Shortys $2.25 - $4.50Domestic Pints $3.50Craft/Import Pints $4.25 - $5.00Goblets $4.75 - $5.50Half Yards (M-F, 3-6 only) $7.00 - $10.00Well Drinks $4.25 - $4.75House Martinis $6.25Specialty Drinks $2.00 offWine By The Glass $2.00 offPlus: Many 1/2 priced appetizersThe drinks are pleasantly strong, the beer selection is overwhelming, and I've found that the food is mediocre, with the exception of the tomato bisque. It is absolutely delicious. 5 stars for that pot of red gold. If you're after great (chain) food, walk across the street to the Cheesecake Factory. If you want to watch a game with an endless supply of beer, you're in the right place. The "Crafted Cocktail" menu is pretty special too. (Try the French Gimlet.)

Reviews.Author: Chang L.
Reviews.Content: Like every single girl in the world, I don't eat carbs. With the exception of pho. And ramen. And pizza (but only when I'm intoxicated because that's when calories don't count, right? ^_^). And french fries, because potatoes are vegetables anyway :PBut the only pasta dish that I order every single time at Yard House and enjoy with pure joy, is the mac & cheese. s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com…It's every fatty's dream come true, and I'm always too busy stuffing my face with this deliciousness to even consider calories and or carbs or things that  I should think about, but can't because I'm such a fatty. I am not ashamed to declare my love for their mac & cheese, the main contribution to my plumpness. Perfectly al dente pasta, covered in a gooey cheddar and parmesan sauce, with sliced chicken and BACON, it is absolutely amazing. There's a generous sprinkle of wild mushrooms throughout, so I keep eating the whole plate to reach my vegetable quota for the day. And if you like to feel classy and fancy while shoving copious amounts of food into your mouth as I do, the mac & cheese is topped with truffle oil for that perfect touch of elegance. The menu at Yard House is extensive, from the adorable sliders with béarnaise sauce to truffle french fries and a flavorful ahi poke bowl. But after trying a bite here and there, I always return back to my delicious mac & cheese. Trust me, it's worth every bite, every hour you have to wait to get a table, and every mile you have to run the next day ^_^

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: HAPPY HOUR is the best at Yard House! I've only ever gone to Happy hour for their amazing appetizers and truffle fries. If you come right when Happy Hour starts there never much of a wait. But if you come during prime time, prepare to wait 2-3 hours!! Food:The appetizers are out of this world! They are half-off, but huge and delicious. My favorite dishes are...Mushroom Lettuce Wrap - They come with this peanut sauce that you can drizzle onto the wrap and it makes your tastebud dance. Chicken Nachos - This dish takes the pie for the largest appetizer in the place. They add an red sauce that taste like enchilada sauce that makes it so scrumptious. Truffle Fries - Okay. These aren't actually appetizers, but you have to try the at least once! They aren't your average fries. All of their appetizers are pretty good. These were just my favorite. I haven't tried anything that I haven't liked yet. Service:The servers here are always friendly and professional. For the most part, they are usually attentive. Overall:I would definitely recommend trying this place at least once during happy hour. I can't vouch for any other times than happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Linda N.
Reviews.Content: Huge selection of beer and food. Prefer and recommend the pear cider (but only cause I'm not much of a beer drinker). Luckily the 2 times that I came here I didn't have to wait more than 5-10minutes. Happy hour starts at 10pm. The mac& cheese with mushroom and bacon and truffle fries never disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Janet N.
Reviews.Content: I think I have way too many reviews for this place, so I'll keep it short. Girls wanted to drink a little and get our snacking on. To drink: Shorty Rose GaardenFood to share:Tomato BisqueMediterranean Flat BreadTruffle FriesRose Gaarden is a delicious beer blend of Hoegaarden and Lindeman's Framboise, definitely a girly drink with flavors of Raspberry. It's crisp, refreshing, tangy and fruity. The Tomato Bisque is sweet, tart and smooth. Comes with oyster crackers and is definitely comforting. I actually didn't intentionally want the Mediterranean Flat Bread, and wanted the Pear and Gorganzola one instead, but was given this one and it was not bad. The flat bread was topped with roasted tomatoes, olives and eggplant. The Truffle Fries were also crispy and delicious. Truffle Fries are always a hit!Service was okay this time around, but wasn't that great considering it was a full house and the football game was on. Try to get everything you want to order before your server leaves!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: I went to Yard House for the first time yesterday for lunch with my mom. It was really nice on the inside, so modern and pretty. The hostess didn't seem really friendly she just stared and said "how many people." Okay,wait. Um, thanks for the smile.When we got seated our server came and immediately asked us if we wanted anything to drink or if we wanted to order any starters. We decided on the fried clamari as our starter. Thank you god we got a nice server. When he came back with our drinks we were ready to order. My mom got the FIsh &Chips and I got the Garlic Lobster Noodles ( I wanted to see what all the rave was about). Fried Calamari- The fried calamari was pretty good. It wasn't oily at all, and the two dipping sauces they gave you really helped enhance the flavors. We got two different kind of sauces, tarter sauce and I believe mozarella sauce. Either way the calmari tasted good and even better when I dipped it in both the tarter sauce and mozarella sauce. I didn't really notice it was oily until I got to the bottom of the basket, but even when I reached the end there was only a small amount of oil.Fish &Chips- I don't know if my mom really enjoyed the Fish &Chips. While she said it was good she only ate 1/4 of the fishes they gave on the platter. The fries they gave with her fish were out of this world  they gave her a lot of fries and I kept picking off her plate because it was so good. Okay,back to the FIsh.. I got to taste the fish and I thought while the fish was good, the batter on the out side was to thick. I would really prefer it with less of the batter.Garlic Lobster Noodles- I wanted to see what all the rave about these garlic lobster noodles were about. This plate was pretty good, I don't know if its good to a point where I would get it again, but it was pretty good. I loved the shrimp and the lobster on this plate. My personal perference of the noodles were that they were seasoned why to much. My mom really really really liked my dish, I couldn't finish it after eating only half and she finished it for me. She liked my lobster noodles, she said it was different and good.My first experience at Yard House was fairly good, I would totally come back and give it another try. If you didn't notice by now my mom and I got the calamari, fish and chips, and lobster garlic noodles, all of those dishes were seafood. :) Next time when I come, I'll be sure to try pasta, burgers, crab cakes, and anything else that catches my eye.NOTE: My mom and I came in at around 12:30 and there wasn't a wait. When we were finish with our meal around 130, as we were walking out there were about 20 people waiting. NOTE: If you don't want to wait on a SUNDAY afternoon come before 1230ish.

Reviews.Author: Danny L.
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for having a variety of beer's and food selection to always satisfied my cravings. The wait here is usually pretty long, average around 30 minutes - an hour (well, for everytime that i go).It's a really nice place to social network, grab couple drinks to catch up with a friend, or maybe even a small date! The environment and atompshere is a little loud, but not that bad if your having a good food and beer.I would really recommend to try the truffle fries and ahi poke salad for appetizer, very good.  Also, my favorite beer is the Timmerman Strawberry & Snakebite, the beer isn't bitter and it's very smooth!

Reviews.Author: Able H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The wait was ridiculously long, but only because we didn't realize you can't call in a 12-person party (lol). I ordered a Poke Bowl and Spicy Tuna Roll. I've had Poke bowls before, and I have to say that while the sashimi was fresh, it couldn't quite compare to the ones I had at other restaurants...but that's understandable. The Spicy Tuna Roll, on the other hand, was quite amazing. This is the first time I've ever had tuna with edamame, and the combo was perfect! I would definitely recommend it. It's worth the price tag. My only comment would be that the wasabi/soy sauce was slightly salty for my taste buds. But definitely not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Author: Patricia G.
Reviews.Content: Get here EARLY!Party of 4 adults and 2 children under 5... big booth by the window!Lobster garlic noodles was a hit at our table.  Steak was delish and so was the potatoes that came with it.  I had the soup and BBQ chicken pizza... it was "ok"Lots of televisions but am sure that the place gets pretty crazy for game days...

Reviews.Author: Mindy J.
Reviews.Content: I know, I'm late to the party. But every time I thought, "Oh, let's check out Yard House!" there was a ridiculous line or crowd outside that I wasn't willing to wait for. Several Saturdays ago in September (yes, I'm late to the review, too!) around 4p the stars aligned - No crowds + hot weather = yes beer. Snagged 2 seats at the bar. -5 stars for the service. The guy behind the bar (I wish I could recall his name) was fantastic.-5 stars for the beer selection. -5 stars for the ambience (I've heard from friends who go during prime time that it can get loud but I went early and didn't experience this.)-4 stars for the prices - a bit on the higher side but then again, it is SR. -2 stars for the food - got the coconut Shrimp. $13 gets you just 3 shrimp, and they were burnt and not tasty at all. Will go back and try something else tho!

Reviews.Author: Cat N.
Reviews.Content: It's weird that the crowds still haven't died down for this place. Expect a 30 - 45 minute wait for a table, and according to the hostesses, the buzzers only work inside the building or immediately outside the door, so you can't walk around the nearby shops to kill time.The happy hour food and drink specials are well worth the wait though. The appetizers - especially the sliders and pizza - are basically full size entrees. The vegetarian stuff is surprisingly good! Our server was really nice even though he was slammed, and even let me sample a couple of the beers when I wasn't sure what to order.

Reviews.Author: Kevin T.
Reviews.Content: I am the king of chains, and this chain has always been a favorite of mine. The reason I like this place is1. Great beer selection2. food is not bad and good veggie selectionThe negatives on this place are in the following order1. Overpriced2. Everyone who goes here is 22 and looks like they need a job3. They still card me even though I'm balding4. Long linesI feel the first 2 overcome the last 4, but that's just me.

Reviews.Author: Robert L.
Reviews.Content: As if Yard House didn't need another review, but 3 1/2 stars is about right.  Unfortunately, I can't give half stars so I rounded up.I have been here many times: when it's crowded, empty, happy hour, late night, Sunday football, etc.  You're here for two things: the beer and the scene.Food: GoodThe food isn't excellent, but it isn't bad.  My favorite is the Mac and Cheese with bacon, truffle oil, and mushrooms.  The presentation and quality is consistent and it's good.  You also can't go wrong with their sweet potato fries, truffle fries, onion rings, and firecracker chicken wings. Beer: ExcellentThe selection is awesome and offers a a number of beers.  If you like a stronger maibock ale, I recommend the Rogue Dead Guy brewed out of Oregon.  It's malty, with a bit of hops, and smooth.Service: Pretty GoodMost of the waiters and waitresses are attentive and friendly.  Every once in awhile you do have someone that isn't, but they don't seem to stick around very long and you're not likely to get them again.  Atmosphere: Yard House has got a loungy, sports bar vibe with TV's everywhere.  It's casual, but you'll see all types of people there.  Because it's the only Yard House in Northern California, the place is pretty popular and crowded on most occasions with waits as long as 1.5 to 2 hours.  It also doesn't help that it's located at the entrance of the trendy and high end shopping/living destination known as Santana Row.  And because San Jose lacks a definitive sports bar, this place has taken it's place as not only a place to watch sports, but to be and be seen.  With that said, you'll run into different types of people.  You'll have to see for yourself.So, the question is, is it worth the wait?  No.  I wouldn't wait longer than 30-45 minutes.  If you go on the weekend or Thursday, Friday evening, call ahead and see what the wait is like.  If it's somewhat long, ask to be put on their wait list.  Get there early when there are sporting events.  Don't go when it's a major sporting event.  I tried to go for a San Francisco Giants World Series game and the place was packed 2 hours before the game.For some, the wait and atmosphere is enough to give this place 1-3 stars.  But, I'm a fan of this place and I'll continue going.  Just  be prepared to change plans if there's a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Kan P.
Reviews.Content: My new favorite spot. Went here Friday night. Crowded as always! Dim lit and nice ambiance! The staff were super nice and helpful. Delicious food! Really great Vegetarian Choices: Truffle Fries - a must try!Stiitake Garlic Noodles - loved it!Their entire GARDEIN™ menu is exceptionally flavorful! So why only 3 stars?Well, its because of their lack of no smoking policy for the front of their restaurant. I don't want my clothes smelling like cheap cigarette smoke and I simply don't want to be bombarded with smoke clouds when I'm entering and exiting the doors. Come on Yard House, you could manage and place your smokers to a designated smoking area either in the side or the back!

Reviews.Author: Summer C.
Reviews.Content: Yes.  It's awesome cuz it's got a huge beer selection.Service is pretty bad and the food itself is just okay.  The wait is always too crazy for me while the noise level makes it impossible to hear the person next to you unless he/she is slightly yelling.It's a good place to hang and socialize if you want to have a fun time (I guess much like many other places in Santa Row on the weekends) with old friends.  But if you want to get to know someone better by having a nice dinner plus good conversation, this is not the place.

Reviews.Author: Heather W.
Reviews.Content: The Yard House isn't really my usual type of restaurant I like to go to. It's loud, full of men watching sports on their many tvs and just too crowded. This time around, although it was loud it wasn't super busy. We were smart and called ahead for a table so we didn't have to wait as long. Our appetizers were the chicken nachos and onion rings. Both were very good and very big portions. For my entree I tried the orange chicken with brown rice, CL had the fish n chips, Soso had the steak salad and Young had the pizza. I liked my orange chicken. I could tell it was made from scratch. CL's fish n chips were fried to perfection. Soso's salad looked okay. I tried Young's pizza and it's the only entree I did not care for. Service was decent. Will probably be back to try some other dishes.

Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: Was feeling a wee-bit down so I asked my friend for some company. Came here on a Sunday night around 8, and it was PACKED once again. The wait was 15 minutes which wasn't too bad. My friend and I were seated at a table near the bar (we wanted a booth). 5 minutes into looking through the menu, a manager comes up to us and asks if we'd move to a booth and that they'll gladly give us a round of drinks and an appetizer on the house. Seriously? HELL YEAH!We ordered a couple round of drinks. I got the chicken nachos while my friend opted for one of the pizzas (I don't quite remember which). The nachos were AMAZING! Definitely a must try. So good with that Irish Stout (I'm a sucker for dark beer). Service was on point this time around and he came to check on us every 15-20 minutes.After an awesome meal with good company, the check came out, and to our surprise the whole checked was paid for! Honestly, was not expecting that at all! Thank you dear manager for pulling such a sweet deed! You most certainly turned my frown, upside down! I am forever grateful JFor this particular experience... 5 star WA-POW!!!

Reviews.Author: Belinda T.
