Reviews.Content: I've been to yardhouse a couple of times now (in socal and up here), sometimes just for lunch.. sometimes for a birthday gathering of some sorts, and sometimes just to hang out at the bar area.If you can ever make it here for happy hour that's the best bang for your buck.  You get pretty much the same portion size of food for much cheaper.  WHAT A STEAL, and if you're a drinker well the booze prices aren't bad either.So, I've come to realize my favorite lunch is.... the lunch combo (ok, ok, so i didn't actually pick one thing), but that's the perk of the lunch combo, you have your choice of sandwiches or pizzas paired with a variety of salads or soups for under 10 bucks.  You also have an option to add fries or upgrade for truffle fries.  The Fries come out in a bowl and is plenty for 2 or more people especially if you are planning on eating the whole meal.I've been pleasantly surprised by their soups.  The Clam Chowder is the right consistency of not being overwhelmed with all clams or fillers like vegetables.  It is the right thickness with an even ratio of clams and vegetables, and a side of oyster crackers (why do they even call them oyster crackers?).  Today I had the opportunity to try the tomato bisque, I'm not usually a fan of just plain tomato soup, but the tomato bisque was delicious, especially for a chilly day!  It's quite simple, and topped with 2 basil leaves, but it hit the spot.The margherita pizza was alright.  Warm, the toppings were hard to keep on it, and it really just tasted like i was eating salty bread.  I didn't finish the pizza but brought it home as leftovers.. I discovered a few hours later.. it actually tastes better cold/room temperature.. for some reason more of the flavor came out.The truffle fries are worth the upgrade.  After eating some of the truffle fries I stole a regular fry or two from my friend and it tasted really bland in comparison.  I would definitely go with the upgrade.They have plenty of Beers and specialized drinks on the menu... chances are whatever you want it's on.  They have a great selection of "girlly beers" as well.  My favorite is the selection of ciders :)This is a nice place to come to, but be warned it's a "popping place"  if you come later in the day there will most likely be a wait.

Reviews.Author: Shirley D.
Reviews.Content: I am a fan because this is my favorite happy hour spot! First, i would like to add that I am a beer girl, and i love experimenting new beers in fun environments just like yardhouse. I went here 3 times a week once during happy hour because I was addicted to their Samual Adams Cherry Wheat beer and their truffle fries. I've been meaning to try the happy hour down at straits, but could never get myself to go there when theres a vast amount of beer offered at yardhouse. Wouldn't hurt to try it during happy hour, the appetizers are great for half price! Truffle fries, hawaiian poke stack, and spicy tuna roll are one of my favorites.

Reviews.Author: Sue L.
Reviews.Content: I love my Belgian Beer! Food is great and always happening. I love the TV's and the 100s of tap beer they have. I would recommend this place over any other sports bar.

Reviews.Author: Lucy L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here quite a few times. I love this place for the Beer! I know most girls do not like beer but I DO! I tend to go with the wheat beers.If you dont, there is a "beer" to try that is sweet. Forgot the exact name but its the Lambic Rasberry Framboise. (with or without ice cream). It is sweet and you really wont taste anything bitter or alcoholic. The food here is OK. Truffle fries are my favorite! I'd say its more worth it to come here during happy hour (for food). Also, there isn't a 1-2 hour wait. Too bad I could only come here during night time when it is packed :(

Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: This place seems ok.  They have a good selection of beers, but to be honest, nothing on the list seemed extremely remarkable.  Just a lot of 'signature' beers, not many experimental beers.  Though they did have some interesting choices on their Chalkboard, I find more unique beers at a place like Smokeeaters.Food was ok, but even at Happy Hour, seemed kind of expensive for what you get.Service was nice, nothing remarkable.I kinda get why people come to this place.  It's an average person's 'beer' place.  It's like when someone goes for a Blue Moon when they get a 'craft' beer.  I get it.  It seems fun.  But I probably wouldn't be back, and I just came during late night Happy Hour.  No way I'd wait in line for this place, like many others have.

Reviews.Author: Lorie N.
Reviews.Content: Because of the gracious customer service team here at the Yard House, I was invited back to the restaurant and given a $35 gift card to use.  Let's just say that redemption is sweet.  I called in about 40 minutes before I knew we were to arrive and the hostess took my name down for 6pm.  When I got there, I was seated almost instantly and directed to a booth which I personally had requested.The server arrived shortly after I was seated and promptly got me some waters.  Since the rest of my party hadn't arrived, Krista had no problem letting me take my time pouring over the menu.  Since I've been watching my calorie intake, it was huge plus to see the "U" next to items on the menu that were under 600 calories.  I really wanted to order the Porcini Crusted Halibut, but guess what folks-- that plate alone is 1262 calories.  After my eyes nearly popped out of my head, I saw that the Mediterranean Seared Scallops had the "U" next to it.  Score.. That was going to be my order.  Krista (our server) came back to our table as soon as she saw the rest of the party arrive.  She then introduced us to Rex who was going to be our server for the rest of our meal.  As soon as I saw my order, I was so hungry that I was dying to dig in.  But I'm going to have to be honest here.  I wasn't completely excited that I ordered from the under 600 calories portion of the menu.  I'm still trying to convince myself that eating healthy can taste just as good as eating truffle fries or a deep dish pizza.  Can you imagine my surprise when I cleaned up my whole plate and loved every single bite?  The scallops were perfectly seared atop a bed of hummus that worked so well together.  The brown rice sun-dried tomato tabouleh with cilantro was so yummy that I could have easily had another serving.  And Rex was just great.  Attentive, but not overly so.  And most importantly, my water was always filled.

Reviews.Author: Linda A.
Reviews.Content: I love the atmosphere at the Yard House! I love the gigantic bar area with seats wrapping all the way around! I love how loud the crowd and staff gets during a sports game!I love the dim lights and cleanliness of this place!I love all their beer selection!I love how knowledgeable some bartenders are about what they serve!I dislike the wait during peak hours for a table. I dislike them overpricing everything! But hey! It is Santana Row after all. And the food is not bad either. Not the best, but not bad. The crab, lobster dip is a must try!Don't try the nachos if you like nacho cheese, they use shredded cheese and it gets all hard. I hate that!  -___-

Reviews.Author: Stella S.
Reviews.Content: Went here for Mother's Day and since they don't accept reservations (for parties less than 10) I called in to see if there was a wait. The gentleman on the phone said they have no wait at all. 10 mins later, we arrived at the place and from a distance I can already see there's a few families waiting outside for a table. I thought, wth...get your facts straight!After we were seated and got our orders, the food was delicious. I got a half order of Jambalaya; it was soooo good that I could have probably polished off the full order. LOL but I wanted room for dessert. Hubby got a 2 plate taco plus 1 additional taco a-la-carte. I didn't taste his food but he liked it except for the rice, which looked kind of old. Kids had the mac-n-cheese and fish & chips. They were wiped clean! I chose the Kona coffee sundae...man oh man, this was worth the calories! Super good, we all ate it in less than 5 minutes! The peach cobbler was good too...if you like cobblers but it wasn't as great as my sundae!Our servers were attentive and did a great job on follow-up and suggestions. Why 4 stars? Well, their hosts could be friendlier, the ladies like to chit-chat with one another; and since they gave me wrong info on the wait, I had to knock a star.

Reviews.Author: Suniti C.
Reviews.Content: I remember hearing about this place from my So Cal friends who always bragged about going to the Yard House for beer. When they opened it at Santana Row, I finally got to try it out. The beer selection is awesome! My favorite beer Weiheinstepher. Love their half yard! Food is great. Avocado spring roll is delicious!  This place is great for happy hours and watch a game. It gets way too crowded during happy hour so you may want to get there early to get a table. Good service and good ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Katherine C.
Reviews.Content: I love the variety of beers they have. We went during the NBA semi-finals when OKC was playing whatever team that lost that day. The place was so packed. We had to wait around 30-40 minutes before we were seated, and we had to wait for our entire party to be there to be seated.Only food I tried was truffle fries, which were really good. Variety of beers that we had:House Honey BlondeSea Dog Bluepaw Wild BlueberryShocktop RaspberryAnd several others that I can't remember the names of. They were all really good, and I love beer so I really enjoyed it. If you're a beer person, definitely check out their happy hour. The whole atmosphere is fun and laid back. Our waitress was extremely helpful and good with suggestions.

Reviews.Author: Anna H.
Reviews.Content: Celebrate at Yardhouse during happy hour after my finals? COUNT ME IN!I've always loved Yardhouses happy hour menu just because it's good food for cheap. Around 10pm, my friends and I met up at Santana Row to start heading over. Since it was too busy, we were able to get a table for 4 without any trouble.Our server quickly helped us out with our drink orders and I decided to get a Hawaiian Sunset martini since it was on the happy hour menu. Soon after our drink orders were place, we went ahead and ordered our food. Since I was craving seafood, I got the Poke Stack along with the chicken garlic noodles with no mushrooms. While my other friends got gardein pizza, barbeque chicken pizza, pear gorgonzola flatbread and chips with guacamole. While our food was in the process of being made, our drink orders came out. I was excited to have my drink since it looked so yummy. The Hawaiian Sunset was a drink that consisted of Cherry skyy vodka, pineapple malibu rum, dekuyper island punch and razzmatazz. This literally is the best mixed I've ever had! It straight up taste like candy and the alcohol taste is so subtle (I hate the taste of most alcohol). The HS drink will also leave you a little buzzed too, at least for me lol. 10 minutes after, our food finally arrived! I was so excited to eat since finals were over and that I haven't eaten all day. Anyways, I was super excited to eat the poke since I've been craving it for weeks! After the first bite of my poke stack, I realized I was going to hate the entire thing. For some reason, each bite was super bitter compared to the last time I got it. I think it's because of the daikon (which I clearly don't remember it being it there.) I'm pretty sure they switched out the bean sprouts for daikon recently. Though, the ahi tuna was fresh tasting, the daikon in there just ruined the entire dish for me. As for the chicken garlic noodles, it never failed to satisfy me! The noodles were cooked on point and had a nice buttery texture to it. The edamame added a nice chewy crunch to it and the chicken was yummy as usual. Though all my friends and I got our own plates to eat, my friend Lucy gave me one of her pear gorgonzola flatbreads to try. The physical look of the flatbread kind of reminded me of Pizza Antica's pear pizza that they have on the menu. Sadly, it didn't measure up. The bread had a weird texture to it, the pear wasn't sweet and the entire flatbread was just bland. Bummer that the food didn't taste too well this time but I'll probably comeback and avoid certain items on the menu or take out certain ingredients. Other than that, I'll be back!PS: Definitely order the Hawaiian Sunset! It's a great girly drink! :)

Reviews.Author: Mitzy M.
Reviews.Content: 45 minute wait on a Wednesday night? YikesI do like this place though when I can quickly get a table. Their happy hour is an amazing, pizza deals?! yes please. If you can find a time where it's not super busy I would definitely recommend going, but it's not worth the long wait. I do love Santana Row in general so on a day with nice weather it's a good day to wander down the street while you are waiting.

Reviews.Author: Richard S.
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible. They told my friend that she could set up a reservation and when she called again, they said they didn't take any but they would be happy to sit us down. When we got there, it took them over an hour to sit up down and another hour to get our food.After we got our food, when we ate, the food wasn't even that great. I've had better food at fast food joints. And the fact that I had to pay 16 dollars for their food kinda pissed me off since it was pretty mediocre. Never coming here again.

Reviews.Author: Kiet D.
Reviews.Content: I want to really like this place, but the times that I have come here, it was very difficult to get a beer at the bar. I don't know if they need to more bartenders, but it can take up to 20+ minutes to get someone's attention (during peak hours) even if I'm standing right at the bar.The food menu is definitely substantial, but I don't feel Yard House excels in any one dish. The lobster noodles are definitely good, but it's been inconsistent in quality (e.g., there were a couple times where the noodles were just way too salty). Also, the time it takes to receive your food varies greatly (e.g., I've had to ask the waiter on when the food was going to arrive after waiting 30+ minutes).In summary, this is a trendy place to get a beer and watch sports. The food is adequate and the atmosphere is lively. I would come here again, but I feel there are better options at Santana Row...

Reviews.Author: Kavita B.
Reviews.Content: Great selections of foods. My first time there the food wasn't that great but this time around I was impressed. Their truffle fries are favorites amongst adults and kids. I had their Ahi Poke Salad, scrumptious! I'll definitely go back to try something new.

Reviews.Author: Katherine B.
Reviews.Content: Everything about the visit was horrible! food, service, over-payment, follow-upI have been trying to get the refund that was from my visit on 6/02/2013, it is now been a month and I have had over 10 conversations with the general manager, who has promised me a call back for follow up and doesn't fall through on his promises.   It's been exactly 1 month today and I would like to be done with this.  They do not following through, so besides a bad dining experience,and over-charge I can now add that the follow through of top management has been awful as well - I can say that my experience has been a complete package of disappointment! Server didn't bring out drinks, and even when we asked again he forgot.  Didn't even bring water until we received our food. Charged us for the drinks we didn't receive and now am trying to get a refund for them, didn't give us the c/c copy back.  When  I called to speak to  a manager, I was placed on hold for 20 minutes, another time I was hung up on.  Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone or if you go,  double check your bill and pay cash.

Reviews.Author: Joe T.
Reviews.Content: Reasonable food, a bit pricey, very popular, and very loud.That's what you need to know.I had a crab cake appetizer for $12 or so.  It consisted of two small cakes - small enough that I was tempted to pull a Clara Peller and ask, "Where's the crab?".    However, the Vodka Seafood Pasta was excellent.Don't expect to hold a conversation in this place.  I found myself yelling across the table to be heard.

Reviews.Author: Jason W.
Reviews.Content: friends and i usually come here to specifically have a drink or two. this place is always packed especially during primetime hours. Its got a pretty nice atmosphere and big enough for a good size capacity. we dont come here for the food but for a place to just chill. The bar is always crowded and if all the seats are taken, we'd stand there monitoring everyone and wait for someone leave. similiar to something youd see in small parking lot with cars waiting for the next one to leave.like how they serve beer with the option of this big a** glass. Pretty cool--it gives you this feeling where you just won a championship or something cus that thing looks like a trophy---hoisting it. Defintely gives you some swag points. All in all, i would come here if u just want to be with the hipster crowd. cool place to bring a date too only if you get a table.

Reviews.Author: Marielle W.
Reviews.Content: I enjoy Yard House. I live down the street and have been here more times than I can count. It's a large space with an open feel and a more casual vibe than most of the other restaurants on Santana Row. I prefer to sit at the bar, which has quite a few seats but tends to fill up quickly during peak hours. The service can lag a bit when the place is packed, but the enormous beer selection more than makes up for it. The staff has generally been knowledgeable about the beers and ready to make recommendations when I have eaten here as well. Ask for the "fruity pebbles" beer! They also have quite a few specialty cocktails and a "skinny" cocktail section for those of us on halfhearted diets.The food is decent. If you stick with the basics you probably won't be disappointed. I've enjoyed the burgers, sandwiches, soups and fries, but didn't particularly like the calamari and found the California roll kind of bizarre. Instead of a traditional sushi roll, the California roll comes as a big rice cake that you need to eat with a knife and fork. It tastes more or less like a typical California roll, but the presentation is strange and a bit off putting. I definitely recommend a visit to Yard House for the beer selection alone. If you can come early during Happy Hour (Mon-Fri from 3PM-6PM or Sun-Wed after 10PM) and grab a seat at the bar, do it!

Reviews.Author: Marissa C.
Reviews.Content: SERVICE WAS THE WORSE.So this would have been the 3rd time coming here. First time, bartenders were alright, second time had lunch and service was so-so, but this time...aweful.We had a group of 6 people and we waited for about 45 minutes for a table which was cool because it's understandable how busy the place was. What was NOT acceptable was the fact our server came by and after taking our meal orders, she asks if we wanted dessert because the kitchen is closing. We say no, and barely 5-10 minutes later, another table of 6 get sat a table away from us. Okay...so how are they going to order their food if THE KITCHEN IS CLOSING?! Not only was it barely 11pm, but it was straight up obvious our server wanted to go home early. Originally I had ordered the chicken wings, but apparently, they ran out that night -_-So I decided to go with the street taco plate. Key word: PLATE. And funny too that my friend and I both ordered a plate, pointed at the plate section, yet our server somehow only ordered us ONE taco each. We asked her doesn't it come with 2 tacos, rice, and beans?? And she goes, "ohhhh you wanted the plate? i'm sorry let me tell the kitchen to make the rest." YES WE WANTED THE PLATE, thats why we pointed at the plate section! Maybe you could've specified with us at the time of ordering whether we wanted the plate or a la carte...After sitting there for awhile since I finished my first taco, my second taco came out. After I finished that one, I waited some more and then finally my rice and beans came out. I don't understand why they just couldnt bring the second taco all on one plate with the rice and beans. Not only that but the beans had CHEESE all over the top when I had told our server I AM ALLERGIC TO DAIRY and she even wrote it down on her note pad. SMH...Seriously though, I used to be a server and so I understand how it is, but wow, I really did not know what was going on in her head! The only pleasant experience here was trying the Raspberry Cider. Other than that, I think i'll pass on this place...

Reviews.Author: Luke G.
Reviews.Content: I've been back three more times!  This place is phenomenal.  I have had excellent service three of four times by Nate, a very knowledgeable and courteous server.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca S.
Reviews.Content: I'm utterly embarrassed to say that last night was my first time visiting Yard House (yes, I know, they're everywhere!). I tend to shy away from chain restaurants, but I must say, this location/particular chain really blew me away. I was impressed with everything from the industrial-like decor to the tasty dishes, and the decent wine pours. Service was excellent as well! Not at all what I was expecting! We came in probably about 9pm on a Tuesday and the place was definitely bustling (granted this is Santana Row), however we were seated promptly at a nice comfy booth. Waitress took our drink and food orders, which all came out relatively quickly. We primarily stuck to simple appetizers including the calamari and the truffle fries, both of which were delicious. Highly recommend the fries - SO good! I could barely keep from shoveling them in my mouth (ummm drunchies, much?) Another thing that I was seriously impressed with was the sheer size of the menu. I mean, my god, the first 3 pages were just beers! It was almost overwhelming, especially because literally, everything on it sounded amazing. Also, with such a diverse menu (everything from pizza and wings to Asian fusion) - I can't imagine anyone in your party would have difficulty finding something to suit their taste. With that being said, Yard House is GREAT for GROUPS! Prices are set right at the cusp of pushing the slightly pricy level, but are ok to where you'll feel ok ordering. Props to them, as they can just barely get away with charging $8 for some yummy sounding craft beers. Lastly, thank goodness they have happy hour, and I love that it starts up again at 10. Definitely makes it difficult to go home when you know that beer you just had will be a few bucks cheaper in 20 mins... go a head, have one more!

Reviews.Author: Verik K.
Reviews.Content: I came back here with my girlfriend for our two year anniversary as we came here for our very first.  I like this place but the downside is that its very loud.  When we got there we ordered happy hour foods; we ordered mac and cheese, calamari, sliders, fries and the ahi dish. Of course we couldn't finish it and we took it home. But I love the food here; it's really tasty and great for just munching.  I would recommend coming here especially for their mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese plate has chicken, mushrooms, crunchy bread crumbs and you can taste the truffle oil they use. Also their truffle fries are to die for. I would recommend coming to this place early as the wait for a table can get very long especially during happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Phillip L.
Reviews.Content: I once came here 5 times in a span of 7 days. At one point, it was literally 12 hours separating when I left to when I came again. I love the beer selection here. You can't really top it, especially at happy hour (M-F 3pm-6pm, Su-W 10pm - close) with the half off appetizers and pizzas. I would say if you enjoyed cocktails, don't expect much. It's the standard fare, and most of them taste like juice with a little kick (basically Mike's Hard at four times the price). The beers are a whole nother planet. I love the Tanilla (kick-ass porter), Dead Dog (excellent malt), plus their pear cider is pretty damn good. If you come here, do NOT order something you can get at Safeway.I'd have to say I don't really like the atmosphere there. It's loud as hell (you pretty much have to yell to talk to your friends), and they keep it pretty darn dim. But I guess when you have 400 people tanked with some pretty damn good beer it's bound to get loud. Seating can take anywhere from 30 minutes to 2 hours on most nights. If you come during the afternoon happy hour, there's no real wait, and it's the noise ambiance is low enough that you can carry conversation normally. However, 7pm and on a crowd comes out, even on the random weekdays you might have to wait 30-45 minutes to get a table.This place is best enjoyed with friends.

Reviews.Author: Denise V.
Reviews.Content: Given that my review on Yelp and via their website has made it's way to their Corporate offices, I will have to write a new review once I re-visit their Santana Row location in the coming weeks...They seemed genuinely interested in my experience at the restaurant and have tried to entice me to re-visit and re-try their menu...Update to come...

Reviews.Author: Manoj T.
Reviews.Content: Over-hyped!  Prices are good, food is okay - some items like asian fusion stir-fry and burgers etc seemed okay... if you go off script then don't expect awesome, but just average stuff.  Presentation is great.  Music is too loud (feels like you are in a club or at the concert) and conversation can be difficult.  TV's every where playing games so you can sit and watch (but dont expect to hear anything with the loud music making you deaf.)Great variety of beers.

Reviews.Author: nastasha s.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great atmosphere and a fun place. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the $40.00 dollar steak we ordered was hardly worth 20. And the Mac and Cheese (the large size) was appetizer sized (16.00) and the ceviche snack had THREE chips. =[. Despite the portion sizes the half-yard beers are great, so many choices! We sat by the bar and it was great, occasionally someone abnormaly tall would stand right in front of you and block you from seeing the tv's, but for the most part they would leave once they realize.Our server, Maggie was great. She checked back often and was super helpful and enthusiastic. She explained everything well and did not rush us to order or leave after we were finished eating. AND THE BEST PART, my boyfriend somehow secretly told her it was my birthday and she hooked it up with a nice little brownie/cupcake/ice cream with a candle. Super sweet of her. If our server was not so great I don't think I would've rated them as highly, because frankly they are slightly over-priced and you are paying for the location and the atmosphere. Congrats yardhouse on having such a great employee! Thanks Maggie!!

Reviews.Author: Diana C.
Reviews.Content: Came back for more but this time a little disappointed. The positives include that the management quickly sat us down (table of 4 plus 2 kids) while other parties of 2-3 were told there was a 30 minute wait. The negative - I tried the grilled artichoke and it tasted overdone..... Not a fan. Also after viewing all those Mac and cheese pics I decided to order it. I got the smaller order which is a very decent portion size- so happy I didn't get the larger version.  I was a touch disappointed I couldn't really taste the truffle oil come through. Also it was under seasoned. I would still give it a try though because it still remains crying baby and kid friendly.

Reviews.Author: Rita L.
Reviews.Content: We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table even though we saw that there were several tables available. Aside from that, the food was pretty solid. I enjoyed the lobster and crab dip, and noticed there was a good amount of crab in it (but couldn't really discern which parts were lobster). The truffle fries are always a good choice, and the lettuce wraps were ok. I loved the Sea Dog blueberry beer. Service was a little on the slow side, but I guess it was pretty busy.

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
Reviews.Content: Very good food clean restaurant fast service great waiters and amazing truffle fries! But bathroom was dirty as a mofo!! No toilet paper, sinks were dirty and very uncomfortable to use, no clue why they would make a sink where you have to bend over about a foot and a half to use.  Both the garbages were literally over flowing I didn't know if I was grabbing a new napkin or one from the garbage which kind of disgusted me. I was there for about an hour and a half, went to the bathroom before I was seated and after we were done to wash my hands. Looked even worse the second time I went. No clue why no one cleans it for a high class restaurant like this.

Reviews.Author: Mona W.
Reviews.Content: With a huge bar area, ample open spaces, good happy hour and a very diverse menu, this new comer fit into the Santana Row dining and bar scene seamlessly. Open for merely over a year and Yard House had already risen up to one of the more popular spots. It does have has a lot to offer for beer lovers. They have a huge selection of beer on tap. It is a great place for small groups to grab drinks and hang out. Unfortunately, like any other restaurants in Santana Row, Yard House is often very crowded. A two hour wait on weekend is nothing unusual.The wine and cocktails were just so-so. Many of the drinks were made with too much artificial syrup. Food was a major disappointment. I managed to stay away from bad pasta dishes for a long time until I encountered the penne with chicken here. The penne was dry, the chicken was bland and the sauce was too thick and super greasy. Salmon was slightly overcooked. If you must eat here, stick with simple appetizers likes truffle fries and guacamole and chips. The clam chowder was the only thing I found half decent.

Reviews.Author: Rafal Z.
Reviews.Content: Love me some yard house! If you're a vegetarian, you'll love their gardein options.  We absolutely love those gardein Buffalo wings.  We're pretty sure they're laced with crack, but we have no guilt scarfing these wings down.  Actually, you could probably cover up a baby seal with this sauce and I'd still probably eat it.  Oh, and that gardein bbq chicken pizza -- wow.  Combine that madness with some hot wings and an IPA, and you've pretty much won at life.  The service is pretty decent, but one time my to-go order was pretty late.  I didn't make too much fuss, but a guy came out, apologized for the wait, and paid for my entire order.  Whoa, slow down.  My entire order??? Highway robbery.  For a while, I actually felt bad for them.  But then I ate my wings, and completely forgot about these worldly problems.

Reviews.Author: Glenn G.
Reviews.Content: The third time is the charm!There's been lots of buzz about this place since it opened earlier this year, and I've set out to check it out twice.  Both times, the estimated wait time was so long (last time, they said 2 hours!) that I ended up eating elsewhere on Santa Row.This time out, I took a different tack.  A friend and I arrived for dinner at 4:30pm on a Saturday - there was no wait; we were seated right away.  The ambiance is nice - I liked the low-light vibe and the non-trancy music.Our plan was a long hike to properly prepare for what sounded like some quality chow at the Yard House, followed by a flick  - "Moneyball" at CinéArts @ Santana Row.We had a great hike, and were now ready to begin appreciating what the Yard House had to offer.  Time to order beer!  With more than a hundred beers on tap, you can spend quite a while just decided on the beer to suit your current mood, and they'll give you a sample or four to taste if you have trouble making up your mind.  As I'd been hankering for a Fat Tire since mile two of our hike, my choice that night was easy.  yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…Next up, appetizers!  We ordered two to share:1) Onion Ring Tower - beer battered, dusted with parmesan, with chipotle & ranch dipping sauces yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…2) Chicken Nachos - spicy pinto beans, cheddar, jack, red & green sauce, tomato, cilantro, onions, guacamole, sour cream yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…The Onion Rings were by far the best of the two - perfectly battered, golden brown, light, crisp and flavorful!  The Nachos were serviceable, though the chips could have been fresher, and the portion size was on the small side.For our entries, we had:1) Fish & Chips - beer battered haddock with fries, tartar & cocktail sauce yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH… 2) Classic Cheese Burger - lettuce, tomato, red onion, roasted garlic & jack cheese with mushrooms yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH… My Fish & Chips were outstanding!  Golden batter fried to crunchy perfection, with the haddock flaky, tasty, and seasoned just right.  The thin cut "chips" were also cooked just right, and the portion was so huge, it was mountainous!  Even after my seven-mile hike, I couldn't eat them all...I didn't try my friend's burger, but he disappeared it almost as fast as I dispatched my Fish & Chips, with a look of complete satisfaction on his face that indicated no complaints.The only thing to prevent my giving Yard House a five star review was the service.  It was friendly, courteous, and helpful, but almost ponderously slow, even though the restaurant was mostly empty during our meal.To sum it up - The Yard House has fun ambiance, an amazingly diverse beer menu, and pretty good food, though the service is slow.  I'll definitely be back to check this place out again.Note to management: Strongly consider taking reservations!

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: Things I like:1. The friendly bartenders and the amazing service.2. The quality of the food.3. The location.4. The awesome lighting and music (great ambiance!).5. How it's always hoppin' with people.6. Late night happy hour.7. The massive bar and beer selection.Things that could be improved:1. Any sort of discount for residents of Santana Row.2. Rewards program (BJ's has this).3. Moving late night happy hour up an hour to 9pm.4. Table ready notification by text (The Counter does this).5. Audio for important home games.6. Wi-Fi that doesn't drop every few minutes (wouldn't matter so much if AT&T had coverage inside this place).

Reviews.Author: Reena P.
Reviews.Content: Okay people so here is the nitty gritty on this joint (from the perspective of a girl that doesn't really drink beer).If you'd like to wait 1.5-2 hours for a table go to the Yard House on Friday or Saturday night. If you'd like to get seated right away, give or take 5 minutes, go to the Yard House during happy hour but make sure you arrive prior to 4:30 pm. Seriously, why is this place so popular? I know its not because of the food cause its good but not fan-freakintastic! Ok so they have a gazillion beers on tap. 2 hours in line versus Bevmo??? I'm not a huge beer fan so I don't get the craze. Why is beer that is 'on tap' better than the same beer in a bottle? I clearly don't have all the answers but what I do know is that my amazing husband loves this place and so occasionally I drink a light apricot beer for him =)What can I say? I'm a team player.

Reviews.Author: Betty N.
Reviews.Content: **OK OK OK OK OK OK PLACE, DRINKS, AND FOOD**Calm down, people.What did you expect, it's SAN JOSE.The long wait complaints will NOT STOP this place from staying super busy. Quit your job and arrive at 4PM.Lofty space with friendly staff. Happy Hour was the way to go.ORDERED:*CHICKEN NACHOS*HAWAIIAN POKE TOWER*GARLIC NOODLES*BIKINI-TINIThe food was not bad. I was pleasantly surprised that the garlic noodles were good.Much better, than let's say  . . . Chili's or Applebee's (yes, I did go there).Their fruity drinks tasted too sugary after the second round. I would go for a beer next time.Prices were reasonable (during HH) and that alone will lure me in again.RECOMMEND for HH at the Row.

Reviews.Author: Abby S.
Reviews.Content: My first Yard House experience ever was last week in San Jose. I know what you're saying, "Really? How's that even possible?". Well, it's true. We didn't have a Yard House in St. Louis and with all of the awesome non-chain establishments in the South Bay, Peninsula and San Francisco, it seemed silly to spend time here.However, I was pleasantly surprised at how much I really liked it at Yard House. The hostess was warm and friendly, especially considering how packed it was on the night of a Sharks game. Our small group was seated within minutes, too. And I must admit, the beer and food selection wasn't too shabby. From what I hear, this location in particular is always pretty busy and I'm not surprised. It's big and has so many beers on tap, plus it's so close to Santana Row, the most popular spot in all of San Jose. Are there non-chains that are just as awesome? Yeah, of course. But there's nothing wrong with showing some love to a restaurant that consistently performs well, right?

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago Joey, Kris, and I decided to visit Yard House (s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com…) to watch our NFL Sunday Football games. For someone who is looking for some American grub and beer, this is the spot for you.  They have over 100 beers on tap (s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com…) for you to choose from. Yard House makes for a fun place to go with a large group or to catch up with a friend over a beer or two.That day I ordered:   - Roasted Turkey Melt (s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com…)   - Clam Chowder (s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com…)   - Pineapple Express (s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com…)The roasted turkey melt had swiss cheese, pickled jalapenos & mayo on garlic toasted french bread. I was really digging the toasted bread and the swiss cheese. However I really didn't care too much for the turkey meat, which was a bit bland and on the dry side.The highlight was the Pineapple Express, which is blended with sky infusion pineapple vodka, malibu pineapple rum, monin mojito syrup, fresh pineapple, and fresh mint leaves. Wow, this drink was quite refreshing and delicious. It had me ordering a few more after the first one. =PScene:Atmosphere is too quiet with elevator music, making this place not geared for football fans. For starters, Yard House isn't open until 11:00am, while football kickoff is 10:00am. Normally you can hear the main game, but instead you hear elevator music in the background. Also there is no real excitement here during the games. Don't get me wrong, Yard House is a really nice place for the casual drinker or someone walking around Santa Row. This is just not the place for someone who mainly wants to watch some football games.Summary (3 Stars): Yard House is a good spot to hang out with friends to drink beer and eat food. On the flip side, it's not the best spot to watch football on a Sunday afternoon, especially if you want to watch all the games like how my friends and I do.

Reviews.Author: Joon Y.
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Yard House before, but after hearing all my friends from Socal ranting and raving about it, so I decided to go to their grand opening for kicks.This is a great location for the restaurant to get face time from onlookers driving by on Stevens Creek. And the decor, ambiance, and the atmosphere here fantastic. Almost feels like B.J's, but more of a modern feel to it. And this place is huge! (That's what she said)We waited for about 20 minutes to get seated for five people, but later on in the day it got quite packed, and some of my friends experienced a wait of up to 3 hours! (I'm pretty sure they didn't stick around) But I guess come here early if you can. This place will probably be packed during the peak hours until things settle down.130 types of beer on tap! I've died and gone to heaven. This might be my one stop shop for all my happy hour/beer binging needs. The Half-Yard is a pretty good deal especially if you are planning on drinking more than two or three regular pints of beer.Stuff we ordered:GRILLED KOREAN BBQ BEEFBeing Korean, I thought I would be setting myself up for a disappointment bomb, but the Korean BBQ Beef wasn't too shabby. Meat tasted a little well done but the marinate/sauce was good and went well with the jasmine rice.HAWAIIAN POKE STACK.Pretty damn delish. No complaints. CHINESE GARLIC NOODLESNot as good as the garlic noodles from say, Straits, but good!BÉARNAISE SLIDERSNom Nom Nom!(MAC + CHEESE)2I'm honestly not a Mac & Cheese fan, but man I am a fan of the Mac & Cheese at Yard House. Hands down the best Mac & Cheese I've ever had. This dish was money yo!SPICY JAMBALAYATypical Jambalaya, nothing really to rant over.The prices weren't too shabby either.The service here was excellent. The hosts were friendly, the bartenders were quick with our orders. Our waitresses Ashley, and Brennie were polished, attentive, and just awesome in general. Our food came out at lightening speed, I was amazed. And I swear Ashley was trying to get me drunk! Who the heck orders a second Half Yard? Ok, maybe this guy(me), but not on a Sunday afternoon.I wasn't really expecting much from this place and there could've been so many things that could've gone wrong for their Grand Opening, but looks like they made a rather smooth transit with staff. I'm actually in awe of how well everything turned out. It as if the staff have been working at this location for years! And this is probably going to be my new food/booze spot at The Row. I'm hoping things will stay this amicable, clean, sleek, and refined in the months to come.

Reviews.Author: Walter P.
Reviews.Content: Even on a Monday night, this place is still crowded with a hour wait for dinner.  RIDICULOUS!!!On the night of my birthday, I chose Yard House.   Thinking it would be a great experience to bring the family, it turned out to be sour one.This was our first time at Yard House in Santana Row.   Several years ago, I had an awesome time at the locations in Southern California.    So I thought it would just as great. I was so wrong.Wait time:  One hour and 15 minutes.  My father was not happy.  They do not have any seating while waiting for a table.  We found ourselves standing the entire time staring at people or watching the hockey game.    The bar was overcrowded with customers bullsh*tting along the surfaces.     I wanted to grab a few people and say, "Look!  If you're not going to order a drink, get the f--K out!  Let some paying customers enjoy the bar!"Not Family Friendly:   The crowd is your typical Silicon Valley white collar worker who just got off work with their lovable mistress for dinner and cocktails.   You won't find any families here.    And they did not offer a baby chair for my 1  1/2 year old godson.    I had to get the manager to help out.Service:You have got to be kidding me with the hosts.   Awful from head to toe.  Learn to smile, greet, and maybe ... just maybe give us a little grief for waiting.    The hosts enjoyed more chit chatting about who sleeps with who among their staff. As for the dining experience, we had to remind our waitress twice about refills.   I preferred our first waiter who highly impressed us with the menu items.For Eats:Five stars for the New York Steak:   Succulent Angus steak and grilled to perfection.  Flavorful rosemary and garlic mash potatoes.For Drinks;I enjoyed the half yard of the House Honey blond for $10.50.Best Seat in the House;If you're lucky, get the tables on the second floor that oversees the restaurant and the bar (close to the host table).   I'm giving them an extra star for our table placement.Tips:- Let's just wait until the hype dies down.    This is not worth the wait.    I was craving for steak and should have gone back to Alexander's Steakhouse for my birthday.- Try lunch instead of dinner.    That's my take.    Dinner service and waiting is absolutely poor.   Don't come here hungry.  - Parking:  Aim for the parking garage next to Crate & Barrel.- If it's your birthday, you get a small ramekin filled with a brownie and one tiny scoop of vanilla ice cream.    Oh...and you get a candle and a greeting done on a cocoa stencil.I wasn't really inspired to Yelp this place.  I just needed to vent.  Thank you.

Reviews.Author: J. C.
Reviews.Content: Reader, I visited Yardhouse twice in order to get two data points and write this stream of rambling. Both visits were in the afternoon between lunch and dinner to avoid the huddled masses yearning to be paged to their table. Parking was easy. When you arrive, a smiling host escorts you to a table. The entrance overlooks the bar and lower dining room area. All areas are stroller- and wheelchair-accessible. The acoustics were good during my visit and the place looks like it could get loud when busy. The ceiling is a wad of shadowy fire sprinkler plumbing, duct work, speakers, and Unistrut. There is a scattered array of televisions.At the bar on the first visit, there was a good looking male+female couple, each with a jumbo, turbine-engine-case-shaped beer glass. The woman wore a tank top, khaki shorts, and a just-back-from-Burning-Man tan. Not that I was looking. (Lucky couple.) "What do you call those drinks?" I asked my server. "A Yard," she answered. Imagine a tall glass with a capacity two point five time your bladder's. They drank two each. Their immediate future would include peeing and giggling. If I were not driving, a Yard would've been on my tab. I wonder, "How the heck do you shoehorn those glasses into the dish machine?" The menu has a wide variety including vegetarian items and some items identified as under 600 calories. Most menu items have neither of these markings. On my first visit, I tried the ginger-crusted Norwegian salmon with garlic mashed potatoes, (US$27). Order this and I think you'll be pleased. Next visit, I opted for the Cuban Pork Dip sandwich, (US$14). It's made with crispy, thin Cuban bread. I wanted to try this baked product once even though authentic Cuban bread is usually made with lard. The sandwich arrived with pencil-thin french fries fanned out like an agave in a paper-lined, stainless steel cup. Cool presentation.Actionable stuff management could do to improve the place: The men's restroom has some cool design features. There are modern sinks with solenoid valves that click on when you place an extremity under the faucet. If it were a little more clean and polished, it would be up to the caliber of the rest of the place. Think: clean grout.

Reviews.Author: Jesse D.
Reviews.Content: Will definitely not come back to this place again.1- $14 for a 32oz beer is stupid. I don't care if god himself pissed this beer out into a golden goblet between Megan Fox's legs (keep her nasty thumbs off my cup though), that's way too much to pay for a beer. 2- Having to wait in line again after you go out to smoke is REALLY stupid. If you want to do the whole line thing, have a smoking area. I almost dine and ditched because I couldn't get back in after smoking. It was during a Sharks game, and of course the line wasn't moving at all. "I'm trying to give you my money, but it's really hard if I can't get back to my table"3- Bathrooms are right by the soda filling area. Um, I feel this is a bit unsanitary...4- Too many douchebag "bros"- Yeah yeah, I should expect that right, being the new place on the row?5- Calling ahead is recommended, but you can't even call ahead on game nights. Seems pretty fail. So as you can see, if I could, this place would definitely be getting a zero. Seems like a fancier BJs with overpriced beer and average tasting appetizers.

Reviews.Author: Lorrie M.
Reviews.Content: I am so psyched that Yard House is now at Santana Row although I imagine this will bring far more  traffic and crazy crowds to SR since when I went a few days ago it was still very crazy out.The wait is around 2 hours for a group (maybe 1.5 if you're lucky) so I recommend you call in to ensure you can get a spot when you show up. This place is huge but that just means it fits even more people. The bar is round and goes about the whole center of the restaurant so a ton of people are hanging out in the bar area. There aren't actually as many booths as I thought there would be but either way the booths are spacious and fit at least 6!The food comes in HUGE portions so yes the prices can be pricier especially when you start ordering appetizer, multiple beers and fish like entrees which are in the $25+ range. But if you think about it, that's how much beer normally is, around $6 a glass, except here you get EXCELLENT beer and GREAT selection! Cannot be beat.This place is definitely awesome, highly recommended and don't bring everyone since you probably won't get seated for hours!

Reviews.Author: Tom L.
Reviews.Content: I love the beer selection, but I'd have to be drunk to order food from here again. I came here for lunch last week expecting a long wait, but the restaurant was half empty when we showed up (12:15). The atmosphere isn't anything special, it's basically BJ's with a much much much better selection of beers. Everyone at our table thought the food was average at best.I'd come back for some beers and maybe happy hour, but there is no way I'm waiting in line to eat the food here .... because it sucks.

Reviews.Author: Vi T.
Reviews.Content: (Just an observation, but I think Yard House is essentially a slightly pricier BJ's.)Overall, the food was a 3, but our server and the beer choices make it a 4.  I've never been much of a beer gal, but I find myself enjoying it a lot more lately.  As such, our waiter was very helpful in making suggestions based on our preferences (I find this an essential skill for those working here, since they have so many to choose from it can send your head spinning).  Shout out to Jason for his awesome recommendations! He even gave us free samples of a few beers he thought we would enjoy.  Thanks!To start, we shared truffle fries and deviled eggs which were quite good, especially the fries - but then again, I love anything that's smothered in cheese and garlic.  The eggs were fine too, but it's the sauce that makes them.My friend ordered the BBQ chicken pizza for her entree.  I tried a slice and I gotta say: I like CPK's version better :/.  It was a good pizza, just not a spectacular one.  For me, I chose the "adult" mac and cheese.  I had such high hopes for it because right when I ordered, our server seemed really excited about my choice.  Unfortunately, it was only so-so... definitely lacked seasoning, but it was nothing a little extra parm couldn't fix (which it did!).  The redeeming part of our meal, however, was the dessert trio.  It was to die for!  Yay for Yard House chocolate souffle, creme brulee, and peach apple cobbler!  Such awesome, sugary deliciousness.Lastly and most importantly, I must address the beer.  They have such an extensive selection that it makes non beer drinker want to order one just for the hell of ordering a beer.  My gf was thusly swayed and ended up having the Framboise and pear cider.  She is now officially in love with the Framboise, which tastes like a super sweet, tasty wine cooler.  For me, I got the Linenkugel's Sunset Wheat and Apricot Hef (I still like a beer that tastes like beer).  Both were refreshing and satisfying.Price breakdown:Truffle fries 3.95Deviled Eggs 2.95 for three piecesBBQ Chicken Pizza 12.75 (Great deal)Adult Mac and Cheese 16.25Beers and ciders 6-6.25Framboise 8.25 (yikes)Dessert trio 8.95 with with creme brulee substitute for a dollar moreOur total came out to $80 (ouch!) but I had such a good time that it's worth coming back with friends :D.

Reviews.Author: Wen C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars!My very first visit to San Jose's newest, freshest hottest spot: The Yard House was a pleasant one.I normally never get lucky but when I showed up around 9:30 pm on a Sunday during their opening weekend...I barely waited 10 mins for a nice, roomy, comfy booth!Afternoon and Late Night Happy Hour everyday minus Thursdays. I got to try a lot of things for 1/2 off! As everyone knows by now, it's the wide variery of beers that the Yardhouse is known for. All the ales, stouts, heifs, and lambic your heart desires! That evening I tried their ROSE GAARDEN blend- Hoegaarden White & Lindeman's Framboise. They were out of Hoegaarden sadly but substitutted it for a simliar white ale. I enjoyed it because I have a strong love for Framboise! Only negative feedback would be, I wish it was colder!I got to try the Chicken lettuce wraps, Pastrami sliders, Hawaiian poke stack, Calamari, and their Kona Coffee Icecream Sundae. The food came out pretty promptly, which was a huge surprise. The only thing that stood out were those Pastrami sliders and the Kona sundae. The sliders just blew me away, very comforting and tasty. The Kona sundae, "crack sundae" as I name it was crazy goooood! Java chip ice cream topped with oreo cookie crumbles, macadamia nuts and chocolate sauce with macadamia nut cookie...enough said.Service was decent, although drinks came out slow, can't really complain too much since the place is huge and for that volume of people, it's pretty much expected. The fun part is you see like 4 different faces throughout your whole experience, I think we saw our server, no more than 3 times the entire evening, she was sweet though.I liked the interior design, the lightning, and the bar setup. The restrooms were real fancy too, I felt like a million bucks washing my  hands! The only thing I really disliked was the noise, it was soooo loud, I felt like I was at a club, I could barely hear myself think....it could definitely get pretentious up in there.But all in all I would definitely come back for the beer, lambic, those pastrami sliders, and that Kona sundae soon!

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: The one spot that got me out of my Yelp hibernation is this place. Yes. I've heard of its greatness before, but I never expected to be this great. The sight of the bar was a just a little slice of heaven compared to the holy grail of the establishment: the half yard beer pours! Oh goodness, the greatest invention ever. Why? Get two beers at once = no need to ask for refills. With the place so busy on a Friday night, this is definitely a blessing.I looked at the pulls. I gasped at the sight of Fat Tire 1554 on tap. Whaaaattt???? So rare. A half yard of that took me back to the New Belgium Brewery in Fort Collins, CO. Delish.This only gripe I have about this place is the service. Of course, the place was packed to the brim with the bar being 3 deep in some parts. On a busy night, expect to elbow your way to the front of the bar to order. Have fun guarding your yard through the crowd like a pass rush. Getting seats is near impossible so expect to hawk eye people at the bar for people getting up to leave.

Reviews.Author: Eli Y.
Reviews.Content: Why is everyone all about this place??Ok I know the beer selection is ridiculous and yes that's pretty awesome. But it's a restaurant not just a bar. If I am in the mood for throwing back some beers I will come here for sure but the food is not very good at all. I came for a birthday and we all ordered food. I got the "Cuban." This was a faux Cuban that was bland more than anything. It came with a dipping sauce that only accomplished making the sandwich wet and added no flavor. The fries were ok but not special. Also it came with a pickle on the side. Let's just say Snookie would hate this place because that was the crappiest pickle I've ever had!My friend got the Cobb Salad and hated it. Another friend said he'd like his burger if he was drunk. So go for the beer and skip the food.

Reviews.Author: Lien T.
Reviews.Content: As promised, I am updating because I've experienced the food at Yard House now. I've actually been back three times since my last review, so you can get an idea of how awesome they are! That, or I have nothing better to do! LOL.On one of the occasions, I came on a Thursday evening when there was an estimated two to three hour wait for a table. My friend and I opt to hang out around the bar area until a spot opened up at the bar top. Luckily, we managed to order some beer as we were waiting and honestly, I don't even remember how long we were waiting, but it didn't seem that long until a spot opened up. We were too busy chatting and people watching to even notice how much time had passed. It was probably half an hour to an hour?Well anyway, I got to try the following beers that night:- House Amber Ale- Anderson Valley Boont Amber Ale- Timmerman's Strawberry- Lost Coast Apricot Wheat- Leinenkugel Sunset Wheat- Delirium Tremens- Spaten Optimator- Great WhiteIt was really fun trying all of the beers. My favorites were the ambers, Timmerman's Strawberry, and the Leinenkugel Sunset Wheat. The Timmerman's Strawberry didn't even taste like beer, it's fermented in a way that made the predominant flavor strawberry. I honestly felt like I was drinking strawberry soda, it was pretty cool! The Leinenkugel Sunset Wheat was also fun to drink. My friend had me take a sip and told me to tell her what I thought and I honestly thought about Fruity Pebbles cereal--no joke! I also want to talk about the Delirium Tremens. It was a very complex spiced Belgian strong ale that I didn't like very much, but I had to try it because it's logo was an elephant. I love elephants!Yeah, I know...I did a lot of drinking, but that actually wasn't all we drank. I also tried the Southern Belle, Tuaca Berry Blast, Pomegranate Press, and the Strawberry Fields. The Southern Belle was similar to the Southern Punch that I tried the first time; however, it had vodka instead of rum and it had a lot of chunks of strawberry and pineapple. The other drinks and martinis that I tried were no bueno. They were either alcohol-laden or tasted like cough syrup.We also shared an order of the house favorite, mac and cheese, and an order of chicken lettuce wraps. I can understand why the mac and cheese (yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…) is a house favorite. It is the best mac and cheese ever! It had earthy mushrooms that complemented the smoked bacon, chicken breast, and cheese so well. The finishing touch of toasted bread crumbs was amazing! I wish I could say the same for the chicken lettuce wraps. The wraps were just too greasy and I'm usually not a fan of butter lettuce.The next time I went, I went on a Saturday afternoon and the wait was 40 minutes. I didn't try any new beers, but I got to try the truffle fries, onion ring tower, and the walnut pear salad. Everything was absolutely delicious! The truffle fries were super thin, but tender and moist. The beer battered onion rings (yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…) were great with the chipotle and ranch dips. The walnut pear salad came with fresh pears and the mixed greens were drizzled with bleu cheese and balsamic vinaigrette. The candied walnuts added texture to the salad, which I liked.This has got to be one of the longest reviews I've written in a long time, but Yard House deserves it. After all, they do have quite an extensive menu of beer, it is only appropriate to write an extensive review. I will definitely be back! Cheers to Yard House!

Reviews.Author: John-Michael C.
Reviews.Content: What Ed H. said...-hungover-lulz;D

Reviews.Author: Austin G.
Reviews.Content: Huge selection of beers! Food was pretty good. I got the Southern Fried Chicken and the piece of chicken was humongous! Nice place to go out with a couple of friends and enjoy a beer.

Reviews.Author: Stephy L.
Reviews.Content: 114 beers ON TAP?! HELL YEA!YARD HOUSE ON SANTANA ROW! :)This location was opened within the last 6 months.  I came here with my boyfriend to Santana Row the other day just to walk around and visited the Valley Fair Mall right next door.  While we were there, we called up one of our friends who works nearby, and he immediately replied with " okay, meet you at Yard House in 10 mins!" Alright! I guess happy hour it is!We arrived Yard House around 5pm?  There was a good amount of traffic inside the restaurant.  This was my boyfriend and my very first time to actually sit down at a Yard House.  Notice they have a huge amount of beer on tap in the center where the bar is located!  They have booths lining around the restaurant and with tables filling the middle section.  We were brought to a booth that overlooks the street right across from Valley Fair.We sat down and took some time with the menu.  Since it was happy hour, I believe ( if i dont remember wrong), appetizers were half off.  They also have a large selection of beer (needless to say).  The beer menu was so attractive that I took more time deciding what to get to drink, instead of what to eat.  We finally settled with 4 dishes of appetizers, which happen to become way too much!The Crab and artichoke dip with pita bread - served with about 10 slices of pita bread with chips accompanying around it.  The crab dip was delightful and not too heavy.  This was one of my favorite.  The following picture shows food half eaten up : yelp.com/user_local_phot…The chicken nachos - OMG! This was huge! (thats what she said..haha)  We did not expect to receive this huge plate of nachos if they were called appetizers.  However, the plate was filled with nacho chips with a generous amount of sour cream and guac.  Salsa and beans were incorporated for flavor.  The dish was not spicy at all, but very flavorful. Liked it! yelp.com/user_local_phot…The crab cakes - served in an large plate with 2 pieces.  The presentation of this dish was very elegant.  The crab cakes was a tad bit disappointing because I thought it was a bit too dry.  However, if you cut out small pieces and dip it into the sauce around it, it will taste better.  texture-wise, I think it needs some work, but overall, not bad.  yelp.com/user_local_phot…Lastly, we also ordered the buffalo wings.  The dish had at least 10 wings in there with ranch sauce in the middle.  There was also some celery and carrot sticks on the side.  The buffalo wings weren't bad.  Afterall, I love my buffalo wings with ranch sauce! Plus celery stick with ranch? yum!For drinks, our table probably ordered over 5 different beers, which included the Black Velvet ( guiness + champagne).  If you have not tried this combo, give it a go the next time you're there! Our friend loved it.  They also have a bunch of wheat ale if you're not a fan of hard stuff, but you like bluemoon.  Servers are real nice and friendly.  They take the time with your orders and your food some all at once.  Thank you Yard House for such a wonderful first time experience.  I am already planning on coming back with more of my friends.p.s. if you're not interested in dining, the bar definitely fills up around 6pm!

Reviews.Author: Malley D.
Reviews.Content: This place is AWFUL!!! I will NOT be going back! I decided to go here with a large group of friends for my b-day (stupid, I know) and had to wait 4 hours for a table because they don't take reservations, even for a large group of more than 10. Also stupid. Anyway, when it was finally our time to sit down, they tried to seat us at a 6 person table even though we had 9 people and there was a bigger table right next to it. We just sat down at the bigger table anyway because we were so frustrated at this point. After that, it was all downhill. Our waitress was a major b***h and rolled her eyes when I asked for WATER.....they check your ID every 5 minutes, as if my age has changed? Really? The food is mediocre at best and the drinks are way overpriced. Also, seems every desperate housewife in San Jose was at this place, looking a cougar mess. So that's the kind of crowd you're gonna deal with.Good luck if you try to go here - pretty sure their motto is 'the customer is always wrong'.

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: Just a heads up, even though every TV is playing the Sharks game Yard House will not play the sound for the game but rather continue blasting The Police and other random music.  Our waiter was super nice and explained that the sound was out of his control.  However, the redheaded regional manager running around was totally rude.  When we asked him about the sound he blew us off and said that it's only round 1 of the playoffs and that they can't play the sound to every game that was on...ummm why can't you just have nicely told us about your corporate policy.  And then he looked all irritated that people were being loud...you have 100 beers and all the tvs are playing the Sharks game...what kind of place do you think this is???I actually really like the space, the place is huge and airy.  And the food was not bad.  The truffled fries were delicious and the mac and cheese was tasty.  Chicken nachos were too wet and not a ton of chips.  The beer sampler is a cute idea and not a bad value.  Monday night, Game 6 Sharks v. Kings, got there at 6:30 party of 6 and waited an hour to get a table.  Really nice thing is that once you are in a booth they don't rush you out of it at all.

Reviews.Author: Ron L.
Reviews.Content: Tap, tap, tap...there, that ought to do it, I thought to myself.  One last shiny pointed fastener pounded into the 2x4 plank on the man sized box...or to put it bluntly, the last nail in the proverbial coffin.Last week I gathered businesses, opened the coffin, and proceeded to dump in familiar names.  Dave and Busters...Tied House...BJs...Gordon Biersch...Rock Bottom...Faultline...you get the idea.  With over 130 beers, the aforementioned drinking establishments came to a gunfight not with a knife, but a toothpick, and you guessed it...Yard House cleaned up.The good thing about the Yard House opening up is you won't have to stand in line if you go to the other places...just be happy with the limited beer offerings at those other places.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: My oh my.. half yard happy hour, half off appetizers, lunch deals.. Did I just walk into beer heaven? Or was I already drunk before walking into here?Let me say something about their beer. If you're like me, you don't like that strong yeast tasting beer. I'm a cider kind of girl and you haven't had beer until you've tried the Raspberry Cider. MMMMMMMMMMmmmmmMMMM. Clean. Crisp. DELIC. Half yard of that and you'll be playing the trombone along with the sports team on the huge Tvs.. I assumed it was Giants that night. But who cares!! They cheer, then you cheer!!! Bottoms up!!!!!!!!!Hawaiian Poki Stack, half pizza, sliders, and oh my lord those fries. THOSE FRIES. MHMMM. It was what I dipped with those fries that made them oh so special. Dijian maple mustard. If you loooveee honey mustard like me, this.. will change you...I've enjoyed everything I've had here so far. Some of the food wasn't as pleasing, but surely everything taste good with a cup of cold beer. So bottoms up, because this will surely turn into your happy hour home after one try.

Reviews.Author: Elaine L.
Reviews.Content: So, two unemployed sisters walk into a bar....We decided to check out Happy Hour at the Yard House yesterday, and it was well worth the trip.  Of course they have a phenomenal beer selection, and at happy hour prices we were very happy with everything we got. Ordering the Margherita pizza and chicken nachos resulted in far more food than two people could consume, and our food plus a pint of ESB and one Black Velvet added up to a mere fifteen dollar check.  Recession-proof!Service was fantastic - Eric was our server, and while our food took awhile to emerge from the kitchen, he stopped by a few times to update us (we were in no hurry, I think his concern was far greater than ours), and he went out of his way to swap out my drink when I accidentally ordered a Black and Tan instead of a Black Velvet.  This was totally my fault and I wouldn't have minded one bit if the spare drink showed on our bill, but it didn't. I'm giving three stars for the food (good but not spectacular) and five for the beverage selection and excellent service.  Know that this is a noisy place so not your best pick if you are in the mood for intimate conversation.  I bet it's lively on game day, though!Thanks for having such a great happy hour, Yard House.  I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to Yard House on a Friday night for some drinks and apps. They have an impressive selection of beers to choose from. Food here is just okay. We ordered the firecracker wings, chicken garlic noodles, and spinach cheese dip. I've also have tried their truffle fries and nachos. The truffle fries are bomb, they're thinly sliced, perfectly crispy, and pack good flavor. The rest of the food is decent, but nothing particularly special. The biggest turn off about this place is the excruciating wait times which could take hours. I've given up many times trying to get a table here and just end up leaving and going someplace else. There are plenty of TVs here to enjoy the game. Noise level gets pretty high in here, I often have trouble hearing people sitting right next to me. It's a fun place to hang out and grab some drinks, I'm just not sure it's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Jeziell B.
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a pretty in depth review, so get comfy. Grab something to drink and maybe some popcorn. Ready? Ok..So unlike everyone else and their mom, I have never been to the Yard House ever. And what I mean by that is, I never went to ones in SoCal. Haha. I was pretty interested in trying it out since I've heard so much about it, so I got a chance last night (the Monday right after their busy opening weekend) to check it out with some of my friends.I called in twice that day, to check if they had a waitlist and what they expected the wait times to be throughout the day. They were quick to pick up the phone and I believe had more than one person answering calls to accommodate everyone.Note 1: They will allow you to call in ahead to be put on the waitlist 30 minutes ahead of the time you come in if you have a party of 6 or less. If you have a party larger than 6, you have to come in and talk to the manager in order to be put on the waitlist.We had a group of 10, so one of my friends gets there around 8pm and was told the wait was about an hour and a half and tells him to come back to check in and gives him a buzzer.Note 2: It will be faster if you don't mind being split up into 2 tables. I would recommend going here will a smaller party of no more than 6 because their booths can hold that much and you probably can get seated sooner.We didn't mind waiting or walking around Santana Row, so we did that and checked in after an hour and then waited around outside and eventually got seated around 9:30 but our group was split into two tables, but they were side by side.Our server was really nice. The food comes out quick! Unfortunately they were out of a lot of taps, but it was ok bc we were still able to try a couple things.Here is a list of what I tried that night (might seem like I have a large appetite, but don't forget we had a party of 10! Had plenty of plates to share. ;) )Courses:Loaded Mac and Cheese: Really good. I especially loved the mushrooms in this dish! And this was big enough to share for 3 people per plate.Appetizers:Spicy Tuna Roll: This aint no roll, this is like a huge tartare! Chicken Lettuce Wraps: Yummy and served with 3 different kinds of dipping sauces.Crab Cakes: Comes with 2 cakes, and they are crispy on the outside and they don't skimp on the meat! This came with some sauce on the plate and some mango salsa. Probably one of my favorite dishes of the night.Poke Stack: I say this is good size for the happy hour price, but I think the poke from Hukilau is better. Also comes with a good amount of julienned carrots, bean sprouts, and some avocado on the side.Beers/Drinks:House Honey Blonde: Standard light beer. I wouldn't order it again though, probably would get a Hef instead of this.Young's Double Chocolate Stout: If Guinness and Dark chocolate had a baby, this would be it.Delirium Tremens: Has a good taste in the beginning, but definitely had a kick in the end. Strawberry something: Reminds me of Capri sun. An alcoholic bubbly strawberry Capri Sun. If that sounds good to you, try it! I liked it.Leinenkugel's Sunset Wheat: A refreshing light beer. Would probably order this again.Pomegranate Press: Really good. Fruity and light, but this is probably one of those creeper drinks you will feel after a couple.Southern Punch: Super good also! Another fruity mix.Although service was pretty solid throughout the night and food came out surprisingly quicker than expected, at the end they did take a little while to give us our bill. But listen up: They have no problem splitting the bills. At one table of 6, we split the bill 3 ways, and in the beginning we shared 2 plates of Mac and cheese. The server was able to split the 2 plates of Mac and cheese 3 ways! That is AWESOME. Makes it much easier for the rest of us who lack the want or ability to do math after some drinking.In the end: The food, service, and drinks were really solid. They have plenty of space at the bar and a lot of screens to catch something to watch or sports. I don't know if it's worth the 1.5hr + wait, but then again, you're in Santana Row, and you have plenty of places to check out and space to walk around to kill time. This place kind of reminds me of a much better BJ's. I would definitely come back for happy hour though. I think the price points there are very affordable for the amount and quality of food that you get. (The Monday right after their opening day, happy hour didn't look too crazy busy. Something to think about.)

Reviews.Author: Joanna S.
Reviews.Content: Beer me. That's the first thing you should decide on after sitting down. Beer first, food later. With 100+ beers on tap all the time, it's going to take you a while to decide! Top Beer choices:-I love the young chocolate stout with framboise. -The rose gaarden is good too (hoegaarden & frambroise)-'fruity pebble beer' Aka leink. Sunset wheat-'blueberry beer' sea dog blueberry -'apricot beer' lost coast apricot :)The waiters know these by their trade names and also as quoted. I love these several selections. If you're not sure, they'll give you a sample to taste! Don't be scared to experiment and be daring. Not one beer on that menu is bad! Once you figure out the beer you want, Half Yard time! There should be a rule that everyone who goes there for the first time get a half yard. It's equivalent to a little more than 2 beers, and it just looks cool like the skinny flask with a bulb. How can you go to yard house and not have a yard stick right?Food:I think the truffle oil fries are overrated. But if you want to try it, you can order it on the side of a burger and they just charge u a little and u get a cup full which is more than enough.My favorite dishes there;-Garlic noodles!!! So addicting. Good both as appetizer or entree. -Jambalaya: waiter recommended it, it's awesome-Surf and turf burger. Soooo good! For $15, it has lobster and a burger patty with asparagus in it. Such a delicious combo!!!!-Lobster crab dip: delicious but it comes in a huge plate so be wary, it's better for bigger parties to share-Truffle Mac n cheese- pretty good. It's different Today we also tried desserts- mini lemon souffle, macadamia nut cheesecake, and kona ice cream. All were decent but really really heavy. I think that all the food at yard house is pretty heavy (unless u get a salad... But who does that????!) it's cool to come here to drink beer and eat, but the food isn't exceptional, the lines are long and I think it's pretty noisy. At like 7pm, they dimmed the lights too. Whatsup with that? Trying to set the mood? It's basically an upscale sports bar, and a class up from BJ's. It's good, but I still love my BJ's brewhouse.

Reviews.Author: Vicky T.
Reviews.Content: Tom is the shit.. by far one of the best servers I have had while on Santana Row.. usually I get folks like Megan who was serving us while Tom was on break.. indifferent..once she realized we were just getting dessert..took her sweet time getting our menu... flung one menu on the table (there were three of us) and then left without bring back some requested items.. in comes Tom from his break.... immediately all errors were taken care of and the negative experience as a first timer melted away..additionally he wrote down different beers he recommended and gave a small sample... totally went above and beyond the call of duty....  This review should also be about the food.. which was delicious! We ended up getting dessert first (we had eaten at Antica first)The brownie sundae (think pazookie or whatever its called but with a brownie) was delicious The Kona Coffee sundae was also delicious... lots of sugar (oreos, wafer, coffee ice cream, chocolate syrup, maca nuts) going around..it was huge!! that's what she said :-P) 'After seeing four of the Ahi stacker things go someone could not resist getting one... it was SUPER NOMMY! well balanced.. loved it! According to our server, the Ahi gets flown in every 2 days.. I believe.. it was like butter it was so fresh.... Coming during a week day between 11-4 is a good idea... there is no line and you get seated immediately..... Lots of TVs for game actionLots of beers (over 100) for the liquid foodieLots of yard glasses (1 glass= 1 serving.. sure why not) Service is hit or miss... thankfully we had a hit for 3/4 of our experience.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany U.
Reviews.Content: After Eva W, Mr. W and Jon Y. and I did it big at a Yelp Elite event in Palo Alto, we decided to continue our night at Yard House. I've been to the Yard House located in Irvine Spectrum before but it had left a very vague impression on me. The location in Santana Row was much more impressionable-- the pipes leading to the beer dispenser thingie (what is it called?) was unique and there is a giant ceiling fan by the entrance! Katelyn, our server, was super sweet and funny! Both Eva and I ordered drinks off their low-calorie menu and both were delightfully delicious! Guess everything is just better in Santana Row-- I can't wait to come back for more drinks!

Reviews.Author: Heather H.
Reviews.Content: With an opening week wait average of 2.5 hours for parties from 2-12 people, this seems like the place to be. The only thing thing this place lacks is a larger waiting area. You could go to the bar to grab a drink but it's already full with sharks/giants/&lakers fans. After 2.5 hours, I had run into old friends, done several walks around the bar, and finished a yard-o-beer, hoegarden, pronounce who-harder. A Belgian white wheat- one of the hundred beers on tap. I worked up an appetite but decided to play it safe with a 'spicy ahi roll' appetizer, ($9.95) and for my entree I had an 'appetizer sized cobb salad', ($7.95). The ahi roll was good, but it was literally a big chunk of ahi tuna surrounded by avocado and edamame. My salad was not a salad at all, but mixed veggies (corn, tomatoes, celery) and bacon with avocado on top. It was good, but not what I was expecting. I also tried the sweet potatoe fries, which we pretty amazing. I ushually like a spicy mustard sauce, bute YH offers a more cinnamon flavored dipping sauce. YUM! The nachos were scrumdidalyumptious as well, just had a bit though, summer comin!The beer was $6.50 for a pint and $13.95 for the yard. Not sure if prices vary. During my time there, I had one not-so-nice server and one EXCELLENT server. The bartender was nice too and very good at carding. You need an ID for each drink you order.
