I'm excited to revisit this place. Its bringing a lot more business to the entire Santana Row and its exactly what we needed in this area..a nice, American Bistro type sports bar. CHEERS! My recommendation: Eventually they will have call-ahead seating, but not now. And don't expect to get a seat during game times because NO ONE gets up. I'm also recommend getting a pint sized beer because the Yard beers are WAY to big and awkward to hold & drink. Trust me.

Reviews.Author: Vicky H.
Reviews.Content: OK minus one star for the LONG WAIT!this place is certainly the place to go for a nice cold beer. the service isnt that bad, i have not yet complained about anything other than for the long wait. if you intend going here i recommend making reservations or checking in a bit earlier. the food was pretty good i highly recommend the Spicy Jambalaya with pasta. its is to DIE for!!!...not really but it is really delicious and it tastes even better as a leftover for tomorrow's breakfast or lunch. mmm so good...the beer : Strawberry Thinnerman (Hands down the best tasting beer I have ever drank in my LIFE!) SORRY  BLUEMOON you have been replaced! Its like drinking a ginger ale with a hint of strawberry as an after taste. It is really light and for all you ladies who do not like beer, I think you will really like this one!yay for yard house, i will be definitely coming here again for the delicious beer and jambalaya.

Reviews.Author: Noelle J.
Reviews.Content: The World According to NoelleAllergic Girl's Guide to LifeHAIR IN YOUR ENTREE IS JUST GROSS.Being a regular customer at the Yard House I'm disappointed in finding hair in my entrees on two separate visits. The waitstaff and front desk are awesome, deserving of 5 Yelp Stars. Yesterday, I found a hair in my Korean short ribs. Before I found the hair I was enjoying the dish with the exception of the cold, hard semi-old steamed rice underneath the meat. More often that not I've enjoyed the food at the YH but hair in your entree two weeks in a row is unacceptable. The kitchen staff really needs to wear hairnets.Noelle's NotesThe management has listened to my concerns, so hopefully next week I won't be finding hair in my food.

Reviews.Author: Anna B.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't overly impressed by my first Yard House experience, or with any of the visits I had after. The restaurant was overly noisy and crowded. Ordering a drink was difficult. I just wanted a beer. A nice, cold beer. It took forever to flag down a bartender. Service is average. I understand that there's a lot going on at the establishment. The waiters and waitresses have much to deal with. But when I have to wait to order a beer, while a drunk guy stumbles to the bar and gets his drink before me, I am allowed to be upset. The beer is good. There's a large variety to choose from. It's a challenge to figure out what to order! The blueberry beer is theeee best! It is reminiscent of the Leinenkugel beer (my FAVORITE!!)Yard House would be ideal for casual drinks and snacks, but the ambience kills it. Thumbs down ;[

Reviews.Author: Carol K.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this place always gets so packed but once you're seated, service is attentive and the food is pretty good.  I really like the chicken salad, seared tuna appetizer, and I recently had the Mediterranean Scallops.  The portion was a bit small but it was so delicious!  It's my new favorite dish.

Reviews.Author: Agent X.
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'd come back would be for their beer on tap selection, and maybe HH.  I normally dread SR because it's always crowded and parking is never a breeze.Their menu is sort of all over the place, and the set up inside really reminds me of BJ's.  I'll admit the Mac + Cheese ^2 was good, but the rest was meh.  The Blue Crab Cakes were okay, and the Jerk Chicken & Shrimp Stack was hilarious...I still chuckle just thinking about it.  By "Jerk Chicken" they meant a regular piece of grilled chicken breast.  The "Shrimp Stack" was basically a flat shrimp enchilada...Our waitress, Jessica, was very sweet, cheerful and attentive.  I'm glad their service is on point, even with the constant crowds of people rushing in to try this place.

Reviews.Author: Kim R.
Reviews.Content: My second attempt on trying to get a table, 30 min wait wasn't as bad as the first time I try to come here.  This place is always packed regardless of the time of day.Yardhouse is perfect for the beer lover, they have an extensiveeee list of beers.Large open space with lots of TVs. Clean modern ambiance and loud at night.Service was friendly and relatively attentive even though the place looked busy..I had the Sea dog blueberry beer- didn't like it.. I guess I was expecting a little blueberry flavor but it was nowhere to be found.. Turkey sliders and truffle fries- yummmyyyy just wish the bun was betterLobster, crab & artichoke dip- not as great as I had imagined, could do without the pita bread, thought it came with pita chipsI shall be back!

Reviews.Author: Steph C.
Reviews.Content: Ok please read my whole review first then you'll understand why there is a 3 star rating..First off.. I probably WON'T be coming back here for about a year. Part of 12. We came at 3:30pm on a Sunday and they said "Hour and a Half wait!". We thought that wasn't bad at all so they took down our number so we could walk around Santana Row till our table is ready. Hour and a half passes. We called Yardhouse to see the status of our table. They said "Sorry, the big group that is still at the table just ordered another round of beers. We're assuming another 45 minutes." Ok Ok.. We all agreed that its understandable that people MIGHT want to drink more (duh). 45 minutes pass... We call in and they say "Party of what? It will be a hour to a hour and a half."SO.. We go over to yardhouse. I think they gave our table away (I think). We waited for another hour when they insured us that our table was NOT given away... After 3 hours they finally tried to "bargain" with us and sat us right by the front door where other people kept trying to sit down because they thought it was the waiting area. Whatever.. 3 hour wait fine.. whatever.. If we knew it would take us 2 hours to get our food we would of left after the first call when they told us to wait another 45 minutes.Food was cold, burgers were soggy AND beer never came out. We didn't leave yardhouse till 8:45pm when we initially got there at 3:30pm.The only reason why I'm giving this place something other then a 1 star is because the management was pretty on top of everything. They took off all the dishes that took over a hour to come out and the manager came over to apologize multiple times. Honestly, it was nice to know that even though the place seems EXTREMELY hectic, they still have a smiling and very courteous manager to support the chaos. Also our server was very nice (Leticia). She was super helpful on the menu and knew all the beers.

Reviews.Author: Naveed A.
Reviews.Content: I had the worse experience here..... The place was definitely worth checking out, but when I arrived they told me it's going to be a 45 -1 hour wait, and there were so many tables open I didn't understand why.  I also saw customers walking to the tables and sitting down on there own, and we went to the tell the waitress and she was like we'll take care of it and 30 minutes later same folks are eating at the table.  Mind you we've been here waiting now for 45 minutes.Just cause the place is new does not mean you should treat your customers with disrespect.  We ended up going to the bar and sitting there since we did not get our seats well over an hour...Honestly it's definitely not worth the wait, I'll give this place another chance, but I'll tell you something it's got way to much hype for it just opening.  I did enjoy the food, but they got  alot to work the service...GET IT TOGETHER GUYS.....CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!!!!

Reviews.Author: Evan J.
Reviews.Content: I've been a half dozen times and I'm always impressed with the quality of the food. The menu is HUGE, which would usually tell me that the food will be mediocre, a la Cheesecake Factory. It's just too difficult making that many menu items well. Yard House pulls it off. My favorite items are usually appetizers, especially truffle fries. My favorite menu item is the low calorie scallop dish that comes with hummus and tabbouleh.Only thing I hate is the long line that is always formed by 6:00. Luckily Santana Row has a ton of shops that you can browse while waiting.

Reviews.Author: Evie B.
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor, and don't eat here.Sorely disappointed in their customer service here.  Haven't eaten here and don't plan on it.  I am telling all my friends and family not to endorse a restaurant with such poor customer service.  My sister-in-law was attempting to apply for a job here.  Filled out an application and went in to submit it, but was told open interviews were on Tuesdays from 2-4pm.  She returned on Tuesday at 2:25pm only to be told that the open interview had been closed and didn't even take her application.  Meanwhile, there were about 6 servers just staring at my sister-in-law and not trying to be respectful of the fact that she was trying to apply for a job. Nobody was attempting to understand her situation or be courteous of the fact that she had now been out there twice and been told conflicting information.I had initially wanted to try this restaurant but after what went down with my sister-in-law none of us will be trying Yard House.I recommend they work on their customer service and treating their customers with respect before they ever get business from me or my family.

Reviews.Author: Rocker K.
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to wait for a table, come as early as you can and during the week if possible. My husband and I waited about 20 minutes for a table and the place was packed. If it weren't for the fairly attentive service, I would've given this place a 3.5 rating based on the food. I was expecting to love the food here after reading the reviews but this place is a little over hyped. I got the avocado burger with cheese along with the truffle fries that so many people have raved about. The burger was too well done and was just OK. There was a lot of fresh avocado on it though. The fries were shoestring fries and I've had much better fries elsewhere. The truffle oil just made the fries taste oily. I also got the gobstopper cocktail which was sweet and tart. That wasn't bad. They have a very extensive list of wine, beer, and cocktails. The lady next to us got the sea bass and it looked so good that even my husband said that he'd like to try that next time and he doesn't really like seafood except for eating the clams in clam chowder. This place is an Asian fusion place that also has lots of different kinds of good old American comfort food. They even have Jambalaya. They have an eclectic mix of Thai, Vietnamese, Japanese, Korean, and Chinese food. I should've gotten one of their more exotic dishes. We also got the onion ring tower which is kind of on the small side for the appetizer. The onion rings are on a steel rod and were just OK. The prices of the food here is fairly inexpensive. My dish cost around $12.00 I think. This place is new and located right in the corner of Santa Row facing Stevens Creek Blvd. Parking is hard to find so like I said, the earlier you come here, the better as Santa Row is usually even more packed later in the day. I'll come back here again and maybe try that yummy looking Sea Bass!

Reviews.Author: Evelyn T.
Reviews.Content: I HATE THE WAIT HERE!!!!!  That being said, I love me a half yard of the pear cider.  And the fruity pebbles one.  There's nothing that hits the spot like the (Mac & Cheese)^2 but it's heeeeavy.  Truffle mac n cheese with chicken.  Why didn't someone think of this sooner?

Reviews.Author: Janet O.
Reviews.Content: First timer here! Tried to go with Crystal C never made it. Second time's a charm for me. Came win my favorite Yelper. Wow! No wait! Charming waitress and efficient.  A booth overlooking the busy Stevens Creek and some people watching I'd say not bad.Average wait time for food. Baby back ribs and a nacho plate to share. A couple of cocktails for me and some beer for my partner plus a diet coke! :)So this,experience tells me that if you're here before 5 or 6 you will miss the mad house experience that other Yelpers talk about. It's pretty much just another place to me. Doesnt really stand out.  I've had better!Still a decent 4 star experience.

Reviews.Author: Tellis H.
Reviews.Content: My coworkers and I came here right when Happy Hour started and beat the rush crowd.  Happy Hour specials for drinks and foods are really affordable. Seared Ahi...... greatGarlic noodles.........greatMac & cheese with bacon on top........goodSweet potato fries.........greatI LOVE their Truffles fries are amazing! Really, you can't go wrong with this place and the crowd is pretty descent with lots of Tv's. Will be back!!!!

Reviews.Author: Joel V.
Reviews.Content: Other than the comically insane wait for a table, I really enjoyed getting my cherry popped by the Yard House.Thankfully, one of my boys was able to get there at 3:00, so that when we got off work and got a few half-yards in us our table was ready. Only a three and a half hour wait...I really liked the layout. The kegs for over 100 beers on tap are on the second floor, and they have tubes that channel the beer down to the main bar and into your half-yard.Bad news: Because of the crowd, a server lost his tray of drinks all over my boys head. No joke - red wine and beer on his head, hair and shirt. Good news: The tray didn't land on me, and we got our bar bill wiped plus a round on the house.I ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken on Mashed Potatoes. A touch dry, but solid nonetheless. I also dabbled in some nacho appetizer, and it was bomb. Finally, after the beer was talking to me, I stole a big ass bite of a Crab Cake Hoagie - and that might have been the highlight. I'll try it again when sober.All in all, a very cool spot. WAY too crowded and trendy, but in six months that could change. Hopefully.4.25 Stars.

Reviews.Author: Lalaine T.
Reviews.Content: I really had high hopes for this place since it's always packed. But I've came here twice and I've left each time very disappointed. I think the first time I order some miso salmon dish that wasn't really good. It was quite expensive too. My friends and I waited for around 2 hours to get inside... and another hour to get our food. The next time I went I tried their Mediterranean scallop dish which was... I wish I can say it in Gordon Ramsey's accent, "IT'S BURNT!"...  Sadly I was unimpressed once again... and they charged me 18 bucks for 5 small BURNT scallops and 2 pieces of romaine lettuce... If you do go to yard house, just go for the appetizers and drinks. Their food is awful. On top of that I find it impossible to socialize since I can't even here the sound of my own VOICE!

Reviews.Author: Aileen A.
Reviews.Content: Edit:Oh heck no am I waiting 2 hours waiting so I can sit and order my poke only to find out YOU RAN OUT OF IT. Please post signs/ announce it if this is the case, otherwise Yardhouse, you will ruin the experience FOR both of us. I came back two more times after, during lunch at 11:30AM and weekend lunch as well, and the quality of fish was great but the flavoring/ presentation was unsavory. Sayonarra, I'll see you in Hawaii instead!++++++The poke here is yum! Ambiance is nice, dim, but a bit noisy :)I had first heard about this place in Oahu (this restaurant is part of a chain, another in San Diego) and my curiosity was piqued when I discovered one was opening at a location near me.My review will probably be lost in the vast sea of reviews for this place but know this, the poke, crab artichoke dip, and truffle fries are de-liiiicious!!According to members of my party, beer is great-too many to chose from! Definitely get the "Yard", a yard long glass of beer.Of course, if you plan on eating hear on a weekend night, I suggest coming as early as possible to get a pager. We've come upon occasions where there was a list to get the pager because they ran out, like a 45 min wait for one. While waiting around, check the other fine neighboring establishments (see Vbar, Blowfish, and Straits)

Reviews.Author: Alecia R.
Reviews.Content: WILL NOT BE COMING BACK DUE TO POOR SERVICE!!!...that says it all

Reviews.Author: Monica F.
Reviews.Content: *THE  NIGHT I WENT TO YARD HOUSE, AN ANGEL HAD FALLEN AND NAMED ME, DEBRA*My guy and I decided to have dinner and drinks at Yard House on a Monday night... We arrived and already see a jampacked house.. (not a good sign)The wait: 3 hours. WHOA. *And this is when the angel appeared*Her: "Are you looking for a table for two?"Me: "yes"Her: "Tonight, you are Debra.." (hands me her electronic buzzer and quickly left)Me: *sorta astounded; took the buzzer and said "thanks"**ninuninuninu*BUZZER LIGHTS UP...Oh.. to be Debra....Thank You, love!!!! It wasn't even a 5 minute wait for us.Oh...what luck can do. If i had seen a better parking spot, and came there sooner...if i had not straightened my hair before my date....if i had not decided to switch shoes after being in my car ready to leave home.. the series of events would have been different. And I would have been disappointed and cranky....and i would not have met Debra and her buzzzer. (okay, 'her buzzer' sounds just wrong but you know what i mean) It was FATE.The place was packed with cheering Sharks fans...we were seated on a booth with TVs in all angles of our table....Our server handed us the menu...and dove right in into picking our beer orders. That beer menu is amazing.. But what's not amazing is that they were down 20 taps that night..and the ones that my guy and i wanted were out... Our server was courteous enough to let us know though..and was really apologetic for it.For our entrees: (we decided not to order appetizers coz we didn't wanna be too full for beer) - We came here for BEER.And that being said, i just ordered...*NY Steak Salad: The portion is good. The meat was good...but it wasn't medium rare as i requested. The menu description said there were beefsteak tomatoes and fried pickled egg...which was nowhere to be found on my plate.*NY Steak Sandwich: for him. Okay. so I've never seen a sandiwch with roasted full round tomatoes. ROUND. Like not even sliced. He wasn't too whoa'd with it....As for service... I'm telling you right now.. If you have "impatience" flowing in your bloodstream...don't go here just yet... wait for the hype to die down a little bit and do not go on a Sharks night..maybe a Warriors night or a Giants night too... Getting our food took forever... Getting our shots took forever..and our beer...One technique for major drinkers on a busy night: As you get your beer, order your next choice... Chances are, you're already almost done with the first and the next is already there.. But that can be a good thing if you want to pace yourself down too.Must try for the ladies: Speakeasy White Lightning -really light, and doesn't leave an aftertaste. Man, were we hammered after that...I'd definitely come back for more BEER!!!

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Yard House at least a dozen times, but have never been fortunate to score a table since the wait is usually a good 2 hours so we usually just meet up for drinks there.  To order off the menu, you need to have a table so my history with YH has always been in alcoholic form.  Tonight we scored a table and it was in a pretty prime location where you can totally scope out all the beautiful, pretentious people (me excluded) in the 408.   To go along with our drinks, we started off with the Grilled Sweet Korean BBQ Beef as the appetizer and added the Ahi Crunchy salad and Miso Glazed Seabass.  The Korean beef was boneless so eating it was effortless.  Doesn't look good when you're sitting in a prime spot knawing on ribs while ripping them off the bone with your incisors.  This was much more elegant.Soon the Ahi salad and the seabass came out.  Oh my  freaking Lord!  This was the BEST Ahi I've ever had!!!  No lie.  It was seared to absolute perfection.  It was sooo tender and the smoky peppery aroma with a hint of sesame just gave me an oral orgasm that I came inside my own mouth but because it was so yummy I reswallowed it.  LOL!  Now I'm not much of a salad person, but I found myself shoveling monsterous amounts in my mouth even though I was stuffed to the gills after devouring the seabass and bok choy which was also cooked to perfection.  Our awesome waiter was super attentive and kept checking up on us numerous times but not at an annoying rate.  For a brewery, this place rocks!  Their food is reasonably priced yet the quality is top notch.  I wonder if my opinion was skewed while intoxicated?  Ok...as far as I can remember, YH is deserving of 5 stars in terms of food, drinks, and service.  Eye candy was free.

Reviews.Author: Ricky N.
Reviews.Content: What's BJ's Brewery? Hmm yeah, after you've had a taste of Yard House, you won't forget it! It sh*t's on all other restaurant and bar/brewerys.Their food is top notch, along with the great service. Prices are decent and portions are huge. Nothing I've tried let me down and always comes out full of flavor, hot, and GONE in 60 seconds.So let's talk BEER, BEER, BEER. If you don't drink beer, its ok... they have options! Like alcoholic cider or framboise. They also do mixes which are actually addictive concoctions of beer and cider which bring a slightly sweet but crisp taste to your tongue.Come here for happy hour and truly take advantage of what they have to offer. Spoil yourself and get a lil drizzy drunk, a half-yard won't hurt. Or will it? Don't drink and drive!!

Reviews.Author: Derek S.
Reviews.Content: Yard House has definitely come downhill after the grand opening last year. The highlight of every visit continues to be the scenery of the employees in full Yard House uniform.Wait time on weekends, especially evenings can be long...up to 2 hours...Food has gone from okay to mediocre. Prices have also gone up...by quite a bit.Came by most recently to try their crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes had too much breading, didn't taste like crab, and wasn't fresh...no good.Moved on to the turkey pot pie that came out with a 12" puff pastry shell...aye aye aye. The 12" was mainly the puff pastry only... The pot pie was more of a turkey salad soup with chunks of overcooked and dry turkey and half-cooked vegetables...yuck.The experience is unique with a unique clientele that Santana Row attracts. The Sports Bar tries to be upscale with their numerous beers on tap and multiple TV screens scattered throughout the dining area.Food: 2 starsScenery: 4 stars

Reviews.Author: Chena N.
Reviews.Content: Came on a Friday evening with a party of 5 and was seated within 15 minutes. Friends were heading to a Beyonce concert in San Jose so we decided to stop by for dinner. This reminded me of something in between Cheesecake Factory and BJ's. HAPPY HOUR 5-7pm WHOOOOOOOO! We got half off of appetizers and some drinks! I shared three appetizers with a friend and we tried other dishes from our fellow diners. We had a total of about 8 dishes for the 5 of us... -___- We went A LITTLE crazy there....Hawaiian Poke Stack: Marinated raw ahi with crispy wontons, carrots, bean sprouts, avocado, wasabi soy sauce. *face palm*, did not read description that it was raw... So i couldnt eat it.... but my friend said it was pretty fresh and tasted good.yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Chicken Garlic Noodles: 3 stars. Finely chopped chicken, asparagus, spinach, shiitake mushrooms, smoked tofu, parmesan & edamame. Flavors were a bit too bland for me... I liked the ones from Kickin' Crab more... However, it was still a delight to eat. yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Grilled Korean BBQ Short Ribs: 4.5 stars. Marinated boneless short ribs over jasmine or brown rice with korean vegetable salad, green onions! I LOVED this dish. I was supposed to be sharing, but I caught myself constantly picking up slices of tender ribs one after another. For once, I had to be a monster and put away selflessness! It was absolute heaven in my mouth. yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Margarita Pizza: 3 stars. Pepperoni pizza! I thought it was ok... nothing special about it. Something about the cheese was off for me though. It was a bit rubbery, which is something I hate in cheese. yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Spinach Cheese Dip: 3.5 stars. Baked with feta, jack, parmesan & cream cheese served with crispy flatbread. i loved the texture and saltiness on the flat bread and it contoured the dip well. yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Truffle Fries: 2.5 stars. Shredded parmesan & herbs covered the thinly sliced fries. I've had better ones from Umami. The fries were thin here, however, it wasnt entirely covered with the cheese and herbs. I only found a minute amount on top. yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Parmesan Crusted Chicken: 3.5 stars. The cheese crusted chicken floated on top of garlic mashed potatoes with sun-dried tomato three mushroom sauce. I loved the crunch on the chicken and it was very tasty with the sauce! yelp.com/biz_photos/yard…Our waiter was very cute. No, I was not checking him out. I meant that in a way where he looked like those tough guys, but he was a softie on the inside. We were intimidated by him when he took our orders, but he was really nice throughout our stay and he was funny. They allowed us to use as many cards as we wanted and separated the bill for us! Great service! However, I would only come here for happy hour because it is quite expensive! Good once in a while splurge location conveniently located in Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I don't really get what the hype about this place is all about. When I walked inside Yard House today and the first time before, I admit that the setup and appearance of the place was gorgeous, as well as spacious. There are many booths to sit at, unless you'd like to dine at a small table for two with those tall, skinny chairs. Also, the bar is set up at the middle of the restaurant and is very well-packed on those busy Friday, Saturday, and Sunday nights.The workers are nice, but I feel that they are a bit too "chill". I do love chill workers, don't get me wrong. It makes them easy to talk to and I find that I have so many more things to talk with them about. However, I'm a bit worried what other people may think. When I sat down, the server literally "threw" the coasters at me in a frisbee fashion. Honestly, I thought it was pretty funny, but I'm pretty sure somebody would take that the wrong way, such as crappy service skills. Also, the server helped my table out, but he didn't really take a liking to one of my friends and I feel that he intentionally skipped on refilling her water but asked the rest of my friends when her half-empty glass was right in front of him. Furthermore, before all of this happened when I attempted to be seated for a table of five, the hostess told me to wait patiently, but I felt that they were also acting "chill". I feel that all of the workers could improve on the etiquette and mannerisms when it comes to handling customers because although I didn't mind their "chillness", I feel that others may label them as sloppy or uncaring.I feel that the prices are pretty high, but then again, it is Santana Row. You have to pay a lot to eat fancy, and by golly, this place looks fancy to me! Also, I thought the food was just alright. I honestly didn't really feel that the food there was too special, and I'd rather eat at a similar place for cheaper such as BJ's.Probably won't go here again unless a friend drags me. But don't let my review stop you from trying this place! I feel that I'm just very opinionated against this place when it doesn't deserve it.

Reviews.Author: Tram N.
Reviews.Content: We dined around 2PM, yes, I did say around 2PM because Amy C., the cool Yelper I met awhile back did not have lunch yet!  Like me, we like to eat and try new and different restaurants and eateries.  We meet up like once a month to try and cross one off of our bookmarks off.When she mentioned, "Santana Row" I thought of Yard House automatically because it had recently opened and I have been DYING to go there.  Of course I am no drinker and that's what Yard House is known for.. hella beers.. hella alcohol selections period.  I was more infatuated w/ their menus.. from snacks to appetizers to side salads to main salads, soups, vegetarian offerings, meat and poultry offerings, seafood (though I don't care for seafood), their burgers and sandwiches, and their favorites on the menu... oh, and of course the dessert.Don't be fooled.. when you come in before 5PM, go towards the back of the menu to see their lunch specials.. $8.95 for a half order of certain pizzas and sandwiches, a side salad, and for $1.25 you can add fries.  This was appealing to me for 2 reasons: cost and portion control *diet*I forgot to mention that I was THRILLED when I was told that they can make me a mudslide.. excited counted every second that passed by until the glass was placed on my table on the coaster... it was not sweet, definitely not strong (the ones at Chili's and D&B and Claim Jumper are strong) so I was sipping happily whilst gossiping about girl stuff.. boys, food, boys, and of course more food.  Amy ordered the turkey melt, French onion soup, added fries but she upgraded to truffle fries.  I ordered the grilled pastrami sandwich, salad (no croutons, no cheese), and I did not order fries.. I was quite proud of myself to say the very least.  Minutes went by and our lovely plates of presentation was brought out.. very cute and very single-serving-like!  I like!  I like!  Although my mind liked it, my tummy wanted more (haha).  My grilled pastrami was juicy and tasty.. seriously.. very YUMMY.. I finished every single crumb.. the salad was good and I unfortunately I can't comment on the truffle fries but based on service, speed, extensive of the menu.. this place is AWESOME in my book and I will go back again to try the other dishes.  Oh and if you check out their website, you can see the nutrition value but I must warn you.. do not look at it or else you might opt to go elsewhere..  The bar area is HUGE and lots of TVs mounted on the wall.  Can I say that this place is great for sports watching?  Oh, hell-to-the-yes!  I need to come here to watch my Sharks play while enjoying my mudslide as well as a fattening appetizer and a fattening entree which will follow by a fattening ass dessert..

Reviews.Author: Loren John B.
Reviews.Content: Let's get one thing straight, I have been waiting for the day when they finally opened up north. One of the things I missed about living in SoCal were the restaurants, especially this place. 3 years later, at least one restaurant decided to follow me back up north. Well, Five Guys eventually made its way here, but thats another story. I got into the soft opening by emailing corporate headquarters and asking for an invite. They online rep emailed me back shortly, and even honored my request to add a +4 to my name for their guestlist. The private event lasted from 5-8, and I regret showing up at 7! Bah, but I had a good experience for my first soft opening party. After checking in at the entrance, the hostess handed out 2 free drink vouchers per person, which was good for at least til 830pm. The space inside is pretty reasonable, just like the other Yard Houses that I have been to. But wow, people were all over the place. Waiters were everywhere offering samples of their appetizers. I got to try the chicken penne pasta, blue crab cakes, Hawaiian pizza, korean bbq beef, and creme brulee. Best part was being able to take as much as you wanted. I've only had their sandwiches and burgers here, but all of appetizers I sampled were cooked just right. Honestly, my favorite was the creme brulee, and prior to last night, I've never had it before. Later on when the restaurant was open to the public, I had a turkey melt. Wasn't too greasy, a little spicy (which was nice), and  a generous serving of french fries. The only about getting a lot of samples was already having a beer in your hand and not having a table. I'll get to the latter in a bit. Having over 100+ beers on tap, its truly like being a kid in a candy store. My first drink was Leinenkugel's sunset wheat. Its my favorite beer of all time, probably because it tastes like fruity pebbles. For my second drink, I asked for a recommendation for someone who likes Blue Moon and sunset wheat, and the bartender suggested a Speakeasy beer, which is based out of San Francisco. Liked the taste, but it was a subtle version of what I was seeking. Anyway, 2 beers down, 120-something to go. So as I said earlier, place was packed. I probably waited over 2 hours til I finally ended up at a table, but that required a lot of roaming around to see if people were leaving. You know, just like looking for parking when you're at the mall during the holiday season. I did however, enjoy the service. Friendly waiters, reasonable service, and attentive bartenders made the experience of waiting for tables a lot better though. Judging from the way things went, I plan on being a regular here. Happy hour here I come. Waits will probably be ridiculous for awhile, but I can understand why. Welcome to the Bay Area Yard House!

Reviews.Author: Wan W.
Reviews.Content: The experience was good at the first couple times here with my friends for happy hour before, but not for the 3rd time, if I could rate zero stars I would.When we signed up at the wait list at 5:10, we were told to wait for about 40 minutes. I looked at my watch then said, the happy hour would be over at that moment as I know it's till 6:00pm from Mon to Fri. But the waitress said, you should get in by then.  Then we decided to wait. When we sat down, it was 6:00pm. It took me about 5 minutes to look at the menu, and when we were going to order happy hour's menu, we were told it was over already. And we told the waiter what we'd been told when we signed up to wait. Then the waiter asked who said that to us, we didn't pay attention to that waitress' name. Later, the supervisor came up, and spoke loudly to us that nobody here would promise or guarantee what time you could get a table, no way. It was like we wanted to take advantage of it. Despite how we explained, that supervisor (she) kept saying blah blah loudly. We got very mad about that type of attitude and decided to leave. And I WILL DEFINITELY SHARE THIS STORY WITH ALL MY FRIENDS, FAMILIES AND COMPANY COWORKERS ABOUT 200 ~ 300 PEOPLE. Don't and NEVER choose here for happy hour or party lunch/dinner or any company activities. At lease for my side, they do lose the business already. All my FB friends, please read this review first before you decide to go YH in future!!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly A.
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of Yardhouse since I lived in Southern California, and eagerly awaited the arrival of its new branch in my hometown. Being located in Santana Row, the feel and decor of this location is more trendy and high tech. You can see the metal tubing to the beer tanks upstairs and there are tons of TVs all around. This place is always packed- so don't come unless you are ready to wait at least 60-90 minutes! & forget about waiting at the bar... those slots are always full too. However, I do enjoy the food more than your typical brewery or chain restaurant, and the menu for alcoholic drinks & food is so extensive I never get bored! The best improvement Yardhouse has made is serving Gardein vegetarian "meat"!!!!! They have fake chicken & beef so no longer do I have to choose between 1 of 2 vegetarian items on a menu or pay the full price for something that has the meat taken out. I can have anything I want & sub in my vegetarian protein! Their Gardein "chicken" is tasty, & they grill it wonderfully. My favorite dishes here are the garlic noodles, deviled eggs, truffle fries, & the BBQ "chicken" salad.

Reviews.Author: Ashley T.
Reviews.Content: The star of Yard House is BEER!BEER, BEER, BEER! What other reason do you have to come here? Seriously?I've tried about a dozen of the beers. I can't remember them all by name but what's the point? Im not done trying them all.. And well if I saw the menu, I know which beer I last tried. I love their brown ale, rogue hazelnut brown nectar! I recommend you to try it if you like dark beers and hazelnut. Another one of my favorite beers is a blended beer, eclipse. It's a combination of blue moon and guiness stout. It looks pretty cool in a half yard, there's one distinct layer of blue moon and another layer of guiness, but when you drink it you get the mix of both. Fruity beers aren't on the top of my list but there are a few good ones and I've tried a lot of them because... my friend's like them a lot.-The Sea Dog Bluepaw Wild Blueberry is delicious, they usually run out of this. Taste like blue moon with blueberries.-Another one that is quite popular is Timmerman's Strawberry that taste like strawberry cider. They won't serve this to you in the half yard because it has a higher alcohol content. -Lost Coast Apricot wheat, it taste like a sweet wheat with light hints of apricot. -If you like floats you should try lindeman's framboisewith vanilla ice cream. Taste like raspberry soda float and it will get you buzzed. -My favorite fruity beer is probably going to be Rose Gaarden, it's a blended beer that combines hoegaarden white and lindeman's framboise. Everyone think's it taste like a fruity pebble beer. Their food is usually too salty for me. I do love that they have a whole vegetarian/vegan section. I have my days where I like to eat vegetarian. -Shrimp ceviche spoons are one of the few things I like to snack on here, fresh and zesty.Small portion enough for just one person.-Seared Ahi Sashimi was a disappointment compared to the one I tried in Vegas. It was way too salty and the texture was really dry all of the times I ordered it.-Chinese garlic noodles are good but over salted. I usually share this, it  is made with thin noodles, shitake mushrooms, garlic, parmesan cheese, and oil. -Onion ring towers are a must, they're probably the only things on the appetizer menu that is made without excess salt.-Blue crab cakes can be skipped. They don't use fresh blue crab and it taste more like a croquette than a creamy crab cake. -If you order the california roll, it's probably something you aren't expecting. It's a single california roll blown up to the size of your fist. If you really like california rolls, you'll like this. It can get bland and gross after a while. Ask for sriracha if you like spicy-Hawaiian poke stack is okay, generic poke stack. It's a deal during happy hour.- The classic ranch appetizer salad is probably my favorite salad to get. The classic ranch salad has the whole shabang, not just iceberg lettuce and ranch dressing. Who drinks beer and eats salad? ME! It helps rehydrate me after drinking all those beers.-Veggie truffle oil mac and cheese. THUMBS UP! Rich cheesy goodness with fragrance of truffle oil, topped with bread crumbs. Share this, you won't be able to finish it. Oh and don't forget a beer. It's a heavy dish.-Veggie boneless wings are really good to snack on. It taste like the real thing. I swear. I get buffalo sauce and it's kind of salty but that's okay if I have an ice cold beer by my side.-Ahi sliders are very interesting and a must try. I felt like it was a bit salty, like everything else on their menu but the sliders were still tasty. When I took my first bite, I got a big burst of the juicy tomato and ahi tuna. It was so good, but when I got to my third one I was full. They come with a side of shoe string fries.Sorry for the long review, I've been here way too many times. Since I've been here so often, I concluded that their hospitality is outstanding but the waiter always goes on a long haitus. No matter what server you get. If you want your beer fast, just walk up to the bar and pay there. Otherwise, expect to wait 10 minutes for just your beer to come around. I usually come during happy hour and the wait to be seated is usually 20 minutes. Dinner time calls for a longer wait... 1-2 hours. Their happy hour is a total steal half off beers and select appetizers!

Reviews.Author: Nicole D.
Reviews.Content: Came in to grab some appetizers at the Yard House after strolling along Santana Row last weekend. I went with my YH faves -- the Lobster, Artichoke and Spinach Dip served with pita bread and chips, the Trufffle Fries with parmesan and garlic and the Hawaiian Ahi Poke Stack with colorful tiers of ahi, shredded carrots, wonton crisps and fresh avocado slices. I really enjoy the festive atmosphere coupled with the delicious eclectic fare. I've relished every dish, dessert and drink that I've ordered from the Yard House. Service is always outstanding and the servers are very personable and hard working. Really wish there was one in the Monterey area. A quick jaunt up to Santana Row always works for me too. Don't forget to check out their great lunch specials offered from 12 - 5 daily.

Reviews.Author: Prince A.
Reviews.Content: good enough, but very cool now.food, service, and taste - good.enough TVs, lots of space to sit, but busy.Host service - terrible, awesful rude, rushed, confused, and arrogant.bar service is terrific and friendly, table service very goodWhat is attraction: meat market.

Reviews.Author: Lu W.
Reviews.Content: There's a bit of nostalgia for me with Yard House. I've been a regular at the Pasadena Yard House since maybe 2004. I'm glad it finally opened in San Jose. My friend and I found ourselves in a huge crowd Saturday night. My friend, a marketing guru, told me that Santana Row enjoy the most foot traffic in the entire Silicon Valley. Little wonder this place was so packed on the opening weekend. Fortunately this place features a ginormous space and a huge bar, so we actually managed to find two stools to sit on. The staff was definitely on top of it all the time. Comparing to Rosie Mcanns, which we had just come from, the bartenders left themselves no slack to refill your thirst. There was no sign of Grand Opening Chaos. A well organized launch is tramendouly important, as most SV entrepreneurs are well aware.Yard Houses always have pretty interesting food. As anti-Asian fusion as I am, I actually don't mind at all a splash of Asian flavor in their dishes. I actually didn't eat at this new one, but I peeked over to some other people's food, and they look sensational.This of course doesn't solve Sanata Row's traffic and parking issues. Someone probably didn't forsee the incredible popularity of Santana Row, or overestimated South Bay's otherwise sterile nightlife, finding parking around here usually takes longer than driving to this place. Unless you don't mind dropping a Hamilton for a valet, that is.

Reviews.Author: Nathalie V.
Reviews.Content: - 2.5 hour-wait- One order of Truffle Fries with shredded parmesan and herbs- One order of Mac 'n Cheese chicken breast, applewood bacon, wild mushrooms, cheddar, parmesan, campanelle pasta & truffle oil- One order of Roasted Turkey Pot Pie carrots, leeks, onions, celery & fresh herbs encrusted in puff pastry- A couple of beersWas is it worth the time and moola?Wait, no.  Moola, yes.  I'll definitely be back for the Truffle Fries and Turkey Pot Pie.

Reviews.Author: Birdy H.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner with my friends last night.  The YardHouse to me is just like any other place. Nothing special. I ordered the Jambalaya.  DONT make the same mistake I did. It was under par! The best thing we had last night was the fries and our beers! Poor waiter, he came by to ask me if I was satisfied with my Jambalaya and I decided to put my poker face on and tell him how everything was just horrible! (Originally, the guy brought me my food but no utensils and walked away, was he expecting me to eat with my hands?) He offered to bring me another dish and I told him I couldn't subject my mouth to another disappointing dish.. ( you should've seen the look on his face - Priceless)...  everyone at my table was just listening and looking at me and the waiter... they all thought I was serious!!  The waiter was silent and didn't know what else to say... I started laughing and told him, "I'm just giving you a hard time!".. everyone started laughing. The waiter smiled and said, "You've got an awesome POKER FACE!" hahaha. What I like: -It reminds me of my young days growing up and chilling with friends in Socal. -the drinks -The Fries-People watching What I don't like: -The attempt of their Asian Fusion dishes... SMH. Just stick to the American food you make. -The long wait. Happy Eating.

Reviews.Author: Chuck N.
Reviews.Content: Get a pen out and start writing your obituaries - yes you: BJ's, DNB, Gordon Biersch & all those other food/happy hour/beer/bar hangout places. Your time is up.Yard House is centered in the perfect location facing Valley Fair and for all driving down Steven's Creek Blvd to see.** Just know that you'll wait at least 1-2 hours for a table, and because of the fire capacity, even if you have a table, if you leave, you might not be able to get back in (I had to wait in line 15 minutes to re-enter my own tables). Think of it like a nightclub, though no ratio required like Vegas :) **The service was mixed. My friends were told their table would be there in about 1.5 hours, but it took one party an hour, the other party 2 hours, and another 2.5 hours. The waiters and staff are very friendly and 5 stars to them, but one table it took one whole hour to get our beers and shots, another took 10 minutes. That's semi-ridiculous. The food did come fast, fresh, and tasty!Truffle fries - $3.95 for buttery, truffle infused string fries that are really good if you like the greasy, sweet type of fries. Expect to visit your cardiologist after though.Beers $4-7- over 150 on tap with yardlongs and the sort.Mojitos $9 - barely any alcohol, don't order cocktails here, they are really watered down and made quickly because of the huuuuuge lines at the bar, get shots / beers instead.Mac n Cheese House Special $17 - delicious! Truffle mushrooms, wild bacon, white meat chicken, a blend of cheeses. Oh my it was good in small quantity, I shared it with a friend and it was really good, though not quite worth $17.Thai Spicy Chicken Pizza $12 - my new goto dish here! I'll be back for it. 11 inches long (so good for 2 people with 8 slices) flatbread pizza that has really good thai chicken and spices on top. Put some tabasco on it and you're good to go.Definitely check it out, though go early, save a table and walk around Santana Row / Valley Fair while you wait.I wouldn't come here in the evenings like a lounge though as the non beer / shot drinks aren't that good and the line is long and you can't dance and the music isn't great either. I'll be coming here often for food / midday hangout / late night happy hour Sunday - Wed only though.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia D.
Reviews.Content: I came for the beer.I stayed for the beer.All else is irrelevant.

Reviews.Author: Stacey L.
Reviews.Content: Yay for Yard house finally being open in Santana Row! I've been hearing many comparisons of BJ's to this place but BJ's doesn't even come close in the quality of food nor the copious beer selections (130 on tap!) here. I'm not a huge beer fan but if you fruitier flavors, try the strawberry or blueberry ones. The venue is also huge and the ambiance is quite nice and fit for everyone.Came here for lunch on a Friday and the wait wasn't too bad considering it had just opened and we had a group of 8. However when we got there, we learned that although you cannot make reservations, you can call in advance to be put on a wait list for groups of 6+, something we will keep in mind for next time.The food is solid quality but a bit on the pricier. My friend and I split a lobster crab artichoke dip appetizer which I HIGHLY recommend. I've never had seafood in my artichoke dip before. it came with some tortilla chips and lots of pita triangles as well. Everyone's appetizers came out in a timely manner but the reason I won't give this place 5 stars is because of the loooooong wait for food. Had  we known the wait for food was so lengthy, we probably would have not even sat down. Most of the people ordered burgers, sandwiches, or salads and while they were all very good, it took about 45 minutes before all of the food came AFTER the appetizers arrived. Another qualm I have with the service is that they would not cut our burger in half even though my friend and I wanted to share. Their reasoning for that? "Our chefs want to focus on the presentation of the entrees so they don't want to mess it up by cutting it in half." Well I mean it's a freaking burger, how presentable should it be?! We got the avocado swiss burger and it was basically slices of avocado, melted swiss cheese on top of the patty, with all the veggie fixings on the side of it (refer to my picture). Um, okay? Some 'presentation' that was...  Don't get me wrong, the food was tasty but the wait for food was a bit ridiculous and how they refused to cut it in half. I can forgive the fact that they're newly opened but had it been an established restaurant of a couple of months, that wouldn't sit well with me and I'd be more inclined to give them 3 stars instead. I have to come back for happy hour sometime and update my review with it!

Reviews.Author: Nguyen L.
Reviews.Content: Dinner and Happy Hour at this place is just too much. Long waits and the overcrowded bars lead to just slow service. However when I was there on a Sunday afternoon the place was perfect. Place was mostly filled but you can still find a seat at the bar or get a table right away. I didn't remember that the food here was all that great but most of the things we ordered on this day was great.Yummy:Truffle Fries- crunchy shoestring fries with Parmesan & herbsHawaiian Poke StackHawaiian Burger - juicy and very tasty. Carnitas TacoBaja Fish TacoFirecracker RibsLove to hangout at this place but only when the wait isn't two hours!

Reviews.Author: Diana L.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 hour wait for a table with a 1 hour wait just to get a buzzer. The bar area was so packed it wasn't even worth fighting through for a beer. Maybe we'll try this place in a couple months when the hype had died down and the wait is more reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Gabe W.
Reviews.Content: Ahhh Yard House, the only establishment that lets me precariously duel my friends with tall glasses of beer.  As we swing these slender half yards like warhammers at each other's heads, frightening patrons and staff alike, we swig a bit from the top with each mighty blow.  No seriously.Every time I come here, I make it a mission to drink my own height in hoppy inebriation and fight as many Irishmen as I can.  Yes it's a challenge, but god damnit I'm a man and such manly work must be done with my own two hairy, gnarled, muscular hands.   Just kidding, I'm Asian: I don't have any hair.But seriously, how can one not love a place that has well over 100 choices of bubbly beer swirling above one's head in pipes like a Drunk WIlly Wonka's Chocolate Factory?  How can you beat the somewhat affordable happy hour and large Bearnaise slider platters?  Sweet potato fries with maple bacon dip?  Oh Lord of Cholesterol and Heart Attacks take me now!Downsides are that it gets packed during happy hour; like a large Filipino family in an Mazda MPV (Mini Pinoy Vehicle as my friend likes to call it).  Luckily sweet drunk debauchery still can be attained standing at the bar area so one can be suitably sloshed before seating!Recommended Beers:For the Wominz:  Honey Blonde, Strawberry Blonde, Lost Coast Apricot, Sea Dog Blueberry, any Belgian FruitsFor the Menz: Boddingtons, Kilkenny Irish Cream, Young's Double Chocolate, House Hef, Arrogant Bastard, Magic Hat #9 (Might not be in the San Jose one).TL;DRWilly Wonka's Drunk-tastic Draught Depot!

Reviews.Author: Natalia R.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere.  The server was very nice and kept checking up on us. We went for happy hour which they have during all football games so that was nice. We had the spinach dip (a lot of spinach very good), calamari (very good flavor), classic sliders (a bit dry but good over all). We also ordered a tall beer and a pineapple express which were very good.  Over all it was a good experience would deff come back and recommend.

Reviews.Author: Marina C.
Reviews.Content: Went for early happy hour with co-workers. Food was great, service was great until the waitress spilled 2 martini's on my back, my new coat and my co-worker sitting next to me!She was very apologetic but I was still very angry and smelling like vodka!The mess was cleaned up and we expected the manager to come over and apologize, no one ever came!So, we thought ok, they're surely going to comp something on our bill, NOTHING!As a matter of fact, they overcharged us on the happy hour drinks, which should have cost $6, they charged us $7.75!At this point we are paying the bill and finally ask for the manager to come over to our table.The general manager comes over and says, 'we normally do this, and that" which none of it was done for us, it was frustrating!He then asked me for my address and phone number? I gave him my contact information and says to bring him my dry cleaning receipt so that they can refund me the amount!! Are you freakin kidding me!!! WOW who does that??!!!So infuriating my co-worker wanted to part of this, I said can't we just get a gift card or something? he said he's not authorized! REALLY!! ?? the General Manager NOT authorized to give out a freakin $20 gift card, the least they could do since they didn't comp'd anything on our bill.3 weeks later I have never received a call or anything in the mail......WORST experience with management at such an upscale establishment EVER!!Horrible experience!Marina

Reviews.Author: Todd C.
Reviews.Content: My first experience at a Yard House is the one on Lewers Street in Honolulu - I was hoping this one would transport me back to that lovely place!It didn't do that, unfortunately; there is simply no way of hiding the fact that this location is on a busy intersection at the end of Santana Row.However, four stars for beer selection and food. I love the huge open space for people watching as well - tons of eye candy here last Friday! I got the vegetarian sliders with fries. Could have done without the fries or maybe subbed something but the five sliders were very good, I thoroughly enjoyed them. Having Speakeasy Double Daddy IPA on tap was a great find, love it!I wish I lived closer. That's a long drive from Dublin especially after filling up on food. Luckily it's a nice place to walk around after eating and drinking, Santana Row always has something happening (I checked out the new Tesla Motors store this time).

Reviews.Author: Tracy T.
Reviews.Content: I made the effort to finally try to ignore the fact that there will be at least a 45 minute wait on a weekend day to come to finally experience the first Yard House in the bay with one goal in mind... to try their famous Timmerman's Strawberry beer. I placed an order for a globlet size (only size available for this beer) and to my surprise, the waiter tells me they ran out minutes after I have placed my order. What the efff, man!!! Did I just wait 30 minutes to be disappointed. Okay I decide to push my disappointment aside and try something else in hopes that their food will wow me....- Lindemans Framboise: The waiter convinced me that this one was another sweet beer aside form the strawberry, so I agree to this as a replacement. Again, globlet size available only. To my surprise, it wasn't bad at all and it was very good. Tart, sweet, and like raspberry cider.-Truffle fries: DELICIOUS and probably the best appetizer on the menu! Think thinly sliced fries with truffle oil, tasted like garlic fries topped with  parmesan cheese. I think I can eat a whole bowl to myself. Portion size is quite small, but what can you expect for $3.95?-Calimari: breaded to perfection and came with marinara and tartar sauce. Typical, but I like calamari when it is fully coated and breaded. - BBQ Burger and Avocado Burger: soggy buns and burnt burgers. Skip! - Chicken Garlic Noodles: chicken, asparagus, spinach, shiitake mushrooms, tiny pieces of  tofu, parmesan and edamame. I loved the mixture of vegetables in this dish, but I didn't taste any garlic at all. Wait consisted of putting down my name, waiting for 20 minutes to come back to get a pager and getting seated within 5-10 minutes on a Sunday. Not bad, but food did not impress me. I would come here for HH drinks and appetizers only. I shall be back for Strawberry beer and truffle fries!!!

Reviews.Author: Alina N.
Reviews.Content: - 1-1.5 hour wait weather lunch or dinner; I've been during both. - Large variety of beer, love the yard long glass that they're known for; very cool.- Every dish I've tried has been average, but last night I had the Mac n Cheese in truffle oil and it was a delightful change. Delicious; I highly recommend it. Big portions so I took half home for lunch the next day and was completely full off the left overs too. - We had a huge complicated party that just kept growing as we ran into more and more people and our party of 8 grew to around 20 and our waitress handled it very well. - Cool place to be seen but it's over priced.

Reviews.Author: Krissie B.
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here last night. When I lived in Vegas, I'd go to Town Square and Yard House was a great drinking destination or pre-drink spot before going up to Blue Martini, however I wasn't too impressed with the food.It was a different case at the Santana Row location, thankfully!I came here with my finally-of-drinking-age cousin after drinks at Blowfish. We were both starving and I decided on the Sliders (with Bearnaise). I absolutely LOVE anything Bearnaise and this was no exception. I got a hearty portion of 4 good-sized sliders with onion straws which came with fries. My cousin got the much talked about Macaroni & Cheese. I love truffle oil and the subtlety of the flavoring with the bold wild mushrooms was such a treat. Both entrees were delicious and like any good Filipino, we took our leftovers home, haha. Drink-wise, we chose to go with their fruity Belgian choices. I had the  Lambic (Framboise flavor) and my cousin had the Timmerman's Strawberry. I always order the Lambic at BJ's Brewery so no surprises there. I really liked the Timmerman's so I believe I'll be ordering that next time! On top of the great food and drinks, our server Tom was extremely accomodating even though we came 10 minutes before last call for food. He never rushed us but we tried to be quick so as not to keep him. He gave great recommendations and his service was top notch. I'll be back again and again!

Reviews.Author: miss b.
Reviews.Content: OH HELL TO THE NO!!! These are my observations on the people at the Yard House: Ladies, please stop wearing outfits that make you look like hookers in order to get attention. Gentleman, stop staring at those ladies because your attention makes them dress that way!Why was everyone dressed up there? Like it was some fancy ass place? Please. It's not. Overall, the atmosphere was not impressive. The coolest thing was the piping that led the beer down to the tap. And it looked like the place had a roof. Maybe that should be opened up because it was way too effing crowded in there!The Beer:Wide variety. Okay that's great. I'll give them a star for that. However, some of these beers on tap really should have been in bottles. Make room for some beers that are unique for the tap. Bartender, please make sure that the glass for my New Castle is cold. And don't talk crap to the other bartenders about who knows what. You lost customers. So, if you want to see a bunch of hoes and bros, feel claustrophobic, and not be served beer properly, the Yard House is the place for you!

Reviews.Author: Dano G.
Reviews.Content: If you like hanging out with assholes, hangout at Santana Row. This is the only down point of the Yard House at this location. Otherwise, this Yard House is just like all the locations I have to before in Southern California.They have every beer imaginable on tap, and you can see all the kegs on display through windows up top.The service for the grand opening was great. The food is typical for a alcohol-themed restaurant.It was super crowded and was the super south bay asian who's-who convention for the opening day.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: After a day in Santa Cruz and San Jose, our friends, whom we were visiting took us out to Yardhouse for dinner and drinks. Yardhouse is known for their vast selection of beer - I think they had over 114 - and their huge beer glasses, called yards. You can see the huge pipes on the ceiling that have the beer in them!Along with their huge selection of beer, they also had tons of food options. Going to any place known for beer, I tend to order beer-battered anything, so I went for the beer-battered fish and chips. The fish was perfectly fried and you could actually taste the beer batter. The french fries were okay, a bit disappointing, but I ate them anyway. The boy ordered the chicken strips with fries and he loved the sauces that came with the strips, his favorite was the honey-mustard.Our friends split a salad and a burger and they seemed to enjoy both. The boy's roommate ordered the blue crab sandwich and he loved it, he said the crab was very fresh.Service was great! Our server was very attentive and knowledgable about the different beers that they had on tap and always kept our drinks filled and asked if we wanted another round.I don't know about the other dining options in Santana Row but Yardhouse is a great choice. With tons of beer on tap and a variety of delicious food, you can't go wrong! p.s. Great spot to watch a Sharks game!

Reviews.Author: Jen J.
Reviews.Content: This was my second time dining here in over a year. I see it as a special occassion place to dine. My first time was during lunch hour and we did have to wait about 30 minutes for a table for 3. This time, there were 6 of us for dinner around 8pm and we had to wait over an hour and a half. Although it seemed long, I was having my first drink from the bar just to pass boredom. That helped a little. I wish they had some seating for people waiting for a table, and possibly, a stage with live music or a dj so I wouldn't have to give dirty looks to the customers already eating having a great time. We finally got seated at a spacious booth, big enough for at least 6-8 people max. Our waiter was the same guy from my first time dining here .Weird. I ordered jambalaya.. It was sooo good. Its not comparable to the Cheesecake factory's jambalaya, but it worked. Our waiter brought out a complimentary dessert for our birthday celebrant. Overall, I had a great night, with great service, great food, and great company.

Reviews.Author: Nathan P.
Reviews.Content: Why haven't I yelped this place yet? must've slipped my mindThe best part of Yardhouse is Happy Hour. Go right after work or check out reverse happy hour on Friday nites to spend time with your friends.Beers to start off with:-Rosegaardens are favorites. I always hear people ordering those.-Eclipse -if you like Blue moon this is an interesting mix-Black and Tan - for you guiness lovers-Timmermans Strawberry - if you love sweet, go for this strawberry beer-Fuller's London Porter - very chocolatymy favorite foods:-Fried Calamari - always a staple appetizer for me. It's cooked perfectly, good crunch, not overwhelming, and not super soft.-BBQ CHICKEN - the pizza is light, filling, and not greasy.-SPICY THAI CHICKEN-Nachos - are huuuuuuuuuuuuge. enough to feed 4 people. stacks and stacks of meat, avocado, cheese, beans, cheese, sour cream, and more meat. Downside of this place is the wait. Wait can take a very long time, but if you're slick and patient enough you can slide in at the bar. The bartenders are real helpful and fast.

Reviews.Author: Jay A.
Reviews.Content: 2 hour wait, a little longer wait to get food (my friends and I walked around Santana Row, and right when we were within range, our pager rang). The food was okay (I could've driven down Bascom and went to Sam's BBQ for something better without the long wait). They took off the drink orders from the tab because the long wait. This was the first time i've EVER waited so long to be seated and received my order at a restaurant. I would've given up after an hour, but my friends and I wanted to see what all the hype was.Not worth it. I guess everyone and their mom's wants to try this place out since it just opened. I'll wait a couple months until the hype dies down, and maybe, just MAYBE i'll give them a better review.

Reviews.Author: Alex K.
Reviews.Content: I had a pretty disappointing experience at Yard House. As nice as our server was, he was kinda slow (speaking on service here). No pre bussing, he brought our entree before our drinks, didn't even start us with water, and left the menus on the table post order. Honestly, I'm open to the restaurant because its new so I'm sure it'll take a while to weed out all the bad servers (come on this is Santana Row).As for the food. Outstanding truffle fries. Don't come here with out ordering them. Also, if its happy hour give the chicken nachos a try. They were satisfactory and go well with a tasty refreshing beer. Avoid the ahi poke, its super salty, also avoid the calamari. Its totally lackluster. Beer menu however is freaking amazing. Love the variety. The prices are pretty reasonable here too. It's basically a BJ's on steroids. Now of the crowd here, for the most part I don't have a problem with the crowd at Santana Row despite various confrontations that have occurred here. But a patron chillin' at the bar grabbed my friend VERY inappropriately on our way out of the restaurant. Perhaps the bartenders should pay more attention to the intoxication level of the patrons. Just Sayin..... All in all Yard House, I will give you another chance. Come here with a big group when you are not in any kind of rush. It's worth a try

Reviews.Author: Angelica P.
Reviews.Content: Now that the hype has died down a bit, wait time isn't so bad. It's usually an hour or less so just grab a drink at the bar while you wait. Seating at the bar is on a first come first serve basis and you can order food off the full menu there as well. There's a ton of TVs and although they won't change the channels, you can request to be seated near one that's playing a specific game.Food is mediocre. I haven't had a bad dish nor have I had a really good dish yet. Portions are on the larger side especially when it comes to salads. They do need to work on consistency. I really enjoyed their French onion soup the first time around, but not so much after that. You can't go wring with truffle fries, they're always a favorite. I like the jambalaya with jasmine rice but it comes with too many peppers.Service is a hit or miss.

Reviews.Author: PeteConstant C.
Reviews.Content: I have been anxiously awaiting the opening of the Yard House in Santana Row.The wait is over and I can tell you, it was well worth the wait!Yesterday I had the Chicken Parmesan. The chicken was moist and flavorful and the sauce was incredible.Tonight I went to the VIP Grand Opening event. Just try to drink yourself through a tasting of all the beers on tap - it will take you weeks. Even if you're a heavy drinker. Personally, I've never seen so many beers on tap.Attendees had the opportunity to try samples of a vast variety of the menu. Here's what I tried:PENNE WITH CHICKENcrimini mushrooms, asparagus, sun-dried tomatoes tossed in marsala cream sauce. Dusted with parmesan. [WOW this was great!]SEARED AHI SASHIMIseared rare, lightly blackened served with soy vinaigrette, wasabi and pickled ginger [it doesn't get much better than this!]MOO SHU EGG ROLLSchicken, chili cream cheese, carrots, green onions, cilantro and spinach served with apple ginger plum sauce [mmmmmmmm]FIRECRACKER WINGStossed in a spicy sesame garlic plum glazegarnished with green onions  [Great wings, too]BLUE CRAB CAKESwith mango papaya chutney, passion fruit beurre blanc and tomato oil [another home run]I can already tell that I will become a regular here!!

Reviews.Author: Vivian T.
Reviews.Content: Great selection of beers! OMG. Its like beer heavennn...Its a cool place to go have happy hour with your friends. Just expect to wait 1-2 hours for your table! SUPER super crowded. Food and service is great. I would def come back :)

Reviews.Author: Terri L.
Reviews.Content: Sorry! Have to revoke my 5 star rating! I had dinner here tonight and the service is non existent. No wonder this place has been getting consistently inconsistent reviews. Our server never checked in on us once. We had to flag him down when he forgot one order of Truffle Fries, there was a discrepancy in our check that took him forever to fix, and it took ages to just pay and leave. That's probably why the wait is so long, because the servers literally force you to sit there. This time I tried the Pepper Crusted Gorgonzola Burger and my boyfriend got the Miso Glazed Sea Bass. I preferred the sea bass to my burger. The Truffle Fries that I switched out my normal fries for were amazing and definitely worth trying.  Basically, the food and beer here are bomb, customer service on the other hand, blows.

Reviews.Author: Nicole W.
Reviews.Content: Went to lunch on Friday April 29th. 2 minutes after receiving our food the fire alarm went off and continued to blare every 3 minutes for the next 30 minutes. Eventually our ears began to ring so we took our food to go. Our server said they are having electrical issues and this had happened the day b4 but soon the place filled with smoke and they had to open all the doors. You got an issue with your ventilation. You'd think they would have knocked off a couple bucks for the inconvenience and headache but we got NOTHING. Bad form...Menu has a little of everything soups, sandos, pasta, pizza, burgers and tons of beers.The food was just ok. Nothing I'd return for. There are many options on the row...If I want pizza - I'll go to Pizza Antica, if i want a burger - I'll go to the Counter and if I want a beer I guess I'd try here but not anytime soon. I'll let them work out the kitchen issues first.

Reviews.Author: Daniel H.
Reviews.Content: This review will be based on everything but the beer selection.  Yes, yes, I know that not including the chain's own namesake in my review may be a sin, but it seems the overwhelming amount of yelpers who've already chimed in about the amazing beer selection can clue you in.The setting: Wednesday, Santana Row, warm summer night.Occasion? Birthday dinner on the row.We arrived at 6:30 p.m., and even for a weeknight, the wait was out the door (although there isn't much waiting room inside anyway).  We were seated within 30 min., which was pretty decent taking into account the massive hype.  Also, waiting in Santana Row isn't that bad with so many shops and hangouts to kill time with.  Initial Vibe--------------Me and seven other dinner guests were seated on the mezzanine level of the restaurant which, while still considerable noisy, was less noisy than the lower level where the bar is.  We met our waiter, who was amiable enough.Starters and Something Yummy-------------------------------------------To start, we ordered the chicken nachos and the firecracker wings.  While the portion of the nachos was pretty huge, the flavor and uniqueness was pretty lackluster, something almost reminiscent of drunken late-night home-made nachos.  The firecracker wings, on the other hand, were amazing.  The order came with 8 crunchy and tasty wings on a bed of red cabbage, which I really could have done without.Main Course and Big Confusion--------------------------------------------We moved on to entrees.  Here's where things started to get dicey.  We were greeted by a new waitress who would be taking over while our waiter was on break.  Also, friendly enough.  I ordered the bearnaise burger and subbed the fries for sweet potato fries for a little extra.  Overall, the portion was good and the burger was cooked to pretty nice medium rare.  However, although I received my food, I couldn't say the same for some others at the table.  Amid some confusion from our table, our waiters, and the kitchen staff, four of our dishes had been lost, only one of which finally made its way to the table.So count it -- 3 dishes missing.  We alerted a waitstaff, who let us know she would alarm our waiter/ermm waitress, or whoever it was that was waiting our table.  When we didn't get a response for about 10 minutes, we tracked down another waitstaff.  Our original waiter came to our table to let us know that he had heard that all of our food actually did arrive and that we are all taken care of and dandy.  Not the case.  Another seven-ish minutes pass by and we're told that our food, although made, was left in the kitchen because of a lost order ticket.  Out comes the manager to ask if we'd like those dishes remade.  But it's now 8:30, an hour and a half since we first sat down.  No, we don't want those dishes anymore.  Dessert and a tart aftertaste-------------------------------------However, we are comp'ed with free desserts for each guest at the table, minus the birthday girl, who's already accounted for.  I share the sampler with a buddy (not that exciting) but really like the fresh-baked brownie with a scoop of ice cream.  Imagine a brownie pizookie, if you're familiar with BJ's: same tin-dish, same layout.  Our waiters are pretty intrusive now after the case of the missing dishes, checking in about every 5 minutes.  We try giving the hint that we'd like some privacy, but alas, our attempts continuously fail.  I dislike an absent waiter, but an intrusive waiter upsets me even more, repeatedly killing the vibe, conversation, and merriment of the table.In the end, we spent a good 3 hours at Yard House and save for a few gems in the menu, the overall experience left me with a bitter aftertaste.  The food was a solid 3 with a few hit and misses, but the service left a lot to be desired.  I'm not completely calling quits on this place, but I hope that if I do come back, I'll have a fruitier finish.

Reviews.Author: carissa w.
Reviews.Content: I always always always get good service here....well until a couple weeks ago. My best friend and I took our men on double dates. We were seated in a booth right next to the bar...but yet our drinks still took at times 10 minutes to come. Our waiters excuse..."The bar is really backed up." This was on a Saturday afternoon with empty seats at the bar as well as in the dining areas. And we clearly could see the bar was not "backed up." The two bartenders were talking with folks at the bar...so no they were not backed up. Our waiter Rex, was also a horrendous experience. He couldnt get the drinks correct...my friends boyfriend ordered a black and tan and Rex brought out Coor's Light? Hmmm...ok. He also took a break after taking our food order, and apparently did not put it in before his break because our temporary waiter could not find our food order. By the time Rex came back from his break we had waited 20+ minutes for our food. Also, when we had asked Rex if our food was on its way he rolled his eyes at us...I kid you not! I guess he left his customer service at home that day?I will still go back to YH because I love this place, but if I get Rex again, Im running the other way. If you want to keep your customers happy dump Rex!

Reviews.Author: Jeneen C.
Reviews.Content: Yard House...you didn't live up to the hype in my eyes!  Loved the atmosphere!!  Being a huge sports fan and all, I do not object to eating lunch with the Giants game in view.  That's one of the perks about this place along with the huge selection of beers.But wait....I ordered a beer and come to find out 5 mins later that they're "out of that beer".  Hmmm okay, so I ordered a different beer.  That one made its way to my place setting.  We ordered the nachos as an appetizer.  Eh, Cheesecake and Rock Bottom have better nachos.  Time to order lunch!  I got the turkey burger sliders on wheat with the truffle oil fries.  Oh here comes our server again; he's telling me they're out of wheat buns too.  Uhhh, hope someone's doing a grocery store run for the dinner rush!  Geesh.  Fine, give me the white buns.  My lunch was mediocre; left most of it on my plate. Darn!In our time there we were visited by two different managers.  One to apologize for messing up on a friends meal that arrived incorrectly.  Another for a meal arriving SUPER later (i.e. it was totally overlooked since my friend had to point it out that her son's meal hadn't arrived).  So, at least they apologized for their error and comped both of those meals.Bottom line: I'd come back to try their happy hour after the hype wears down and the wrinkles are ironed out.

Reviews.Author: Huey N.
Reviews.Content: I love Yardhouse! I don't know how many times I've been to the Riverside and Rancho Cucmonga locations. I've even went there twice in one night before. They have about 130 beers on  tap, with a large number of microbrews that I usually drink. Their happy hour is the best. A few bucks off the beers and half price for most of their appetizers can't be beaten.The menu is eclectic in a good way, heavily drawing on Asian flavors at times. Last night I tried three items I haven't had a chance to before. I really enjoyed the Mac 'n Cheese since it was loaded with stuff and had a prominent truffle oil flavor. The crab cakes had a great crust and tasted pretty good overall. The Jerk Chicken was a point of contention however, with a main argument of it being nothing more than grilled chicken breast (I highly disagree). I will admit that the chicken breast was a little dry and the Shrimp Stack that accompanied it was comparable to a limp tostada. I know it sounds like the food food wasn't that stellar on this occasion, but service was great despite it being only day two. I know the rest of the food is amazing and I look forward to being a regular here.

Reviews.Author: Lillie T.
Reviews.Content: I've been here too many times...my waistline is proof! The food is great. i love the Garlic noodles with lobster! Yum the service is great, I've never had a problem. They let you try out a couple of their flavored beers before you commit to buy which is great for people not into beer. The only downside is the crazy wait time for a table...i've never had to wait less than 45 mins! The great thing is you can call ahead and put your name on the list or go shopping at Santana Row! Wish they did reservations!

Reviews.Author: Annie D.
Reviews.Content: I'll say 3.5 stars because of their poor layout, or they just need a bigger space! We were smart, we came here Easter Sunday, why so smart? Well the mall was closed and some other stores were in Santana Row, so that equals less people!
