So yeah, it was still crowded, but we had a party of 16 and waited for about an hour.  My complaint is they really don't have that much seating, the beer bar they have going on takes up all the room and the people standing around it blocks most of the walk ways and any table near the bar will have peoples butts and backs against their table, joy.  So after being seated, our server took drink orders and left. About 15 mins later another server came and said the last server left for her break so she rechecked our order cause she wasn't sure if the last server placed our order in?? So eventually we got our drinks and took our order. CHINESE GARLIC NOODLES- butter, garlic and shiitake mushrooms. Topped with parmesan and chives, this dish was pretty good, it was a little salty to me though, but good. SPICY JAMBALAYA- blackened jumbo shrimp, spicy chicken-andouille sausage, red bell pepper and pasilla peppers pan blackened with sweet crawfish and cajun tomato cream sauce served with linguine pasta or jasmine or brown rice- this was pretty good, the portion was a bit small though. PEPPER CRUSTED GORGONZOLA-marsala sautéed crimini mushrooms, carmelized onions, baby spinach, the burger was good and the fries I liked, they were thin cut so they were nice and crispy. When we were there, they had a lot of  beers that were "Tapped Out" so I never really got to try what I really wanted to try, but for the beers I tasted, they were all fine, it's beer!

Reviews.Author: Manda Bear B.
Reviews.Content: ************************** 532 ****************************         Yard House the newest addition to the overly crowded Santana Row. It's probably the the biggest restaurant and bar here on the row, with plenty of big screens for watching games.         The crazy extensive menu of American fusion cuisine featuring over 130 items including appetizers, salads, pastas, sandwiches, grilled burgers, individual-size pizzas, seafood, steaks and ribs.        Beers on tab, think of almost 140 types! Probably the most in the Bay Area! No wonder this place is always jam packed on a game night with the guys! My BFF took me here before she headed out to Miami! Even I don't dink much beers but you got some great ones here!       I big bar go around the restaurant, perfectly open up for all to order. Good lay out, casual, and friendly service. So if you are in to beers and want to try what the world of beers have to offer, come by.         Happy Hour 3-7PM as well!

Reviews.Author: Joe A.
Reviews.Content: The service here gets worse and worse. When I got here it was a little bit before closing i say 45-50 minutes. We were told to have a seat anywhere and a server would help us out. Also me and two other friends were told the kitchen was closed. But the bar was open for a little bit. We ordered beers and we had a seat at a table. NO SERVER TO HELP US OUT! We had to ask a buser where a server was so we can get another beer and this guy walks off and DOES NOT get us another server. We waited 20 minutes before they stopped serving alcohol and by the time a server does approach us she tells us no more alcohol can be served. COMPLETE BS!! I wasnt even here during a game or anything special. YARD HOUSE PLEASE DO ME A FAVOR AND STEP YOU'RE GAME UP!

Reviews.Author: Mona Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: I went here last night for a Sunday night dinner with another couple and my fiance. Pros: the food, the service, overall ambiance and appearance, the location (Santana Row)Cons: noise level (this is probably not the best place to go if you are looking for a quiet intimate dinner), and the price tag wasn't the cheapest (it IS Santana Row) so it wouldn't be an everyday dining place. What my fiance and I ordered/shared: the rib eye steak + the cheesecake. As we knew the portions were going to be big sharing these items was just right. The steak came with mashed potatoes that looked like it was slightly baked (it had a browning/slight crisp to it like it was put in the oven). with a side of green beans. Overall a good dish. The cheesecake was topped with nuts and whipped cream with the caramel and raspberry sauce, also a good combo that you can't really go wrong with. Again, it was nice for sharing.  What the other couple ordered (which I also tried): mini Pork Belly taco and mini kimchi taco (both very delicious - and you can't really taste the kimchi if you're a phobia of kimchi like my fiance is). My fiance also ordered one of their tall glasses of beer. It IS tall (the ones they have in Las Vegas), so know that you'll be getting about 3 bottles of beer worth in one glass. Advice: share dishes and be okay with waiting a few minutes (they give you a pager like they do at Maggiano's or The Cheesecake Factory) and know that it apparently is very crowded on Friday and Saturday nights.

Reviews.Author: Hung D.
Reviews.Content: Food wasn't good. Supposedly a "sports bar" but the White Curly Hair  manager threatened to kick us out because we were too loud? AND THEY WOULDN'T PLAY THE DAMN AUDIO FOR THE SHARKS GAME! Besides that Our Waitress, Ashley, was nice and is a 10! HAH.

Reviews.Author: Khang T.
Reviews.Content: Most Important Tip for a Great Time: Save yourself the wait and trouble by avoid coming at night and go during the afternoon. Don't go at night unless you love self-fulfilling prophencies. You have read the reviews other people have made about going to YH at night so why set yourself and friends/SO up by still going at night? The wait is +1 hour at night for a table, the service is probably better during the afternoon (less cranky, rushed servers & faster service), and YH has lunch specials from 11AM-5PM (separate from the Night & Afternoon Happy Hours). The quality, quantity, and price of the Happy Hours and Lunch Specials is a steal!P.S. Drink suggestion for females: try the Woodchuck Pear Cider if you are interested in those kinds of drink.

Reviews.Author: Terre P.
Reviews.Content: Our server was really nice, but he did remind us that it was a Monday and they are not busy.  Not sure the servers would be that attentive when there are actually other customers.  I DO appreciate when servers KNOW the menu.  He told us he knows ALL about the menu and the beers.  That is ALWAYS nice.He allowed the birthday girl two tastes of beer which was nice because it allowed us to decide.  He suggested which ones to taste.  We both ended up getting one of the suggestions.  It was Hogarten or something.  It was nice.  I ordered the pear and gorgonzola flatbread with chicken (they let me add that for extra $).  The chicken was nice.  It was moist and tender.  Now that I am writing this up I remembered there was supposed to be pears on the flatbread .... I would imgine since that is what it was called, but I don't remember seeing any.  I think there MIGHT have been a teeny tiny itsy bitsy amount of cheese on there, but I only saw it once or twice.  It was good.  I ate it.  Am I thinking I need to get it again . . . . ever?  No.  They let my friends split a salad and burger.  That is always REALLY nice because some restaurants don't let you do that.  My other friend had a burger with lobster on it.None of them made yummy noises or an exclamation about how good anything was.  So I am thinking it was meh.I think this place is probably great for people that like fish and hot/spicey food.  Because a HUGE portion of the menu is fish/seafood.  And most of the menu has hot/spicey stuff in it.  But I probably won't be back to eat.  I can see stopping by to have a beer or two with a plan of walking over to another restaurant to eat and spend a few hours.   And since 100+ beers on tap is their claim to fame I guess that is just fine.

Reviews.Author: Michelle W.
Reviews.Content: I've come here a few times, and the food here is totally worth it during happy hour.What I've tried that worked out:-hawaiian poke stack: delish, probably best thing on the menu-raspberry beer pretty good, strawberry beer is amazing-truffle mac and cheese: best ive ever had, chicken, bacon-spinach dip: good, large portions-truffle fries: can't really go wrong with truffle oil-chicken wings are good.What I don't really care for:-ahi tuna roll: not exactly a roll, more like a round cake, and it was a little weird that fish was seared, which made it taste kinda like canned tuna-yards are awkward, I'd rather get 2 different beers than drink a warm backwashed yard-pear cider was too light, it was like a light pear sodea- the california roll, which also doesn't look like sushi, but a round cake, had too much riceThe service is alright, some servers are nice, others are rude.. So it's kind of a hit or miss on this one.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre. Go across the street for Cheesecake Factory if you want better food and service. Come here if you want beers, slow service, and want to catch a game on TV. Seafood Artichoke Dip tasted funny. I wish we had ordered a regular artichoke dip instead.A side order of fries proved to be disappointing. Service made it worse because we didn't even get ketchup. The tower of onion rings looked interesting ... I wish we had ordered that instead.My jambalaya was WEIRD. It looked as if they had scouped out all the ingredients onto a plate (sans rice), then dumped a bowl of brown rice onto the plate. I must say, it did taste better than it looked. I'm not in any rush to return.

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
Reviews.Content: Oh Yardhouse, it almost pains me to give you 2 stars, you have such wonderful beers!  However with everything that happened, I guess the 2 stars is deserved.It started out with a phenomenon that I have noticed at almost every Yardhouse I go to, my first beer choice was not available.  (My beer had to wait for a keg to be tapped which apparently takes 25 minutes in Yardhouse time, the beer my girlfriend wanted was just plain out.)  But since there are so many beers we just selected another.We ordered the garlic mushroom noodles which while pretty tasty, was definitely nothing special.  We also ordered a beer sampler which I always enjoy.  I have drank most of the beers that they serve there, but my girlfriend hasn't enjoyed nearly as many, so it was really nice to be able to get 6 little samples for her to try.  (And she ended up finding one that she really loved!)The first indication that we might have a problem was that the wait staff had a bit of confusion as to who was going to wait on our table.  The first guy came by and introduced himself, but then another guy came by and said he would actually be waiting on us.  He ended up seeming pretty disinterested in what was going on, and didn't seem to be very familiar with the beer menu.  (Which admittedly is a tough task, considering how huge it is.)We ordered and eventually received our food.  Mine was pretty good, I got a crab cake sandwich.  My girlfriend got the seared ahi tuna, which she was pretty excited to try.  Sadly however they completely mangled the dish and ended up way overcooking it, and then drenching it in soy sauce.To top it off our waiter didn't bring us any condiments or even ask if we wanted some.  I had to track down someone else to get me some catsup for my fries, because he was nowhere to be seen until it was time to pay up.Overall I am really bummed this turned out so badly.  I had been hyping this place up to my girlfriend and when we finally at there, they completely drop the ball.  I guess in retrospect the main draw for this place really is the beer, and not so much the food.  While I have never had a bad dish myself when I go, I am also usually extremely drunk by the time the food rolls around, so perhaps every meal is bad, and I just haven't realized it!

Reviews.Author: Lena D.
Reviews.Content: Why oh why did I choose to come here on a Monday night when the niners were playing during HH?! I was out of my mind.. obvi...After 1hr 40mins of waiting, we finally got a table. It was actually a nice booth by the window and in front of a TV. I was annoyed that the game made the wait so long so I didn't pay attention to it. Our server, totally forgot his name, was awesome. He was sincerely sorry about the wait time and was on top of everything. He came to check on us several times. It was suuuuper busy so I really appreciated this. I really just came to snack and drink so I ordered the Strawberry Fields martini and firecracker wings and chips and guac. The drink tasted like cough syrup. Yuck. I highly recommend avoiding that drink. The wings on the other hand were delish! I was really surprised at how much I liked them. They were cooked really well... nice and juicy with a crispy skin. Yummmm. The guac was pretty tasty too. Chips and dip are my weakness so its hard to eff that one up for me lol. I had a bite of my friend's bearnaise sliders. Yummmmm! I would definitely order those again. I think I'll try coming in the middle of the week next time to see how bad the wait is on a "slow" day.

Reviews.Author: Angeline K.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is such a big deal up here, which I'm not really used to because it's just an average restaurant in SoCal where I'm from. When this location opened up, it seemed like people flocked here as if it was the next greatest thing! Anyway, I didn't ever feel the urge to come here because I knew what the wait would be like and honestly, it's so not worth it. But I was out with friends on a Friday night, and we decided to check it out at 11:15pm when the crowds died down and we could get in without having to wait for a table.So... this really only gave us 15 minutes to order drinks and 45 minutes to sit and enjoy them. We were told by our waitress that they are on probation for the time being and have to be really strict about cutting people off at 11:30 p.m. for that reason. She hinted that once their probation is up they may be able to extend their hours to 2am and serve drinks later. This is just like any other run of the mill chain restaurant. Food is average, drinks are average, I guess potentially a decent hang out if you don't mind the annoyingly long wait times.

Reviews.Author: Jenny A.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god, the hype has FINALLY died down!! Although I have been here many more times since writing this update, I felt like this trip was worth writing. Came here for happy hour on a Tuesday. There was no wait at all versus first couple months of opening and wait was HOURS. We were seated right away and pretty much already knew what we wanted to order!BBQ Chicken Pizza, Hawaiian Poke Stack, Garlic Noodles, and Truffle Fries. Total came out to $26 with tip. Pizza was good today for some reason (LOL, i usually hate it cause the chicken is so dry). I did not like the poke as much today. Overuse of wasabi that made my nose burn with every bite. The carrot/bean sprout slaw was bland and was all carrots. The garlic noodles were good (REQUEST for less salt!!!! Its better this way..don't forget, salt causes bloating ladies!!). Lots of mushroom and noodles were chewy and yummy. Truffle fries, you can never go wrong. Our water (Navid) was kind of weird. Really awkward and when he came to refill our cups, he didn't ask if we wanted more water, he just stood there and looked at us. First time was funny...second and third time..uhh...AWKWARD. When we asked for boxes, he brought them over and RUSHED us to get everything in the box. What the heck is your hurry, the place is freaking empty!! While I was trying to put the pizza in the box, he goes "I will do it for you" and I said "no" which stopped him. He was clearing the table before I even cleared my plate!!! Food is good, waiter was weird, beer is always good.

Reviews.Author: Timothy C.
Reviews.Content: Wait.. what's not to love about this place... nothing.. that's what's "not" to love (a triple negative makes this a positive...) I went here on recommendation of a native San Jose'ian (that's a real term, look it up... okay, don't, I made it up, but it's real now). This restaurant was amazing, great atmosphere, amazing selection of beers, and the food was silly good. I had a delicious ahi pokey appetizer, prob could have stopped there, but no, my gluttony set in and I opted for some asian fusion pork tacos (with kim-chee... mmmm) and a nice little apple pie for dessert... You have to love this area of town, and if you eat here (and you will), you will be a "happy camper" (you just won't be camping).... Go here and eat their food already

Reviews.Author: Daisy T.
Reviews.Content: Third time's a charm!Everytime I came here there was always a LOOONG wait. Me and my friends got impatient the first two times we tried to eat here. We finally decided to wait it out after the THIRD time trying. During the 45 MINUTE WAIT I was looking at the novel of a menu they had. There are soooooo many options! But the menu seemed like BJ's but with an Asian fusion feel. Prices range around $8 to $40 depending on what you're feeling like. There's something for everyone. There's even a vegetarian section. It took me forever to pick something from the menu. Did I want beef? Pasta? Seafood? I was dizzy from reading everything. O_o And even once I was done with that, there's also the EXTENSIVE beer list. I went for the porcini crusted halibut and washed it down with their strawberry beer. =) The halibut had a DELICIOUS porcini and white truffle oil cream sauce with it. I dipped everything on the plate with it: mashed potatoes, fish and bok choy. And I'm not usually a fan of beer but this strawberry beer tasted more like a cider than anything else. You could really taste the strawberries!And what about dessert? Of course! I tried their Kona coffee sundae. Yum. The thin cookie that came with it was the best part. Don't know what you want? Bring a few friends and share! =) I tried part of my friend's steak sandwich. It was disappointing to say the least. It was dry and lacking flavor. So I guess the entrees are hit or miss. And what about the beer? No worries. They offer two different kinds of beer flights with about six small cups of beers. Don't come here for a romantic evening though. It gets pretty loud in here. I found myself almost yelling at my friends trying to talk to them. But there are a ton of TV's here. Perfect if you want to go out and catch the latest game. Overall, my experience here was okay. I don't know if it's worth waiting almost 45 minutes for a seat at this super noisy restaurant. But I'll try to come here for happy hour. Hopefully I can catch a seat at the bar and avoid the wait. But if you want to sit down and eat, try to go during the middle of the afternoon. It'll probably still be crowded but the wait might be shorter.

Reviews.Author: Holly L.
Reviews.Content: From being a BREA YARDHOUSE lover, this place just isn't the same. I remember I use to be REALLLLLLY excited that we had our very own in the Bay Area, but the food wasn't as good as I remembered. i was in love with their MAC&CHEESE2. however, the last time i went, it just wasn't as tasty as I remembered. Don't you just hate how different locations of the same restaurants aren't the same?but HAPPY HOUR deserves 4 stars though! :D raspberry cider and timmerman's strawberry are my favs!!! i tried a honey blonde or whatever, but didn't like that at all... chicken wings are good! my bf loves them. pizza is good for the happy hour price you pay. nachos were alright... there's way more sour cream and guacomole than there is meat. when i ordered the spinach dip, it was overbaked and dry. when i had their seared ahi, it was wayyyyy too salty. i guess i'm just not a fan of santana row food... but i'm down for the drinks! i've only been here during their afternoon happy hour so i can't complain about the wait since i've never had to wait for any! oh and their martini's are delicious!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany K.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great place to socialize and hang out at with friends. A great place if you like beer, etc etc. When we first walked in, I was surprised by the decor - not really sure what I was expecting, but this was different that what I expected. Very simple, yet lively and fun. I came here with a few girlfriends for happy hour, and the happy hour menu is great here. Discounts on beers, 1/2 off selected appetizers, yaddy ya ya. While here, we got beers, Enchilada Stacker, Ahi Poke, and Chicken Wings. Appetizers and food are gorgeously plated here - that's definitely one of the things that puts Yard House above BJ's, etc. Yard House definitely has a higher-end feel to it - environment is a little nicer, and plates are more culinary chef looking. The food is okay - looks great, but taste wise, it's just alright. Definitely a lot of frills, but the taste quality just doesn't really pull through. With that said, I wouldn't come to Yard House for a romantic dinner, or if you're looking to eat good food. However, with a bunch of friends, this is definitely the type of fun place to go to.

Reviews.Author: Samantha N.
Reviews.Content: Holy moly this Yard House is SMALL compared to the one in San Diego.  There's only open seating at the actual bar? Not at the tables around it? And a one hour plus wait? YEEESH! Oh how I'm glad I'm in San Diego.A MUST TRY? Delirium Tremens and the Strawberry Lambic Beer :)

Reviews.Author: Samantha C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time yesterday, for dinner on a Tuesday night. My boy toy and I sat at the bar to avoid the 30 minute wait. Bar service was okay in the beginning, but still not as prompt as I preferred. As our dinner progressed, service slowly deteriorated. I ordered the chicken garlic noodles and my boyfriend got the surf and turf burger. Food came out, my chicken garlic noodles was good at first but then became too oily. I also did not like how they used ground chicken, it was weird eating chicken crumbles in a pasta dish. My boyfriend's plate was a piece of steak with shrimp; IT WAS NOT A BURGER. We were a bit baffled since he clearly ordered from the burger section of the menu. We politely informed our server Sarah (girl with a asymmetrical a-line, who desperately needed a trim) and she rudely said that, that is the surf and turf. We then said that we ordered a burger and she made up some bizarre excuse that the burger and the steak were both called "surf and turf," even though our tab showed the steak as "steak and shrimp!" She totally gave us the impression that it was all our fault. It's like HELLO; we dont work here, we don't know the menu and if there were any confusion, it was her responsibility to clarify it with us. She then rudely took his plate away without an apology or even an explanation as to what she's going to do. My boyfriend then had to wait another 20+ minutes for his burger. I highly doubt that she even put in a rush order for it. The burger was also overly salty. After almost half way done with my garlic noodles, I noticed a piece of hair buried in the noodles.  I then informed another server (not Sarah since she was useless, rude, and incompetent) and that server politely asked if I wanted something else and told me that someone will be out shortly to speak with us. The manager Jim came out and apologized. We also informed him of Sarah's LIES and her lame excuse for putting in the wrong order. He admitted she was wrong and that there is no such steak called "surf and turf". When he asked who the server was, before we even answered, he knew it was the girl with the short hair, which made us think that she frequently make mistakes like that; or that she's a compulsive liar!!! In the end, he compted our food right in front of her, which was super awkward, but there was a nice feeling of vindication!!!!!!!!! We just ended up paying for a beer, so haha you lost!!

Reviews.Author: Raghunanthan K.
Reviews.Content: Heard lot about this place and we finally went there with friends and family. And that when our trouble started. It took them two and half hours for them to get us seated while the front desk didn't even had the our name while they provided us with a digital tag. The idiotic manager who received us went out of shift so they lost it the new one didn't even know what the fuck we were talking. The idiotic put us in two tables and he said that if we have to wait for one more hour if we have to sit together. After being seated, no waiter to 20 minutes even to take the drinks order either. The food was delivered fast but we think it was because of the dissatisfaction expressed by us. Food was okay and not that great as I heard either. Basically the whole experience sucked, so I ain't going back to that place and wouldn't suggest to others as well.

Reviews.Author: Khaled A.
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice and the food is excellent. It's a little expensive, but being that its located in Santana Row, the prices are fair.You can taste the quality of food and the skills of the cooks.Overall, this place is like BJ's restaurant on steroids, except much better.

Reviews.Author: Patty O.
Reviews.Content: Finally...Yard House is open!  After all these weeks of anticipation, Yard House delivers.  I must warn everyone that because this is a recently opened restaurant, the wait during dinner time is around 3 hours (reported by my coworker on a Thursday night), they also do not take reservations because the level of business is so high right now.In order to avoid the 3 hour wait, my friends and I decided to go during Happy Hour which is 3pm-6pm on weekdays.  I arrived at 3pm on Good Friday and requested for a table of 15.  They were able to accommodate my request within 45 minutes.  With a party as big as that, you must tip a gratuity of 18%, which is noted on the receipt, but members of your party may be unaware and may tip less , so just be aware to inform your party of the gratuity rate.There is a small Happy Hour section in the Yard House menu, and it consists of 50% off drinks, and 50% off most appetizers.  I ordered some kind of drink in the "Fruit Lambic" section called "Lindeman's Framboise".  Framboise is French for raspberry.  It was very fruity, and didn't taste like alcohol.  Highly recommended.In tems of appetizers, I had the Chinese Garlic Noodles, which were ok, but no where as good as the garlic noodles served at Xanh in Mountain View.  Also, I tried the sliders, and in my opinion, they were bland, and only tasted good with ketchup, or whatever condiment that it came with.  Drinks wise Yard House is cool, but the selection of appetizers on the Happy Hour menu, not so cool.  I will probably order an entree next time and hope that the selection is better there.  With that being said, Yard House is definitely a must go, but not during peak hours (for now), because it is wayyy too busy.

Reviews.Author: Lily R.
Reviews.Content: I knew NOT to try and come here on hot days, sharks game days and weekend nights. I DID come here on a quiet afternoon at about 4pm. There were plenty of tables and I was seated immediately. I am pretty impressed with the food and drink selection! :D I was so hungry so I didn't wait for my friend to arrive to order. I chose for us haha! Our waiter was super attentive and friendly.Pizza! Pizza! - A+ very good. Wood fired baked, flavorful dough and just the right size for 2 or 3 ppl. Perfect with BEER! 1/2 off @ HH.Hawaiian Ahi poke- B+ pretty darn good. Great app. and its on the happy hour menu 1/2 off. Grilled Chicken egg-less Cesar- A + I loved it! Super refreshing and the chicken was grilled to perfection. Tasty Parmesan tostinis and croutons gave it yummy flavor.I had the house honey beer which was delicious and also had a glass of the fruity red beer that tastes like grape fizzy juice. Delish! Now if only I have the same experience NEXT time! I guess I just have to arrive super early and snag a table for the rest of my friends.

Reviews.Author: Brenda L.
Reviews.Content: Alas! Last night (a Wednesday) I finally found time to venture into the much-talked-about Yard House.  The night before last night I did my research online and discovered that 1. Yard House was a big chain and 2. Sun-Wed happy hour was 10-12.  Pretty sweet I say.  I am no beer buff but seeing as Yard House has the most beers on tap that I have ever seen, chances are you'll find something you like.  I was girlishly excited to see that they had strawberry, apricot and blueberry beer.  Now I wonder if they had cherry Kriek beer, b/c that stuff is delicious........Anyways, I tried the blueberry beer and then later on tried some sort of blonde beer that our waitress suggested-it was refreshing and tasty, even for a non-beer enthusiast like myself. Oh, and the wait was around 30 minutes. I heard friends say they had waited 2 hours for a table before though, so just depends on the night you come.I was pretty hungry so I ordered quite a bit: the garlic noodles (tasted like buttered popcorn), the buffalo wings (has a good kick), the California roll (not so bueno.  too much avocado and strange), the tuna poke stack, the nachos (yum), and the calamari (yum yum).  All that food fed 6 people easily and was around 40$. Not shabby.  Not shabby @ all.I'd say the Yard House lived up to its hype.  But maybe that's b/c I got lucky and didn't have to wait 2 hours to experience it.

Reviews.Author: Grace H.
Reviews.Content: BEST HAPPY HOUR!!Come here for happy hour! Their selection of appetizers and beers/cocktails are amazingly priced! If you come for anything else it could get pricey. Heck $4 off House Martinis?! Golly.. the Watermelon Martini is so damn freaking tasty!!! I'm a girl who can drink like a man. I enjoy my beers and cocktails strong and hard -oh my! The Watermelon Martini is strong yet it tastes like a jolly rancher.. a creeper for sure!  Come for the beer and drinks. Stay because you're drunk.

Reviews.Author: Anna W.
Reviews.Content: When this place first opened up, Boyfriend was super excited and insisted that we had to go try them out because their beer selection looked to be amazing. Since it's located all the way in the South Bay in San Jose, I agreed that we could try it out the next time we're out in that direction.We manage to get Boyfriend's friend and his girlfriend to agree to go with us as well. We decide to go during a weekday around lunch so that the wait time isn't as horrendous. After about a 30 minute wait, we get to sit down.It's smaller inside than it looks from the outside. The booths are super spacious though, so all four of us were super comfortable by the time our server came to get our orders. What I do love about this place is that you have the option to order a "shorty" of different drink. It's a smaller drink size from the standard full-sized glass for all of us with smaller stomachs, smaller alcohol tolerances or have to drive at the end of the meal. I remember that our food was pretty good (but don't ask me what I ordered; this visit was several months ago) and that splitting the check in two wasn't too difficult.The reason I give this place 3 stars is because it really didn't have anything to recommend it past the availability of its "shorty" size. I don't entirely see the hype. And when I go out to Santana Row and see a line that goes out the door and am told that a wait for two people is well over two hours, it really makes me want to just stay away. Maybe I'll return for lunch (the wait times are much more manageable/acceptable then), but since they don't take reservations, I don't think I'll be back for dinner or evening drinks anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: Beer on tap and munchies? sweeeeeeet.

Reviews.Author: Oriana C.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Yard House for years and was sad after moving up here to find there wasn't any in the bay area.  Thank You for opening ONE up here, Yardhouse!Happy Hr is the best here but you must arrive early.  This is what I normally get here -- Ahi Poke Bowl -Fried Calamari-Margherita Pizza (the mozzarella....oh my)-California RollAs for the Beer.....-EVERYTHING!!! you can't go wrong =)

Reviews.Author: Iris Y.
Reviews.Content: Alcoholic beverage galore here compared to other breweries and also including microbreweries. They have beer and mixed beer on tap from all over the world. I tried: Greatness (Guiness and Great White- mysteriously good) Timmermans Strawberry (Light and girly, Belgian drink - Love!) Hoegaarden White (Classy- Like!)Hemp Beer (Hopsy.. ) Chocolately beer - that I will never have again.. Solid, super heavy and can't see through the beer..Truffle Fries ( cheese and herb goodness like garlic fries - like!) BBQ Chicken (chewy white chicken and very flavorful sauce - you're cool) + a couple more beers = $80 est.. during happy hourWhat I like about this place: Lots of TVs - about 20 makes a great game day & audienceBeer Selection and hybridsCiders and hybrids (with beer) Seating I can eat here tapas style and just hang out if we're up for a wait. I would say, it's like a younger; stronger version of Tied House and Gordon Biersch.

Reviews.Author: Johnny T.
Reviews.Content: I was given the opportunity to try this place before it opened.. free drink and food but something came up and I had to pass on the opportunity..I work around the corner and eat in Santana Row daily.. but this place is all hype.. (for now??)1. no discounts for SR employees? BOO!! LB Steak gives me 15% and the food destroys this place. (this is probably only a valid complaint for other SR employees)2. $16 for dinner or $11 for lunch portion of theirs Mac & Cheese.. WEAK. Don't even bother trying it. House Favorites? no way.. wack and cheese if you ask me. It's not a cheddar taste and theres TOO much cheese (if thats even possible) It was stringy and got everywhere.. chicken didn't mesh well with the entree either. I honestly think macaroni's w/ nacho cheese would have probably been better.. seriously.. if you don't believe me try for yourselves. 3. Beer is great but not worth the premium price..4. the wait is TERRIBLE. And you can't really call in. Going early for lunch is key but the odds of me picking this place are slim.. I'd rather go next door..The concept of a sports bar in SR is kind of cool. Trendy, upscale and lively.. but parking in SR is bad enough for regular guests.. and now you have to wait a few hours to drink a beer and watch the game.maybe i'll re-review this place when they hype settles. (if it ever does)

Reviews.Author: Kim D.
Reviews.Content: I've experienced better service ever since I was here. Even though, things take longer than normal (like to get acknowledged and to get your beer) - this place does a pretty high volume.So some of it is understandable.However, I'm sure this place will suffer a backlash soon - because, this place is strict on the rules that go on in their house.Like a bad house party, they are strict on their times.11:00pm - exactly is when the kitchen closes12:00am - is when everyone has to leaveThey even kick you out at 11:55pm as polite as they can. Like you're Sandra Bullock in Speed and you're not driving fast enough, so shit is about to blow up.In the realms of customer service, this is odd. And it's not the restaurant's fault, let's be clear (as we were informed). It's the douchebaggery of Santana Row. However, let's get real - if you can score Happy Hour and it's convenient for you to get a table amongst their wait, it's pretty awesome. Their Lobster, Crab and Artichoke dip I had last night made me die.

Reviews.Author: katherine h.
Reviews.Content: My first YELP review! :) Been taking advantage of Yelp using the reviews but never thought to give back until now! Oops!So when I saw that Yard House was opening in Santana Row which is what I call my second home, I was seriously excited and couldn't wait. My friend an I were even looking up their menus a couple days in advance. I went last night on a quad-date. After reading the reviews on here, my boyfriend and I decided to arrive at 5:30pm put in my name and grab the buzzer for a party of 8 to hopefully get seated by 8. When we got to Yard House, the place was jammed packed. I spoke to Cat who took care of parties of 6 or more. She was extremely nice. The wait would be 4 hours. (not happy!) She told me since the parties who called in ahead didn't have their buzzers yet it left me ahead of them on the list so hopefully my party would be seated a bit earlier. She also mentioned to update her as more people of our party came.**Fast Forward**Our buzzer finally vibrated at 8:30pm. EXCITED! The place was nice, dark and loud. The tv was placed right on the wall at our table and of course the guys were happy because it was a hockey game on the screen. We were greeted by our waitress (forgot her name) and she took our orders. She was extremely nice and sweet despite the fact that one of our friends we met there was hitting on her. So the orders! Drinks:Snake Bite: It was good! It wasn't similar to the one I had while studying abroad in London but it still did satisfy my craving!Sampler: Two of the guys ordered the sampler and according to them it was not great. Food:Lobster, Crab and Artichoke Dip: ORGASM IN MY MOUTH! If you go this is a must order. The dip came with tortilla chips as well as pita bread. And yes, it did have lots of lobster and crab in it. They definitely did not skimp out on it.Chinese Garlic Noodles: It was good but after awhile the taste gets too overwhelming and makes you want to stop eating. I'm not a fan of mushrooms but if you are, it has plenty! Sweet Potato Fries: Yummy! Just the way I like it. Not soggy, thin and crisp. Bacon Burger: My boyfriend ordered this and he said it wasn't so great. "Just like any other burger." It came with a side of fries which was a bonus because they were long, thin and crisp. Towards the end of eating, one of the guys had to go outside to take a call and after he wasn't allowed back in. Supposedly, the guy at the door yelled at him to get back in line thinking our friend was lying when he told the guy that he was already at a table. SERIOUSLY DUDE? The guy finished his dinner and all he needs to do is grab the bill, pay and leave. We told the girl at the door who was giving out buzzers that our friend already has a seat at the table. but she didn't believe us. Finally our waitress came and was able to bring him back in. And believe it or not, when he entered....he was given a wristband. THIS IS NOT A CLUB ALRIGHT?! Please get off your high horse and treat your customers better! By the time we left it was 11pm with a long line outside waiting to get in. All in all, I think this place is only packed because of the hype and it will eventually die down in a couple of months. Not a fan of their service. Food is mediocre compared to their prices. From now on I'm only going to Happy Hour!

Reviews.Author: Maggie H.
Reviews.Content: Happy Hour: Thumbs upHUGE selection of beer: Thumbs up!The ability to order my fave beer in a HALF yard: SUPER thumbs upSnakebite from BJs = Black Velvet from Yard House (they're interchangeable names so don't mistaken order one for the other)Truffle Fries aka Crack fries = MEGA THUMBS UP!I was literally addicted to eating these fries.My mac and cheese sucked. Sounded good on the menu with bacon, mushrooms, different kinds of cheeses and chicken. DRY chicken. Not enough cheese. And bland. Service was great, during non-peak hours. And wait was short, during non-peak hours. Will be back to try something else. Would love to come here during a Sharks game, should be good times.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine G.
Reviews.Content: When you go to Yardhouse, the must-orders include:-Truffle Oil Fries-M-Squared Mac & Cheese-Chicken Parmesan-Any PizzasThey have over 100+ beers on tap, but they do run out of the popular ones if you show up too late in the night (mostly the fruity ones). Also, allocate at least 1-2 hour wait in the evenings, as this place doesn't take reservations and is crowded with people always.The "Southern Belle" mixed drink is the best!

Reviews.Author: Pamela C.
Reviews.Content: I've never had any issues with this place, especially with my most recent visit tonight.I had dinner here with my boyfriend and asked for my main entree to be boxed up since I hadn't finished it, only to forget it as I walked out. Normally it wouldn't be a big deal, but since I had so much food left, I decided to come back. Mind you, it literally took me only 2 minutes to walk out and return. By the time I walked back in, my table had been cleared up completely, along with my to-go box. I looked for the woman that served me (Pomai) and she completely went out of her way to figure out where my food was. Figuring it was long gone by then, I told her not to worry about, but she still did whatever she could to make sure I would leave the restaurant completely satisfied. She literally went as far as to asking the cooks to make a whole new dish for me to take home (it was the penne with chicken, absolutely delicious). I couldn't believe how much trouble she went through just because my ditsy self forgot my food to take home. In return, I have her 2 complimentary tasting cards to a local winery which were given to me to show my appreciation towards her wonderful customer service. It was the least I could do for all that she went through. I hope she comes across this review, because she instantly became my favorite server at this location.

Reviews.Author: Reine K.
Reviews.Content: Was here for the soft opening and could not have been more pleased.The best evidence I saw for Yard House's potential was the witnessing of two potentially physical bar fights.  Yes, to see a bunch of yuppies digress into debauchery and stupidity is what it's all about and is a true testament to the power of the alcoholic flow of the place..when someone get's mad over mere brush of the shoulder, you know the 100+ choices of beer, wine and mixed drinks are doing their job:) On a side note--this is not a review that promotes violence, know when to stop people!As far as the food, I tried the truffle fries, ahi poke bowl and chicken lettuce wraps.  None were a disappointment.  The truffle fries were crispy and truffly-tasty.  The poke bowl was fresh and satisfying while the chicken lettuce wraps were standard; I could see how someone sober might find them a bit on the salty side, I however was not and they tasted great!As far as the drinks, there is something for everyone here.The beverage world is your oyster. Try the Piraaat, it's one of the strongest. Go to Amber (gorgeous, btw!) or Bryan for some great bar tending hospitality.

Reviews.Author: Estella L.
Reviews.Content: Was visiting from San Francisco and came to Yard House for some fruity beer and delicious food with the girls.1. We were greeted and seated immediately. The server was attentive and our H20 glasses were always filled. (+1)2. Came here specifically for the Strawberry beer but they were fresh out. (-1)3. Hawaiian Poke Stack consisted of fresh marinated raw ahi with crispy wontons, carrots, bean sprouts, avocado, wasabi soy sauce. The ingredients were all fresh and plated beautifully. Overall the raw ahi was very flavorful but the portions were lacking! (-1)4. BBQ chicken pizza consisted of chicken, mozzarella, cilantro, red onion, smoked gouda & bbq sauce. The pizza was perfect. The crust was crunchy but not enough to cut through your gums (like). The chicken was tender and juicy.  The bbq sauce was perfectly balanced with equal ratios of sweet and spicy notes. The ingredients were all fresh and prepared in a timely manner. (+1)5. (Mac + Cheese)2 consisted of chicken breast, applewood bacon, wild mushrooms, cheddar, parmesan, campanelle pasta & truffle oil. This was also delicious! The chicken breast was also tender and full of flavor. The applewood bacon and wild mushrooms added a very unique contrasting texture to the sauce. (+1)Overall, if you are craving something creamy and cheesy, order the (Mac + Cheese)2! If you have money to blow and don't mind small portions, order the Hawaiian Poke Stack.

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: When this place first opened up it was crazy packed. Now that things died down it's not so bad. The ambiance is very lively and spacious. The bar scene is more of a sports bar feel and the asian fusion food is above average. The place has over 100+ beers on tap and I usually get the strongest which is trois pistoles or golden drach or what I like to call the "golden drunk" (which you can ONLY get in a glass) because of the alcohol content. My friends would text, call, or fb msg me when they're there because I'm infamous for always being there. They actually called it "my house" instead of yard house. "Hey Ryan we're at your house, where are you?" I must've been here well over 50 times and it never gets old with good company. Where else can you find a nice bar with classy people in the area? Overall great place to kick back after a long days work and relax to a ice cold bruski.

Reviews.Author: Katrina T.
Reviews.Content: Super stoked when it opened and super obsessed with it ever since the first time I went here! This place makes me really excited when I come here. Why? It is because they have a variety of food options! I get so overwhelmed with wanting to try something new every time, but then I always find myself getting the Seared Ahi Steak Sandwich. The service is pretty great. The workers are really friendly and accommodating. The first time I came here I went with my friends. The wait wasn't that long at all. We were seated fairly quickly. We started off with the Truffle fries and the Lobster, Crab & Artichoke Dip. I really liked the dip because it came with chips and pita bread. I got the Seared Ahi Steak Sandwich. Too good! My mouth was watering and even when I finished it, the thought of eating it again was too exciting. The negative thing that happened while we were eating was the fire alarm seriously went off for a good 15 minutes. The manager did come around to explain the situation, but it was whatever. I swear I heard the ringing of the alarm even after it stopped. The second time I came here, I took my parents for Mother's Day. We probably waited for at least 35 minutes. My dad ate the New York Steak Sandwich. TOO GOOD! It was ginormous when it came out, I don't know how he managed to eat it all. My mom had the Chicken Garlic Noodles, which I really liked and kept picking off her food. Once again I had the same thing. Anyways, the food here is so good that I recommend going here. It is a "high-end" Bj's. I might be over exaggerating this place, but either way it is based off my personal opinion and I really like this place.  NOM NOM NOM

Reviews.Author: Aimee L.
Reviews.Content: This place just opened so I expected it to be busy on a Saturday afternoon/evening.  We got there around 4pm and waited about 1/2 hour for a table.  By the time 5pm hit there was a crowd outside waiting for tables.  The food was good.  I had the gorgonzola burger with truffle fries.  It was really delish!  A little overpriced for some things on the menu, but they do have a lunch menu from 11am-5pm daily so that is nice.  LOTS of beers to try.  They have them listed in categories so that helps, but I was still lost as to what I wanted to try.  I like Blue Moon so I ordered a White Lightning Speakeasy beer.  It was aight, but definitely didn't hit the spot.The annoying thing about this place is they had the Giants game on every TV except two.  The other two had womens soccer and golf.  We asked repeatedly to play the Tampa Bay vs Bruins game, but they never did.  A couple was seated next to us and they asked for the Giants game on the TV so they got it.  Not everyone in the Bay Area is a Giants fan!

Reviews.Author: Lynn V.
Reviews.Content: Finally...Yard House made its way up to NorCal. I've dined at the one in Irvine and liked my experience, so I was looking forward to this one opening up in Santana Row. I came here last Wed with 2 girlfriends at 8:30pm and there was a 35 minute wait. We grabbed a seat at the bar and ordered an appetizer. Time flew by fast and when our buzzer went off, we were seated at a table. The NBA playoffs were on that night so it was great that they had all those TVs around. The food was delicious! Granted, it was basic bar food...American. But the portions were HUGE and I highly suggest getting a few items on the menu and sharing. The atmosphere was lively and it was definitely a young crowd at that time of day. Anyway, they have an extensive drink and food menu and I'll surely come back for more.

Reviews.Author: Janet H.
Reviews.Content: Wow, I'm so surprised to see that Yard House already has close to 400 reviews and it has only been opened since April!Anyway, it looks like Yard House might be my new favorite hangout! They have over 100 different beer of tap and delicious food! The place really reminds me of bj's but yummier and a greater beer selection, of course. They also serve wine for those non-beer lovers (such a crime!). My best friend and I came randomly and split the mac n cheese and summer salad. The mac n cheese was so soulful and complex... seriously a plate of cheesy perfection! This bold dish was packed full of flavor! it's a perfect dish to split between two people because it's so rich.The summer appetizer salad is the perfect salad if you love sweet things, because it was filled with strawberries, oranges, and candied walnuts that harmonized well with the greens. So refreshing! I also ordered the 6-beer sampler ($8.99) which was pretty neat... but I couldn't really finish even half of it. I think I'm just going to stick to a glass of beer next time. My only complaint is the food and drinks took awhile to come... In fact, our appetizer came after our entree. Strange combination...Overall, pleasant experience here... Great and fun staff, too.  Be prepared, Yard House, for I will be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Aivy C.
Reviews.Content: Sweet potato fries with maple bacon dip, and a glass of beer. I have pretty simple needs.It gets crowded, but that's Santana Row for you. Be prepared to have to yell at your friend sitting just across the booth from you in order to keep up a steady stream of conversation.I wouldn't come here expecting a full on meal and service (especially on weekend nights and during televised games), but a couple of beers and some snacks should suffice.

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for weekday lunch a couple of times with a group from work.  It's a great place to come with a group as there's something for everyone; kind of like Cheesecake Factory when it comes to the various types of food available.  Seems like they take reservations if over 10 people.  Weekday lunch is not crowded here so it's a nice place for a leisurely lunch, but I think I've learned now that there is nothing good that's healthy here!  The healthier food I've had has been nothing but disappointing!  All the unhealthy choices are the GOOD stuff, but if you check out their nutritional facts, you WILL be shocked!For lunch, I've tried the following appetizers:Truffle Fries - pretty good when it's hotShrimp Ceviche Spoons - skip it....nothing greatFried Calamari - good, but nothing specialBlue Crab Cakes - DISAPPOINTING!  Skip it, not worth it.Grilled Korean BBQ Beef - YUMMY!  Worth getting as a meal!Chopped Salad - Didn't realize until I got my order that this salad doesn't have any lettuce and it consists mostly of celery.  Bleh!  Wrong choice!I've had the Lunch Combo with Roasted Turkey Club and Mixed Field Green Salad, but this was boring as well.  So learn from me.....when you're here, get the unhealthy stuff and you'll be much happier and satisfied!!!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan T.
Reviews.Content: I've come here on Wednesdays for happy hour and I haven't been disappointed yet! Their appetizers are all pretty good. The onion tower is huge and they give generous portions of the fried calamari. We also got the crab cakes which were by far the best dish there but you only get two so you should eat that slowly and enjoy its decadence.  The truffle fries here are also excellent and definitely have that earthy taste that truffle-flavored foods have. The pizzas here are also good for their price point during happy hour and the sliders will definitely fill you up! for $25 expect a feast if you're here for happy hour.  Our server was always around and keeping a close eye in case we needed anything which was nice. The restaurant itself was pretty clean and the bathrooms were impressively well-kept. Definitely something worth going to if you have the chance with friends for happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Ali C.
Reviews.Content: Great beers on tap!!  They have 150 of them and I only tried 3.. Try the House Honey Beer if you want to be happy for the rest of the night. Didn't wait 2 hours for a table because we sat with a guy who was sitting alone.  He was also dating the manager so the service was awesome!  We tried the Ahi Tuna Poke Bowl and the Lobster Garlic Noodles.  Both were great but it might have been the beer too.  The Poke Bowl had lots of fresh tuna and was definitely not like other pokes I have had in the past.  The Lobster Garlic Noodles also had crab and shrimp in it!  It was delicious and perfect for sharing.  Yards of beer are $13 and pints are $6.  Pretty decent for Santana Row if you ask me.  Next time, I will just be coming to try the 147 beers I have yet to taste..

Reviews.Author: James N.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this place at least 4 stars but unfortunately, I couldn't.The wait wasn't too long but I never judge a place based on the wait unless I know the workers are just being lazy. My girlfriend and I waited exactly 1 hour before our buzzer buzzed and we were seated.The place has a really nice ambiance and really casual feel. Great place to enjoy a bunch of beers with your friends and take a stroll through Santana Row. The food is what made me not like this place as much as I wish I could have. My girlfriend ordered the Spicy Jambalaya with Pasta and I had the Orange Peel Chicken.The Jambalaya wasnt even spicy, the sausages had this weird ass taste, the crawfish had flavor, the shrimp lacked flavor and the pasta was bland.My Orange Peel Chicken wasn't so bad but the chicken gets really sweet after you finish a few pieces and it has a very strong orange peel taste that wasn't good. The sweet jasmine rice was pretty bad ass though.I couldn't put my finger on it but what the hell is up with the floors ? I was walking to the bathroom and the floor feels like its wet throughout the restaurant but its just the material. What the hell is that ? Oh, and the bathrooms are awesome. The stalls are actually doors and the sink is washes you hand like a waterfall. That was pretty cool.But those floors are weird though ...3 stars !

Reviews.Author: Tomomi S.
Reviews.Content: 2 and half hour wait... As ridiculous as it sounds, people do wait that long to eat here. I was here for happy hour on Friday late afternoon. With Sharks Playoff Game on TV at 4pm, this place was packed like Japanese train during the rush hour. We, group of 4, wanted to get a table to eat and watch the game but what were we thinking...?  So we stood at the bar area for the entire 3 hours with drinks on our hand. I like to look at all the colorful beer taps and watching people struggle with the half yard glass. Some people DO need training on that.  My husband and I went back to eat the next day as the image of yummy looking foods were stuck in my head and I could not shake it off. This time we only waited for about 20 minutes and got a table. Luckily we found chairs at the bar area so wait wasn't bad after all. We ordered Hummus from the snack menu. I like the snack menu as it came out very quickly and it will be perfect as beer snacks or appetizer for your appetizer. Onion ring tower was pretty good as well. Fun presentation, and we both loved the Chipotle dipping sauce (the red one). My Grilled Pastrami sandwich was ok, french bread was too much bread for me so I took out the top bread and made it an open sandwich. My husband's spicy chicken sandwich was well blackened, spicy and pretty big. I hate the wait here, but have to admit, this is a fun place to hang out with friends, beer selection is amazing and food is pretty good. Just prepared to deal with the crowds and parking.

Reviews.Author: Omi Y.
Reviews.Content: Yay Yard House is opened! Located right at the corner of Santana Row you can't miss it....I miss the Yard House in socal and was anticipating the opening of this place!Yard House is known for their large selection of beer...and boy oh boy was there a lot of beers to choose from...beer ranges from $6-8There is plenty of seating, but this place gets crowded and loud...Our server was very nice...They close at midnight and go around and tell you that they are closing soon... so we had to down our beers =)...overall a fun night!I must come back for happy hour ...that is a waay better deal...

Reviews.Author: Alyssa S.
Reviews.Content: Overhyped.While I think the food is pretty good and plentiful and the beer selection is impressive, I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.  Especially if I'm trying to watch a major sporting event.  Yeah, there's TVs all over the place but you can't even hear anything!  Therefore, people need to stop calling it a sports bar, because it isn't one.  Hell, I watched Stanford's bowl game against Oklahoma State here and while the crowd had its moment, it definitely isn't the vibe that I'm seeking.It's not that I'll REFUSE to go here...this just wouldn't be my personal dining choice.  Plus, the wait for a table is ridiculously long.  I will say though that the trufle fries and mac & cheese is pretty awesome.  Just a little too heavy for me to eat for dinner and on its own.

Reviews.Author: Mei X.
Reviews.Content: I love this joint in San Jose as much as the one in Las Vegas. I've been eyeing this place to open ever since I moved back to Cali in 2010. On February 15th, I finally went to YH for my 21st birthday and it was lovely experience.Perhaps I'm easy to please, or the exceptionally price and delicious food they offer during on their Happy Hours, or the charming and witty staff that YH is known for. Oh heck, I'll say all of the above are what makes Yard House so special. My boyfriend and I went right at the beginning of their happy hour, so there was no waiting at all. However, as we sat throughout the two hours there, I noticed increasingly more and more people came for their HH and dinner. This made me extra glad that I got there early. So to start off, my bf got this beer that he will never forget (and he hates beer) and I got my first legal drink, Pomegranate Press Martini, it was sweet, fruity, and sweet at the same time. Next, I ordered Ahi Poke, Shitake Garlic Noodles, Gardein Wings, Fried Calamari, and Truffle Fries. Each dish were fantastic and the portion size is like an entree. I enjoyed every bit of the food with a big smile on my face.  Finally, as we were finishing up our entrees, our server brought us the dessert menu. And for me the bday girl, I got to choose one of their mini cakes with vanilla ice cream for free! My bf got the same but it was STILL decently priced! Out came the dessert and we heartily ate with open smiles while still finishing the last of our drinks. As sunlight dims into night time, the aura in the restaurant turns into a dark, cool, and sophisticated vibe. With everyone around us all having a good time like us, I couldn't help but eat a little bit more happy.Our total bill came out to be less than $45. For FIVE entree sized appetizers, two drinks and a dessert. My bf was surprised to find it so cheap, I couldn't agree more. Besides, our server was great and prompt with greeting us all the way to presenting our check. You would think it's unbelievable to get this type of deal in a place like Santana Row. But Yard House with their incredible Happy Hour menu, they sure do know how to keep their customers coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Jenny K.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the yardhouse in San Diego and tried a good variety of the menu and the food was just bland. So I didn't expect too much when they opened one here in Sj but I was impressed!*gardein orange peel chicken is to die for! I get it with the brown rice. It's perfectly crispy and the portion is just perfect. The only con would be the price. $16.85 for chicken and rice is a bit pricey for me*shitake garlic noodle was ok. Not enough mushrooms I think. It did get a bit dry after a few minutes. Nothing special*truffle fries are a must!! It's a great snack while waiting for your entree or just munching while you're having a drink. I get it every time*gardein spicy Thai chicken pizza is ok. I didn't like the long strips of chicken. I wish they had chopped it so it would be easier to eat. Surprisingly, the pizza was just bland. I think they left it in the oven too long cause the sauce was too dried up. *gardein sliders and fries are absolutely delicious!! The portion is perfect. They give you 3 sliders with diff meat options and a side of fries*chicken nachos = must have!!! I ordered this with two coworkers and the 3 of us could hardly finish it. It has everything you can imagine on it. It's an absolute must try. I couldn't finish my entree after finishing this appetizer. So beware! Sharing is caring!*grilled cheese with tomato bisque was a little disappointing. The grilled cheese was a bit burnt and too salty for me. The tomato bisque is delicious though! Although I don't think I could finish a cup of it. A bit creamy but still great. Their beers and wine is pretty good. They have an entire menu for both. I've tried their beer delirium and if you like blue moon or Stella you'll def love this beer! I've had their red wine 337 and its a nice subtle wine. Def recommend!

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: I had the worst experience ever. I went here with couple of friends last night and our server was the rudest of all. I know it is not easy to be nice to everyone that you serve especially at a busy hour, however, as a paying customer, I expect decent service.  As we left the restaurant and were walking away, I heard someone yell something about skipping the bill from behind. I did not know it was intended for us. Our server ran past us and stood in front of us. He said "did you decided to skip on the bill tonight?" in a very rude manner. He had the check folder open and pushed it towards my friend's face. By this time, other people were staring at us. At that moment, I thought 'my God, someone took our money and now we are accused of not paying'. I took the bill from the server's hand and checked. Money was there under the printed check. Server said "oh", took the check back and left us. If he said sorry, I did not hear it and neither did my friends. I thought I would let him know how I felt. I managed to say "dude" as he walked away from us and never looked back.He was quick to accuse us rudely and loudly for others to hear. When proven wrong, he was just as quick to walk away without a proper apology. I was embarrassed by the false accusation and people staring at us and I was also embarrassed for having my friends go through such unpleasant experience at the restaurant.All my life, I've never been to a restaurant that treated customers like criminals. I wouldn't return to this kind of restaurant even if the food is good.

Reviews.Author: Steve K.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to eat out late in a rather quiet San Jose city.Service was fantastic, the hand crafted lager was brilliant, and the Jambalya was A+. Was surprised how crowded it was at 12am on a Tuesday - ambiance is fantastic if you enjoy high energy and fast paced music.

Reviews.Author: Kristina I.
Reviews.Content: I always skim through their humongous menu and think I'm going to try something new but I never do, because what I normally get is just too darn good.Their jambalaya is the best I've ever had, but it needs more spice so I always request for a little extra. Truffle fries for an appetizer is a must and it's great paired with any of their countless beers.  I'm the type of gal that likes her drinks fruity, so I stick with their Sea Dog Blue Paw Blueberry beer. Absolutely my favorite beer and I contemplate driving all the way from SF just to quench my thirst for it. Downside, it's always so crowded here. But at least they give 21+ wrist bands later in the night to avoid the hassle of constantly taking out the ID.

Reviews.Author: Diana P.
Reviews.Content: 2 hour wait, so make plans to walk around Santana before hand! Really sweet staff & quick turn over- the staff was honest about the wait but they kept updating us, which I thought was super nice and made the experience more bearable. I mean, who wants to wait that long right? I'm a big cider girl, tried the raspberry cider, DELICIOUS ! Our entire party tried different beers (fruity pebble, strawberry, & the other fruity one) & they were all really good! Everyone suggested the truffle fries-- got the surf & turf burger with the fries. Really filling, tender, flavorful, and juicy.Excited to come back and try the other things on the menu & especially wanna come back for a happy hour! Not that crazy about the wait time, but the ambiance is really fun --especially with a group that likes to drink. Totally thought it was a fancier BJs. So if you're a fan of BJ's I think you'll enjoy YardHouse.

Reviews.Author: Carina M.
Reviews.Content: I had to downgrade this to 2 stars. Why? Well...I've come back here several times since my initial review and the service has seriously taken a huge hit. While still friendly and affable, it's gone slower than a snail's pace. Accuracy has gone out the door.Arrived here for a friend's post bday lunch celebration...ok, it was closer to 7pm. We were seated pretty quickly - under 30 minutes. SCORE!Our server greeted us with a friendly smile with the servitude to match. Can't get that much in the Bay Area nowadays so we were thrilled. However, things went downhill massively fast after that. We ordere appetizers that took 20 minutes to get to us, but when it did they were all stone cold; barely above lukewarm. We had to return 2 of them and when we received our allegedly newer appetizers, they were also stone cold/barely above lukewarm. We decided not to quibble.Main courses arrived! Yay! I got the mac and cheese, hubby got the pot pie and sadly, I forgot what our other friends got. Hubby's food was steaming hot - it looked fabulous and tasted great. Although it looked like the puff pastry wasn't browned long enough because it was a very pale shade and the layers under were just barely cooked....and then we got to my food. Stone cold. Like it had been sitting under a heat lamp. The cheese sauce had coagulated and started to thicken in a way that was not appealing. The freshly sprinkled cheese on top looked like it had seen 15 minutes already and was about to expire.We'd have definitely complained, but our server was nowhere to be found. I take that back, she was flying around so much that we couldn't flag her down. Plus, I think she was miffed about us having complained earlier. It's not her fault, is it?They have runners, but it seemed very slow and a bit disorganized which was a very marked difference from the other YH I've frequented and from when it first opened. I think this location needs to be retrained because they clearly can't keep up with the demand of a busy, fast paced restaurant.When the YH gets it right, it's great - it's what keeps me coming back, but I don't want it to turn into another BJ's for me. I sincerely hope the YH gets their act together before I write them off permanently.

Reviews.Author: Vivian l.
Reviews.Content: Honestly this place is.... hype.  The happy hour is great, the truffle fries are deilicious, and the strawberry tinnerman is delicious. But the food....was honestly nothing special.   If you get there before the rush, other wise you're gonna find yourself waiting for a table for hours.  This place is great for groups and you definitely don't need to worry about being too loud cause it IS loud in there. Other than the wide selection of drinks and the truffle fries really nothing special.  Is it worth checking out?  Sure, but i wouldn't put it on my "places to eat before i die" list.  It really is just.. whatever.OH!  but if you're into sports this IS a great place for you!  But again, be prepared to wait in line or stand the entire time.  Cause on game nights, you're probably NOT going to get a table ESPECIALLY during happy hour.

Reviews.Author: samina p.
Reviews.Content: Giving Yard House 2 stars because MOST of the time the service is pretty good and the food is better than most places at the Row.  Things have gone down hill since that total biatch of a hostess, Lucia joined the crew.  She made for the worst birthday experience this weekend, I had to walk out.  Nope, you're not hurting for my $150 when you have a 2 hour wait to get a table..... but who needs employees like this.  Hope you get rid of this chick... few of us will come back if you do. Thanks.

Reviews.Author: Trina L.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here for happy hour so this review is based solely on that.Happy hour here is awesome ! Big portions for a great price. They offer 50% of appetizers, pizza and reduced priced sliders. I've had both the turkey and ahi tuna sliders and I have to say that the tuna sliders were a little too salty for my taste. But everything else that I've tried has been great. I would recommend the truffle fries and chicken nachos/chicken wraps.The drink specials are great too. I'm not much of a beer person (not a fan the wheaty taste), so if you're like me, I would recommend the strawberry framboise beer-it's super light and refreshing ! Also, the cocktails are really good too- I love my margaritas!

Reviews.Author: Lyn L.
Reviews.Content: Appetizers here are so amazing that I feel like I'm in heaven!  My favorite is are the Hawaiian poke tuna.I've been here twice.  I went for the first to  their pre-opening party on April 16, 2011.  They served samples of scallops, classic cheeseburger, garlic noodle, summer salad, penne with chicken, artichoke dip, ahi poke tuna and fried chicken.  All were surprizingly delicious and tasted so fresh.   I wasn't eating beef at that time, but all my friends liked the cheeseburger.  Then the best part was saved for last, they served creme brulee for dessert which was to die for.  I heard the angels sing!  On top was glazed sugar and slices of banana and at the bottom was chocolate!  Yummmy.  I want to go back soon to have that.  So I went the second time this past Saturday around 3pm and they said it was an hour wait, but we only waited for 15 minutes for a table. In the mean time we hung out the bar area.  I don't like beer because the one's I've had tasted bitter and gross.  But with my friend's recommendations, found the beer that I like!  Cheers to Paulaner and Dunkel "Bavarian Hefeweizen" from Germany.  Paulaner is so light and refreshing and Dunkel is just a little darker.  For snacks, we had the ahi poke bowl ($5.45) and guacamole with chips ($4.95), and both were so delicious! This place just opened up, so it gets really crowded.  Tried to go there for happy hour on a Thursday night in the first week they opened, but the wait was 2 hours!  So that's the only bad thing.  But service is great and the foods are definitely 5 stars!  And they have so many TV's!  Great place to hang out with friends!

Reviews.Author: Brittany S.
Reviews.Content: Cool spot but they're trying to be a sports bar (TVs everywhere), yet the manager refused to put on the sound for the Sharks game - during the playoffs! Manager Jason didn't seem to have a clue. He said that the restaurant would not play sound for every Giants game either - but we're talking about a deciding game 6 in NHL playoffs, not your run of the mill baseball game. Give me a break. Take down the TVs if you're not serious about being a sports bar, and check your zip code - you're IN Sharks territory. Unbelievable.I'd rate the food, but our group was never shown to a table - despite being paged twice (false alarms, they said) and waiting for 2 hours when we'd been told the wait was 1 hour and 15 min. We had a lovely dinner and fantastic service at Village Bistro instead.

Reviews.Author: Drea B.
Reviews.Content: So. Many. Televisions.This is THE place for any sports event. Stopped by Yard House for the basketball finals last year. It was wild! I ordered the hot wings, a few beers, and red wine. Why did I mix drinks, you ask? I don't know, honestly. I was just so excited to finally make it to Yard House after hearing all the hype about it.To my surprise, I didn't experience much of a wait during the lunch hour on a weekend :)I'd love to check out Yard House during the evening, but I do not enjoy anticipating the long line I will likely encounter.

Reviews.Author: Rishi G.
Reviews.Content: 3 and a half stars? C'mon Yelpers, I know this isn't a family owned place serving fair trade, vegan, organic, locally sourced produce that has predominantly LGBT employees - but this place is freaking tight.1) Past 9 pm, your dining options diminish significantly in Santana Row. You can try to get some sushi with the cougars at Blowfish Sushi. Seduce some girl at a bachelorette party so you can get into Maggiano's. Or just fucking come here where the menu is diverse (sandwiches, pasta, misc California/American entrees, steak, appetizers, etc). Everything is pretty good, Orange Peel Chicken and Crab Encrusted Swordfish are my favorites.2) 100-ish beers on tap, and the selection rotates frequently. I wish there were more Belgians, and the domestic selection had more craft beers, but it's still an amazing selection. Your Bud Light drinking redneck friends will find something, as well as your friend who can't stop talking about the barley concentration from when he made his own beer.3) Fun environment. Dark and intimate, but it's not tacky and it's appropriate for a variety of occasions. Birthdays, hanging out with friends, dates, it'll work for almost all of it.4) Service is attentive and friendly. Despite the fact that this place is always packed, I've never had any significant issues. We've had the bartender mess things up on occasion, but that's always corrected.One of the best places in Santana Row, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Pearl V.
Reviews.Content: Happy Hour is awesome. Most of all the appetizers on the menu are half off, as are the beers.Tried:Beef SlidersTruffle FriesChicken Lettuce WrapsLobster, Crab, and Artichoke DipGarlic NoodlesLobster Garlic NoodlesClub Sandwich________________________________________Yes the wait blows. When will the hype about this place die down already so I can come at any given time and get seated in 5 minutes or less?! Geez.

Reviews.Author: Anh Thu P.
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what the hype is about. Everyone from socal is absolutely mesmerized by this place and here I am thinking it's just like another cheesecake or Bj's, but the location is perfect. Santana row is the perfect place to be classy yet get down and dirty with some good american food. The wait however is horrendous, so be prepared to wait a super long line for dinner!Although I do not like beer at all, I understand the great appeal to people about their variety and huge selection on draft. The bf and I ordered the beer sampler (which is a bit pricey) but a nice experience to try. We went during happy hour and it was half off appetizers and some drinks. The appetizers were super worth it. We got the pepperoni mushroom and thai spiced pizzas which were really huge and we barely got through one! We also ordered the spinach dip appetizer but that was super gross after a while. I expected bread with the spinach dip or something a bit studier than their super flail and oily chips. It was for the boyfriends birthday and he got a complimentary souffle that was powdered with sugar to say happy birthday! It was super cute, but the souffle was nothing amazing. It lacked a lot of flavor. I would only come back to try their blueberry and strawberry beer, I hear it is a favorite for those who don't even like alcohol!

Reviews.Author: May D.
Reviews.Content: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer...Seriously, I had no idea what beer to get after browsing through what seemed like an never ending menu of IPAs, ales, lagers, stouts, pilsners - you name it and they most likely got it. It takes me about 15 minutes just to choose a damn beer here and while your girl likes options, they've got plenty AND for an extremely reasonable price too! I personally love their house honey beer and the blueberry beer - can never go wrong with these two.  Go during happy hour (M-F from 3-6 pm) and you can get a half yard of beer for about $7-$10 depending on what you choose. If you're hella thirsty and it's a Thursday, or if your boss pissed you off while at work, this is the definitely the place to be! Aside from their beer, the food is also worth raving about. I CANNOT stress how good their truffle fries are and it's a must that I get them every time I'm here. Thinly sliced fries that are perfectly crisp drizzled with truffle oil and topped off with freshly grated Parmesan cheese - absolute perfection for only $3! TIP: Get your own, you wouldn't want to share this. The ahi poke stack is another favorite of mine. The tuna is marinated in a flavorful medley of soy sauce and juices and tossed in an bed of carrots and avocado slices. Goes extremely well with the fried wontons this dish comes with. Only downside is that it does get extremely crowded and I don't like waiting...especially when I just want to drink.

Reviews.Author: Joe N.
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy that they finally added a new place to go to in Santana Row.  I was getting so sick of the usual Straits, to Sino, to Blowfish, then to Vbar to close the night tour.  Granted, Yard House is only open until 12, so the inevitable finishing out the night at Blowfish or Vbar is still in play.  The environment at Yard House is awesome.  The feel is similar to the one in San Diego, but it only has one and a half floors instead of the 2 floors at the SD location, so it seems smaller.  It's also not as stuffy and douchey like most of the other places in Santana Row can be, which is a welcome change.  I went on a night when the best NHL game ever played was shown (Sharks 6 - Kings 5), so that helped, but even if the outcome wasn't as good it was still an awesome night.  They had tv's playing all of the local games (minus my poor A's, who get no love) the NHL playoffs and the NBA playoffs.  The place was crazy crowded, but it didn't take 20 minutes to get a beer like the other places on the Row.For the food, the Chicken Garlic Noodles were delicious and was probably enough to fill up 1.5 or 2 people.  I was sad that I was not able to try the yard(the big beer glasses that the place is named for) yet, but I think I've found the beer that I'll have in it - The Seadog Blue Paw Wild Blueberry Wheat.  Fantastic taste and you can smell and taste the blueberries.

Reviews.Author: Jacki E.
Reviews.Content: ***FOOD*** GOOD: -Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer Beer -Seared ahi sashimi appetizer- yummy sauce and slaw -Ahi Poke tower- take some of the sauce from the sashimi appetizer above and dip your wonton with Poke in it -Sweet potato fries with caramel glaze- the sweet glaze grows on your after a while -Hot artichoke dip- yummy with the pita bread OK: -California roll cake- Not your ordinary CA roll. Interesting spin on it PASS: -Crab cake- I didn't care for mango salsa and the twist on the standard crab cake flavor.
