I couldn't tell if it was cornbread used as a filler or a cajun seasoning or both, but I prefer plain Maryland style crab cakes ***SERVICE*** Can't give them less stars for having a long wait, or running out certain beers or alcohol- it was opening weekend, you have to give them time to adjust to the local market/demand. Service was surprisingly pleasant for opening week. They had Yardhouse employees flown in from other cities to help open, so it was pretty organized and seemingly flawless. Let's see how long they can keep it up. These servers and bartenders were nicer, quicker, and more patient than most of the local bartenders you encounter at srow. I have to give them credit for putting up with drunks, people hitting on them, people who ask them a zillion questions when it's stupid busy, just all sorts of obnoxiousness...Don't be dumb and talk shit to the bartender like the guy who sat next to me at the bar; he tried to argue about the size of the shot, and got cut off from alcohol for the rest of the night.

Reviews.Author: Jolly R.
Reviews.Content: Sports Bar atmosphere, mediocre food at best.  You pay for the location and the aforementioned atmosphere, which I don't care for.Excellent beer selection.  I am picky when it comes to my brews so that earns a star, else I would have rated it two stars.

Reviews.Author: Pamela D.
Reviews.Content: Went in on a Monday night and thankfully it wasn't packed : ) Had the chicken thai pizza and friend got thai chicken noodle salad...both amazing.  Food, service and drinks were great.  Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: *5 stars for their beer selection.*5 stars for being a great hang out spot with friends (as long as you come early enough before the place gets packed).*4 stars for their happy hour food.Finally got to try Yard House after coming once and leaving due to the extremely long wait. Yesterday, we got here before 4pm and was happy to find many tables/bar open. We sat down at the bar and proceeded to browse the extensive drink selections. I love how they categorize their beers so that it is much easier to find a new beer to try while knowing its taste is similar to one you like. Being a fan of citrusy and orange spiced beers, I decided to order the Leinenkugel's Sunset Wheat. I thought Blue Moon was my favorite beer but have now discovered Leinenkugel's is even better!! Between the food and conversations, I also ordered the House Honey Blonde and Lost Coast Apricot Wheat. These two were also delicious as they have subtle tastes of honey/apricot. After all that beer, we decided to order some food. I was more then excited to try the spicy tuna roll as its presentation looked beautiful. It was basically layers of seared rare ahi, edamame, cucumbers, and a generous layer of avocado. A soy sauce based sauce and squirts of siracha surrounded the circular layer of deliciousness. It looked beautiful with all the colors and layers.. And for only $6, it's definitely a steal :)I also tried some of the boneless buffalo wings but have to say it's mediocre. It would have tasted a lot better if the outer layer was more crispy. Instead, the buffalo wings were soft and squishy. The buffalo sauce was good but the texture of the wings were not that great. For the price and large beer selection, I would definitely come back for happy hour! We left around 6pm and by then the place was already packed. Many people just stood around with their drinks as there were no more spots open at the bar/tables. Be warned, it's hard leaving this place without wanting to try numerous beers on tap. As my friends and I joked, we wanted to ask the bartender to give us a shot of each beer on tap.. which would have amounted to over 100 shots of beer. New favorite spot at Santana Row :)

Reviews.Author: Van L.
Reviews.Content: Like a BJ's, but better (I bet it's rare to hear something is better than a BJ ha ha). But seriously, this place has that same atmosphere - somewhere you can just chill with your friends, have a drink, and watch some sports. They have so many TV's! I got a bad first impression since I was expecting some super glamorous place from all the hype its gotten from my friends. When I walked in and it looked like a...you guessed it, BJ's, I was annoyed to hear that my wait would be 2 hours. Um, are you serious? This place better be damn spectacular! Too bad little ol' me couldn't wait because I was starving so I decided to get dinner somewhere else and come back in 2 hours for drinks. By the time I got there, my expectations weren't very high since I learned that they're mostly known for their beer selection and I'm not the biggest fan of beer.As recommended by a few of my friends, I got the snakebite and...I liked it! I suggest using a spoon or something to mix it up before drinking it. The sweetness from the pear cider really balances out the harp lager perfectly. I also tried drinks from my friends who had strawberry beer, blueberry, and one other that I wished I remembered (Guinness mixed with something) and they were all delicious! 4 stars for making me actually like beer :)I definitely plan on coming back (and earlier) for dinner because I hear they have amazing truffle fries!

Reviews.Author: Angelica  C.
Reviews.Content: There's always a huge wait here, and I would advise you that its definitely not worth any wait over 10 mins (if that).We came at about 10 on a Tuesday and it wasn't busy, but the service was slow and horrible. We watched our beers go flat waiting at the bar to be picked up.  But the server "swore he already dropped them off"...clearly he didn't.  He never cleared any of our plates even though we saw him walk by our table with empty hands 10+ times.  We had to flag him down for another round.  I have somewhat high expectations for servers in Santana Row... We just got a bunch of happy hour appetizers. The chicken nachos were pretty good, actually the are the only thing we liked other then the truffle fries (which we wanted another round of but were in a time crunch). The calamari was the worst by far the ahi tuna was WAY to salty. Obviously, their beer selection is impressive.  But I don't think I am going to be becoming a regular at Yardhouse anytime soon.  The food is average brewery food. A little but not a lot better then Rock Bottom or Bj's

Reviews.Author: Denise C.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night. From the reviews, it seemed like this was a pretty popular place and actually hard to get in, but we were lucky and it was a bad weather weekend where no one wanted to go out to the bars. Since it was past 10 pm, they had us get wristbands to get drinks at the bar, which was no big deal, and we got in just like that even though we had a pretty big group (6 people).It was semi-crowded inside (maybe about 80% full), but lots of people were already on their way out. This place has a crazy awesome selection of beer. TONS of beer on tap. From domestic to imports, this place has something for every beer lover (and even some cocktails for the non-beer drinker). As I said in another review, I'm not a huge beer person, but I can appreciate the finer beers (aka not the Natty Light/Budweiser types).My friend picked up a Firestones Ale, while I tried one of their specialty lambics, the Tellermans Framboise (they had strawberry ones too which his cousin's sister got). My friend's cousin got a pear cider, while her fiancee picked a Leffe Blonde. We all seemed to like our drinks (and there are definitely non-beer drinkers in our group). After wandering for a while (tons of people had the half yard, which is basically this huge glass that is half a yard long), we decided we would sit down at a table and chill for a bit.It wasn't too difficult to get a table at all. After sitting down, we decided to order some food and ended up deciding on some chicken tenders, their truffle fries, and some calamari. The food came relatively quickly and it all looked pretty reasonable. There were maybe four chicken tenders, which we all shared, which came on top of a generous serving of thin cut pencil fries (which were really done well). The truffle fries were tasty and fried perfectly and covered with Parmesan shavings and herbs (some of the best I've had). The calamari was well... calamari. Nothing special, but nothing awful either.Had a great time here; the only thing that we had a gripe about was the fact the waitress kept coming to our table and asking us if we wanted to order more drinks/food (like every 10 minutes). I think for a table our size, our table wasn't netting her a bunch. Still, I would consider coming back here if I was in the area; it beats the majority of the other places on Santana Row when all you want to do is hang out and chill.

Reviews.Author: Inde A.
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this place when I first walked in. Yard House is in a nice part of San Jose and the interior design and atmosphere were both great. The beer selection is impressive - somewhere around 130 beers on tap.The food was disappointing. The calamari appetizer was a bit soggy and the portion was very small. The Spicy Jambalaya was very greasy and left me feeling queasy. I would go back for the beer selection but doubt I would eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Adam C.
Reviews.Content: Been a few times now. I am a fan, but gosh darn it does it get loud and crowded in this place. I think its great for happy hour, but you most definitely have to get here early if you not enjoy the hours long wait.Food is above average they have some dishes that I think are quite delicious and others that are just ok. Love the long list of beer menu items if you are a beer lover then you need to come by at least once.My favorite dish is but of course their Mac and Cheese. I think its just delicious. Cooked with bacon, chicken, and truffles. Very tasty and I am sure horribly unhealthy, but its just so yummy. Portions are way huge at the Yard House, which means you can share most of the menu items. Normally I have only gone during happy hour so we tend to end up ordering the half price appetizers. Tried the  mushroom lettuce wraps (Bombay), chicken lettuce wraps (Bombay), chicken nachos (My Fav), seared ahi tuna (Tasty), california roll (No repeato mr roboto), and hawiian poke stack (Liked it). My girlfriend really likes their Tomato Bisque soup and I tried the grilled pastrami sandwich it wasn't bad but nothing special either.If you are a sports fan and there is a big game on then this is for sure a good spot since they have TVs everywhere. Watched a couple of Sharks games here and it was crackin. The Red Wings fans got booed the entire night. Servers are friendly and attentive. Only real issue I have with this place is that is gets super loud and crowded.Repeat Offender in my book for this Hapa.

Reviews.Author: Cathy L.
Reviews.Content: My review is going to be based on three occasions.My first time at this location was a Saturday at 6pm for 8 people. We were told the wait would be 3 hours so we just got a round of beer at the bar n went to cheesecake factory. The best way to get a bartender's attention is to wait by the cash register. The female bartender totally ignored us, probably bc she was mackin' on her two male customers. I went over to the next cash register and the male bartender recognized us immediately. My friends aren't into beer, so naturally we ordered the girly ones: leinkugel sunset wheat, timberland strawberry, and aproicot hef wheat. Leinkugel is my favorite beer, esp. on tap.  My second time was for dinner on a Monday for 3 people. We arrived a t6:25pm and were told the wait would be 45-hour, but it was actually 20 mins wait. I guess better to over estimate rather than under estimate. My server was rather annoying because she kept on checking up on us while she was busing other table. I'm almost positive she did that on purpose to get a quick turn around. I had the surf and turf burger which was excellent. Lobster and artichokes! YUM. My brother Thai Chicken Noodle. Bland as fuck. Avoid that dish. Avoid the lettuce wraps too. Heavy on the tofu and light on the garlic =(.My third time was for happy hour with 6 people. Our server was Bianca and she was awesome. She was knowledgeable with beer and very  friendly. Most of us were either buzzed or drunk throughout the night. I got to try like 6-8 diff. beers that night. The framboise is way too sweet. I really like the host staff at Yard House, very friendly and welcoming. They seat you, even if your whole party haven't arrived.Overall, I give this place 3.5 stars. The food isn't as good as San Diego's Yard House. Great addition to Santana Row nonetheless, and  will always be packed. I wish there was a yard house in DC.

Reviews.Author: Warren H.
Reviews.Content: I'm a BIG fan of Yard House and have been to, not only this one, but a few of the other Yard Houses located in California and Massachusetts. Seeing as how I come to Yard House quite often, I never really thought of doing a Yelp review on them and, on a random trip for lunch to the San Jose one, I decided to just do one.Right off the bat, I'm gonna give it five stars just for the beer selection that Yard House offers. EVERY Yard House you visit has AT LEAST 120 beers on tap so if you say you can't find a beer to drink, I'm gonna be a little inclined to call you a liar haha EVERY beer I have tried I have not disliked and always found very interesting as the beers I end up trying are very different and unique and not like your typical Bud Light flavor profile. The BIGGEST thing, literally, that makes Yard House what it is, is they're option they give to people to serve ALL 120+ beers in half-yard glasses....yes...that's right....HALF-YARD glasess as you can probably see from the pictures that other Yelpers have posted. Quit thinking about it and just get one, you won't be sorry.....or....maybe you will be...depending on how you look at it =P hahaOn to the food...for being a place that has 120+ beers on tap, the food choices are very gourmet and give off the "high class" vibe that you would get from other high end places, but still keeping the comfortable ambiance that you're looking for. My co worker and I came for lunch, as I mentioned before, and I wasn't in the mood for a main entree, so I settled for a BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger with truffle fries (See Picture). The burger was delicious! Moist, tender, and never lost its flavor. The BBQ sauce was served on the side and had a very unique flavor profile because, of course, it's made out of rum. The truffle fries were delicious as well...crispy, great notes from the truffle and not too overpowering...proved to be a great balance with the burger.As I said before, I've been to Yard House for dinner quite a few times (Understatement of the Year haha) so I've also had a few dinner dishes, which I feel need to be honorably mentioned:(Mac + Cheese)2 - Really tasty and can't really go wrong with Mac & Cheese...it's like your typical Mac & Cheese on steroids.Southern Fried Chicken Breast - My absolute FAVORITE dish at Yard House! Very well balanced, very tasty, and the textures of the mashed potatoes, the crispy chicken breast, and the bourbon gravy are a perfect match.Surf & Turf Burger - I didn't have this myself; however, one of my good friends had it and had swore up and down about being very tasty and flavorful. The lobster and beef made for a perfect combination.I can't say enough good things about Yard House, the people that have given Yard House bad reviews are probably based on bad service or a bad experience, but the times that I have been there, which have been quite a few, I have no complaints! If you're in the mood for a NICE size beer, great food, and a good environment, go to Yard House...you'll have a great time! Bon Appetite!

Reviews.Author: Becky W.
Reviews.Content: The food is 3 and a half for me, but I love their extensive beer list, the size of it, and the atmosphere- so I'ma give it a 4. My friend and I both ordered the half yard snakebite- half woodchuck pear cider and half harp, LOVE IT! So refreshing, light, and crisp with just a hint of sweetness! She ordered the Tortilla soup and sliders with sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries was good, but wasn't as crispy as I would like it. I didn't try the other two, but she said it was really good. I ordered the Ahi Tuna Tower and Ahi Steak Sandwich. The Ahi Tuna Tower was meh. It wasn't as flavorful as I would like it (I guess that's what the light sodium soy sauce they give you is for), not enough ponzu sauce and I don't really like the sliced avocado on the side, I liked it more when it's mixed together with the fish. I also don't dig the overflown beansprout and carrot shreds with sesame oil (personal preference, some people may really like it). I LOVED the ahi steak sandwich though, so good! The ahi steak was cooked perfectly with the center being raw still, the caramelized onion adds the perfect sweetness to the sandwich, bread was perfectly toasted (very greasy though) and the tomato/spinach(arugula?) balanced out the heavy-ness of the sandwich. I opted out the fries for steamed vegetable, which is just your typical snap peas, broccoli, and carrots- nothing too special. The service was good, our waiter was friendly and attentive.The wait was about an hour, but it worked out fine for my friend and I as we waited by the bar with our beer and chatted the way through. I love this place!

Reviews.Author: Fraulein C.
Reviews.Content: Don't hate on me for the 4 stars! I'll explain. Beer enthusiast? Check. Great vibe? Check. Food? So-so. Worth the wait? Depends. Why do you ask? Well, I'm here on a weekly basis!After awhile, when a good thing comes...it really comes! When a good thing comes, sometimes, people get too greedy and take advantage of what's there.I like wine. I like my spirits too. However, I wasn't a fan with beer until now. I forgot how much I liked Yardhouse when I went to SoCal. Once the first location popped up in the Bay Area...wow! I felt really lucky. A quick 2 minute drive and I'm there!I'm fine with the florals, spritzy cider ales, tangy or bitterness flavor of IPAs, chocolate double goodness stouts....yum! And the countless amount of beer listed on their menu. Take it from me, I'm a chick that would rather be sipping on a cocktail or a glass of wine looking classy. Move over....I'm a fan! Their food is ridiculously priced and the long wait for a table is....crazy! BUT if you're smart and you know when's the best time, I'll give you the secret. Either you wait for that long awaited table, check around the bar or you come in early once it opens or an hour or two before they close. That's my easy tip to you Yelpers!If you don't see me elsewhere at Santana Row, come find me at Yardhouse! Happy hour?! Well...what do you think?!!They have Lunch Selections available 7 days a week from 11am-5pm. Happy Hour Mondays-Fridays 3pm-6pm & Sun-Wednesdays 10pm-12am!

Reviews.Author: Alexander E.
Reviews.Content: Santana Row has an endless selection of dining options, from upscale to fast casual, Santana has it.  Being that I live pretty far from Santana Row, I wanted to try something I hadn't had before.  I was set on trying one of the Mexican spots, but Yard House sounded quite appetizing.The menu is American and its mass appeal is its booze.  With over 100+ brews on tap and monstrous Vegas sized yard glasses, the Yard House is the place to get your tipsy on.  I skipped the booze, but the selection is impressive and the decor and atmosphere is upscale yet casual.  The food menu has all the main staples, such as salads, soups, burgers, pizzas, steak & ribs, seafood, and more.I settled on their Avocado & Swiss burger that's served with lettuce, tomato, red onion, and a roasted garlic aioli.  The burger comes standard with a side dish and I opted with the standard fries.  My fellow Yelper ordered a plain Pepperoni and Mushroom Pizza and an over-sized domestic beer.The food took a reasonable fifteen minutes or so to get to our table.  The presentation of the burger looked great and the burger looked just as appetizing.  The fries were cooked to a golden crisp and were the perfect side dish.  Although the burger looked appetizing, it looked much better than it tasted.  The beef patty lacked flavor, felt dry, and was a disappointment all around. The only thing that saved my burger was the nicely melted Swiss cheese and fresh avocado.I was really hoping the burger was a fluke but after tasting my friend's pizza, I was really disappointed.  It's extremely difficult to make a bad pizza, but the Yard House pie was simply uneatable.  The cheese was salty, the pepperoni was overly greasy and the mushrooms didn't resemble mushrooms. Had the pizza been my entree, I would of sent it back, which is something I never do.Ultimately, the food at Yard House was a huge disappointment.  I was expecting much more, especially given its size and impressive menu. I will, however, admit that the service was great, but will not merit a second visit with so many options on Santana Row.Ambiance: 4 Stars (out of 5)Food: 2 Stars (out of 5)Service: 4 Stars (out of 5)Price:  $$ (out of 4)Overall: 3 Stars (out of 5)

Reviews.Author: Linh V.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best happy hour ever.  After a day of shopping, the boy and I dropped in to satisfy our hunger.  The wait can be a bit long - 20 minutes or so. But sometimes you can find a seat at the bar. Although service at the bar sucks ass since you can easily be missed.Things to order:Garlic noodles:  Has anyone tried An's famous garlic noodles, aka Crustacean's garlic noodles?  Well this dish is a great cheap alternative.  A bit of shiitake mushrooms and a whole lotta garlic flavor.  Vampires and twilight fans beware.Buffalo wings:  Not that they're especially great or anything, just that it's happy hour and wings are always great.  Plus, they're always happy to give you an extra side of buffalo sauce.  Thai chicken pizza:  Out of all the pizzas, this one is the best.  It's sweet with a bit of spiciness. We finished all three plates.  Equally.  Bottomless pit I have.  :)

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
Reviews.Content: They should have some sort of section where people can hang out at while waiting for a table. Came here on a Sunday and as usual it was packed. Poor servers have been trying to squish through the crowds of people waiting for a table.Love the ambiance of yard house -location, decor and overall vibe is fresh, fun and lively. Great for groups it reminds me of an upscale BJ's.The french fries are dangerously good mixed with the skinny margarita is a must! :)

Reviews.Author: Peggy S.
Reviews.Content: If you wear traction-free five-inch heels, the floor here is not made for you.  It was like a slip-n-slide for me to maneuver my way around the crowds by the bar, especially with drinks in hand!  But I managed, thankyouverymuch.The wait here is almost unbearable.  I am not quite sure about the hype.  Maybe it is continuously bringing in new people, and everybody wants to try out their supposedly amazing selection of beer on tap.After about an hour of waiting on a Thursday evening, Sophia C. and I finally got seated.  We were able to grab a beer at the bar prior to being seated, so that killed a little bit of time.  They were so busy!I had a blueberry ale, which was super refreshing and not overpoweringly sweet.  Sophia, on the other hand, got a raspberry cider, and it was a little syrupy and definitely too sweet.  I would recommend sticking with the beer... none of that hard cider stuff.We ordered Mac n Cheese as our appetizer, which was topped with various mushrooms and pieces of chicken.  I like the done-ness of the pasta - al dente, but that was perfect when they were drenched in that creamy cheese sauce!  They were not too generous with the amount of chicken and mushroom in that dish.  Though it was mostly carbs, Soph and I still enjoyed every bite of it, and even had leftovers to take home with us.For entree, I decided on having the ahi salad.  I know, a very weak sauce dish to order in a restaurant like Yard House... but the ahi was fresh!  My only gripe is that they put way too much wonton strips in the salad and not enough slaw.  I asked that they go light on the dressing so they did, which made the salad perfect.  If I ended up having the regular amount of dressing, the salad could end up being soggy and too dense for me.Sophia ordered the blue crab cake hoagie and we upgraded the fries to be truffle fries.  Uh, those fries are to die for!  Though I do enjoy thick fries, these thinly sliced fries were crispy and delicate enough to compliment the truffle aroma.  It was one of the most enjoyable things I had that night!  I did not try Sophia's hoagie, but it looked huge and she could only finish half of it.The service was friendly, and came back to check on us periodically, just not quick enough.  I suppose they expect you to order more beer and chat away while you wait for your food, which is a very good strategy!

Reviews.Author: Tram N.
Reviews.Content: It can be really hard to find a seat, especially during happy hour but if you linger and take notes, you'll find some people who are about to leave -- that's the time to snag their seats!Happy hour: Monday - Friday 3-6pm, Sunday - Wednesday 10pm-closeHalf-off select pizza and appetizers

Reviews.Author: Jenny H.
Reviews.Content: 1st attempt  - 4 + hour wait2nd attempt - 2 + hour wait3rd attempt - 20 minute wait...whohoo!Finally have three tries, we finally made it in here.  I've been to Yardhous many times in socal and couldn't believe people here were going that crazy over this place.Food isn't that great but the 120 beers on tap makes it all worth it.  Get the half yard and you'll be one happy camper!

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Kickin' it in San Jose with my buddy, we were looking for a place to grab a late dinner.  Santana Row is where all the cool kids hang out so we decided to check out the scene.  It was decently busy for a Thursday night and planned to hit up a bar afterward for some drinks and hang out.We started off the meal with the lobster, spinach, and artichoke dip, which was served with pita bread and tortilla chips.  It's a good thing we're on a carb-free diet or, wait a minute...  It was pretty good but I thought the portion size was a tad small considering that it was about $13 for the appetizer.  I ordered the mac & cheese which had rubbery chicken, mushrooms, bacon, several cheese, and truffle oil.  It was very rich, but as I mentioned, the chicken was the definite weak spot in the dish.  At ~$17 it was downright expensive, but it's one of the few places to kick it with friends for dinner on a late Thursday.Service was just ok, and our waitress was pretty airy when it came to delivering on our meal.  She forgot how my buddy liked his burger, forgot a few things I asked for, and generally wasn't around.  For overpriced, over-glammed food, Yard House is a good choice but still falls short of Cheesecake Factory.  I'll be opting for a nice bowl of pho next time.Food: 5/10Service: 4/10Price: $$Atmosphere: 6/10

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: So-so meh food, but kinda saved by a large selection of beers (50-60).I waited 2 months after the Yard House opened to even attempt to get a table - I guess that's the Satans Row effect for you...I'm so confused with this place. Is it a sports bar trying to be an up-market restaurant?Or is it an upmarket restaurant trying to be a sports bar?Unfortunately it kinda fails on both aspects. Plenty TVs but not nearly enough seats at the bar to watch your sport of choice.Plenty tables for dining but the food is just your typical american fare.Will I go back? Yes -  because they serve some pretty nice British beers on tap. But probably not for the grub...

Reviews.Author: Marco O.
Reviews.Content: Whuuuut. BEERS on BEERS on BEERS!! I love going here after a long workday, not really.. i just like going here because im an alcohol enthusiast! LOL!Atmosphere: Great atmosphere! TVs are on with the current games, people around are always down to have a good time and for a chat, after 3 is what i  will call CUTE girls happy hour and you know what means.. cute girls get drinks and ugly ones get faucet water. LOLOL!! im jk.. guaranteed 3 hours of drinking, everyone should start looking good or yr not doing it right:)Food: Pizza, Calamari, Tuna roll and their HUGE nacho plate are always great hitters for a crowed of people. Easy to pick at, no drama over forking.. just grab and eat! Personal favorite here is the Calamari for me, its not a rubber band like other places and i think their beer batter is light- so it's not very filling.Drinks: Mai Tai, Chilled vodka, rose garden, & tokyo tea.. what I like about this place is that they'll remake a drink if it doesn't suit yr taste. I think that's something great considering they have such a drink variety. Thanks for this!Tips: DUI is $9,000.00 + it puts your life on hold, cab fare to yr house is less than $90.00. So, let's get home safely ok?:)

Reviews.Author: H T.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is the perfect addition to Santana Row, unfortunately, everyone else thinks so too! We've been here when there's been no wait to a 4 hour wait (on Saturday night) and everything in between.Pros:*Happy hour!! M - F: 3PM - 6PM half off selected appetizers and discounted beer and drinks*Late night happy hour!! Sunday - Wed: 10PM - Close*Tons of beer on tap (over 100!) *Pizza! Oh so yummy crust, fresh ingredients, and lots of toppings*Onion ring tower is really good but the portions are HUGE so be sure to share with others!*Tons of flat screen TVs with sportsCons:*Typically there's a long wait*Chinese Garlic noodles -skip! So greasy and pretty unappetizing!*Truffled french fries - skip! Not very truffley, just go for the regular fries instead!*Guacamole - skip! Their guac is simply meh, I wouldn't get it againTips:*Put your name down and go walk around! Their estimate on the wait time is usually pretty accurateBottom line, Yard House is a great go-to happy hour spot at Santana Row!

Reviews.Author: Amir A.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE YARD HOUSE.Came here to watch the Giants close out the Cardinals. There were so many fans out here that they couldn't guaranteeing a time for seating. Ended up getting a seat at the bar, and was seated about an hour later. The energy for the game was fantastic. Loud cheering, we are the champions blaring, and a great selection of food and drinks to accommodate it all. Drinks were half off because of the game. All of appetizers are delicious especially the garlic fries. Parking in the structure is easy and plentiful. One of my favorite spots to stop by when I'm in the area since it is centrally located in Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: amy c.
Reviews.Content: Oh Yard House... just when most eateries in Santana Row seemed blah and bland, yourarrival changes my perception of the food scene in SR.Came here for lunch with my friend, she's been here once and had good things to say.This place is nice, clean, open and ROOMY. Seemingly huge range of beers on the menu.Can i say how i drooled over the menu (available online)... it all sounds YUM but the truth of the matter is that most places that serves that variety of beer usually considersfood a lower priority. it's like beer goggles - the more you drink the less you noticethe food isn't really up to par - you'd order anything fried to soak up the alcohol anyway!However, with no alcohol at the table, my perspective on the food here was unclouded...passion fruit ice tea (not bitter at all, quite refreshing as ice teas go)shrimp cerviche spoons - delish. There's 4 little spoons and I would have easily been able to eat 2 plates of these by myself.The shrimp was fresh, the flavors balanced just right between the lime and mango for sweet and tart flavors. With a fewstripes of crunchy tortilla chips on top, this was a perfectly balance bite for those who likes fresh seafood.appertizer ceasar salad - pretty standard ceasar salad, however the extra cheese cracker bites added a bit of interesting textureand flavor.Ahi Tuna appertizer - delicious citrus-gingerish sauce. This was yummy and my friend and i fought over the last bites.Jambalaya - yummy yummy. This was by far one of the best interpretation of jambalaya i've had. Granted this dish is got somepretty strong red pepper flavors and gets a bit greasy in the end, but lots of seafood, lots of flavor. I'd definitely order againYard house has some mini size desserts and full size ones - I think it's a great idea. Especially when shared, even when my friendand I were so full, we still ordered a mini dessert each to finish the meal without overeating (well, without SEVERELY overeating).the mini lemon souffle - yummy, airy and definitely lemony. it's like a fluffy light version of cake and i inhaled it along with the 3 raspberries on top.mini creme brulee - this one is interesting - you'd definitely have to love bananas. They put sliced bananas on top and torch itso the top of the banana is caramelized, then you get the creme part, but on the bottom, it's got melted chocolate chips.However, the chocolate chips were no longer 'melted' at serving time. I think they could do even better by quickly torching the bottomto remelt the chocolate chips, then torch the top for the sugar glaze, then serve it. All in all Yard House offers a decent variety for the picky eaters (non seafood, non meat, etc etc) - lots of decent beer choices (I'llhave to come back to try and follow up with an updated review). They have half size lunch portions as well as mini portion desserts, whichhands down wins my heart (I am one of those ppl who loves to try the flavors of a lot of different food but isn't so happy having 1 single huge heaping plate of food). I would order everything again - and definitely crave the Ahi Tuna appertizer as well as the jambalaya. For the amount and qualityand variety of food I shared for lunch, the price is decent (also considering this is in Santana Row). All in all I would definitely recommentthis place if you want decent food in a casual but clean environment. (I hope it stays this way even after the restaurant is no longer so 'new')I hear there's lines on weekends so your best bet is to come on weekdays if you really want to try the food. Lunch got pretty packed for a Monday. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: We came here for a little Friday late afternoon Happy Hour, and apparently, everyone and their moms thought the same thing.  The tables, the bar stools, and the standing room around the bar was packed.   The wait for a table was 30-45 minutes around 5 'o clock, so be prepared to grab some drinks at the bar and stand around being a fire hazard for awhile.  Props to our server who hustled to get our drink and food orders in before Happy Hour ended.The house martinis were too sweet - I ended up getting a regular ol' gin one after the first round.  Obviously, this isn't the place to go for a good mixed drink, but there's a wide variety of beers are on tap.The appetizers were standard bar grubs - good but nothing amazing or unique.   The Fried Calamari, Hawaiian Poke Stack, and Blue Crab Cakes were just ok - all seemed to lack flavor.  The pita chips that came with the Avocado Dip were a nice treat compared to the usual tortilla chips.  The Buffalo Wings were good in quality and quantity to go with a light buzz.With just ok food and ridiculous waits, I wouldn't go out of my way to hit up Yard House for Happy Hour for fear of bumping into my friends' moms or worse, my own mom.

Reviews.Author: Diana P.
Reviews.Content: So I'm 0 for 2 with Yard House a week after it's opened. Don't get me wrong. I love a place with tons of beer on tap, and living in the OC and having a couple YH's nearby... I generally like this place.Yard House in Santa Row is a zoo. I understand they've just opened, but something is just a bit ridiculous about a 2+ hour wait. To make matters worse, the people at the door wouldn't let guests in, even if they already had a table, or just popped out for a minute. Instead guests had to queue up in a line to the side of the restaurant. Really people? Is this place that awesome that it reaches maximum capacity even on weeknights? This is a bar/restaurant not a Vegas club!On my second attempt, we managed to sit down at a table (but mind you a friend had been squatting there since 4:30 pm). Table? Check. Beer? Hmmm.  My friend with an international drivers license was flat out denied. Apparently they only accept passports here people, so internationals be warned!  After waiting 20 minutes and still not receiving my beer (that I had the proper ID for) we decided to cut our losses.Maybe... just maybe I'll check back with YH in another 6 months or so when all the hoopla has died down a bit and I can get a decent pint and sliders.

Reviews.Author: Marissa D.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Yard House in Scottsdale but when I went to the newly opened one in Santana Row, I suddenly didn't remember the Scottsdale one being so cool.The ambiance is great for The Row and is actually just the kind of place that The Row was missing. Our service was fast and the food was great. You've probably seen the menu elsewhere before, but the quality of the food was great.I had the Pineapple Express and it was one of my highlights that Mother's Day Sunday.Note: They just opened and do not currently take reservations, so expect a manageable wait of about 25-30 mins.

Reviews.Author: Frances T.
Reviews.Content: OMFG, whoever thought about having this many beers on TAP is a genious!! "HOLD UP!! I don't even LIKE beer!" (do you say?)Uhh, me either, but every time I come here, I love beer all of a sudden. Maybe because they have something for everyone!!! I really like the black velvet (I think that is what it is called). Ladies, you will love that beer if you don't enjoy the bitter taste of beer or if you think all beer tastes the same. This one reminds me of a like a smooth chocolatey beer. Mmm =)I just wish they had more toilets for everyone, cause you know I broke the seel!!! LOL

Reviews.Author: Sarah A.
Reviews.Content: I'll be real... Only reason why this place gets 3 stars is for 2 things: 1. Strawberry beer 2. Garlic NoodlesA must for all to try!! I guess strawberry beer is more of a girly thing but guys... you can ask your gf to buy it so you can look manly and then you can pretend to take sips but really drink the whole thing. Secondly, Garlic noodles are so bomb here!! Very buttery and well garlic-y hence garlic noodles. They have it in 3 different kinds: veggie, chicken, seafood.I recommend the seafood garlic noodles! I've had a bite of the mac&cheese with bacon and the bacon made it really good but for $16 bucks?!?! Call me cheap but.. I'd rather buy a whole pack of bacon if that's what I'm paying for. I've had the sliders here and they were NOT GOOD. It seems cool that they have the half a yard for beer but my stomach wasn't really sitting right after finishing all that. Honestly, the wait is ridiculously long. It's not like boiling crab where you always walk away satisfied. I don't think it's worth it. I'd rather go to BJs.

Reviews.Author: teena y.
Reviews.Content: I've always walked by this place and finally got the chance to try it when it was my gfs birthday. Here's what we ordered since we love to eat:Garlic Noodles - Yummy, must tryTruffle fries - Delicious, must try - heck it's only $4Hummus - OkCrab cakes - OkSpicy Tuna Roll - Good size Artichokes & chips - Good and the homemade chips were good - recommend as it's good for you (maybe not the chips)Sliders classic - Just Ok - they say they put a secret sauce on it like thousand island but I didn't taste ityelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…Grilled Jumbo Shrimp (w/fried rice) - Pretty tasty and there was 6 jumbo shrimp in the dish.yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…Ahi Crunchy - Good Overall, the menu is a bit overwhelming but this place is great for sharing lots of food. The starters aren't very expensive, so we just order everything :)There was a beer sampler which was pretty good.yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…I wouldn't mind coming back and trying the other items on the menu, but will stick to my favorites too!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Yardhouse a couple times since it's opening.  I think the food and beer is great and I think it's much better than your average bar-restaurant-hybrids.  I really like their french dip sandwich!  The service on the other hand is a different story.  This place is always busy and buzzing to a point where I almost think the waiters forget the fundamentals of waiting a table.  On one occasion I went with my sister for happy hour and we ordered wings.  40 minutes later, the waiter confesses that he forgot to submit the order and asked if we could wait awhile longer?!  We kindly declined and said we didn't want to wait that long.  We even spoke with the manager and he didn't even offer the wings to go or a free beer on the house on our next visit.  I consider taking and submitting an order a pretty standard service at a restaurant.  I wasn't too happy that I left the restaurant with an empty stomach.  I guess there is a first for everything?!On a separate occasion, I waited 15 minutes for a waiter to bring out my condiments for my burger.  Again, GG fail on his part on a very standard service. I would give this place a 3.5-4 on the food, but the service warrants Yardhouse a 2.

Reviews.Author: stefanie f.
Reviews.Content: I can now honestly say I have had the WORST dining experience of my life. A relaxing girls day at the spa, ended in a disappointing afternoon lunch. So first off let me just say I was a server all throughout college, i usually give other servers the benefit of the doubt NOT THIS TIME. I only wish i would have got his name.Our party of four (hungry women) ordered one appetizer and our 4 meals. About 40 min later our app (spinach dip) came out burnt....followed by two of our meals. So we sent the app back, because usually you like the appetizer to come out before your meal...not with it..right?  So anyways about 10 min later, still waiting on the last 2 meals, we decided to flag our server down. Ummm, hello where is our food? Oh well the kitchen screwed up and separated your tickets (right buddy)! Not I am sorry about that..nothing....just blamed it on the poor kitchen.So the manager comes out apologizes, and offers to pick up the meal. Awesome gesture, but we would have rather paid and got our food within a reasonable amount of time. She also offered to give us dessert as well. So about 5-10 later we finally got our last two orders. YES!!! Anyways we finish our meal, and decide heck..why not take advantage of the dessert offer right? WRONG. We ordered our 4 cheesecakes to go....ONLY to have to wait another 15 min for our cheesecake. So we ended just walking out..cause lord we probably still would have been there waiting.Another side note, the women's restrooms were dirty, 2 stalls were out of toilet paper, and there wasn't soap in one of their dispensers. All in all.....the worst experience EVER!!!

Reviews.Author: Phong T.
Reviews.Content: 1:30 wait... Ouch.I don't know why people rave about this place.  The food is about as good as Applebee's, but costs twice as much.  The beer selection is pretty good, but it is so crowded that you can't even find a spot at the bar to just drink.  For a place that is supposedly a beer haven, they don't do it very well.  I ordered a Franziskaner weissbier.  First it came with a wedge of lemon.  The second mistake was that it was already squeezed into the beer.  This is not like American hefeweizen that needs a lemon.  If you are going to do that, give me the choice to throw it away.Some people just think at anything at Santana Row has to be good.  I have been to multiple locations.  I have to give them credit for being consistent.  Unfortunately, it is not consistently great.

Reviews.Author: Catherine L.
Reviews.Content: Woo! Finally made it to Yard House over a year after it's opening. The beer selection is to die for and I don't even like beer! The calamari is nice and crispy, the ice berg wedge salad is huge and the spinach and portabello mushroom salad is okay. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Peter J.
Reviews.Content: Love this placeThis place is awesome thrie menu of beers n wine is wonderful I mean you jus name itand they have it, very nice n clean place I allways come to yard house whenever I am in yhe area love thier food very great customer service and reasonable prices

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Pretty impressed with this place.  I've been to a Yard House in San Diego but I think this one is definitely a little better.  Beer selection is excellent, happy hour is even better, and the layout of Yard House itself looks very nice.It does get packed though.....all the time so expect to wait.Other than that it has everything you need.  Good beer and good food.  All you need to do is supply the good company.

Reviews.Author: Veronica S.
Reviews.Content: If you want good, American grub and a nice pint of beer, Yard House is the place for you. With over 100 beers on tap, you can opt for the Pint or the half Yard (huge but fun to drink) for $13.This would be a fun place to go with a large group or if you just want to grab a seat at the huge bar.Granted it's recent opening, it's still super crowded of course. Get there early or call ahead to guarantee early seating.

Reviews.Author: Amy C.
Reviews.Content: Lunch with Tram N :)Went in about 2pm and it wasn't totally busy. I love the decor! It's artistic & clean looking. Oh my goodness... major variety of selections on their menu (both food-wise & drinks-wise) ^__^Both Tram & I ordered the lunch specials of sandwiches & soup. I got the turkey melt while she got the grilled pastrami. I wanted to get a hard cider, but our waiter recommended I try the L....something. It was fruitier & dark red color. It was sweet, but I wanted something less sweet & sparkling that's why I wanted hard cider in the first place. But oh well.. at least I tried something new. The food was great. Service was great. Would definitely come again to try out new food & drinks. :D

Reviews.Author: Cindy K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch on Saturday. The wait was super short, shocking! This place looked a lot more upscale than I was excepting, but totally casual. Their menu is somewhat small although they have a good range of stuff from salad, seafood, pasta, sandwiches, and burgers. Their beer selection is unbelievable - couldn't decide what to get. Our waiter was super helpful and even offered us some "samples" to help us decide which beer we wanted. ZOMG I had their sweet potato fries and they were so amazing, much better than The Counter's. I loved my crab cake hoagie. YUM. This is nice addition to Santana Row, now I have even more problems on deciding a place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Crystal H.
Reviews.Content: Finally was able to experience what the hype is about! I came here at 5:20 and waited for 1 hour and 30 mins for a table. The wait was worth the delicious food!Good thing I ordered a salad to eat since my St Louis Ribs took longer to cook. We waited about 25 mins probably for our food to arrive. The Caesar Salad was good but normal. The Ribs were so tender and meaty! So yummy. I loved the creamed corn and baked beans side dishes that came with the meal too. It was awesome there was a side of bbq sauce for me to dip the ribs in for more flavor! My ribs were ~$22 plus $2.99 salad.I am definitely coming back for happy hour and more foods/drinks! Reasonable prices.

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: The hype train comes again, only this time, its from SoCal. Now I've been to the Yard Houses down south, and you can just walk in and grab a seat. It is quite the opposite here. At Santana Row, you're looking at a 2 hour wait no matter the day or time you're coming here. There will be a horde of people waiting outside/inside just clamoring for a place to sit. What saves you from all of this is just walking to the bar to grab one of their huge assortments of beer. Now with a place named Yard House, you're sure not coming here for the food. You're here for those ridiculous amount of beers that they have on tap. From your mainstream beers to the micro-brews, Yard House has enough beers to get you drunk for a month. The bar area is pretty decently sided, but don't let that fool you. You're still going to have a rough time getting a spot to stand/sit and most likely, your group is just going to hover to the nearest patch of empty space in the area. Nonetheless, the prices are pretty reasonable. If you're a true bad ass, you can opt for the yard glasses and go to town. Obviously this place is popular as hell since there's no other big hangout spot in the area. The closest I can think of would be downtown San Jose. Thus, for all the drunkards, this will end up sucking your funds away. I'm sure by now, all the other businesses are feeling their alcohol money being sucked away and towards Yard House.One thing that does also suck is that since this place opened, it's becoming increasingly impossible to find parking, even in the 6 story lot. You better come early or something cause Santana Row is now packed and rejuvenated.

Reviews.Author: Mansi S.
Reviews.Content: Great ambience, food n service. Best time to go is on a weekday since they r too busy on weekends mayb coz they opened recently. Loved the girly girly beer , honey house blonde. Lunch hours (3 to 5)   very pocket friendly.... Soooo many thngs to try..Didnt like d dessert too much ( creme brulee)...would go again:))

Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: 4.0 Stars"99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around, 98 bottles of beer on the wall."Wait, this is Yardhouse we're talking about! You won't find bottles of beer here, but an abundance of beer on tap. Yes, you read that right. A wide selection of beers on TAP!This place is a great way to expand your palette of beer and they even offer beer samplers called the Six-Pack Samplers in the Traditional or Belgium variety. I tried the Belgium Six-Pack (~$10) and it was deliciously refreshing. Don't be fooled by these small 5 oz. glasses. The Belgium beers also have higher alcohol content. They'll really start to kick in as you go through half of them. Dangerous!I have to make a disclaimer that Yard House is extremely popular and I've heard horror stories of friends waiting up to 2 hours before getting a table.Bro-tip: Come early and get a pager. You can walk around Santana Row to kill time before you get a seat or head to the bar in the middle of restaurant.In terms of food, Yardhouse takes the "shotgun" approach and offers a wide variety of American fusion items. Everyone in your group is bound to find something they'll like. I decided to try the Spicy Jambalaya and it was good. It came with two giant blackened shrimp, spicy chicken-andouille sausage, crawfish, pan blackened red and pasilla peppers, and a cajun tomato cream sauce. It could be served over linguine pasta, jasmine, or brown rice. The jambalaya had a nice spicy kick to it that wasn't overpowering. The pieces of shrimp were huge and the sauce went well with the rice.Yardhouse is often compared to BJ's and I have to agree that I love this place a lot more. Nothing beats a fun atmosphere and endless choices of good beer! The only downside is the wait, but I think it's worth trying for the experience.== A MUST TRY! ==

Reviews.Author: Monica G.
Reviews.Content: 2 stars for service3 stars: for the long wait, crowdedness. 4 stars: for the beer of course!!!so cal people, this yardhouse is not the same as the one in san diego. see the one in san diego has a frequent chill ambience. very relaxed and not loud of overcrowded to the point where a guy elbows you in the boob (yes that happened to me in the yardhouse in san jose).......so not cool.but yardhouse is yardhouse and i go because of the beer!we had a party of 15, and the bf's bro totally showed up at 6:30 for this party, and we were seated approximately at 9:45pm. this was on a friday night! yea, talk about a loooooooooooooooong wait! good thing that the bar is accessible to everyone, so one can drink and kill time...bad though because you could potentially be drunk already before you even have dinner!the beers we got (excuse my spelling):-framboise: fruit fermented beer! yum! and to die for! if you are a Wine-O this is the beer for you! its hella fermented, so prepare for burping! so good, and rich, kinda reminds me of the commerical for "i can't believe its not butter" except in this case it's "i can't believe its not wine" yup it's that good!-I don't know the name of this beer but the blueberry tasting one: YUM! very light and the hints of blueberry kicks in as the after taste! -Timmerman's strawberry: also very good, not as light as the blueberry one, but still very good. food we tried:-spinach dip which came with flat bread large chips: not that great, so you can totally skip it, i would get the nachos instead-onion rings: ay okay! nothing spectacular, but decent!-garlic noodles: came with an array of veggies and tons of garlic. this was okay too, especially for an asian dish made at an american restaurant.Soooo....i would prolly be back for the beer, but nothing more...the wait is ridiculous, but if you have to mingle and have a nice dinner then go for it, but if you have to wait for more than two hours, you have been warned!btw: our server sucked! because our table got two tabs and the server, being money hungry charged both of our tabs 18% gratuity, so he got double tip! what a !@##%#$%^$%&*

Reviews.Author: Cat V.
Reviews.Content: Happy Hour starts at 3pm!It's nice to know that I can run out to the Yard House when I want a nice, cold crisp beer to quench my thirst after a long strenuous day of shopping.  Shopping gets stressful; it involves critical decision-making and often fighting people for that cardigan or wedges you've been eyeing.  So dramatic sometimes.Walking into the Yard House is exciting especially once you walk down into the bar area.  I get the same feeling I get when I'm in line to ride a roller coaster.  The selection of beer is endless.  The wait staff are all very patient and friendly especially since I can take a while to order a beer.We were seated in an uber comfortable booth right in front of a flat screen. Our server was very nice enough to put the Giants game on for us while we dined.  Perfect.Had their House Hef and House IPA...very, very satisfying.  Foodwise, we had: Ahi Poke BowlSummer SaladGuacamole & ChipsObvious that we were really just here for the beer?!  I've been back a few more times and have always had the same pleasant experience.  However, I think the only thing I'd change is the fact that their samplers are pre-selected for you.  I would prefer to select my own to sample.  I think that would make more sense...No?

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 starsI'm so glad they opened up a YardHouse in Norcal and one that's pretty close to me.  The only prob is, everyone else and their moms also love coming here.I had my bday dinner here last night and we were quoted for a 2 hour wait for party 15 around 8:30pm.  Our tables were split (2 adjacent tables) and we only waited a little over an hour. Score! :)The appetizers here are really good, main dishes not so much.Some highlights for me:1. Chicken nachos (i don't know if it was because i was starving, but they were delish!)2. Crab artichoke dip (comes with tortilla chips and pita bread)3. Onion rings4. Shoe string friesYou'll find 114 beers on tap. Beer heaven! The hosts were nice but the bartenders are a bit snooty.  They have this laissez-faire attitude because they know the server to customer ratio is like 1 to 20... okay, i'm exaggerating about the ratio, but still! I don't appreciate being ignored for long periods of time.  If your party is small enough, scout out a seat at the bar. They'll serve you food there too. :)

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this place for months, I finally got to try it and was not disappointed! It was the first time for the boyfriend and me, but we went with my sister and her boyfriend and they've had it in Irvine before. We went on a Friday night, around 5pm, to beat the dinner rush and good thing we did because there were tons of people waiting already! Our wait was pretty short - 10 minutes tops and we were seated in a booth adjacent to Santana Row.I ordered the seared ahi steak sandwich, the boyfriend ordered the blue crab cake hoagie, and my sister and her boyfriend shared the mac n cheese and truffle fries. Everything was delicious and we still had some leftovers! The ambiance is perfect for a double date, a date, or even a group dinner. The service was awesome, our server came back to check on us to make sure everything was great without being too overbearing. The total came out to be somewhat pricey, but for the amount of food we got and the beers, it was decent- nothing outrageously expensive.I would definitely come back again for dinner and would recommend this place! We'll definitely have to come during happy hour next time too!

Reviews.Author: Courtney M.
Reviews.Content: I was excited to go here for the first time since it's been put in Santana Row and I wish I could have taken advantage of all the beers on tap, but I was under the weather. The way they designed the bar is incredible! All the beers on tap are in the middle and once you lay your eyes on it, don't be surprised if you see a bright light shine down and hear angels singing...it's that good. We didn't wait too long for our table for lunch, and sat near the bar area. Our waitress was very friendly and normal, and let us take our time to order. She also let the cooks take their time to make our food...because it took ages! I know in America we get our panties in a twist when food doesn't come out right away.. But I am not one of those people. I am happy to chat and wait for my food to be made... but even I was feeling like it was taking way too long. I didn't time it or anything, so I can't give you numbers, but just don't go here when you are starvin' marvin.. or you will get cranky waiting. I ordered the 1/2 sandwich and soup, with a side of sweet potato fries. The sandwich was 'meh'. I would have preferred the crab cake on it's own considering the bread was twice the size of the crab cake in between it. Who wants all that extra bread? I also had the French Onion soup which was delicious, but the fries were not that impressive. I am picky so some people might like really crispy sweet potato fries, but they just didn't have great flavor. I would go back for an evening happy hour after 10 and for dinner. The atmosphere is classy but casual, so a great first date spot. Just be ready to talk incase that food takes a while..!!

Reviews.Author: Cindy Y.
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness, what bad can I say about Yard House? The food here is delicious, and if you go during happy hour the appetizers are a great deal. I went here with 3 other friends one time during happy hour and we got 4 appetizers and an order of truffle fries, the total came out to be about $25. Yeah, I know, GREAT deal. Pretty much everything that I've tried here has been good. I especially love the chicken wraps and the truffle fries. Just thinking about the food here makes my mouth water. I can't wait until I'm 21 so I can come here and try their crazy huge selection of beers ^__^ (4 months and counting!) But this place is in Santana Row, so expect the wait to be long. But every time I've been, it only takes about 15-20 minutes, even if they say it'll be an hour wait. So don't let the wait intimidate you! This place is huge, so people move in and out pretty quickly.

Reviews.Author: Joyce C.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is great.  I've been going for years (the one in San Diego that is), so it was nice to know that they opened one in the Bay Area.  I think the most comparable place to YH prior to this restaurant opening is BJs in Cupertino.  YH has a little more upscale feel (prob cause its at SRow) and the menu is slightly more expensive though.YH is most known for its large beer selection but the food is also delicious.  During happy hour, I usually opt for the chicken nachos and a pint, or sometimes half yard, of the house hefeweizen.  During dinner, I usually get the Mac N Cheese or the seared ahi sandwich.  Last night, I tried their spicy tuna roll for the first time - I thought it was delicious.  Hint: it's not a sushi roll.  Check out the pictures!This location has happy hour M-F from 3-6pm, but unless you show up before 4pm, don't even think about getting a table before 6pm.  Yea, it's like that.  The wait in the late afternoon/evening is ridiculous.  They also have late night happy hours Sun-W from 10pm-close - come at this time if you don't want to fight for a seat.Anyway, the biggest con of this restaurant compared to the other YHs I've been to is that they don't take reservations, and this restaurant is a lot smaller.

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time last week. I've heard so many people rave about this place. Almost everyone I know who are in their 20s would come here for a date, drinks or a dinner with friends. Let me begin by saying my experience here was rather disappointing - maybe I expected too much or people over-exaggerated. We waited for around 30 minutes - this part is okay because I know we are a party of 15 people and need a big table.What's not okay is the drinks! We came for my friend's 21st birthday, but the drinks weren't great. I had their Strawberry Fields, which was unpleasant. I'm not a fan of alcohol, but I have tasted better. My other friends' drinks didn't live up to my expectations as well. Maybe it was because we came really late (11pm) and only started ordering when they were nearing closing time. Now I feel like I'm making excuses for them. Anyways, moving on to the food.Food was delish or at least their appetizers are. I highly recommend their: - Spinach Cheese Dip: I especially love their crispy baked pita bread- Firecracker RibsI'd come back, but only if it's for a date. Otherwise, I'd go to better places for drinks.

Reviews.Author: Braden K.
Reviews.Content: once upon a time, someone special was having a terrible day. simply stated, I needed a huge favor on behalf of yard house to help with the cheer up. I planned to buy a round for some special people via telephone and everyone involved was nothing but extremely helpful.to alexis, jeff, all the other managers that I spoke to helped me complete my master plan, huge thank yous from yelps finest!they e-mailed me the consent form which i filled out and had sent back and voila! success and nothing less!bottom line: theres TVs, an incredible selection of beers on tap, females, great appetizers, and its smack dab in santana row.. AKA san joses finest! whats not to love?

Reviews.Author: Angeline H.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it was because it was an hour towards closing or it is just really starting to go downhill...I came here last week with friends to catch up over a late dinner. It was 10:45pm. We ordered 2 parm truffle fries and the Mac & Cheese with mushrooms chicken & bacon. The truffle fries were just a bunch of small pieces under a heaping amount of parmesan. When the mac & cheese came out I was excited to eat it because the last few times I ordered it, it was hot, tasty, and had bacon in every bite.Not this time..the whole plate was so bland. I had to sprinkle (or better yet DOUSE) my plate with salt and pepper to get some flavor in there. Even the tobasco and ketchup couldn't save it. I was disappointed that my food wasn't how it was the last few times when I came here. Maybe the hype is starting to wear down here.

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: I came for a late lunch with some friends. We all got drinks ($9 each! Damn.) and different lunch specials. Mine was the spicy salad and bbq pizza. The spicy salad was good, but was unimpressed with the quantity. It's a freakin' SALAD and there was so much empty room on the plate. Keep your customers satisfied - you can afford to give more. I also didn't like the bbq pizza very much. Now, you might say that this is just a personal taste thing, BUT I have tried a lot of bbq pizzas in my time because they are my favorite, and this was probably the worst because the bbq sauce was so weird. In the end, my meal was filling (maybe only because I had that drink on the side though) but I definitely would not say it was worth $22 (meal + drink + tax + tip). I will probably come here for Happy Hour sometime and give it a second shot, because that's where I heard the real value and delicious apps are at. Hopefully my second review will be a higher score!

Reviews.Author: Seliya G.
Reviews.Content: I like this place a lot. There's good beers, good food, good atmosphere! Happy hour is extremely busy but the yard is only $7-10!

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: What should i do when i write a review of a place outside of the Portland area. Should i compare it to what i have available to me in Portland or do i compare it to the local scene? If i compare it to what i have at home this place wouldn't do to well, but then that would be unfair I'd think. This place has the best beer selection that i know of in the San Jose area. From beers like Boddington and New Castle and with Deschutes brewery and Widmer also available this beer selection amazing. The food was OK, some dishes surprised me like their deconstructed California roll. The Truffle fries were good but i felt too short on the truffle. While the other dishes i had i can't remember and i think it's because my body doesn't want to relive it. Over all a great place to grab some beers. price is higher then what i am used to but that is because I'm spoiled by my local scene. nice place, great service and of course lots of beer choices.

Reviews.Author: Christine Y.
Reviews.Content: I am totally on board with the Yard House train!  Love this place!It can be somewhat of a turn-off dining here if you're trying to catch up with friends.  The place can get really loud during dinner.  It seems to be all the buzz right now, so definitely a popular spot on the Row.I come here more for the quality of food and drinks, which I really like.  The menu has a wide assortment of appetizers, entrees and booze to choose from.If you get there by or before 6:30 pm for a small group seating on a weeknight, the wait shouldn't be too bad.  If a bigger group, I'd get there earlier.Their happy hour deals are a bit more pricey than other places...$6 martinis and other cocktails and half-off appetizers.  I would have to say though their martinis are very well-done. Tried the Hawaii Sunset Martini and the Peach Martini...both fabulous.  The Hawaiian poke appetizer is as close as you can probably get to poke at Foodland.  The restaurant serves the spicy tuna appetizer as a cake with guacamole and edamame beans...very different and interesting.  And, I love the shiitake garlic noodles!Oh, and seating hostesses and service staff all very excellent!

Reviews.Author: Clare G.
Reviews.Content: I mostly come to this place because it has something for everyone, including vegetarians. I came last year for my birthday, and despite having a party of over twelve people I had to arrive three hours early and wait. Frankly I think it is ridiculous that they don't take reservations at all, but especially for large groups. Any situation in which I have to pay automatic gratuity, should also allow me to make a reservation.Because of the convenient location and broad menu, I will likely return, but I think their no- reservation policy is ridiculous and insulting.

Reviews.Author: Del S.
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here but mainly because of who I was with, not because of where we were at.Location location location, which is probably the main reason why this place is CRAZY busy. Because frankly, Yard House is just not that special. Food and drinks are very ordinary and mediocre. Basically it is a bigger and slightly more fusion-y version of BJ. The highlight of the place is definitely the staff. They are very friendly and attentive. Our waiter was a bit clueless but he was super nice and easy to talk to. I noticed there are lots of hot girls working here which is very easy on the eyes.The place is not bad, but I don't think it was worth my 30 minutes looking for a parking + 45 minutes waiting for a table.

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: What?! Two hour wait? Effffff that!!We'll just uh sit, I mean stand, over here... In the corner...No.. Yea... Ummm excuse me, two beers please

Reviews.Author: Ann T.
Reviews.Content: This place gets SUPER packed! wait time... they told up 1 hour 15 minutes up to 1 hour 30 minutes. our actualy wait time, 1 hour on a saturday night. we were fine with that because we put our name down and walked around santana row. the weather was abolutely gorgeous that day. they told us to return 45 minutes later to pick up the pager. when we finished shopping, we headed back to yard house. we watched the Giants game on their many, many tv's and checked out the menu after we picked up the pager. about 15 minutes later, the pager buzzed and we were seated within 5 minutes.our server, David, was super cool and helpful! he told us their selection of beers on tap is amazing! holy shit... 150+? so many choices! now, onto the food. we started off with the shitake garlic noodles. this was really good... but also a bit on the greasy side. the bf ordered the bbq bacon burger.. that shit didn't look good. but my surf and turf with truffle fries was GREAT! loved the lobster and the fries... but the actual burger patty was not cooked to medium. it was cooked to super well done... which means burnt. ick.next time, we come back.. i'm trying something different. the girl sitting next to me ordered the pot pie and this thing was ginormous!! i'll probably try that. :)

Reviews.Author: Thanh N.
Reviews.Content: YUMMMMM!! Happy hour is so worth it!My go to order list:1. Shiitake garlic noodles2. Truffle fries3. Chicken strips platter4. Strawberry or Raspberry beerDon't order:-Their pizza! Boyfriend and I both got the mushroom pepporoni to share, YUCK!...our pizza was soggy halfway through!I've come during regular hours, mid-day happy hour, and late night happy hour. There is always a wait! The longest wait was definitely during their mid-day happy hour.TIP: you get two free tasters of their beer per person! So if you're unsure on what to order, ask your host/hostess for your two free tasters before ordering =]

Reviews.Author: Tyler M.
Reviews.Content: I don't come here for the food, LESBE-HONEST! The best thing about Yard House is the wide selection of draft beers. It's a fun environment to have a drink with your friends and eat some unhealthy food. I know they have a section of the menu that is supposedly "healthy" however, I seem to always avoid that and order the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger and truffle fries. I like the fact that they have sports on all over the dining room. This place is what you would expect except the selection of beer makes it more attractive than other restaurants. Obviously, as with most things on Santana Row, it gets very crowded on the weekends and even some weekdays. However, you can always grab any open seats at the bar if you don't feel like waiting, walk around the surrounding shops, or watch the TVs as mentioned above. I'm a fan of this place for what it is, a place to enjoy a yard of Stone IPA. Cheers!

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here 3 times and overall it has been a pretty good experience. The minus 1 star is for the times when the waiter/waitress forgot our order of brought out the wrong dish, or the bartender who took a very long time(more than 10min) to finally take our order or acknowledge our presence. One good thing I will mention is when they brought out the wrong dish one time we got to keep it to eat for free as we waited for what we originally ordered.It'll probably take me years to sample every beer(they have over a hundred) but so far the Belgium sampler and the Strawberry beer is yummers!The entrees so far were decent, but the lobster/crab artichoke dip is fabulous!It can get busy but we head straight to the bar so there is usually seats available. It's fun place to chill and watch the games or just socialize! :)

Reviews.Author: Peggy T.
Reviews.Content: Finally, after months up and running, I came to Yard House.I've been before. Yard Houses are all over the place in Socal, but this is the first in the Bay and I guess I can see the appeal - the first upscale, trendy-ish sports bar. It's big, it's got lotsta beers, it has TVs and it's a good place to hang out with friends.But to wait HOURS to get in and eat overpriced bar food?!?! UHH i think not!!!I went and had a beer float (yummy raspberry beer with vanilla ice cream = berry milkshake YUM!!) and a gardein burger. Meh.. the consistency of the gardein burger was chewy and sorta gross. I would've much rather had a regular garden burger. Unfortunately from what I remember, most of their veg items are made with gardein something or other. However, A+ on their service - the waitress was on top of our orders despite it being a crowded friday evening and us having a large party!

Reviews.Author: Ayaka S.
Reviews.Content: Another beer to add to the list:Firestone Double Barrel (Amber/Red Ale) - yet another delicious amber ale. This I might have been dreaming, but I swear this one had a light after taste of espresso, and I LOVE coffee, so it was an added plus!The waiter told us that there are ~115 beers on tap at this location, and at the LA location, there are over 300 beers on tap! Well I guess I have about 100 more to try at this location! Cheers to that!Also right now they are serving some sake. I think this probably for the summer time as it was a temporary insert in the menu. If you look at the bottom, they also have sake bombs. Along with the sake, they have a whole fleet of "skinny" mixed drinks which have less calories. But in all honesty, I don't really understand people who come to the YH to drink hard alcohol or mixed drinks. They are known for the beer, so let's try it! With 115 kinds of beer, even if you are not a beer drinker, you are bound to find something that you like. They also let you taste the beer too before you buy it which a great thing too.

Reviews.Author: Cristel R.
Reviews.Content: Here's my order everytime I get a beer here...."Can I get that hefeweizen drink...the one that sounds like Frankenstein?" .. They ALWAYS know what i'm talking about. Good beer, good times...BUT...Good luck getting a table if you come on a weekend night. But that's ok, stand, walk around and maybe try to mingle with other people. And maybe you'll get buzzed enough to get some courage to ask those 2 people in a LARGE booth to share their seats! lol

Reviews.Author: Fanny W.
Reviews.Content: Happy Hour for the underage.A friend of mine brought me here for a little snack since I was starving but couldn't eat much since dinner was just around the corner. Let's just say I got a little more stuffed than I should've been...Big windows, dark furniture, clean surroundings, and a bit fancier than BJ's. Our waiter could've been more attentive with our water glasses, but that's no biggie since he was cool about it.Pastrami Sliders - warm, juicy pastrami topped with cheese all sandwiched in between two soft, sweet dinner rolls. These babies just melt in your mouth. Oh and it comes with thin, crispy fries. Delicious!Traditional Buffalo Wings - comes with celery and ranch. Sauccccy. I hate getting my fingers dirty, and this dish did just that. Tasty, but nothing special.The sliders were amazing! The bill was cheap, ~$14! I'm a fan, but I'll have to try more before I bump up the rating. I'll be seeing those sliders again!

Reviews.Author: Ocee D.
Reviews.Content: Short Version:The Classic Cheese Burger and Fries were good, but next time I'd rather just get a big bowl of the Clam Chowder. yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…yelp.com/biz_photos/MRlH…Extended Version:Stopped by for an early dinner. The wait was 40 minutes, but we got the buzzer and went for a walk....came back 20 minutes later and the table was ready. I started off w/ a small Clam Chowder....not the best I've had, but still really good. Ordered the Classic Cheese Burger, and it came w/ a pretty big side of skinny fries. Both of 'em were good....the sliders here are still a lot better than this burger. Been to Yard House (here and in Honolulu) a few times, and I haven't ordered something that wasn't good. Another thing I like about this place is that the crowd is more diverse than at the other restaurants in Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Faye C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE YOU YARD HOUSE. Ever since I stepped foot in your establishment in Newport beach, California I have always wondered when you would expand here in the Bay AreaLucky enough it's in my city! Although I love you, Yard House,You should probably open another branch or build a second floor. There are just too many people here now and I really want to be seated no longer than a 30 minute wait. PLEASE.Sincerely,Fan.

Reviews.Author: Jarleen V.
Reviews.Content: I love Yard House. It's a great place for happy hours which includes snacks/appetizers and drinks. Their entrees are huge, but I honestly love all their appetizers and snacks that appear after their drink menu. I freakin love those truffle fries. OMG. My mouth is watering right now. I've gone to Yard House a couple of times and have never been disappointed with a yard of Leinenkugel. Their service is awesome and the ambiance of the place is dark, but very modern. It's a type of place you would come to with some girl friends and catch up, or on a hot date with your significant other.

Reviews.Author: Wesley H.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a Wednesday night because I knew that the A's and Giants both had day games and the Sharks were not scheduled to play. Knowing this, I figured there wouldn't be much of a crowd at the Yard House. I was wrong. Along with my friend, we waited two hours to be seated. We did go to the for a couple drinks while we waited though. This place gets 5 stars from me just for the beer alone. Over 130 beers on tap? Can we say "Heaven"? I was in flavor country! For food, I ordered the Chicken Parmigiana. I ended up getting the Chicken Penne though. Our waitress realized she pressed the incorrect key when entering the order. She apologized and I got the correct dish shortly after - Now, you might think I should dock points for the incorrect item I received, but I respect the waitress who owned up to her mistake. Don't come here unless you plan on spending some money though. You must not forget, this is Santana Row we're talking about. I will definitely come back here in the future.

Reviews.Author: Beverly R.
Reviews.Content: Beer on tap selection, 5 starsLocation, 4 stars Ambiance, 4 stars (if you like the santana row scene)Menu selection, 4 starsPricing affordability, 3 stars (Santana row pricing)Service, 3 stars (food was slow but server was attentive)Think Chili's/TGIF/BJ's up a notch plus a hundred more beers on tap and you have a Yard House.

Reviews.Author: sherry t.
