Reviews.Content: Yay to all the beers on tap and most importantly TRUFFLE FRIES!! They are so good.  That's all I need.  Fries and beer. I wouldn't come here if you are starving.  The wait is ridiculous.  2 hours minimum and you can't get a pager until 30 min into the wait.  I definitely wouldn't bring children.  Too many drunk people.  It's more like a club than a restaurant even during the day.

Reviews.Author: Steven L.
Reviews.Content: We came here on a Saturday night at 6:40pm. Our waiting pager didn't go off until like 8:20. We got to shop a little bit at Valley Fair, but the wait was still way too long. I guess the place is that popular. When we got seated, we had a booth that could fit 6 people just for us 2. Maybe thats why it took so long - no 2-seat tables.The place is really nice, dark. Bathrooms are nice. The sink water comes out about 5 inches wide and is at a nice, warm temperature. I got the turkey burger and it came w/ shoe-string fries. It was pretty good. I also got 1 of the chocolate-tasting beers. It was really good, a little dark, but still tasty. The service was good. They were friendly, knowledgeable, and checked on us to make sure we were okay. Would I come back? Yes, probably either only during the daytime so the wait is bearable or with a large group. It's kind of a waste of time waiting just to eat there with your significant other. Also, I think this is the type of restaurant you need to have beer at, since I think it's their specialty. Why would you go here for food only? It's good, but not extraordinary.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this place is sooo great - I thought it was mediocre.  It's super crowded and the wait is really long. Two stars go to the MANY MANY beers they offer on tap, it's amazing! The last star goes to the layout of the restaurant/bar - it's so cool! It's a super long bar in the middle with tables and booths situated around it, so the focal point of the restaurant is the bar! There's numerous TVs all around so you won't miss the latest game playing.As far as the food goes, I had the truffle fries and Hawaiian poke salad.  They were okay, not super good.  I must go back and try other things though, but this was my first impression of the 'oh so infamous' Yardhouse.

Reviews.Author: Zaydian A.
Reviews.Content: I am taking away 1 star because of the long waiting times, but you can't really hate on them for being busy. I learned my lesson though, only come here during Happy hour or Lunch. Place has a really good happy hour menu, most if not all appetizers are 1/2 off. Must try the Garlic Shirataki Noodles, Tuna Roll, Truffle fries, Firecracker Chicken wings. You can get all of this for roughly $15-20. It's a steal if you wanna get a good buzz & pick at food.Speaking of buzz, the beers are amazing of course. I usually order the Delirium, which is only served in Goblets btw. It's a Belgian Ale i believe, and the strongest beer they have there. Usually 2-3 make me see pink elephants, kidding. Really though this is a must try beer. Of course if you wanna experiment, get the sampler. They have two samplers to choose from, the Belgian one is stronger btw. All in all though, service is good. Still though, I highly recommend coming here during happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Lauren K.
Reviews.Content: We didn't have to wait in line at the time we went.The food was alright. The drinks are overpriced.My friend tried to order 3 beers... they didn't have any of them. the hell?I don't really understand what all the hype is about.

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: LOVEEE the ahi poke bowl and truffle fries! esp during happy hour. their garlic noodles are very good toodim lighting with a LOTTTTT of beers on taprecently tried their creme brulee with bananas on top. delicious! but I wish the top was a bit more caramelized..

Reviews.Author: Anna N.
Reviews.Content: Great happy hour food! I haven't tried their entrees and whatnot, but the happy hour fare was cheap and delicious. Between six of us, we split an order of onion rings, thai pizza, ahi tuna sashimi, crab cakes, boneless wings, traditional wings, and spinach and cheese dip (came with housemade pita chips). Adding on the half yard of beer and pomegranate martini, our total came to $61! Amazing price for all the food and drinks. I believe the happy hour snacks were half off and the pizza was...$7.95? Not totally sure on that price. The food was kind of slow coming out, but it wasn't a big deal. I will be returning to Yard House for happy hour very soon! Quality food + low prices :)

Reviews.Author: May T.
Reviews.Content: They serve great food & drinks. But their service is terrible. I'm a regular at this place, and I've had more terrible service here than great. I've experienced multiple times where my server never checks up on the table or to reassure that our drinks/food will be out momentarily when they walk by the table several times. I come here for their awesome food, it's really good but I wish they had better service. I don't know what kind of training they do for their servers but customer service should be top priority.

Reviews.Author: Joe S.
Reviews.Content: What else can I say? It's the new place to be. I can't come here without running into the who's who of SJSU.One thing I will say is make sure you get there in time for Happy Hour. The place gets crowded! and they don't have any tables larger than 6 spots usually but luckily my friends and I can squeeze 8 people at a booth.Make sure you try the seared Ahi. The wasabi and creamy sauce is so delicious it's almost unbearable.Oh, and the workers here a very sexy. Great place.

Reviews.Author: Julie N.
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled when I found out they were opening a Yard House in San Jose. Definitely my go-to place for delicious crafted beers, especially the leffe blonde, kilt lifter scotch ale, and young's double chocolate. And yes, they have a variety of different beers on tap, I think over 100? AMAZING!If you haven't already, try the crab, lobster and artichoke dip. It's one of their appetizers. SO YUMMY! I've been here plenty of time, and all of my stay have been good thus far. The only downfall is closing time. 12am? Too early in my opinion. I hope they will earn their privileges to stay open later ASAP!Don't miss out on HAPPY HOUR!Monday - Friday 3pm - 6pm Sunday - Wednesday 10pm - Close

Reviews.Author: Tinka G.
Reviews.Content: I went here last week with some co-workers for lunch. The wait wasn't too bad to get a table. But the wait for my friend's plain cheese burger was an hour long!!? I felt really bad for her so I didn't eat my dinner until she got hers. So my dinner ended up being cold and it just ruined the mood. Even after an hour of waiting for her burger they brought it raw?! She asked for well done! Thankfully they didn't charge us for the burger. So even though this kind of pissed us all off, we could not deny that their chicken strips are BOMB! The fries kick ass! The California roll look AMAZING! And the Ahi Tuna was to die for!!! Plus the selection of beer was the toping! So even though they fucked up our order. I'd still come back :) The food was so delicious I wouldn't mind waiting another hour..

Reviews.Author: Ashley G.
Reviews.Content: I understand that this place has a lot of beer, and If I only had ordered beer and fried things, this place would have gotten four stars. Unfortunately, the boyfriend and I tried to have an upscale beer lunch. If this is your goal, don't go to The Yard House.So lets start with the pluses. Everything we had that was drenched in butter or deep fried was delicious. Second, I love that they have little beer sample trays which as someone who is forever learning about beer is really fun for me. Third, beer floats! I've never had one of these before and they are actually really delicious. I'm going to credit the yard house with my discovery of these, even though I'm pretty sure I can get them elsewhere or even make my own. Now with the negatives in handy bullet points!~Ahi Tuna Entree was severely overcooked and poorly prepared. They basically served me was a medium rare ahi steak, when I was expecting what you get everywhere else when you order pan-searched ahi, which is raw tuna with a slight butter singe on the edges so you can stick sesame seeds to it. I understand this may be a liability thing as The Yard House wants mass market appeal, but, yeah, just gross. Also, don't drench your mistakes in soy sauce!~Any place that is charging upwards of $25 for an entree needs to have professional wait staff, not just a bunch of college kids who would rather gossip by the POS terminals, then wait on their tables.  Our waiter didn't even ask us how everything was or offer us a desert menu? Do they even have a desert menu? If not, thats also a negative.~The first two beers my boyfriend and I ordered were out of stock. If this is a regular comment, the management should really start strategizing about how to be more proactive in replacing their stock.If I went again, it would be purely for beer and fried things, not a meal.

Reviews.Author: Nini C.
Reviews.Content: Reservations: NOPE, so if you really want to eat/drink here come early and shop during the wait because it's usually a long one especially during dinner time.Beer: I may be a girl but I am a fan of beer. I was told to try the Strawberry beer but will admit I am not a fan. The taste that is left in your mouth after the after-taste is definitely strawberry, but the after-taste has a coin/metal taste to it. How do I know? Just trust me. I've only been here twice and would like to try a new beer every time I go, but they have such a wide selection I'll probably have to choose one from each category/brand. Food: I shared an ordered of the Hawaiian Poke and New York Steak Salad. The poke tasted fresh & would get it again to share, but I've definitely had better. They served it with steamed bean sprouts and sliced carrots. A little weird pairing but being a fan of both veggies was good to me. The meat on the salad was cooked to perfection. I like medium rare but the meat was cooked to medium so it stayed juicy and was still flavorful. There were fresh potato chips in the salad??? I usually like crunch in my salad but the steak was heavy enough so having something fried in my salad was not very appetizing. Perhaps ask to have them on the side or to hold them.  Price: $$$. I will pay good money for good food, but this is not the place I would do so. Everything is over priced and it's not even a "fancy" or "gourmet" restaurant. The food is good but not something out of the ordinary.Would I go back? Only for an occasion.

Reviews.Author: Thai T.
Reviews.Content: I been here on several occasions, one for a friend's birthday and the other was just to hang out. First off, this place gets extremely crowded during peak hours. Come early if you want to get seats for the food. The food was "alright," I ordered a burger, medium rare, thick and juicy meat the way I like it. Slightly overpriced in my opinion though.The beer here was delicious! A large variety to choose from. I had no idea what any of them are, the bartender recommended to a few. I chose a Rosse Garden, which turned out quite well. If you trouble deciding, just ask!The bartenders are quite friendly and funny! I would recommend this place if you want to grab a drink and chill with your friends and meet new people.

Reviews.Author: Stacey A.
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here!!! This was my experience:I came here on a Monday night at 915pm, which turned out to be perfect! Waiting for seating was less than 5 mins for 2 people. We ordered the calamari, which was delicious....nothing spectacular about it, just really good calamari you'd expect! For drinks... my bf ordered the Great White after discussing with the waiter which drinks he would recommend to help narrow down the selection... cause he wasn't about to come to a brew house and order a blue moon or Stella he could've ordered anywhere else! I ordered the raspberry cider which I recommend to anyone like myself who has yet to acquire a liking to beer. I love me some cider, haven't come around to enjoying a beer quite yet. For food, he had the steak sandwich medium rare, and I the avocado swiss burger medium. His came with sweet potato fries, and mine shoestring. His sandwich came medium rare and was super juicy! His also had shoestring onion rings on it, which I got to steal a bit of :)) my burger however managed not only to be juicy, but delicious, and super filling!!!! They did not skimp on the avocado which made me so happy and it was sliced thin which made the process of eating the delicious burger easier. The garlic aioli it comes with is divine so don't forget it!! I asked for ranch with my fries and the ranch was addictive (biased tho cause I love restaurant, not bottled ranch) and had a hint of citrus I think... Yum! By this time in our dinner when we began to eat our meal happy hour had started so we ordered another round to enjoy with our dinner. Their happy hour is awesome on it's own. I've definitely come before with a gal pal and just ordered drinks and appetizers to eat and left plenty full. Becareful coming on weekend nights though...that line can grow!! Also, it is loud most of the time...keep that in mind. I like to rhyme. Oh yeah.

Reviews.Author: angie m.
Reviews.Content: Visited Yard House for the first time last friday.  I knew the wait was going to be ridiculous but what the heck, it's a new eating spot at Santana Row..it was expected.  After 2 yarders(the husband) and 3 martini's later(me)  i was feeling quite tipsy...lol.  We were seated- ordered the calamari to start- YUM! Husband ordered the crab cake sandwich he really like it.  I tried it and thought it just ooook.  I ordered the spicy thai chicken pizza and OMG  LOVED it!!! Fantastic drinks, yummy food, and great service.  I'll be back :)

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: I rate Yard House 3 stars because to me, the strength of its extensive beer selection outweighs its numerous negatives.  If I was rating it solely on its merits as a restaurant, I would give it 2 stars.  Here are my 2 cents on Yard House...FOOD  (hit-and-miss and expensive)I've had decent food at Yard House -- the firecracker wings, burgers and nachos come to mind.  However, some of the food I've eaten here was unsatisfying.  The menu seems to rely significantly on canned and frozen ingredients.  Last week I made the mistake of ordering the margherita pizza.  It featured uber-salty canned tomatoes, tasteless basil strips, and pale, bland crust.  I guess I shouldn't expect much from a chain restaurant, but I hoped for higher food quality in exchange for the relatively high prices... I was wrong.  A plus is that the menu is extensive and caters to diverse tastes.SERVICE (pretty good)Generally, I have had satisfactory customer service at Yard House.  Hostesses seem to be remarkably efficient in handling waits.  In my experiences, servers were fast, even when the place was packed.  My experiences at the bar have not been as positive.  I have found the bar staff to be less attentive and less friendly than the staff as a whole.  I once had a memorably negative experience when I was intentionally ignored by a bartender.ATMOSPHERE: (good)The layout and atmoshpere make Yard House a fun place to be.  Over-sized tables and chairs are comfortable.  I do wish the televisions were bigger; they aren't proportionate to the enormous room.  I often have difficulty reading text on the televisions.MISCELLANEOUS NEGATIVES:Often there are long waits to eat at Yard House; waits can exceed an hour.  Even seats in the bar area can be hard to come by.I have experienced lines for the restroom that rival those you would find at a sporting event -- no joke.  The men's restroom has 2 or 3 toilets and 2 urinals.  I think this is insufficient for a beer/wine/liquor establishment with a capacity of over 500.  To me, one of the benefits of suburban chain restaurants should be their ample restroom facilities.Yard House serves 24-ounce beers in 3-foot tall bongs they call "half-yards."  The use of these half-yards as drinking vessels is a gratuitous spectacle that I don't appreciate.  The half-yard is difficult to drink (one practically has to take it off the table and put it in his lap to sip).Apparently, management has adopted a practice of showing every available sporting event and not changing channels even when there is substantial interest in a particular event.  I discovered this recently when I was at Yard House when a Raiders game was being aired.  My group and a whole lot of other Raiders fans were in a section where the televisions were showing Jacksonville Jaguars vs. Buffalo Bills (or some equally inconsequential game).  According to the waitress, patrons are encouraged to tell the hostess that they are interested in a particular event, and the hostess will seat them in areas where that game is being shown... if not,  you run the risk of sitting in the  section where the loser bowl is being played.  Why does Yard House even play uncompelling games with non-local and low-market teams? To me, Yard House's TV practices are annoying and defy common sense.

Reviews.Author: C K.
Reviews.Content: The half Blue Moon/half Guiness combo is pretty good. I tried the Snakebite last night (half pear cider/half Harp lager), but I did not like it very much. My favorite item on the menu would have to be the lobster garlic noodles. There is a good portion of lobster meat and shrimp, and it is cooked with a lightly sweet butter sauce. It is an all around satisfying dish. Happy hour here is also decent. The buffalo wings are alright, but nothing extraordinary. The poke stack is pretty tasty.

Reviews.Author: Tina S.
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad Yard House is finally open in the bay area! woop woop!I've experienced YH in socal many times, and I love the environment, food, selection of beers on tap and above all else, their happy hour!The food here is pretty good, just don't get the crab cakes, which is two measly patties that are tiny and not very fresh. It might have been over fried or something because it just didn't taste or smell right. I swear I saw some diced carrots in it too, which was odd. I was expecting something bigger and better. You can't go wrong with their pizzas, and my personal favorite appetizers are the California roll and spicy tuna roll. I tried the rose gaarden (a beer blend of Hoegaarden White & Lindeman's Framboise) and it was just okay. It tasted flat and I know that the Lindeman's Framboise tastes good just by itself. My favorite blend is the snake bite, it is so perfect and refreshing. I came in around 2:50pm on Friday. They told us the wait was going to be 15-20 minutes, but it was only 10. The place was full, but apparently not as busy as other days. By 4pm the wait was 45 mins, I know because as I was leaving a friend of ours was waiting! The service here is outstanding, ask for Rex, he's great.

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: Put your name down at 5:30pm get in at around 8:30-9 ish. Sweet deal when you're only a few miles away. So while my friends and I waited, we watched a movie at my gf's apartment, came back, buzzed in- no standing 3 hours for us. :DBetween my gf and I: Truffle Fries (media3.ct.yelpcdn.com/bp…)Jambalaya (media1.ct.yelpcdn.com/bp…)Chicken Garlic Noodles (media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bp…)SnakebiteHoney beer-------------------------------60 bucks including tip-------------------------------Wonder if the hype will ever die down, it's been massively packed since this place opened. I definitely will come here again when the excitement dies down so I can enjoy my food in peace without yelling to talk.Cheers.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Food and beer are good.  Waiting in line (like at a club) to get into the restaurant is no good.  They were over capacity during the Sharks game and it took us 30 minutes to get in and they quote the table wait was over 3 hours!  Instead, we got in and sat with these other two girls who had a four-person table (thank you for being so gracious and nice if you're reading this!).  Good place to catch up and I love their raspberry cider (more than the pear one).  We split the peppercorn gorgonzola burger with sweet potato fries (drizzled with syrup) and a side of guac and chips.  Everything was pretty good.    On opening day, I tried their lunch special - organic tomato bisque and half sandwich roasted turkey.   Those were pretty good as well.  The service was excellent for being the first day opening.  Would come back soon!

Reviews.Author: Kim N.
Reviews.Content: Looks like Im reviewer 100 for this place and it's only been open a week!This place is insane even at 2pm on a Sunday. looking for both grub, beer and a way to maximize the amount of playoff tv I could consume, we wandered here for a late lunch. Wait was still a good 10-15min though we got seats initially at the bar. Got a solid Stout and proceeded to watch the NBA and NHL playoffs in full swing. As I got half way through my beverage, we got seated in the main dining area. This place isn't as big as I thought it would be but still, if you separated the four walls and bar into dining quadrants, each one could conceivably be the size of a restaurant normally. Im fascinated by at scale places like this which somehow manage to run logistics, staffing, supply chain/inventory, etc, etc. in a remendous manner. Now I've seen the SoCal ones for years but never set foot in one. I can imagine that if I did, the experience food, and everything else would be eerily close, as they seem to have the formula down. Had the lobster/crab/artichoke dip plus the southern fried chicken breast. All was pretty solid with nothing to gripe about. Less fancy than the other food joints (for the most part anyways) in the row but definitely a decent place to catch some games, a few beers and eats. It could probably stand to wait for the hype to die down a bit if you don't want to deal with the crowds.ps. the server Ashley is a looker! :)

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: First time around, really wasn't digging the service. My friends and I put our name down for a table and got the little pager thing. Our pager didn't ring and we missed our name being called. We went up to the hostess after, saying if we were called and she said, "WHAT!? Your name was called 20 minutes ago. You're just going to have to wait" My friends and I told her our pager didn't ring and we gave it to her. She said that she would give us the next available but sat a buttload of tables before us. We knew that happy hour was 10-12am and we got there at 10pm. We got sat at 10:55pm. Then we were told that we had 5 minutes to order food since the kitchen closes at 11pm..I HATE THAT HAPPY HOUR, YOU CAN ONLY ORDER FOOD FOR THE FIRST HOUR AND NOT THE WHOLE TIME!I also hate that they start kicking you out right when it hits 11:55pm. They straight out told us that they wanted everyone out by 12am. Got some new insight from a someone that because Santana Row is also part residential, they MUST clear the buildings by midnight. A little FYI for ya.I will say that happy hour food is such a steal! Chicken nachos was enormous. Not that much chicken and if you're drinking a lot of beer and have a lot of people. You should order this.Spicy tuna "roll" was not a roll but more of a tartar. I really liked it though! It needed to come with chips or something because it was just too much to eat by itselfHawaiian Poke Stack was pretty much like the spicy tuna but less minced and wayyyy salty.  A little hard to eat. Didn't really enjoy it much.Selection of drinks can be a little overwhelming to some but is a mini heaven to me.Shout out to the cutie server, Rex, that was serving me last night. Keep up the good work!First server that i had sucked. But I will give it to her that they were only opened for maybe 2 weeks and she was a bigg noobie who didn't give us the right about of waters, didn't take away our menus, over charged us and over all, sucked.

Reviews.Author: Kristina N.
Reviews.Content: Yardhouse is quite an experience. From the long wait to the endless beers, this place is unlike any other restaurant. I came here on a Saturday night at 6:30 and was told the wait is 1-1.5 hours. It ended up taking 1:45, which is of course ridiculously long. I noticed that everyone came in large groups; this place is great for birthdays and celebrationsThe food is Americana but has fusion with other ethnic flavors. The Chicken Enchilada is good, but not mind-blowing. I think the beer stole the show! I got a light fruity beer and a chocolate-coffee beer, it was delicious!The decor is really nice and is in line with Santana Row, it reminds me of a hip LA restaurant.  Their choice of music is strange, it's country music. I would come back for happy hour or in a large group, but there is no way I'm gonna spend more than 15 minutes waiting for my table!

Reviews.Author: Megan H.
Reviews.Content: AAAH so many beers, so little time. I've always just hung out at the bar, hearing that the wait is ridonkulous. It works perfectly because I've always come here just for beer. And they have quite a selection. The bartenders were friendly and pretty aware of when we wanted refills but on a weekend night it can get damn crowded. I love their weeknight happy hours when the crowds are at bay. Only funny thing that happened was when my friend asked for Moretti and the bartender said they didn't have it. Later we notice that it's right there in front of us! Fail!Summer weather calls for a nice cold one and this is the place to get it.

Reviews.Author: Hang T.
Reviews.Content: Since this is one of the first Yard House restaurants to open in northern Cali, it is a really big deal. In the first couple weeks, this was the place to eat and be seen. The wait was always 2 hours or more and people were willing to wait that long. I was lucky enough to not have to wait so long. The menu is insanely huge so you'll have to come back here multiple times to try out everything. My favorite dishes were the jambalaya and the truffle fries. OMG! The truffle fries are so good! I could taste the hint of truffle oil, and they were super thin and crispy. Just how I like it. The jambalaya is the best I've ever tried at a restaurant! There were a lot of pieces of crawfish and shrimp. I was so happy they didn't skimp on that. I hated the ahi tuna stack. It was just disgusting. The sauce it was drenched it was bitter and bad. The crab cake was also bland and needed salt. Since this place is a chain, I have to really go by what I know. I've tried the Irvine one and the Los Angeles one. This one by far is the smallest restaurant of the three. No wonder there is such a long wait. I don't know why they couldn't have thought of making it bigger when they were building it. I had to take off one star for that. The service is really good! They trained their servers well! Both times I came here, the waitresses were extra nice, friendly, and hospitable. The price for the food is pretty high, higher than a BJ's or Chili's, but the quality of food is better (as well as the portions). Huge portions! Split a meal with someone!Obviously they have a great beer selection! That is what they are known for and also an excellent happy hour!

Reviews.Author: Alice T.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Sunday afternoon.  Beautiful area to shop and hang out if you have never been here.  This place is usually busy because the food is pretty good, and there is a bar with a lot of beer on tap.  Sometimes there can be a really long wait so come early especially if you are trying to get in on a Friday or Saturday night.  The place is pretty big in the inside and the music can be loud.  They also have a lot of TV's where people can watch sports.  Great place for a guy or a girl to hang out to watch sports.  The staff was also super nice when I came in.  Maggie who was our server was also super nice.  She checked on me like 4 times.  If you get her as a server you are lucky.  I ordered a chicken barbecue pizza and my husband ordered a fried chicken breast.  Portion size is pretty big.  I was stuffed.  The food was not too greasy and I did not feel like sleeping after wards.  I thought it was really good.  I will be coming back!  Parking can be crazy when it is busy.  But if worse comes to worse you can park across the street and walk over from Valley Fair Mall.

Reviews.Author: Allister D.
Reviews.Content: Finally the time has come! Ever since thi splace opened up here in SJ, I couldnt wait to get my hands on their draft and sandwiches. HH here is f*ckin crazzzy!! Great deals on their tap and apps! The look of this place is top notch. It looks like an upscale lounge/club. The crowd here is young and I have noticed the type of look here as far as clothing. People still like to dress up and look good coming here to eat. I know it's SROW but damn hahah. The service is pretty cool. I have to be honest though, I think due to the heavy traffic here full of customers, the waiters and bartenders are a bit bitchy. Whatev?!I ordered their cuban sandwich and their blue crab hoagie! MMM sooo good!! I also came here for their HH and had my first half yard LOL. I had that good Guinness tap. The spot is legit! I just hate the looooong ass wait for 2 hrs just for 2. UGH, it's like these people havent gone to a brewery before haha.I will def come back!

Reviews.Author: Mikey U.
Reviews.Content: The same decent food, [some of] the same good beers, but far too much hype and fanfare for its own good...The menu offers a wide swath of choices to satisfy most cravings, from tapas style dishes like Hawaiian Poke Stacks and Shittake Garlic Noodles, to stepped up bar burgers/sammiches, to full entrees of steaks and seafood. Most of it, I wouldn't call fine dining or rave-worthy, though its a gallant attempt at sophisticated cuisine for a place that is thematically just a United Nations of Hops and Barley. Personally, so long as there's a Mac&Cheese (made with chicken, smoked bacon, truffle oil!) in front of me, I'm bueno. Keep the beers coming...And there's that.Regrettably, the beer selection here isn't as various or numerous as at other Yard Houses. (The online menu vaguely says "130-250 taps"; the Santana Row site is at the lower end.) Thankfully there are a few favorites and go-to brews on hand here (and at most of the YardHouses I've been to), but there are some better bars for exploring/appreciating beer/s.But the most unfortunate aspect of this particular Yard House is how inundated (afflicted?) it is with [a certain ilk of] people because of its location. Business-wise, I'm sure they're making money hand over fist. That's good and I'm glad that they're successful because - in full disclosure - I know people that work there and it'd be awesome if they're benefiting from the high traffic, but gone (and maybe never-was?) is any semblance of the fun and chill YardHouse experiences I got in Chicago, or San Diego, or even the Vegas locations. (Yeah, I said it, S.Row is d-baggier than Vegas... what.)In essence, Yard House *Santana Row*: the food is good, but not "2-hour-wait-for-a-table" good, the taps alright but  not worth standing three people deep at the bar for, and I couldn't care less to wade through that crowd on any night of the week. I eagerly anticipated Yard Houses arrival for so long, I wish I could like it more than I do. I'm not gonna NOT go (although that's usually how I feel about most things Row-ish), but I'm also not clamoring to get in either. _____________________________I don't need a scene, I need a beer - and there are better places for both.

Reviews.Author: Scott P.
Reviews.Content: Dropped in for some happy hour merriment... I lucked out by getting a table at about 515.  By 530, the Yard House was packed; on a Wednesday!  Had some tasty appetizers, the highlight was the Hawaiian Poke Stack - excellent ahi combined with wasabi soy sauce, delicious!  Another big hit for me was North Coast Old Rasputin Imperial Stout, smooth, big on flavor... almost chocolatey.Our server was like a beer diplomat... if you had any questions about the beer menu, he would quickly bring little tastes of anything you were interested in... with the varying tastes of everyone in the group, it worked out fantastic for all of us.By the time we left, there was a line of 30 people out the door... On a Wednesday!  I still can't believe it.

Reviews.Author: Donovan T.
Reviews.Content: Easily my favorite Santana Row hangout! Best happy hour in town! Great prices on beers and appetizers.Some restaurants tend to cheap out on portions and quality when it comes to "happy hour" prices but Yardhouse doesn't follow that practice! They have an extensive list of half off appetizers. Beers are also a great deal, pints are around $3-something, and halfyards are around $9. I tend to do the halfyard just cuz that's how i roll!They also have a ton of flat screens where you can catch the games. For Monday Night Football, it's happy hour from 3pm to close. So that's pretty awesome!As a restaurant, prices are similar to Cheesecake Factory. I can't comment on it too much, since I only eaten here twice but both times service was good. When they messed up my order on one occassion, they ended up comping it and giving it to me on the house, so that was nice of them.A few months ago, it wouldn't have been a 5 star rating, but now hype has died down, you can get in here pretty quick. Yardhouse clowns on BJ's so hard, it's ridiculous!

Reviews.Author: Jen H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a bday dinner on a Thursday night. Party of 6. Waited 1hr and 25 minutes.Pricey and not worth for what you pay. I purchased 2 drinks and 2 tacos (Short rib and fish taco), and my tab was $35. The tacos were delicious though--maybe because I waited so long for my dinner!There are plentiful of options around the area. Regardless, good company makes up for the horrendous wait!

Reviews.Author: Steven C.
Reviews.Content: Well known in Socal for their beer selection, okay happy hour pricing/selection, half-yard beers, and mediocre food. All of this holds true to their newest Norcal location, I'm surprised it wasn't brought up sooner to compete with BJs or any other modern American pub/restaurant.If you don't expect amazing food but appreciate draft beer, this place is great for hanging out every now & then. Unfortunately its still pretty new and considered the place to be in Santana Row so getting seating is a lesson in futility and you're far better off heading straight to the bar for open seating. This location's bar area is the largest I've seen at a Yard House and for good reason, its always packed.What to order? Get your favorite beer in a half-yard and be done with it. Or try the samplers if you want to make your way around the huge draft selection.

Reviews.Author: Danster L.
Reviews.Content: The wait can be torture at Yardhouse, especially if you want to have dinner at Santana Row's hot spot. I recommend going to Yardhouse during off peak hours or during happy hour. I have gone to YH several times now for happy hour, lunch, dinner and late night happy hour. Some of my favorite items include the truffle fries which is amazing and very addicting. Get this, I promise you won't regret it! I also recommend the cajun jambalaya dish which has tons of flavor, seafood and much more. It probably is my favorite entree at the restaurant. The garlic noodles is very good but don't get it as an entree with the chopped chicken. Get it as a side dish and the flavors of the noodles stand out more.The staff are always running around and they will take care of you if you are friendly and direct towards them. Tell them what you want and you will be satisfied. My favorite servers at Yardhouse at Owen and Renzie (Rex). Ask for them and you will get really impeccable service. Happy hour is very fun at Yardhouse as you can try many items for half off or discounted prices. If you do go to the restaurant, just have a lot of patience if you come during peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: I really dig how they have a nice veggie menu.  Makes me want to go back and try more.  Best to get here during their Happy Hour, because some items and beer are half off.  Holy Toledo I had a beer and it was $4.50 during Happy Hour.  Can't believe the normal price is $9 for a glass of beer!This place has a super long waiting list, which is a bummer.  Best to just get here early as you can to get seated.My favorite was their nachos.  Too good.

Reviews.Author: Katlin L.
Reviews.Content: I wish that the wait wasn't so long EVERY time I go, BUT...the food is ALWAYS worth it. I think I order one of the most expensive things on the menu (the filet mignon) but it never disappoints. Another staple that I absolutely have to order is the lobster, crab and artichoke dip; one word AMAZING. If you like seafood, you must try this, and I say this as someone who doesn't ever order anything with seafood in it, so good.Yard beers, cool. I'm not much of a beer drinker, but I guess they look cool. It's also a good place to catch a game, as long as you get there an hour early ;)All in all, give it a try if you have a lot of time to spare, or if you want to put your name in, walk around Santana Row and come back. Oh, and definitely try the lobster, crab and artichoke dip!! :)

Reviews.Author: Andrew D.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the atmosphere here and the layout is well designed. Happy hour is great with half price pizzas and appetizers. I recommend the tomato, garlic and spinach pizza and also the calamari. They are both delicious! The bartenders are friendly and attentive and the food comes our REALLY quick. It's like order, sip on your drink, chit chat, sip on your drink and BOOM... pizza on the table!The only negative I have about this place is phone reception. I have At&t and I get no signal at all. I would always have to go outside to make calls or text. They do offer free Wifi though. The SSID is called YardHouseGuest or something and it requires no password.Would I come back here? Definitely. I like the vibe, people are friendly and the food comes out quick.

Reviews.Author: Joanne Y.
Reviews.Content: Good place to hangout with friends. Food is not THAT great here but it is the beer that makes this place worth it. Food is way too overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Marialena S.
Reviews.Content: Some people and places deserve a second chance, and we are so glad we gave it to Yard House in Santa Row.We came on a busy Friday night, but our server Loree did not seem phased.  She took our order in a timely manner and delivered our drinks quickly (after waiting for a table for 45 minutes a drink is a high priority :) ).  The kids' meals were a generous portion and excellent value ($6.95 with a drink AND dessert!).  Kids had mac n cheese and chicken fingers - YUMMY.  Even the husband was raving about the chicken fingers.  We both ordered fish tacos and they did not disappoint.  Beers and drinks were top notch.  Husband was not sure about ordering a new type of beer and the waiter did not flinch about bringing a sample.  My martini was delicious, too bad we had to drive home or I would have had more.  We will definitely be back to this location!

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: Best place for happy hour. Mon-Fri 3-6, Sun-Wed 10-12am. 1/2 off appetizers, and good deals on drinks. Don't come Fri after 4 for hh, you won't get seated in time, although you can try your luck at the bar area.I recommend:Chicken Nachos (best bang for your buck)CalamariPoke StackLettuce WrapsChicken StripsWings with bonesSliders (Bearnaise)If you like Blue Moon/Shock Top, try Sunset WheatGeorgia Peach House Martini on the rocksFor non happy hour menu, I recommend:Truffle FriesGrilled Sweet Korean BBQ Beef appetizerAhi Crunchy SaladPepper Crusted Gorgonzola-- BEST BURGER EVER.I'm not going to go into details about how great this place is. For the most part waiters/waitresses are friendly and accommodating, service fast, food comes out fast and is tasty.

Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: Yardhouse gets 5 stars just for the selection of Beer. Not only do they have a great selection, but they have changed their menu so you can see where the beer is from, alcohol content, etc. My favorite right now is 1. Killkenny Irish Cream - reminds me of travels in Ireland. 2. Rogue Dead Guy Ale - a great balance malty red, or maiboch? not sure but good!3. White Lightning - great chill wheat beer from SFThe food is very good, better than BJ's or Cheescake Factory. Happy hour and lunch specials are very good. You can get a half pizza and half salad for around $10 now, and the street tacos are very unique, straight from a Hipster food truck in Austin, TX.The huge downside, and why it only gets 4 stars, is that it can get so crowded you can't sit down to eat for 2 hours. The bar can get so busy you have to stomp all over people to get one order in. OH WELL.

Reviews.Author: devin p.
Reviews.Content: My gf and i went and ate lots of cheap lil foods and we got so excited by how cheap and little they were that we went home and had sex

Reviews.Author: Danny K.
Reviews.Content: I experienced a rarity at the Yardhouse today...there was no wait for a table for 2 (probably because it was the 4th of July).  We walked in for a table for 2 and we were seated right away...how common is this at the Yardhouse? The normal wait time is 1-2.5 hours.  Since I was seated right away we wanted to take advantage of this so we went all out and ordered as much as our tummy's would allow....Instead of ordering a main dishes we ordered several appetizer's (I think their appetizers are better then their main courses).   What did we order:AHI POKE BOWL - marinated raw ahi & avocado with carrots, bean sprouts, macadamia nuts & wontons (nothing too great, I would definitely recommend passing on this dish). SWEET POTATO FRIESwith creamed maple bacon dip (good stuff, small order - nothing overwhelming)LETTUCE WRAPSstir fried, smoked tofu, pine nuts and green onions with three dipping sauces and choice chicken, tiger shrimp, or shiitake & portabella mushrooms (great taste, I would definitely recommend).  IRECRACKER WINGStossed in a spicy sesame garlic plum glaze, garnished with green onionschoose: traditional * boneless * gardein (OK, if you haven't had these wings then this is a MUST order.  Probably one of my top 3 wings - I love BJ's and Sino's too). BÉARNAISE SLIDERSfour mini burgers made from natural angus beef served with fried onions, béarnaise sauce, fries and pickle (pretty damn good and well cooked, if you haven't tried - it's a definite recommendation).OK, I can't go to Yardhouse without trying their beer.  I ordered the:Leinenkugel's Sunset Wheat White Ale.  Has a bit of a flowery scent and taste to it.  The first sip was great but overall it kind of tasted like a cocktail versus a beer.  I also tried a Peach flavored beer (forgot the name) - again, too much fruit flavor and not enough beer "action."  To close out the day we ordered the regular beer sampler which comes with 6 small glasses of their light ale's.  Overall most of the beer was pretty good except for one that was extremely watery and not to my liking.  Most of them had some type of fruit flavor (1 had a coffee flavor similar to Guinness but lighter).  They had another sampler with darke ale but I chose the lighter for lunch.  I wish the server explained what we were drinking rather then just delivering the sample on our table and walking away....I can't wait to go back to the Yardhouse.  I love the atomosphere.  It reminds me of the Yardhouse at Oahu!!!

Reviews.Author: Monica A.
Reviews.Content: An upscale Red Robin, minus the bottomless fries. But.. I LOVE Red Robin so I admit I loved Yardhouse.Food?Ordered from the Happy Hour menu and I was pleased. Food was delicious but not overwhelmingly memorable. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing... in reality-- its normal food you'd find at a place like BJ's but add in the ambiance, service, and of course HYPE... you fool yourself into thinking its top notch.Wait Time?Came here early around 4:30pm to beat the crowd. We forgot there was a sharks games, so we patted ourselves on the back again for beating the shark heads there. We were seated immediately however literally after 15 minutes the crowds stormed in. It was a Wednesday, I can't imagine what it would be like over the weekend. Service?Service was passable. Again nothing memorable. Our servers shuffled around 3 times, however we were never really overlooked. Props for that. Looks like they were training that night too, so can't place blame on someones first day. But they were overall pretty attentive, not really personal and seemed to be in a bit of a rush.Restaurant?Modern and Fancy. Like I said, an upscale Red Robin. The restrooms were really neat... something you would find at a hip Las Vegas club. Decor made the restaurant look really "expensive" but the people made it chill. The location couldn't be better. Right on the tip of Santana Row along Stevens Creek Blvd... location, location, location! After you grab a bite or finish your half yard beer... take a stroll around Santana Row and walk it off that onion ring tower.

Reviews.Author: Immortal S.
Reviews.Content: So far, I've had two very different experiences at Yard House which has left me quite conflicted on if 1. I will return and 2. If I even like this place. There is no doubt the place is big, beautiful, and attractive with all of its 100+ beers on tap. I've also come across it's share of friendly and not-so-friendly staff. From server's repeatedly coming to our table when the bar is still full telling us they are closing and basically pushing us out (before midnight no less!) I thought you were a bar? I don't get it. On the other end, I met a wonderful bartender who was sweet. A different night, I met a nice server who helped me pick out a really awesome Belgian wheat beer that I ended up loving.I'll probably return one day to try out their happy hour I hear so much about. From word of mouth, it's the best way to spend your money here. I haven't tried the food yet so that will be something to do as well. So, unfortunately for me the verdict is still out...  but one thing is for sure- it's always crowded here.

Reviews.Author: Peter K.
Reviews.Content: Is fumy that my friends want to impress me with Yard House when there are dozens of Yard House in So Cal already. Didn't feel like drinking on a week night,(By the way I am cutting down my drinking, is not like I drink much anyway but I want to drink less than once a month.) so I ordered a coffee while all my friends were drinking, for some reason the waitress just didn't think I needed any creamer or sugar, I thought maybe they were giving me hints that I need to stay away from sugar, but after 2 cups of black coffees I finally got my creamers, and I had to wait for another 20mins to get my first patch of sugar.  And we ordered some 50% off happy hour appetizers(We went after dinner just to hang out), the food was just alright.  I am not really a big fan of Yard House anymore, maybe 6-7 years ago it was cool to me.  Only time I would come here if my group of friends planned to come here and chill.

Reviews.Author: Elaine Y.
Reviews.Content: This is now our family's favorite "go to" place for yummy casual food.  We went for Mother's day celebration and they had a Lobster Mac and Cheese special! OMG - CHUNKS of delicuous lobster paired with their already AWESOME mac and cheese?  And they don't just give you a "little portion" - it's a GOOD cheesy size of mac and cheese!  I've gotten it again when we celebrated my dad's bday - but it was just with chicken - JUST as good!!  With the sundried tomatoes... YUM!They are known and justly so - for their truffle fries and sweet potatoe fries.  We ended up getting seconds of both because it's so delicious - skinny french fries with truffles?  who can beat that?  And the sweet potatoe fries were perfect - my 3, 4, 6 and 9 year old nieces and nephews couldn't get enough - AS WELL as the teens and adults!  Something we can ALL agree on.The other thing I want to point out is Yard House has AMAZING Salads.  Their summer salad is AWESOME - just wish they gave more.  My daughter loves their Pear salad!  Love that they have SO many to choose from.You also can't go wrong with their fish dishes - So tender packed with lots of flavor.  I will say though that the night we were there for my dad's bday dinner - the kitchen oversalted some of the fish dishes - but the manager got them replaced right away - with apologies and free dessert - can't complain!!  Service was great!And you can't beat their drinks - too many to choose from - am still working my way through their drink menu!  It does get crowded but since we have little ones and teens we go early and are just fine!Give this place a try - it took me YEARS to finally try it and now it's one of our familiy's all time favorite places...

Reviews.Author: Kylie H.
Reviews.Content: Good luck coming here on a Friday or Saturday night! Sheeesh......after coming here multiple times and being turned down because of their crazy 3 hour waits, I finally came on a Monday afternoon and was seated immediately. This place is basically Bj's Restaurant's hot older sister, with a bigger beer selection and better food. I ordered the Shrimp Vodka Pasta lunch special, and it was incredibly tasty! I wiped my plate clean. I felt like they put a "special" ingredient in the Truffle Fries I ordered because I became addicted immediately. Many of the other items on their menu look very appealing and I can't wait to try them!  I thought it was kind of strange how they had their beverage station RIGHT next to the bathrooms. Bottom line, do not piss off your server or you might get piss water in your drink!

Reviews.Author: Ede S.
Reviews.Content: The happy hour here is quite awesome and the appetizers are huge! My husband and I came here at the start of hh at 3pm and the place was nice and unpacked. When we left, the place started to get more crowded. The service we had was great and my husband said that going there was the best idea I ever had.We tried five shorty's (9 oz) beers and if you are a fan of wheat beers, I would definitely recommend the house honey blonde. We paid $3 per shorty. Make sure you bring your I'd because they definitely card you. There was a select menu of half off appetizers and we had the ahi tuna, classic sliders and chicken nachos. We ordered thinking that the appetizers were tiny, but boy were we wrong! We could've gone without ordering the third appetizer. Instead of regular fries, we upgraded to truffle fries and it was definitely worth it! It may be one of the best truffle fries I've had.Our waitress, Katherine was very friendly and surprised us with a special "birthday" dessert at the end of the meal. At first I thought my husband was being shady and said it was my birthday.  But it turns out it was for my son (who was sleeping soundly in his stroller). Thats how you get a nice tip, thank you Katherine! When we left, the place started to look more packed since I'm pretty sure other people were slowly getting off work.

Reviews.Author: judy n.
Reviews.Content: Awesome-ness!!!: Hawaiian poke stack - Nom Nom Chicken garlic noodles - yum!Grilled sweet Korean short ribs - nice but pricey. Truffle fries - awesome Lambic (get raspberry. the strawberry tastes like cough syrup. really bad cough syrup) they have a Beer float? Huh....S'ok: MAC n cheeseSliders

Reviews.Author: Kenny Y.
Reviews.Content: This is a happy hour review only..Amazing!Prices are fantastic... all of the drinks are pretty much half price... with their huge selection of drinks you could come here over and over again and never get bored.The food is half off during happy hour (appetizers only?) and very very good.  The portions are large as well.  I would definitely recommend the Thai Chicken Pizza and sliders...!Stay away from the spicy tuna roll thingy they serve though... I'm a pretty big sushi fan... and any real sushi fan would say this thing is gross.  It came out looking like a big avocado cake filled with Tuna, and tasted like it too.. tuna was not fresh and tasted cooked... too much avocado.. I didn't really understand what the concept of the dish...Overall, if you avoid that tuna dish, this is a great place for happy hour and to knock a few back.I would recommend getting their early, as it got SUPER crowded after 5 pm.

Reviews.Author: Rav V.
Reviews.Content: Quick, cheap and good. I met a buddy for lunch and we were able to grab some spots at the bar. I ordered a chicken sandwich with their tomato soup. The sammy came out and it didn't look too exciting but looks aren't everything. The sammy appeared simple but it was delicious. The tomato soup was excellent. The place was bumping but we were able to get in and out in a breeze. Can't wait to return to try their beers and dinner selections.Yay, I'm a Fan!

Reviews.Author: Kate L.
Reviews.Content: Loud, crowded, sleek and a test of your patience. A good place if you are looking forward to spending time with one or two people. A larger crowd might be difficult to hang around the bar with to wait for a table.  This place does not take reservations.  It's well worth the wait ... just be prepared.  The good was very good and the service exceptional.

Reviews.Author: Issa A.
Reviews.Content: The Yardhouse is like a mix of the Cheesecake Factory with a sports bar, but with a MASSIVE selection of beers on tap.Their entree portions are GARGANTUAN. That's why I prefer sticking with the lunch portion. Or even appetizer. Or even their "snack" section.Favorite Items:- Sea Bass- Most of their burgers, stay away from their disintegrating wheat bun- Ahi Poke (snack size filled me up!)- Southwest salad- Mac n cheese (so so bad for u though! :-\ )- House Honey Blonde beer (I like lighter beers)- Blueberry beer (weird combo but good! try it!)Also, for kids--my niece got chicken tenders with fries and they also were amazingly delicious. I was watching her like a vulture waiting for her to say "I'm full!" :)Really most of the beers I've had here are good, but a tiny bit pricey at 6-7 per pint, so try to go for HAPPY HOUR! Overall, a great atmosphere, but the wait you have to suffer here makes it really not worth it. We've waited over 1 full hour WITH A RESERVATION. It was a large party of 8 people, but still--thats what reservations are for..

Reviews.Author: Leilani N.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Thursday at 2:00 p.m. expecting it to be relatively quiet--goodness, I was wrong. It was already crowded, and since I spent some time here waiting for the Sharks game, I saw YH go from crowded to chaotic to wtf? I can't imagine coming here on Friday or Saturday, seeing that it's already a 2 hour wait to get a table on a week day. Lines everywhere! For the restroom, to put your name down to get a table, even to get inside...I was lucky enough to get here early and try all their cool beers on tap. Their food is pretty salty, but I guess they're assuming you'll be drinking beer along with it. Sadly, I don't recommend getting a half yard because the shape makes it awkward to drink. When you get near the bottom of the glass, you almost feel like you need to pull a "das boot turn". But then you remember the thing is cylindrical, and doesn't help at all.

Reviews.Author: Mabel L.
Reviews.Content: A HUGE drink selection and comparably ENORMOUS menu = BIG fan! I was a bit skeptical because of all the hype and it seemed like another generic franchise but I had a really good time at the Yard House! We arrived at ~5:00 on Saturday and despite the crowded entry way we were able to find 4 spots at the bar while we waited for our table. The bartender was very responsive and informative and not soon after we got our drinks we got our table.I'm not a huge beer drinker but I really appreciate their huge selection. I ended up getting a raspberry cider that was tasty and refreshing. Next time I would try some of their beer blends. The beers my companions had were all quite tasty too. Truffle fries were yummy. Tomato bisque was very tasty. My mac n cheese was pretty good too-lots of mushrooms and bacon. Our servers were very prompt to almost too quick--they would start clearing our dishes before we were done. Other than that I appreciated the attentiveness.Cool industrial/modern decor. Very large interior.

Reviews.Author: Jenn S.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good food. I love the Caesar salad from here. I liked the burgers, fries and also the garlic noodles were pretty good. Service is very inconsistent, sometimes it's good sometimes it's slow, once it was awful. I once called and asked how long the wait was for 7 people and was told 15 minutes, when I got there (less than 15 minutes later) and asked for a table for 7 the hostess up front just stared at me and said uggggh let me go get the manager. Then we ended up waiting more than 1.5 hrs for a table this was also the same night where I got the awful server too. (no smiles, no expression, drops stuff and ignores you)

Reviews.Author: Phuong H.
Reviews.Content: Yardhouse is... alright.Great beer selection.Decent food. Don't get the mac & cheese. It was dry and bland. Flavors were not married together at all. Burger was meh ok. My husband and I agree we've had better burgers at Jack in the box, Carls Jr and definitely The Counter.Service sucks. If you are fine with waiting then feel free to give it a try.We waited for 30 minutes to be seated.Waited another 30 minutes for our drink orders.Waited 15 minutes for our beer. 15 minutes after, got lukewarm soup and cold truffle fries.Entrees arrived. Oh weeee finally the water arrived.On the bright side, our server sympathized and noticed my uneaten dinner and didn't charge me for it. There are many better choices in Santana Row -- choose one of them.

Reviews.Author: Christine H.
Reviews.Content: I tried to come in for happy hour, and because of the long wait, I missed it! THIS PLACE GETS SO CROWDED!!! I've decided to come in with 2 other friends for some shared appetizers, and to try out their beers. Appetizers that we ordered, and that I would totally order again!!-AHI POKE BOWL (nice chunks of avocado and ahi tuna.)-FIRECRAKER RIBS (slightly spicy spare ribs that were crusted and crispy. Never had anything like this. Tasty!)-TRUFFLED FRIES (super thin fries with herbs and shredded parmesan.)-ONION TOWER RING (nicely sized rings with perfect amount of batter)If you like fruity and light beers (basically beers that don't taste like beers, but rather, more like sparkling juice):-TIMMERMAN'S FRAMBOISE (tasted like some sort of berry soda!! I wanted to try the Timmerman's Strawberry because so many people raved about it, but they ran out. So the waiter suggested this one! I'm glad that she did!)-SEADOG BLUEPAW WILD BLUEBERRY (very light beer that has hints of blueberry. My friend said it reminded her of blueberry pancakes. haha) PERSONAL NOTES:****Happy Hour: M-F, 3pm-6pm, 10pm-1130pm & Sun-W, 10pm-12am*****-Bar seats are on first come first serve basis. You don't need the waiter to seat you in the bar area. -Because its so crowded and busy, the service can be a bit slow, borderline neglecting. So, the winning questions is: Would I come back? Uhhhmm....I'm a little bit hesitant to come back. I hate long waits + super crowded area + slow service. Because of these factors, I'm giving it 2 stars. The whole process of getting seated and waiting and ordering and all that just seems to be a bit of a pain in the ass. I'll definitely be back again for their happy hour at exactly 3PM! I'll be sure to update how it went. But for now, Yard House gets only 2 Stars from me.

Reviews.Author: Matilda P.
Reviews.Content: Whoever says this place is only about beer is crazy! Yardhouse has THE BEST Chicken Tortilla soup I've ever had. It's legit - trust me!The Ahi Poke Bowl is excellent and a great price. When I'm feeling like I can spare some calories and carbs I will opt for the Moo Shu Egg Rolls. Yumm.Oh and the Southern Punch drink tastes like a watermelon jolly rancher. Tasty.

Reviews.Author: Julie Z.
Reviews.Content: I'm always inbetween a 4 and 5 stars here. I want to give it a 5 star for its overall quality and impression of the place. But, I also am hesitant to say its the "best' i've ever had type of bar/restaurant. It's definitely a hit or miss which I think is heavily based off of our experience with the waiters each time.This time, I had a really easy going, friendly and attentive waiter. He didn't rush us with our orders and always remembered to bring whatever we needed. Our waiter was named Linh and I totally think he deserves praises for taking care of us during our "happy hour" gathering at YH. We came as a group of 6 and was sat towards the middle of the area (away from the Bar, top floor).  We came right when HH started at 3pm, my friends ordered beer, mojito, blue moon, georgia peach, martini, and appetizers!Here it goes:Margherita Pizza - I'm particular with my pizza because I LOVE BJ's deep dish pizza. However, this pizza topped with tomatoes, basil, cheese. so simple yet so delicious! i topped it off with a bit of sirarcha sauce and it was heavenly! For HH, this pizza is winning! It's like 10 slices for 8 bucks. The thin crust is giving my BJ"s great white a run for its money.. hmm more please!California Roll - the biggest mistake thus far. The first time I had the CA roll, the rice was fresh and not hard (as if it came straight from the fridge/made days ago). The presentation was beautiful, but it was bland and the rice was hard and tasted like it was more than a day old.Fried Calamari - it was good, it was what I was expecting from a calamari. good sauce that accompanies the calamari. no complaintsThai Chicken PIzza- i tried a bit of my friend's pizza. It was good, but i think after eating the margherita pizza. i still liked that one the best. we left feeling satisfied. so far my experiences at yard house have been excellent. i would come back with friends for HH.

Reviews.Author: Monique M.
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Yard house restaurants down south so when they finally opened one up near home I was so excited!  Our server was named Christine. She was on top of it! I am not too much of a beer drinker, but she was so helpful on giving us her opinion and her favorite is now mine! It is known as the "fruity pebble beer." Amazing. When I go back I will def order a half yard of it. The food was absolutely amazing. Never have had a problem with ANY of their food. Everything on the menu is delicious! Love this place. :)Ps- Be sure to call ahead for reservations! =)

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here so many times I'm surprised I haven't written a review yet! This is definitely a restaurant/bar with a vibrant feel. The moment you step into the restaurant you'll probably find yourself speaking louder so that the noise doesn't drain your voice. Huge bar and plenty of tables but I'll tell you this: you'll most likely have to wait to be seated! They don't take reservations so the wait can get pretty long since it's a really popular joint! The great thing about this location is that while you wait you can shop. It's located at the end of Santana Row's strip so I usually park either at Macys (across the street at Valley Fair) or if I'm going to shopping around Santana Row I'll park in one of their parking structures. I'm seriously addicted to their truffle fries - you CANNOT go here and NOT order them! I've tried a lot of things on their menu but the most memorable to me are: Mac N Cheese, Sea Bass and garlic noodles. The service is generally good. I've had no bad experiences and most of my waiters were super friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Marcy L.
Reviews.Content: Their Ceviche is delicious & I know authentic seafood since I've lived on the beaches in Mexico. Mmm mmmm mm

Reviews.Author: Heather B.
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I have now been to both this location, as well as the one in San Diego, and we literally go out of our way to go there. I have never ordered anything there that I didn't like. The only thing I had an issue with was the Cuban sandwich because it comes with a beef dip on the side, where I would prefer extra mojo sauce instead, which I'm sure they would accommodate. Unfortunately there are just too many things to try and I don't live quite close enough to make a weekly trip there, so I spread my wings to other areas of the menu. The service here has always been great, if not sometimes a little slow because they get super busy. They don't take reservations and the wait can be way too long, but it is always worth it.Some highlights:BEER:  I can't help but love a place that has tons and tons of beer on tap, especially when a "half yard" size is an option, as well as a goblet. A GOBLET. Mmmm beer.Truffle fries: I was turned onto this truffle oil/parm/herb blend on in-house made potato chips at another restaurant, but this is where my truffle fry obsession exploded. I think about them often, I think I have dreams about them.Roasted turkey sandwich:  The turkey is quality and thick sliced, and pickled jalapenos is so genius on sandwiches, it's my new favorite condiment. Maybe other people already do that, I don't know, but it was a revelation to me.Crab topped Swordfish: This is the only item I have tried in the fish category, but wow. WOW. Wasabi mashed potatoes seemed like it might not work out with the other items on the plate, but I trusted them, and everything all together it was fantastic.I've come here as a couple, as a group, sent friends there, and I haven't heard any complaints yet besides the basics, that could literally happen at any restaurant. They're still human, things happen, things get busy. But the food, the food is the most important part, and Yard House hits that shit out of the park.

Reviews.Author: Marc W.
Reviews.Content: Go for the bar and ambiance. Food service and quality was severely lacking. Our server was inattentive to the point of negligence, dinner took twice as long as it should have, and the food had no flavor. The beer selection, while wide, lacks both depth and surprise. Ultimately, I would have walked away thinking they just focus on style over substance, except style too seemed poorly thought-through.

Reviews.Author: Allan Y.
Reviews.Content: Only one word can describe this place...overrated. Why do people wait 2 hours for this place? And why was I one of those people? SMH. I've heard everyone rave about this place and when Yard House finally made its Northern California debut, I was definitely intrigued. Then I heard about the outrageous wait times at this place and I was quickly turned off.But one fateful Saturday night brought me here for dinner. I was having dinner with some of my San Jose friends and I suggested that we go here for dinner, since this place is so hyped up; I consider myself a hype-monger, who seeks to try only the newest and the hottest "ish." I stopped by Yard House at 6pm to put my name down on the wait list. I was quoted a wait time of 2 hours. Goodness gracious. Normally I would have said "eff this" and gone some where else to eat. But I was sort of set on YH, so I put my name down and just went shopping at Valley Fair Mall for 2 hours. Fast forward to 8pm and my table is finally ready. This place reminds of BJ's. They have a similar decor and seating arrangements. Let me preface my review, by saying yes they have a lot of beers on tap, but honestly their beer selection is pretty mediocre. You can pretty much find any of those beers at a Whole Foods or a BevMo. If you are a true brew snob, get ready to be disappointed.But if you are someone who considers themselves a non-beer snob, there are some good things about this place. One thing that YH does well is that it gets a lot of my non-beer drinking friends to actually drink beer. They forgo the fou-fou cocktail drinks and indulge in the elixir of the gods, beer. Plus beer served by the half-yard is a nice touch as well.The food here is not bad. The portion sizes are pretty huge; think Cheesecake Factory or Applebee's huge.For starters, my friends and I had the onion ring tower. The name pretty much describes the meal. Onion rings arranged in the shape of a tower.For my main entree, I ordered the crab crusted swordfish. This dish was alright. I felt that the swordfish was a little too overcooked for my liking, so the fish turned out dry and stringy. But ignoring the texture of the food, I thought the flavors were great. The fish was topped with a lemon grass white sauce, which was both citrus-y and creamy. I was huge fan of the wasabi mashed potatoes and thought this unique combination worked well together.I sampled my friends' entrees, which included the mac and cheese, fried chicken breast and the lobster garlic noodles. I was huge fan of the mac and cheese because it was littered with pieces of bacon and chicken. The fried chicken was especially crispy and worked well with the helping of mashed potatoes and gravy it was accompanied with. The lobster garlic noodles is a good dish if you love comma inducing and extra buttery carbs, oh yeah and seafood; the garlic noodles were topped with large chunks of lobster and shrimp.For dessert, I had the chocolate souffle. This was a pretty decent dessert. Thank you for the YH staff for paying me to courtesy of topping off my dessert with a birthday candle and spelling out "Happy Birthday" with cocoa powder. Thanks again. Overall, this place is alright if you want to get a beer, but the wait time is pretty outrageous. Wait till the hype dies down and then this place will be a lot better. Beer by the half-yard is a good thing.

Reviews.Author: Tien P.
Reviews.Content: Long wait, but from what I could remember from my experience at Yard House is that it was well worth the wait. For a group of 10 on a Saturday, the Host said it would be a 2 hour wait, but it ended up being only an hour and a half. They were going to split us up into two different booths, but we wanted to squeeze into 1 since we all wanted to eat together. The booths in the far wall sat 10 of us comfortably (we were all fairly petite), so next time if I come with that many, I'd ask for 1 booth so the wait would be shorter.From my friends I tried their Truffle Fries which were really good, Ahi Tuna sliders which were bomb, and the Blueberry beer had a light fruitiness to it.Personally, I shared an Avocado Swiss Burger w/ Sweet Potato Fries and the Turkey Pot Pie with a friend and washed it all down with the Strawberry Beer/Cider thing (sorry forgot the name). The burger was a perfect medium rare (just the way I like it), but the fries were mediocre. The turkey in the potpie was moist and the crust was bomb. The strawberry beer was really good. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience with my friends. They're pretty new, so they have a lot of growing and developing to do, but I will give them 4 stars because I feel like my biggest problems with them aren't really their fault and it'll be alot better once the hype dies down.

Reviews.Author: Jarek A.
Reviews.Content: The SJ area lacks places like this so thats the reason for 3 stars, but its beer selection is actually quite mundane when it comes to actually being a beer snob looking to try new things.I might have been a bit more generous if they had allowed me to order more than one damn drink at a time since I sometimes like to mix my own concoctions up, but no - its against policy. Pathetic,

Reviews.Author: K L.
Reviews.Content: Great place to hang out for beer & food but this place is super loud.  We were yelling across the table to hear each other.  Great selection of beers and beer samplers are fun to try. Lotz of different types of food and they were all good when we ordered bbq ribs, garlic noodles, chicken salad, pasta, fries.  Service was good too so I would definitely come back with friends.

Reviews.Author: Samantha C.
Reviews.Content: My first time at Yard House was with 3 other friends and we were able to be seated at a table.  The atmosphere in the restaurant was great for a night out.  There were a lot of people talking and music just loud enough to enjoy but not so loud that you couldn't hear yourself think.  There were many yards of beer being passed around and that was fun to see.  The waitress that served us was awesome and super chill.  Her recommendations for beer (I had the house hefeweizen) were so good and we just had a good time chatting and enjoying the place.  I had the truffle fries this time and they're TO DIE FOR.  The one thing you have to have = truffle fries.  Those are so delicious!  The one food menu item I would not recommend is the seared tuna sashimi (not sure if that's exactly what it's called).  It was a bit too salty.  It wasn't horrible, but I've definitely had better elsewhere.The second time I was at Yard House, I was sitting at the bar.  It was hard to find a seat, but if there's 2 or 3 of you going, it's a lot faster to be seated at the bar.  Once again I ordered the truffle fries because they're so good and they go super well with beer.  I ordered the beer that had a long German name and I couldn't pronounce it XD.  Over all, this is a good place to hang out and I would definitely recommend it to both people under and over 21.  The wait time could get a bit long though, so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: Met friends here for a happy hour and thought it was a great, fun atmosphere!  VERY loud, VERY crowded and a "cool" atmosphere with tons of tables and standing room around the HUGE bar.The menu is incredibly long and reasonably priced.  They have tons of drink options as well, so you'll definitely find what you're looking for.I recommend highly for groups and for a fun night out!

Reviews.Author: Max T.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night with my gf. She had been here before and I hadn't yet. All my friends raved about it so I had high expectations. The wait wasn't too bad. We were seated at a great spot, the wine selection was fair,  our server was awesome and friendly, and above all...the food was spectacular! Great find. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Alisa Z.
Reviews.Content: Good place for happy hour, but probably not much else. ALL of their beers and many other beverages are part of the happy hour, so I was able to try a few things that I've never had before. A lot of the appetizers and pizza's are half off. I tried a friend's margherita pizza and it was just not good, even kind of bad. The calamari and crabcakes looked unappetizing and overdone. The truffle fries were ok. The chocolate souffle cake was really good, but tiny.Overall they give you giant portions of average food as appetizers, but if you don't like it, don't eat it, it's like $5.It's kind of like a cheaper Cheesecake factory with beer instead of cheesecake.We also had to wait for over an hour to be seated when we were there with a pretty large party around 4 pm on a friday. The service was okay overall, but it took forever to pay. I guess they were busyI would give it 2 stars, but the beer and how cheap the place is during happy hour bumps it up to a 3 and i would come back.

Reviews.Author: Sheena T.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love yard house. The first yard house that I ever went to was in So Cal the irvine location and then Rancho Cucamonga. I have yet given a review to the place but I am so glad they were finally able to open one on Santana Row. The location is one of the best. Right at the corner of the main street you can't miss it! What I like about the place is the many beer's they have on tap and the verity of taste. My favorite beer is the: Youngs double chocolate stouts with Wyder raspberry cider! It a mix that was made when I first went to this location. A waiter had brought it up to me and said no one has tried it before and I thought I'd give it a try and that turn out really good. This drink has stuck with me ever since. OH AND BTW they did add this mix onto the menu but they put a framboise in the mix instead of the Wyder that does make a price difference since the framboise is more they don't do it in the half yard. So if you want the drink in a half yard I suggest getting what I get.  It is pretty bomb because its strong and then gets light and fruity!Food wise: I like the truffle fries and the mac and cheese but mac and cheese can be a bit greasy once it cools off. The slides are good here esp the seared ahi. Pizza is awesome! Lunch is also very good the and there is a good amount for lunch. Service is fast and friendly although on some nights it can get super packed. The wait can be up to 1 hour and 30 min if you dont arrive early enough. You can go up to the bar and you wait so its not a big deal. Day time it is pretty chill and not too loud but at night it gets a bit loud with so many people there. Parking is pretty easy to find. I do recommend this place if you like beer and esp during happy hour time!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany T.
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to order because there were so many things on the menu. I ended up getting a pepper jack burger with fries. It was delicious and the service was attentive too.

Reviews.Author: Wai P.
Reviews.Content: Happy hour half price appetizer menu is awesome here ..starts around 4pm I think. Staffs are a bit slow. They have extensive list of beer especially their own brews. ..  Truffle fries and chicken lettuce wrap here is pretty good. Wait can be quite awhile on Fridays and weekends. Parking. In Santana Rows is a pain though. Music is rather loud for group chat.

Reviews.Author: Jennae H.
Reviews.Content: I've tried the Yard House in Roseville, San Diego, and Hawai'i. The food and beverages are delish, but the main reason I'm writing a review is because of our server, Robin -- she was AMAZING. The restaurant was super busy, but she was efficient, attentive, and very personable. If I'm in the area again, I'll definitely request her section. Plus, we share the same DOB. Hooray for Leo's! ;)

Reviews.Author: Alex H.
Reviews.Content: We had a good time here.  It was a little loud for us, but it was a pretty hoping place for young 20-40's to hang out.  Its a modern sports bar/brewery.  Its very fun and energetic.  Its the place to hang out for an hour after work but not the place for the family.  The food portions were huge.  We got the sliders and the California roll as an appetizer and those ended up being our meals cause they were so big.  The roll was as big as our plate.  We also got the eggs and the flat bread snacks and those were really good too.  The martinis and cosmos were pretty awesome.  Fun place to hang out with a few friends, just talk loudly.

Reviews.Author: Shannon L.
