Reviews.Content: If it's Saturday night,...-last call for food is 11pm-last call for alcohol is 11:20pm-restaurant closes promptly at 12amBe adventurous and try one of their unique blends!  Priced at $6-8, there's usually something for everyone.  For me, that drink was the Rose Gaarden which was Hoegaarden and Lindeman's Framboise (raspberry).The space is huge and I don't know if this is how it always is but it's opening seating so you'll have to walk around to grab something.  Even though it was opening night, we were able to find a booth in the back because it was near closing.  Most of the booths can fit about 8 max so if you have more, you'll probably have to put some 4-tops together.I didn't get this last night but I remember liking the calamari.  Food is diverse in that it's like a Cheesecake Factory and the environment is like a BJ's.

Reviews.Author: jenn w.
Reviews.Content: I am in love with the Yard House.  I want to keep my review simple, so these make me happy:-House Honey Blonde-Blue Crab Cakes-Seared Ahi Tuna-Happy hour & excellent service

Reviews.Author: Thien N.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a friday night for dinnner...Thumbs down for the whole "open-seating" idea.  Even though it didn't take too long to find a table (kuz i was like a hawk) I didn't like people wandering around or people hanging around the bar putting their butt in our faces.  Atmosphere was lively, but wayyy too loud.  Loud music + loud chit chat + loud clankity clank of the bar = ME GOING DEAF.  Not a place to go if you really wanted to have a conversation or reach an epiphany. Service was really good, surprisingly...despite a packed house, our waiter was able to get all the food quickly and made sure we had everything we needed.Now for the food reviews:Traditional sliders:  Delicious! The meat was moist and fries were addicting.  They could use a little less bun in the buns though.(Mac + Cheese):  Hmm, not the best even though it's over-loaded with chicken and bacon.  But TOTAL comfort food.Fried Calamari:  Skip it.  Plain and over cooked.Lobster and Crab dip:  Couldn't really taste the lobster...or the crab.  Tasty pretty much like a cheesy dip.

Reviews.Author: Ren L.
Reviews.Content: Wow, I learned my lesson here:  Do not come to a place when it just opened a week ago.  Don't come here on a Friday.  Don't come here on a Friday night.  Don't come here on a Friday night during playoffs.  Don't come here on a Friday night with the local team involved in a playoff game (GO SHARKS).My friend got here at 6:15pm and was told to wait in line (because the reservation system was not set up yet, yikes).  Apparently at the end of the line was a list.  The list was to get a pager.  Hang on a second.  There was a waiting list to get a pager.  Not a list of people to get a seat, but a pager.  Hmm.  That was about ONE hour.   So, after receiving the pager, my friend went to the bar for a drink and waited. Once you get the pager, we waited at least TWO hours before it ringed, which meant that we had to deliver the pager to the hostess in order to get the table.  Now, this part is very important.  In our case, there were at least a hundred people (or at least two or three hundred) between the bar and the front door, which seemed about 10 half-yard glasses in length.   Since we weren't able to get through the crowded set of people within the span of about 3-5 minutes (their minds were all focused on the game), we lost our table. :(  So the hostesses move our name back to the bottom of the queue list and we had to wait at least ANOTHER hour.  And by the time this mistake occured, even more people decide to come in and put the place in full capacity, just as the Sharks tied the game and had it going into OT.  It didn't help that there were patrons who were visibly holding up the seats so they could watch the end of the game.  (By this point, I couldn't care who won, I just wanted to sit down).Luckily, the Sharks won quickly in OT (GO SHARKS), so a lot of people started to leave.  With this in mind, we were finally able to sit down, which was around 10-10:15pm.  So yes, for a table of 4-5 people, it was a FOUR hour wait.  Awesome. :(The last time I went to a Yard House was in Rancho Mirage a while back.  So, I expected the menu to be somewhat similar.  I grabbed an order of the Spicy Tuna (FIST) roll and a Half Yard of Greatness.  Was it delicious?  Yes, yes it was.  Was it worth waiting four hours?  God, NO.I'll wait a couple of months for the trend to die down, before I give it a second try.  Even then, I know better than to come here on a Friday night with the local team involved in a playoff game (GO SHARKS).P.S. Navid, our server, was a pretty cool guy.  I tipped him extra because he was nice.  Also, the manager comp'd us for one of our entrees since we waited a long ass time.  +1 star for the brilliant service on such a busy night.

Reviews.Author: Hanna Y.
Reviews.Content: Crazy busy, uppity crowd, classy, long beer glasses to help ensure beer easily pours into your throat like sticking a hose down your esophagus, friendly wait staff, large bar, countless tv screens showing various games going on, fresh, scrumptious, asian fusion dishes.  The ahi tuna tartare was however, a miss. Love sesame oil but not that much.  It shouldn't taste oily.  You better make your reservations early.  The person in our group made reservations for 4:30 I believe, and we were not seated until 6.  Be wise and nice.  There were lines out the door of people waiting to get in.  It located towards the beginning part of Santana Row across from Crate & Barrels.Tab - damage wasn't too bad considering we were a group of 7 people.  Was about $20 per person and we ordered a good amount of food and beer.  Fun place and comfy. Strongly recommended for happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Leeann C.
Reviews.Content: I've been here exclusively for the Happy Hour menu, and while eating a large meal at 10pm isn't really ideal, I'd totally do it on a regular basis. Among the 5 of us, we ordered (and devoured): truffle fries, nachos, Hawaiian poke stack, Chinese garlic noodles, and a pepperoni & mushroom pizza. Top it off with a beer (or two) from their extensive menu, and you've got yourself a happy hour that's hard to beat.-L.

Reviews.Author: Ee Vonn Y.
Reviews.Content: I have to thank Yard House for introducing me to the world of beer as before Yard House existed, beer was a nasty thing of liquid for people with no taste (you can tell I've been around). The acquired taste for beer was made possible by the Timmermans Strawberry, which is almost literally strawberry soda. For any girl who hates beer and is feeling pressured from their guy buddies to just have something, this sweet beer will make you smile. From that point on, their beer selection became a treasure trove. One time that I ordered their snake bite which looked nothing like it but tasted everything like it.There are never any seats at the bar. For some reason, the bar is a great spot to people watch because you get a wide variety of people--college grads and fancy white collar groupies chat together and everyone here is actually really friendly. Overall, the wait time sucks but the atmosphere makes your patience worthwhile.I really didn't like any food item I ever ordered here. No matter how much or little I ate, I still felt like my small intestine was going to erupt. On three separate visits, I ordered half the amount of food I did the previous time with each event bringing much closer to gastroesophageal reflux. Eating one slider was a buffet in itself. Eating one slice of pizza was almost vomit-inducing. Eating 3 onion rings was overkill. There's something I'm not doing right. Last tip: The happy hour makes this fancy place comparable to a dinner at a family chain restaurant. Otherwise, prepare to take out another loan.

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
Reviews.Content: HOT DAMN!  can I say that on here?What has become of my Santana Row!  It's a crazy house over there these days!  I was waiting anxiously for the opening of this Yard House.  Little did I know so was EVERYONE else in the vicinity!My first attempt here I said "forget it!" because the wait would be over 2 hrs?!?!  As is common knowledge, if you go on "off" hours there really isn't a wait.  And so I did.  I had a fair time here.Service was decent.  Can't complain, it was very standard.  They are just too busy in there.Food was fair. Nothing really stuck out to me.  I did enjoy the garlic noodles my friend ordered.  Beer Selection AMAZING!  I guess that's what really puts the kicker in it.However, it is the company you keep and if you go with a group of friends for laughs, alcohol and fun times!  it is well worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Lisa T.
Reviews.Content: Great food selection!  Service was good and quick considering how busy it was.  Boyfriend took me here for a drinking date.  A ton of beers to choose from!  We settled on the Black & Tan (Bass Ale and Guinness Stout).  We then got Bitter Monk (Stone India Pale Ale and Leffe Blond)...way too bitter for me and I'm the type who loves bitter tea and bitter melon, OK.  I forgot the other drinks we had in between, but they were enjoyable.   Before the kitchen closed, we ordered some guacamole with chips and a mini chocolate souffle.  The guacamole+chips was such a small portion for $5.  A small scoop of guac and a grab of chips only enough for one person, yikes!  The chocolate souffle was more like soft chocolate cake with ice cream on top.  They should've put it to the side instead of pressing it onto a supposedly moist, fluffy souffle.  Otherwise, the taste was almost legit.I will definitely be back for the ales and more food!  I just love the atmosphere and location!

Reviews.Author: Gary J.
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the servers (Krystyna) did a good job and deserves 4 stars. The let down is in quality of the food and noise level. There is no doubt this is a sports bar and I get that; but, try and at least get the food hot and somewhat tasty. The Cuban Pork sandwich was nothing special and lacked "Cuban." There was nothing Cuban about this sandwich. A half sandwich and tortilla soup is higher in price than the whole sandwich and fries; go figure. The soup was cold. My partner Bob had the clam chowder and it was the same price as a glass of ice tea; go figure at $2.95.   $36 for lunch and we had a half sandwich, two soups, a lunch size tuna salad and two ice tea.Do not plan on having a conversation as the noise level is something less than being near the launch of the Space Shuttle. I can see where Yard House is popular with young adults and kids; but, for us seniors I recommend something a little less corporate and trendy.

Reviews.Author: Grace K.
Reviews.Content: I recently visited home and went to go meet up with a former coworker - she was talking about this new place on Santana Row and I thought...sure why not?  She loves food and she has good judgment on what's good so I went with it.  As we were approaching the restaurant I really liked the look from the outside.  Walking in I liked it even more because it was so open and there was so much space - I felt as if I was in Texas because everything is big and has a lot of space! (unlike Cali everything's small and cramped).I was overwhelmed with the menu because I felt as if I was looking at a Cheesecake Factory menu - WAY too much to choose from and it'd take me at least 15minutes to look through it - I didn't even know where to begin.  Good thing my friend knew what to suggest to me and I definitely wasn't disappointed with her choice.  She suggested the Classic Cheese burger and it was amazinggg!  Loved the roasted garlic aioli and omg, it was so huge I could barely take a bite of the full sandwich!  Loved the fries as well and they gave me so much of it that I couldn't finish..and I usually finish ALL my fries!Good thing we didn't order an appetizer because we were going to since it was my first time there...I could barely finish HALF of my burger and I had to take the other half home...

Reviews.Author: Leslie H.
Reviews.Content: Review for happy hour ONLY. The beer selection is expansive and comprehensive and the half off appetizers are a pretty good deal. I enjoyed the beer and food that I ordered. The portion sizes for the half off appetizers were very generous. The draft pints were about $4.25 each. The service, however, left something to be desired. Considering the fact that we arrived at 3:15 when the restaurant was half empty, it took WAY too long for our drinks to arrive. We were presented with menus immediately, but it took 10 minutes for a server to come around to check IDs and take orders. Also, the beers took at least another 10 minutes while my fried food appetizers took another 10 minutes! I can understand the delay when there are people waiting 30 minutes for a table, but now when the restaurant is experiencing a slump in business. Service was rather unobtrusive, and by that, I mean that we were never really visited to be asked about service. None of this really bothered me because we weren't in much of a hurry, taking about 2 hours to finish off 2 pints each, but I would be annoyed with this pace of service if I had waited more than 30 minutes to be seated.I will return for happy hour, between 3 and 6pm on weekdays, but probably not during peak hours. And, oh yes, if you like lots of variety and selection in your beers and a sports bar vibe, this place is for you!

Reviews.Author: Leigh R.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5:30pm on a Sunday night - gladly we only waited 20 minutes for our table.Environment: loud and dark. Lots of TV screens which is nice.Food: major disappointment.Blue crab cakes were nothing special. You only get 2 pieces per order, FYI.The lobster garlic noodles were super salty. Didn't taste any other flavors but the salt.The truffle fries were good, I liked how they were cut thin (shoestring style) with parmesan cheese on top.Southern belle was OK, nothing different. I've had better (Pimms).Dessert was very disappointing. The chocolate souffle was *not* a souffle. It sounded fishy to us too because usually if you want souffle you have to order it right at the beginning when you arrive because it takes awhile to bake. I should've trusted my gut instinct :P The texture was like that of a lava cake. It was a total letdown (we were expecting light, fluffy souffle).The banana creme brulee was OK, I didn't like the hard layer of chocolate on the bottom. AND the top was not crackly because they put bananas on top. They should just stick to a classic creme brulee without attempting all the fusion stuff - that'd be much better.Bottom line: don't think I'd come back again. Mediocre food @ expensive prices. Just like the rest of the restaurants on Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: Starting off was a little annoying. We got in there and there was a 15-20 minute wait (no problem), 20 minutes goes by and our buzzer goes off, we go up to the counter to wait another 5 minutes for the hostess to give a table away and then get to us, we follow our hostess to the table that has just been given away, go back, get a new table. It was just sort of annoying, that bit. Everything else was wonderful! All the food was yummy, mixed drinks were very good and sooo many beers to choose from! Plus, our waitress really turned the evening around. She was super nice, made good suggestions and was very prompt. I'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Phoebe T.
Reviews.Content: After being told numerous of times that I have to go here for happy hour, I finally had a chance to go!***This review is strictly based on their happy hour.***Last Friday, I decided to schedule a "happy hour lunch date", with my boyfriend and my two girlfriends. Let me start off by saying that the inside is pretty huge. If you look up right towards the bar, you can see different tubes connecting from the kegs to the bar. That was pretty awesome.Anywho, lets talk food and drink. I'm not much of a beer drinker but I ordered the "Timmerman's Strawberry", which tastes like a carbonated strawberry soda only except it made my cheeks turn a little pink (yes, I am lightweight when it comes to alcohol). For food, I had ordered the chicken nachos which was SUPER HUGE! The chips weren't that great, it was actually a bit oily and tasted a little stale. The toppings on the nachos were typical: beans, cheese, tomatoes, onions, guacamole, sour cream. If you come with a group of 4, I would say to only get one order of that to share. I had also ordered the "Truffle Fries", since before I came here I checked on Yelp to see what I should try and what the hype was all about; these fries reminded me of the garlic fries you would get at the carnival. The potatoes were pretty much dried out and seasoned with garlic powder, salt and some green herb. Nothing really memorable.Last but not least (don't judge me, I was sharing all of these with my boyfriend), I had ordered the "Classic Mini Sliders", which consists of 4 mini sliders & a small regular fries on the side. These mini sliders were decent, they kind of reminded me of the sliders you would get at Burger King. Overall, I spent $46 (tips not included) and gave this place a 3 star. Food is mediocre, the service was good, and there was a large selection for beverages. I recommend to anyone who goes here to go only during happy hour and EARLY. The restaurant started getting packed at 4pm (an hour into hour happy) & a line starts forming outside the place.

Reviews.Author: Lynn C.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was because our party ate at another place.  Perhaps it was because my friends went at 7 and we came back at 10:30 to get our table, just in the nick of time.  3.5 hours for a table?  YEESH.  To be fair, we were a party of 7 and squeezing in a party of that size is difficult, especially on a Friday night.I love the ambiance of Yard House(s) and this one is no different.  It's HUGE (hard to believe it can still be that crowded) and pretty hip.  I'm no beer drinker but I can sip some light fruity beers and be happy.  The truffle fries ARE AMAZING.  I could eat five plates of it.  I even dared a friend to lick the plate...which he pretty much did.  THAT GOOD.  BTW, the yard long glass fits 2.5 glasses of beer.  We measured.  With water.  I don't think our waitress was too pleased with our scientific endeavor for the truth.The waitress was pleasant, the service was quick.  If the wait wasn't so long, I would come more often!

Reviews.Author: Raizel G.
Reviews.Content: Went here for my friend's 21st. We waited forever, even though it didn't seem THAT crowded. We asked how much longer we had to wait and the hostess told us there were only 2 groups ahead of us. Forty minutes later someone approached us to say the buzzers were not working and that they had open tables. They had like 4 big open tables, and we were just waiting there! That was annoying.If you are into beer or trying different kinds of drinks, go here. They have TONS of things to try. Some recommendations: Timmermans Strawberry, Pear Cider, Belgian Shandy. The drinks were good for the most part. The appetizers were great. Definitely get the Truffle Fries! We got nachos and onion rings also, which were nothing special in my opinion. The food was just average.Our waitress was very nice and made our experience enjoyable despite the bad start. She even brought my friend a birthday dessert.

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: Time to write another update!  $6 house martinis--decent sized selection on the corresponding left page.  I tried the watermelon; it was strong!  Pretty icy tasting.  Southern punch was also good, tasted like punch, simple punch.  Lemon drop was classic, the rims were okay.  I am not entirely enamored by the drink selection here because I am NOT a fan of beer!  As of now.Love/ Like everything else about this restaurant though... it's nice when you get those giant booths for just 2 people!  The extreme benefits of coming during non-rush hours aka HAPPY hours. Oh Jolly.

Reviews.Author: Sally H.
Reviews.Content: Half yard during happy hour + half off pizzas and appetizers = BOMB!The service is great and the food comes out pretty fast. Plus, what can go wrong with food + alcohol? :)

Reviews.Author: Shirley M.
Reviews.Content: Ok trendy place, always packed! the wait is amazing... you go there put your name down, after an hour or two you then get a buzzer which then takes another hour. So its about a 3 hour wait... Drinks are average as in any other place. Ambiance is packed its nice, but you can't really hear conversations because its loud. Not a place to go wine and dine on a weekend and expect to hold a conversation.Food, is great, the truffle mac & cheese is to die for. Salads are excellent, i'd come here for lunch time. The one star is for long wait, and loudness. I have been here twice and never coming back unless its for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Sheena T.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this location twice, and I'd say Yard House is pretty good - a little over-hyped, but the drinks and appetizers (especially during happy hour) are pretty satiating and there's a good spread.First time I went here was with D and V during happy hour, we ordered the Mahi tuna, calimari, spicy thai pizza, and a vegan dish that I forgot the name of. As for drinks, I got the same as V, a snakebite, and I couldn't finish it! Judging from that experience and a few before, I'm not a beer person, despite the fact that it was Harp with pear cider. V had to finish up the snakebite for me. Thanks, V!The second time, I went with R and K, and it unfortunately wasn't during happy hour - it was a little pricier, but I was in good company so I didn't mind too much. We had the original sliders (pretty tasty and savory), artichoke dip, truffle fries, and nachos. Thank goodness Sunday was my cheat day because I'm pretty sure I consumed more than my daily allotted calorie intake from this meal! As for drinks, I went with the raspberry cider, and I think it's the only alcoholic drink that I'll ever drink. It tasted like another version of Martinelli's apple cider, except with alcohol and raspberry flavored. I could barely taste the alcohol in it.  I managed to finish with no problems.I would definitely come back here with friends, but perhaps during happy hour because it'd be more wallet-friendly.

Reviews.Author: Kathy Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is so crowded!!! I can't get over how packed this place gets even on a Wednesday night! I guess people like their wasted Wednesdays even more with great happy hour deals. I also hear they have beer floats! Whaaaaat?! I will be back.Music is pretty loud, it's pretty hard to meet new people and have a smooth conversation without missing a few words here and there.

Reviews.Author: Mary T.
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely a beer kinda girl... so when i heard they have this big ass glass called HALF YARDS on HAPPY HOUR.. i drove my happy butt over there.I love how they let you taste the beer before you order.And the variety of beers they have.......... =]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]Got me smiling for days.I never tried REAL food here so i have nothing to say about that.

Reviews.Author: Jenn L.
Reviews.Content: OMG this place gets packed during big games.  Like, 1.5 hour+ wait time.....and we got there at 5:30pm.  It's not a bad place to watch the games because there are screens EVERYWHERE. but they don't have the SOUND on, and I like hearing the commentary.  Their pizzas are good, but the food is definitely not cheap.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla O.
Reviews.Content: I come here a lot. -_-;;If I'm not grabbing coffee with a friend, Yard House is my go-to to grab drinks with a friend. I think in the month of May, I avged coming here like 10+ times. wut. who does that. & I still only give it 3 stars. :P That's cuz I only think this place is worth it for happy hour.Yard House w. Happy Hour = 4 StarsYard House = 3 StarsI LOVE their truffle fries. I get them every time I come here. (so yeah, 10+times in may = 10+ servings of truffle fries...ohhh..my.)My usual order = Truffle Fries, BBQ chicken pizza, & a pear cider. Freaking awesome.Their entrees. eh. wouldn't prefer it.But regardless of their lackluster entrees. 3.50 for a pint of pear cider during happy hour & truffle fries keep me coming back.

Reviews.Author: Margo G.
Reviews.Content: I have been avoiding this place because of all the hype and the talk of 2-3 hour wait. My friend wanted to go here for weekday lunch and it was the perfect time to go. Plenty of seats available. What I didn't like was that when we walked in, no one acknowledged us. There where 3 ladies at the front, one of them was helping some customers and the other two just looked down at their computer of whatever is under the glass top table. Is it so hard to ask for a "Be right with you" or "She'll help you in a sec"? At least look up and smile when people walk in. What is wrong with customer service?Once we got someone to walk us to our table, they were super nice! Our server was great and gave us tons of suggestions. We sat at the pub style tables. The place is nice, much bigger than I expected. Steely decor with black accents and colorful paintings. I was surprised how many people drink during lunch. Hee. Anyways, the food was average, nothing to write home about. We got the truffle fries to share and I ordered the blue crab cake hoagie with a side salad. My friend ordered the full hoagie. The weird thing was when he asked if it came with a salad, he was told that it would be an additional charge. Why couldn't he just swap the fries for a salad? I don't think salad costs any more than fries does it? And why weren't we told that a sandwich comes with fries when we ordered the sandwich? We had an overload of fries. I think servers should be able to let people know. The truffle fries were indeed good with some slivers of what I think was Parmesan cheese. The hoagie was ok. The lunch portion only has one crab cake which wasn't that big or moist but had good flavor. It didn't have enough bacon, avocado, swiss, or tomato, and you could barely taste the cajun aïoli. I would go back to try other stuff but definitely not for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Karen H.
Reviews.Content: Tried this place for the first time ever on New Years with my family and loved it!Positives:-Luckily we arrived around 4pm and there was miraculously no wait!-The server was super friendly-portions are huge-decent prices-fries are delicious!Negatives:-The four cheese pizza leaves a lot to be desired...Prices are pretty similar to cheesecake factory, but this place has a lot more alcohol! I am definitely looking forward to coming again!

Reviews.Author: Margaret T.
Reviews.Content: I came here early around 5:30pm on a Saturday to put my name down for a table for 6.  Expecting a 3 hour wait, it actually was only 1.5 hours.  Not too shabby I guess.  Considering this location is at Santana Row, it would be really useful if the pagers worked further than a block so you could at least make it all with way to Ben & Jerry's.Before coming here, I was stoked to drink their Rogue Hazelnut beer.  They were out.  Major major bummer.  So I tried going for the beer sampler anyway.  There were only two pre-selected options.  Wait, so you have dozens and hundreds of beer options and you don't let us choose our own sampler?  Isn't that the point of having so many options?  So you can taste all of them?  I had been to a similar brewery in Seattle with over 160 beers on tap and the sampler was THE BEST because you were able to customize your entire sampler.  Their excuse was that it would take too long to customize each sampler but hey, if Tap House can do it, you should be able to too.The food was decent.  Nothing special.  I had heard it was way better than BJ's but not really. The presentation was nice and the appetizers were actually really good so maybe I just made a bad entree selection with the Teriyaki burger (or whatever it was with the pineapple).  Despite all this, I know I'll be back, maybe not for a date night cuz the wait just isn't worth it but  I mean, it's Santana Row, it has tons of beer selections, and is a great place for big groups.

Reviews.Author: Emily G.
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly tasty food: 5 starsVery high prices for a beer place/drinking spot: 3 starsService: 0 stars, truly terribleFrom what I hear from friends and fellow Yelpers, this seems to be the norm, so i doubt my night was far from different.We were a group of about 6 people on a Wednesday night, 9pm- so not even dinner time, not a weekend, and not happy hour. Still though, our server made a point to card everyone (even the very obvious over-30 ones that ALREADY had a cocktail from the bar) and then kept pushing for our orders even though we hadn't even seen the menu yet. He then proceeded to forget our orders, take over 30mins to bring us a drink order or completely forget to bring anything at all. He took our orders, but it was other wait-staff that brough it to us, and they often did not know who ordered it, or they did not even ask and just put it in the middle of the table - such a rude thing to do.There is a ray of hope though: the food. The garlic noodles were surprisingly delicious and had tons of veggies, flavor and texture. The mac and cheese was very fancy and had tons of wild mushrooms and truffle oil- a very different take from what you expect mac and cheese to be. The drinks were delicious and very well prepared. Finally, the chocolate fondue with ice-cream was light and fluffy, but rich in flavor and with a gooey/creamy center. Absolutely delicious.We ordered TONS of beer, drinks and food and stayed there for a while, enjoying the atmosphere and each other's company. The bad service is extremely evident and definitely puts a big damper on our night (and his tips), but I think if Yard House turns this around, it has the potential to be a million times better.I hope you're reading, Yard House!!

Reviews.Author: Jesse K.
Reviews.Content: This place takes the cake.  The food is amazing, the beer selection is among the best around and the ambience is pretty cool too.Avoid peak hours unless you don't mind waiting - Friday and Saturday night's I'm told this place is transformed into a nightclub with lines around the block.  Great for lunch or an early dinner.My favorite dish thus far has to be the tortilla soup.  It has tons of flavor and is creamier than a traditional tortilla soup - definitely worth trying out.  Their burgers are quite tasty too and go well with a pint of your favorite brew.  Speaking of brews, try out the "six-pack", it's basically a beer sampler composed various selections and a great way to discover some new beers.Give this place a shot, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Magda M.
Reviews.Content: I was here on a Thursday night right before 6 pm. We were lucky and snagged a table before the wait got to be ridiculous. I got an order of wings, which for half price at happy hour is a reasonable deal. They were OK but I have had better wings before. I definitely would not be happy with them at full price. I got a honey golden beer in the half yard and enjoyed it. For some reason though, I'm not convinced to give this place 4 stars. I think it's the price and crowded-ness that makes me hesitate. Sure, I'll be back because it's energetic and a hot spot right now... but overall, not incredibly wowed.

Reviews.Author: Thomas N.
Reviews.Content: So it's about time I reviewed this place after visiting it so many times.  With an accumulated wait time of like 10,000+ hours after countless trips (and waits), I have tried a good amount of food and beer at multiple Yard House locations (SJ, Hawaii and LA).The GREAT: Obviously it is the beer.  I love the selection of beers here.  There are soooo many types and brands, plus they rotate with the season.  As a lover of beer, this is heaven for me.  If I rated Yard House on beer alone, it would be 5+ stars hands down.The good: So the majority of the food I have tried here is pretty good.  My favorite item is the Chopped Salad.  Order it, trust me.  The presentation of the salad, especially with the way the prep the avocado is breath-taking food porn status.  A couple of other pretty good dishes that I would get without hesitation: Hawaiian Poke Stack, Lettuce Wraps, Grilled Korean Beef, Fire Cracker Ribs (GOOOD!), Chicken Nachos (BIG!), Maui Chicken, Orange Peel Chicken, Bearnaise Sliders and St. Louis Ribs.  Definitely the 4-5 star status!The so-so's (a new band name!): For me, there are two dishes that really are off putting.  I apologize in advance if I offend anyone who likes these dishes, but the Mac + Cheese and the Garlic Noodles are a little too much.  For someone who eats a lot of damn food at a lot of damn places, I know when a cook or a recipe is way too heavy handed.  The Mac + Cheese is heavy, greasy and too hard to finish.  The same goes to the Garlic Noodles.  The flavor of garlic is heavy, which I don't mind, but the amount of oil in the dish is too much.  These two dishes are not the business.Overall, Yard House is damn good and I love going here for the beerrsssss.

Reviews.Author: Chris O.
Reviews.Content: I'd say this place is under rated. The food was very good, they even made a good french dip which is damn rare these days (I should say damn dry and well done which is normally what you get when you order them). The salad was good as were the truffle fries. The service was quite attentive and friendly and overall I really like the spacious, clean, modern atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Hilary L.
Reviews.Content: Was there with a large party. We had two tables and three dedicated servers. Food was great. Drink service a little slow but very friendly waitstaff. Will definitely be back on my next trip to San Jose.

Reviews.Author: Po L.
Reviews.Content: everytime i've been here after my first bad experience, the service has been consistently bad.i dont know how they are training their servers, but they are super rude and they just disappear on you after awhile! i get it, im young and i come during happy hour for the specials, but it doesn't mean i wont tip well. i am not just every other bad asian tipper damnit!if it wasn't for the half yardies.........

Reviews.Author: Jesse W.
Reviews.Content: I've been to other Yard House locations in California so I was pretty excited when I heard they were opening one in the Bay Area. It's been open for around 2 weeks now so I haven't had the opportunity to visit multiple times yet. I'll write a bit about my initial thoughts and hopefully update my review later on.I dropped by on the first Saturday night they were officially open. It was about 10:30-11pm and still fairly crowded probably due to grand opening buzz. There was a bit of a line outside but I think it was more for ID checking rather than waiting. In fact we didn't even have to wait at all,a s once we got inside a hostess offered to take us to an open table. However, when she arrived at the "open" table there were people just being seated there. She looked confused and then said we can wait for the party in the next booth to leave, and they looked like they were about to pack up and go so we said ok. She told us we could sit at a table to wait and we did that. After maybe 5 minutes those people did leave, but no waiter came by to move us into the booth. We flagged one down and he said he didn't know if we could do that since it wasn't his section. He then asked another waitress who also shrugged her shoulders. It seemed like they both didn't know what to do so they decided to just ignore us. After a few more minutes we asked again and he said he could do it but if anybody asked to not say it was his idea. Great...Our server eventually showed up and I asked her for recommendation on some menu items. It seemed like either she couldn't hear me well or she didn't know what I was talking about until I pointed specifically to the menu. Her descriptions also weren't very helpful and she used really vague words. I asked about one of the beers they had and she just used the keywords that were printed on the menu for that type of beer. I understand that they have 130+ beers on tap so she probably hadn't had a chance to try everything yet, but I do remember at all my previous trips to Yard House the waiters were more than helpful recommending something new for me to try. I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt right now that my above complaints are due to the freshman staff. With time I'm hoping they'll have a smoother operation running. I also wished they were open past 12am but around these parts that's pretty impossible to find.

Reviews.Author: Shreya G.
Reviews.Content: I had been waiting to try Yard House for a while, and I finally got the opportunity to do so today, for lunch. I went straight to the lunch menu, picked out some really good clam chowder (New England) and a margherita (or however you spell it) pizza. Normally, I can't finish my food at the restaurant but I was able to do so, and the food didn't feel heavy in my stomach. This was surprising, because I had pizza AND soup. I like places where I can get a perfectly filling lunch! Then I won't feel sluggish when I'm shopping. To simplify, it's a more upscale, far less family oriented place to get food than a place like BJ's. Yard House reminded me a lot about BJ's but of course, Yard House is much fancier and the focus is on the bar. While I don't find it to be the most amazing restaurant I've ever been to, it's definitely a nice place, and I plan to come back and try the happy hour food. The service is good too, especially for lunch on a weekday. There were a lot of people, and those who needed to get back to the workplace could do so in a timely manner, because there were the right number of people working. It's a pretty loud restaurant.I wish all their tvs weren't playing the same ESPN channel the whole time, that's kinda boring...

Reviews.Author: three's company M.
Reviews.Content: I had lunch here with a friend a few weeks ago.  We were surprised that we only had to wait 10 minutes as it was newly opened.We had a nice seat in the bar area and were served quickly.  We shared both our dishes - we got a Hawaiian burger and a BBQ Ranch salad.  They were both really good.  The hawaiian burger was not cooked to my preference, but the flavors were good - the combo of pineapple and beef makes it feel a lot juicier.  We both loved the salad, but wished we would have ordered the dressing on the side.  Overall, pretty good....but might eat somewhere else if hanging out at Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Pornsakdi T.
Reviews.Content: So everyone went crazy for this place once they opened.  Being a so-cal native, I had been to a few different yard houses down south.  Food is typically decent and they have a ton of beer on tap.  Unfortunately, the San Jose location was awful.  My friend and I went around 4:30 on Saturday and sat at the bar.  The bar was not busy, and the bartenders were just putting away glasses, chatting amongst each other, and drinking water.  Not a single bartender came to greet us, ask us if we wanted a drink etc.  After 5 minutes I was literally just interested to see around when someone would come talk to us.  After almost 10 minutes my friend finally waived down one of the bartenders and said we haven't been helped yet.  At this point, I'm so annoyed with the awful service that I just want to drink my beer and leave.  I finish my drink maybe 5 minutes before my friend.  No one came to ask if I wanted another drink or if there was anything else.  Really, if you work in the restaurant industry, its your job to to be nice and serve people (especially if you're a bartender).  I've worked in the restaurant industry, so I know its not that difficult to greet patrons and not make them feel unwelcomed.  Now, I do understand if they were swamped and really busy or if there was just one bartender.  But they were not busy, and there were at least 3-4 bartenders at work.  Bad service at restaurants/bars is just one of my biggest pet peeves, which is why this place is a no-go for me.

Reviews.Author: Chels S.
Reviews.Content: Super good drinks here! But the food is disappointing and over priced. We had an appetizer, pasta dish and a steak dish. 2 glasses of wine, 1/2 yard and a pint of beer and it cost us $140 for a Tuesday night dinner I think that's a tad much buuuut I supposed that's what you get for the awesome vibes of this place and all the T.V's are awesome!

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: You've probably already heard that the wait is a couple hours long. Well, it's true. Thankfully, cousins of mine got there at 3:15PM on a Thursday for Happy Hour. I didn't arrive until about 4:30PM, and they had JUST gotten seated. (Apparently, other people who got there a few minutes later had to wait 3 hours for a table) It's all about TIMING PEOPLE!Drinks: Ruby Red Martini and Grape Escape Martini - Ruby Red was my perfect martini, plenty of alcohol and not watered down. Personally, I enjoy a bitter martini over a sugary one and this was ideal.-Grape Escape tasted like medicine. Blah. -HUGE selection on beer, had a couple sips from others and they were pretty good.Food: Appetizers (forgot the real name according to menu)-Chicken Nachos were generously proportioned and not soggy like other places.-Tradition Wings are so good! One of the best buffalo wings I've had in years! We had to order a second place since the wings disappeared immediately after it was set on our table.  -Hawaiian Poki? It had raw tuna - not my favorite appetizer but, I've tried quite a few Poki in my time. This was fresh and nicely seasoned. -Cabbage Wraps - if you order this, you should ask for more cabbage since there is a lot of meat vs. ratio of greens. -Spinach Dip - mouth watering pita chips, with lots of creamy dip. Yum! I really enjoyed this one.-Calamari was pretty mediocre compared to different places that serve this dish. It's a good appetizer to share, but this was nothing special. Our waiter was calm, regardless of the busy crowd and rowdiness. My throat started hurting after we left, since we had to yell across the table in order to have a conversation going. The atmosphere had a "drunken-college-frat party" feel to it. Overall, I would have given 5 stars but the prices and wait in line were things to take into consideration. Good experience, and definitely would come back... AFTER the hype falls down.

Reviews.Author: Rhia R.
Reviews.Content: This place is crack-a-lackin'! Reason being because it hasn't been opened for that long. But I have a feeling it will always be busy because it's one of the bigger bars within the Santana Row/Valley Fair area. Drove into the area from SF to reserve a table for 15 for a friend's birthday celebration. Yeah, it takes someone from out of the area (I have several friends in SJ) to hold down a table. Arriving early paid off and I got second on the list for the large parties. The wait would have been roughly an hour and a half. So I took a pager and went on my merry way to walk around the mall and the rest of The Row. Once a little more than half of our group was inside, I checked to see if something had already cleared up. We got a spot near the entrance, which was fine so anyone who came later could locate us right away. As for the food, it wasn't bad. I probably shouldn't have had high expectations to begin with since this place is more known for their beers than anything else. Such a ginormous selection that if you don't know what to drink, you'll need someone to help you out, be it a friend or one of the servers. Had pints of both Shock Top and Hoegaarden since this location didn't serve Abita Purple Haze (boo). Had a swiss burger and substituted the regular fries for truffle fries. Never had truffled anything, so I was really excited for these babies. I did like them, however, I felt that it was a tad too greasy for my taste. If I'm ever back here again, I'll probably order them as an appetizer to get a second opinion. But I'll try another item instead of a burger.My thoughts on Yard House? Definitely the place to go to if you're a beer lover. And not a bad place to hang out with a few friends, as bigger groups provide a long wait. If it's a game day, try  to arrive early because it's guaranteed to get crowded and incredibly noisy.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars because the wait here is RIDIC.During happy hour, its not too bad getting drinks but if you want food.. DON'T COME HUNGRY + Don't forget to come 2 hrs early! Great beer selection + bartenders are friendly, helpful and suggestive. Good happy hour deals, beers end up being around $4-6per pint, which is decent. I'd recommend the honey blonde, delish without being overpowering in tangy or sweet with the feeling that you're drinking a beer not a cider. After our second attempt of trying to eat here, we (a table for two) are finally seats after almost an hour and made it just in time to order from the HH food menu (50% OFF PIZZAS + 50% OFF SELECT APPETIZERS!!) FYI, can't order food if you're not seated. Wompwomp. So.. If your lovely bum ever gets to grace even the edge of a seat, I'd recommend:Turkey Sliders - Recommended by our waitress and yup.. winner, winner, turkey dinner! Juicy and petite sliders of 4 w/ baby tomatoes, cheese, and turkey patty. So simple, so good!Thai Chicken Pizza (something like that) - imagine a bbq chicken Vietnamese sandwich made into a pizza... that's EXACTLY what this tastes like, BOMB. Hearty cilantro, sweet, bbq-esque taste in every bite!+ Great for sports - Multiple flat screens playing different games+ Must have patiences+ Parking varies .. sometimes easy, sometimes a beezyreally depends on the occasion.

Reviews.Author: Melanie B.
Reviews.Content: Finally scored a table here twice without any wait! The crowd has definitely died down a bit. We ordered the New England clam chowder, garlic Chinese noodles with shitake mushrooms, chicken tenders (kid's meal), burger with avocadoes, and the parmesean and herbs truffle fries. 1/2 off on the appetizers for Happy Hour. Also, there's a good beer selection. I ordered the Honey Blonde Ale which was very refreshing after a long work day!

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: **Preface:  I'm not a huge fan of chain or expensive restaurants.  Nor am I a huge fan of eating at Santana Row.  I finally got a chance to experience the much hyped up Yard House.  Twice actually - both times during a late Saturday afternoon/early evening.  If you get here before the dinner crowd, the wait is actually bearable.  Bar seating is usually full, but if you wait a bit or circle around a few times, seats do open up.  For a table, the wait today at 4:30pm was about 15 minutes.  We decided to shop around SR for a bit and when we came back about 45 minutes later, the wait was about 30 to 45 minutes.  They do give you a buzzer for the wait.The atmosphere is actually pretty decent.  It has a subtle/trendy environment.  It's a nice spot to just eat/hang out with friends/family and doesn't have the super snooty feeling that you might get at other SR restaurants.  The bar area is pretty nice - it's right smack in the middle of the restaurant so the seats circle all the way around.  They do have a ton of beers on tap and that takes up the island at the bar.Prices are a tad on the high end here.  I believe most beers are $6/pint.  They also have half yards which are the long glasses of beer - that runs about $13.  It's actually 2 pints worth of beer, so they're basically making an extra buck from you for the novelty of having a gigantic glass.  As for food, the only things I saw that were "reasonably" priced were probably the appetizers and the soups.  Excluding those and appetizer salads, almost everything was above $10.  I have yet to eat a meal here, but have tried the sweet potato fries, truffle fries, and onion ring tower.  All 3 are fairly solid appetizers.  At first, the portions for the fries looked small, but they did last for awhile.  Portions are good for 2 or 3 moderate munchers.Service is OK - like most places, it really depends on which server you get.  I guess we must have been at YH for awhile as we went through 3 servers today - kept changing shifts.  I felt that one server neglected us a bit, but oh well.  Overall, this place is OK.  Pros:  Nice atmosphere and large beer selection.  Cons:  Super long waits during peak hours and the place is on the expensive side.

Reviews.Author: Brenda N.
Reviews.Content: This place has a lot of beers on tap.  If you are the type of person that gets giddy over beers, try the Eclipse.  It's about one part Blue Moon and one part Guinness.  Blue Moon is surprisingly more dense than Guinness so you get to see the separation of the two.  Awesome!  Asians (in general) seem to frequent this place so it's good for those with yellow fever.  Though, the crowd (also, in general) is fairly diverse.   And now, the FOOD! Appetizers: Seared Ahi Tuna: the sauce was a bit too rich for my taste.  Perhaps too much ginger.  Clam Chowder:  Best clam chowder I ever had.  Ok, maybe not as good as clam chowder from San Francisco, but I'm not complaining.  The clam to soup ratio was on target. Main Courses: Spicy Jambalaya:  If you like flavor, this dish has plenty of it.  It's a really rich dish so I recommend sharing with a few friends.  It's one of those dishes that is only good in small portions.  Kinda like how spam is good only with the first few bites.Ribeye with green beans and mashed potatoes:The green beans are the Italian kinds, cooked al dente.  The mashed potatoes were mashed potatoes, nothing special but prepared how I like my potatoes.  The ribeye came out juicy and tender.  Linguine with Clams in a spicy tomato sauce:  YUM.  Lots of clams, not too much noodles, and delicious sauce.  I had no leftovers from ordering this.  It was that good.  I've been to this place twice so far and both experiences were positive ones.  The waiters are very friendly and service is pretty cool too considering the volume of customers they get on a daily basis.

Reviews.Author: Sandy T.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Wait can be LONG if you came during the peak hours.  First Visit - Saturday night, check in at 7pm, didn't get seated until 9pm.Second Visit - Friday afternoon (Happy Hour) - 3:15pm, seated right away.Third Visit - Friday - check in at 5:25pm, seated by 6pm.  Nachos - GOOD! Tons with cheese, small bites of chicken.  Ahi Sliders - LOVE! Big pieces of ahi tuna slices and perfectly cookedTurkey Slider - BLAH~ (uhm..  skip it) It's a little dry ~ Truffle Fries - YUM ! Goes perfect with the beer.  (Ask truffle fries instead of the regular fries...it's worth it!  Jambalaya - LOVE! (you can get it with white/brown rice or pasta).  Two blacked prawns, spicy chicken andouille sausage, small pieces of crawfish, and peppers.  Nice and spicy~ Beer = ENDLESS!   Asked waiter/waitress for suggestions! I personally like the IPAs.  The half yard glasses are pretty cool, but a little awkward to drink out of it.  Services for my visits have all been good. Always checking to see if we needed water/beer or anything. Definitely try this place during the happy hour time - as the prices are better!

Reviews.Author: Julia L.
Reviews.Content: Truffle fries - 5 stars. Korean pork belly tacos - 2 stars (no flavor, huge amount of gristle, I almost broke my tooth).  If you come here, stick to the regular pub food - burgers and fries.

Reviews.Author: Matt V.
Reviews.Content: Now, this place get's REAL busy during happy hour, as it should.  But unlike Dave and Buster's *HINT HINT* the bartenders here are not assholes and actually take their time with patrons!  Wow...instead of hurrying people up, they let people have time to think?!  Who woulda known that this sorta philosophy would result in better service and bigger tips!My mom and I went during happy hour and the place was swamped.  1.5 hr wait for a table?  No thanks!  I'll take my chances with the bar.  Lucky for us, we found a corner that we were able to squeeze in and start ordering.  My mom wanted food but we needed to find a seat.  The bartender (I think his name was Mikey) was super helpful.  He even helped us find a seat!  My mom got the House Belgian and I got the Apricot wheat.  I wanted to try more but a half-yard on an empty stomach meant that I wouldn't be able to drive safely later (especially with the madre in the passenger seat!).  We ordered the Spicy Thai Chicken pizza and the calamari.  Good choices!  The Spicy Thai was slightly sweet and spicy...but not spicy enough for my taste.  The calamari was perfectly fried and came in a huge portion.  And at half off, I was ready to just roll around in the food.I love the atmosphere here.  People are just tryna have a good time and they are so friendly with one another.  The couple sitting next to us started plating my mom and I onion rings, which turned out to be my mom's favorite onion rings ever.  Overall, great place to go and have a good time with good company :)

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: It should be known for a very Happy Hour. Disclaimer: I've only been here for Happy Hour (day and night) and dinner on a Thursday night. I don't know how weekends or lunches go.Well, I'm glad the hype died down a little bit. When it first opened up, this place was rolling in crowds. It would take about an hour to get seated, but now I can walk in right when Happy Hour starts and get a table. They have a similar seating system to BJ's, but there's plenty of space and a huge bar right in the middle. The venue is low lit, almost like you're eating in a Hollister clothing store, but gradually lightens up the closer to closing.Happy Hour (M-F 3-6pm; Sun-W 10-C) consists of select appetizers and all pizzas for half off, and about $4 for their crafts and imports, $3.50 for domestics, well drinks under $5, and half yards for between $7 and $10--among other things. Let me just say, you can never go wrong with their appetizers. Their Chicken Nachos plate is ridiculously huge and can accommodate 2-4 people probably, but then again you have smaller plates like fried calamari. But everything is pretty much good on their chosen selections. Chicken Lettuce Wraps are huge, hella wings, and a good amount of onion rings on the tower. Their pizzas are medium sized but are built mainly for one person. It'll look like a lot, but that thing can fill up, trust!And if you want fries, Truffle Fries are your calling.Drink-wise, they have a mighty fine selection of beers on tap, neatly organized on their front few pages of the menu. Most people's favorite would probably be Sunset Wheat (White Ale). If you haven't heard of it, yikes. Their stronger beer is labeled. Try their Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale.Anyway, this is a good place to catch up with friends or go for an occasional night out to drink.BUT. I hate how they rush you out before midnight. I work at a restaurant and am never allowed to force people out of the building. First, they close their kitchen at 11pm, so if you're not at a table by then, you're not getting food. Bar closes probably around 11:30. Then the lights gradually turn on, servers expedite the bill to their tables, then if you're still there by 11:55, management comes walking around and telling you that you have to leave! I don't like the hospitality at the end of the night! Don't get me wrong, the servers are probably some of the best, very sociable, consistent and precise (Rex, Bernardo, Jessica, I see you). But there needs to be a smoother way to escort people out. /:

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: Not often I come to places like this, but it's surprisingly not bad.  Been here my requisite minimum 3 times, so have a good sense of the place.Definitely a large selection of beers on tap.  Might not have every esoteric brew, but there's always a few that I'm in the mood for drinking.  Food, it's okay.  It's basically that minimum quality to qualify as food as I'd willingly eat without complaining.  In other words, the food is marginally better than the likes of The Cheesecake Factory or PF Changs and their ilk.Service is actually pretty decent.  Not as polished as the well oiled machines I'm used to, but they make a friendly effort.  But it's the kind of place where you need to be patient and not surprised if they mess up your order or take too long or don't come by enough to check on drinks.If someone asks me to head to Santana Row and suggests we eat here, I won't say no.  Though I'd likely suggest eating at Amber or someplace else.

Reviews.Author: Monica M.
Reviews.Content: As a San Francisco native, let me just start by saying we don't have ANYTHING up in SF that compares to Yard House, and if there is and I'm missing something -- somebody please let me know ASAP!I've been to Yard House on two separate occasions and loved it both times. On my first visit, my friend and I ordered the:1.) Hawaiian Poke Stack2.) Truffle Fries3.) Crab cake hoagie4.) JambalayaWe ordered the two entrees at lunch prices, so everything was fairly inexpensive, but GOOD! I remember the entrees being about $10 a plate.I raved to my boyfriend about this trip to Yard House, and thought he had forgotten about it until we made a trip down to Milpitas. He immediately suggested we go to Yard House for their happy hour, and it was our best decision that day! On my second visit, my boyfriend and I ordered:1.) Hawaiian Poke Stack2.) Lettuce Wraps3.) Moo Shu Egg Rolls4.) JambalayaAll of these were great and made perfectly! Not to mention, since we caught happy hour -- our bill came out to roughly $30+.I love the food, the ambiance, and the modernity of the whole restaurant from the dining area to the bathrooms. Not to mention, this restaurant is HUGE and I can see us taking our daughter here one time. Added pluses are their extensive beer selection and FREE parking all day regardless of what time you arrive. The servers are friendly and knowledgeable, and I definitely see us coming back here sometime soon!

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: BEER BEER BEER BEER BEER.Very chill. Great place to enjoy good company and again: their great selection of BEEEEEEEER. I love how there's so much variety; I always try something new every visit. And their happy hour appetizers: yum!

Reviews.Author: Janessa C.
Reviews.Content: They get their keg orders on TUESDAYS, so Wednesday is the BEST day to come because they will never be out of your favorite beer. :)I have seriously NEVER ordered anything from here that I didn't like. Their service is pretty crappy usually, but oh man, the food is good.Never ever EVER come here for dinner time, especially on the weekends,  because you'll be waiting 2+ hours for a table. I always come on a weekday for their happy hour specials. Cheap yummy beers and half off most of their appetizers, all the pizzas and the sliders are around $8 (which is an awesome deal, considering you get 4 of them AND french fries). You can go with a group of 4 people and share appetizers and come out with a bill that is $30- 40 (minus drinks).

Reviews.Author: Roger C.
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a beer/brew review, you won't find it in my review since I don't drink. Though I will talk about the excellent customer service I received along with the amazing dish I had too.Came here on a Friday night, so I'd recommend to plan accordingly and come early. I think we got here at 6:45PM (dinner rush), and we didn't get in for almost an hour. So THAT was a downside that it was such a LONG wait.Once inside and seated, its a very nice, casual ambiance. MUCH better then downtown SJ's FLAMES. Maybe its cause despite it being packed, you could make your way around the restaurant. Nice TV's screens showing the latest sports games. Sadly where I was seated, the channel wasn't showing the GiANTS. Heh, but onto the customer service, it was prompt and quick. I can remember our waitresses name but she was friendly.As for what I had, I had some sort of Asian Seafood Garlic noodle dish along with the Truffle Fries which I thought were amazing. The portions were generous and I think I had just about enough to save for lunch the next day. I typically eat everything but not that night. Perhaps I had a large lunch that day so I was able to save those delicious noodles for lunch the next day.Anyhoo, I'd def. recommend this spot if you and a couple of friends want a fun night out at Santana Row, want to get good beer (Based off my friends), great food, and chill/bar like ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Joseph M.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this place 3 stars just because their wait can be ridiculous at times, but ever since I discovered that it's actually better for my designated drinking friend and I just to dine and drink at the bar, which has been available the past several times I've been there, I can't be hating too much :)Moving on, I love Yardhouse -- or should I say, I love their Happy Hour! My past Sunday (late) nights at 10pm have consisted of glasses of Apricot Wheat, Truffle Fries (not discounted for Happy Hour but how can you beat $3.95?) and their pizzas -- amazing! Special shout out to our bartender / server Yolanda -- she's super cool and so nice and didn't laugh at me when my drunken self slurred my words! But a lot of the servers and whatnot have been amazing my many ventures here, so a big shout out to all of them!The only bad thing I have to say about this place is boy do they get busy at times!

Reviews.Author: Brenda C.
Reviews.Content: Good happy hour selection and spacious dining area.However, our server was lacking. I mean if YOU, as the server, made the mistake of placing in the wrong order, all you have to do is apologize to the customer and say you'll place in the correct order. But surprisingly, instead of being in an "apologizing mode", our mean looking waitress was in the "I'm-right-you're-wrong-and-I'm-gonna-argue-with-­you-until-you-back-down" mode.Then of course, after she realized we ordered the chicken garlic noodle instead of the mushroom garlic noodle, she doesn't even apologize and refuses to check up on us or provide us with any refill in our water. You suck.

Reviews.Author: Linda V.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been anticipating the opening of Yard House.Yesterday, my husband and I walked by and we were invited in for an employee training!  So, hooray!  We were super excited because we had an opportunity to tryout their food without the wait!  And it was an added bonus that it was on the house.  With it being an employee training, the menu was limited (no ahi) and no tap yet.  However, we didn't mind at all :)I had the peppercorn filet, done medium rare per the suggestion of our server.  The peppercorn filet came with mashed potatoes, carrots and asparagus.  Normally, I'm not a fan of peppercorn anything, but the dish was super tasty.  The meat was cooked nicely.  It's a huge portion for a cut of filet compared to other steakhouse and breweries.  I really enjoyed the mashed potatoes- I didn't anticipate on finishing, but I couldn't stop eating...so I did!  I was filled to the brim!We also tried the cheesy spinach dip served with a Parmesan crusted pita.  The spinach is fresh and they use 4 different cheeses.  Yum, a must try.Like with everything here, the portions are huge.  So, you can definitely share.And we also had ice teas.  The interesting part is David noticed that our ice was melting, so he brought out a glass of ice on several occasions.  Great catch!  We didn't notice and I've been to some Michelin rated restaurants that don't do that!And the service here was excellent - everyone was attentive and super friendly!After my experience, I'm definitely coming back to try their Ahi - have heard great things! And I have a feeling the wait is going to be longer than lines at Disneyland, but it doesn't matter because I know it's worth it! :)And because I've never understood what all the hype of Cheesecake is about and yet, it still has the longest wait for frozen tasting foods..."Watch out Cheesecake!" because Yard House is going to give you a run for your money (rightfully, so) and they will show you what it's like to cook real good food!Bravo for Yard House!!! :)

Reviews.Author: Wendy L.
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 6PM on a Saturday, and was told the wait was half an hour for a buzzer. But the buzzer wasn't ready until 45 minutes later, and then it was a 1.5 hour wait for a table. No problem! My friends and I easily killed time at the bar. We were told the range of the buzzer wasn't too far, nothing past Crate & Barrel and LB Steak. So after a while I got bored, and I walked around Santana Row while my friends stayed with the buzzer and watched the game on the plasma screen. (Thanks, ladies!) As expected, we were finally seated about 2 hours later.Here's what we had:*SEA DOG BLUE PAW WILD BLUEBERRY WHEAT ALE - 5/5 stars. One of my new favorite beers! The blueberry was more of an aftertaste but so delicious.*BELGIAN SHANDY (Woodchuck Pear Cider & Leffe Blond) - 5/5 stars. A bit too sweet for my friend, but I loved it.*ROSE GAARDEN - 4.5/5 stars.*TRUFFLE FRIES - 2/5 stars. Eh, nothing special about fries dripped in truffle oil.*GRILLED CRAB CAKE HOAGIE - 3/5 stars. Could've had more flavor.*SEARED SEA SCALLOP - 4/5 stars. The scallop was flavorful with great texture, but too salty. Luckily, paired with the simple orzo, it was perfect!*MAC & CHEESE - 1/5 stars. So overrated. Our waiter told us that was a terrific choice and we were excited. Yet when it arrived, all 4 of us were confused by how bland and oily it was.Service was fine (waiter messed up on my water but no biggie!) Loud, had to shout a couple of times. Would like to come during happy hour but timing is inconvenient for those who aren't locals. Seriously, the beer saves this place. I came here for the beer and will come again!

Reviews.Author: Dorothy B.
Reviews.Content: If P.F. Chang's and the Cheesecake Factory had a baby restaurant, it would be Yard House. The menu had lots to choose from -- sandwiches, hamburgers, pasta, seafood, steak, salad, pizza, rice bowls. This would be a good place to come with a group because the menu has something for everyone. The interior was nice and modern. There were so many vegetarian options on the menu, including an entire section of gardein dishes. I had the Orange Gardein Chicken, and I would order it again.

Reviews.Author: Cece P.
Reviews.Content: I lovedddd this place. I know New Yorkers are hard to please but I was out in San Jose visiting family and they took me here. A ton of beer and cocktail selections and the food menu was insane.Everything we ordered tasted yummy. I love a huge menu with great ambiance and service.And hey, its in Santana Row walk the food off when you're done and do some drunk shopping.

Reviews.Author: Hong An D.
Reviews.Content: Overhyped.The food was okay. Service isn't consistent! It's understandable because it gets pretty packed. The last time I came, my group ordered several truffle fries and they all came out cold. Our waiter barely checked up on us and we always had to flag her down. Not an enjoyable experience at all.The happy hour is worth it though. I like the truffle fries and shitake mushroom garlic noodles.

Reviews.Author: Annie W.
Reviews.Content: The Yard House boasts a nice location, reasonably priced happy hour menu, and of course a million beers on tap. But, I must say that I was not happy with my last visit there. The Yard House came off as being not very family-friendly. It turns out that they only allow high chairs on the top floor in the small area near the hostess desk. Mind you, there are only about 12-15 tables there. The bottom level has about 4-5 times as many. We were a little annoyed as we looked down upon about 10 empty tables we could have been sitting at had there not been this "high chair rule." So, as we waited for a high chair friendly table, other guests were being seated left and right. My VERY ACTIVE toddler was hard to contain wanting to run up and down the stairs. Finally a table opens up and someone does a half ass job bussing it, leaving a couple used napkins and cups behind. We inquire with the desk about that table, and why it's just sitting there dirty while we've been patiently waiting. The clueless poor excuse for a hostess says "I don't know what's up with that table." A more fitting response should have been something like, "Let me take care of that for you right away, you have been waiting a long time." She went on with her business, and we took ours elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: 4 stars cause the 45 minute wait sucked ass. Menu is huge, there's a lot of beer and good food. For happy hour I payed 8.50 fir there half yard if Lost Coast Brown Ale. Which is a decent price for some pretty good beer. The food is excellent. Had the California roll, which is made with real snow crab. It's not an ordinary sushi roll, it's a deconstructed roll and it was amazing. Also got the grilled artichokes with garlic aioli. Also very flavorful and fantastic. Service was pretty damn good. They were all over it removing empties, asking for refills, bringing our food out. The staff are young and hip and good at what they do. I would definetely come back.

Reviews.Author: Nas K.
Reviews.Content: The place wasnt bad at all the environment was good nice and calm but the waiter's dididnt get my order right they need to work in it however I wouldnt mind going back

Reviews.Author: Dilys Y.
Reviews.Content: The menu items are expensive, but the food tastes pretty good.I usually come here only for happy hour when the appetizers and the alcohol are cheaper.The appetizers I regularly order are the garlic noodle and ahi poke stack. The sliders are really good too. The truffle fries are a must, they are to die for.The cool thing about Yardhouse is the large variety of beer. During the 3-6 happy hour, the half-yard beer is only $7, it is so worth it. If you can't decide which beer you want, you can order a beer sampler.

Reviews.Author: The N.
Reviews.Content: Ok so this place I guess is a favorite among my vegetarian friends for its soy meat- substitute dishes. But as a carnivore myself , this review is for the worst chicken breast SANdwitch I have ever eaten . The sourdough and the meat were so hard my teeth almost fell out ! Really ! The meat was so dry ! My jaws hurt so much I gave up half way through my SANdwitch

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B.
Reviews.Content: OK, since everyones' hyped this joint up I figures I'd give a lil review:I've been here two days in a row, Friday afternoon at 2pm I had to wait about 10-15 mins. Our Server was Jared, really sweet and very helpful since I was a newbee to the beer world. I had both 6 pack samplers Traditional and Belgian beers  along with the black Velvet (i'm not much of a beer drinker) but when I do drink beer I love Guiness & pear cider!!! Friday I had the NY Steak salad. It was a fairly large salad but not really mmmmouth watering. Didn't care much for the fried pickled egg. Saturday: whole different story, the wait at 6pm was a 4 hour wait and thank god I was here friday to tell my friend to go early and get a table. He did just that and still waited 2 hours. finally seated I ordered the Southern Fried chicken ***** that gets a 5 star long with their Mac & Cheese OOOOOOH Yea will have to come back for both!!! I thought the atmosphere was great could have been a bigger establishment but oh well. Its not a club its a sports bar, so if you want to party not the place to go. But to eat sure  why not. make sure you give yourself some time to wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Kelly B.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place! As a first time goer to this establishment, I've been back a total of three times in one week. Every time we went we got seated right away, never even waited five minutes. The staff was always very pleasant and eager to please! The first time I went with my girlfriend and we enjoyed the ambiance and definitely the lunch specials and portions.The next couple times after that I went with my hubby and he was thrilled with the amount of food you get for very little money during happy hour that we went two days in a row! Now onto the food: Guacamole and chips - hard to screw up but definitely enjoyedGrilled Artichoke - oh how I love the artichoke, and the dipping sauce is so devine! French dip sandwich with a side Caesar salad - the sandwich was thinly sliced with no fat on it which equals melting in your mouth yumminess! As for the Caesar salad, it wasn't your typical Caesar dressing but it had a nice twist to it. Chicken Nachos - loved the two green and red tomatillo sauces, and the guacamole wasn't an extra charge! Two thumbs up! We got this both times!Thai chicken Pizza - didn't care for it, too sweet for my liking. Outer crust was goodBoneless buffalo wings - the chicken was really crispy but not very breaded, absolutely loved them and they had a bit of a kick to them as well. Four cheese pizza - the two bites I ha I enjoyed but it was gone before I could have a whole slice. Definitely liked the cheese one over the Thai chicken one! There's so many choices that I still want to try but now that I'm already establishing favorites its going to hard to detour. Everything that comes out of the kitchen looks amazing! I love the vibe and the atmosphere of this restaurant. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Frances Lois R.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times and I must say that the service is impeccable! Of the two times I've been here, both of the servers whose area I was seated at were very genuine. The food, however, is ok. Their lunch menu is pretty good though because they give you a decent amount of food for a good price. However, since I've only been here during lunch, it kind of looks like everything else on the menu is quite pricey.UPDATES: Happy Hour here is the best. Half off appetizers and beers. 'Nuff said =)

Reviews.Author: Chelsea B.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was expecting better. I've been to the Yard House in San Diego and I actually thought that one had a better atmosphere.The Santana Row version isn't terrible.... but it's definitely not great. Obviously their selection of beer is legit (I'm a big fan of red ales and they have some good options), but that aside, there were a lot of people who were way too drunk and I hate it when places close early on weekends. Is it really that terrible to keep somewhere that's essentially a bar open past midnight?? It'd be better tip money... just sayin...My advice, if you're going to come here, stake a spot at the bar early on in the night (especially since you're going to need to order your last drink by 11:30).

Reviews.Author: Frances B.
Reviews.Content: My husband, friends and I decided to try this place out. The atmosphere and food is really similar to BJ's: fun and loud, REALLY loud! We went on a Saturday night and waited for about 1 hour to be seated, and then another hour to get our food. Food: Order the buffalo wings! Super spicy and tasty and full of deliciousness! The Maui Chicken with veggies is good too, but note that it takes a long time to cook (according to the server).Overall, I would come back for one of those nights that you want to have a laid back but fun time. But, be prepared to wait awhile to be seated and for your food.

Reviews.Author: Beverly B.
Reviews.Content: Yardhouse is okay. Came here with my boyfriend.Happy hour appetizer: onion ring tower.I had the BBQ chicken pizza and a strawberry lemonade. The boyfriend had the BBQ cheddar bacon burger and pineapple juice. The food was good, but it wasn't great. The hosts had horrible attendance to me. 5 of them, 3 chit chatting with each other and the other 2 were both helping some guy who wants change for $100. Hello, paying customer over here. Then one if the hostess went to chat with the rest. The guy finally seated us after he was done helping the guy. Our waitress, Brennie was a dear. She was so sweet and attentive. Ooo. Our onion rings were cold. And the food wasn't like hot. It was warm. So eh. Overall, the food is ok. The staff is eh. And I think you end up paying for the dimly lit ambiance and flat screen TVs.

Reviews.Author: Charleen B.
Reviews.Content: Yard houseI love their food! Ordered the ahi tuna poke, pastrami sliders with truffle fries, and the strawberry beer! ALL DELICIOUS!!! We went during the first happy hour (around 5pm) and we were seated right away! Their happy house choices on food is super cheap and will fill you up! beer choices are one of the best because I am a fan for sweet/fruity beers and they have plenty. The three that I got to try were the strawberry, blueberry and honey beer and they were all good and light! I def recommend this place! Go before 6pm, because after... The line/wait wraps around the building! Mind you it was a Tuesday evening too!Definitely coming back for their yard long beers and cheap happy hour! They have such a great selection of food and beers, you can never beat that!

Reviews.Author: Alex T.
Reviews.Content: Ahhh Yard House, how I love you and your fine selection of beer. - Great food! The asian fusion thing is kinda meh for me, but the food was tasty none the less.- Dunno how it will get later on, but I assume that since it is Santana Row, this Yard House will have a wait time that will test your patience. - If you're a sports fan, screens everywhere! - Large selection of beer!

Reviews.Author: Andrew G.
Reviews.Content: Met up with friends to check it out.  I've been to a Yardhouse in SoCal and was impressed down there; not so much with the one at Santana Row.The positives:  The appetizers/food is delicious and well portioned.  We snacked on the nachos and spinach dip and were pleasantly surprised.Negatives:  The music is too loud and seems out of place.  Ridiculous wait, though it should go down; no call ahead and the beer is over priced.  If you are going to go, time your visit for Happy Hour.

Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: Been trying to get in here for a while.  The first couple of weeks were completely insane, and I absolutely refused to wait 2+ hours just to check it out.  Finally went in on a whim mid day on a cold saturday a few weeks ago and after about a 15 minutes wait, we got our table. Beer selection - Check.  They have a ridiculous (for the south bay anyway) amount of beers on tap, including my current favorite - Racer 5.  Woot!Food - Check.  I had the turkey burger which was super delicious.  The sweet potato fries were also very good and my wife really enjoyed the sauce/dip they bring with the fries.  (So much so that she asked how they make it so she can attempt to recreate it at home!)Service - Check.  Very friendly and attentive.  Being brand new and super busy, I expected the service to be less than stellar.  I was pleasantly surprised by everyone I cam in contact with (Hostess, bartender, barback, waitress, runner, and manager)  That's 6 people and 6 good experiences.  Will I be back?  You betcha!  After all, My glass is empty and I need some more Racer 5.

Reviews.Author: Mabel C.
Reviews.Content: Oh Yardhouse, how I love you, let me count the ways:-St. Louis Franboise Beer = my favorite -Chicken strips and truffle fries, mmm-Good ambiance -Onion ring tower, HELL YES-Sliders, good old American style.Don't get the California roll, it's just a really big rice roll with crap inside. I've had other foods and drinks, but those are my favorites (:I love happy hour!

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
