The Tomato Bisque Soup was really good, but we thought the size a little small than what we get served in other restaurants, which is fine with us because we don't wanna be fatties, but if you like a big bowl of soup, you might just want to go with the full entree size. :DHere is were awesome customer service comes in. We ordered the Margarita pizza, but our server misunderstood our order, and we ended up getting the BBQ Chicken. We were puzzled at first and we didn't know what to do. So we told Jenn, our awesome server, and she handled it super professionally! You know how sometimes they mess the order, and they take the food back and your left waiting for your food longer than what you expected to, then you get your food, and your out of drinks and everything else is cold? It's just not cool! D:Jenn was like, 'you know what, you guys just enjoy this pizza, and I'll go get your Margarita.' We were like, 'WOAH! WUUUT?!?! Thanks!! :D'Then, the manager came over. He was so polite and pleasant!! He asked how everything was doing, and apologized for the misunderstanding and assured us that our original pizza would be coming up soon and to just enjoy the BBQ Chicken on them. We were soooo impressed!! We felt super loved :DWe ended up with good amount of food to take home, an we left a nice tip for our awesome server, and a great memory of this restaurant!! We will be definitely drive back to San Jose to come YardHouse, they really appreciate their customers!! :DThanks Jenn and the awesome Manager there! You guys made our night!!!

Reviews.Author: Devon H.
Reviews.Content: I came in here last night with my boyfriend and friend and we were seated really fast! Within a few minutes. It was really nice. The beer list was amazing, and they even had the lambic beer I wanted. It's very rare to have those in restaurants. The food was reasonable priced and the dessert size was perfect for one person. I even had to share it. The only reason they aren't getting 5 stars is the wait between ordering and receiving the food and drinks. We put in our drink order around 9:30 and it didn't get to us ti about 9:50.  Now, I know if it's busy at the bar it'll take a while to get a mixed drink, but it literally takes a bout a minute to pull a beer. So, that was the only disappointing part. Other than that, I really enjoyed this place and I would go again. :)

Reviews.Author: C V S.
Reviews.Content: Food is good, and the Yardhouse staff agrees.  In fact, you can watch them eating from plates in the kitchen through the windows while you wait for your food.....and wait you will b/c the service is way below par.The only thing saving this review from a single star is their good beer.

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: We come here often and the service is usually just so so, but the food is always excellent. Tonight our order was totally wrong multiple times, but, after being sent back 3 times, it was corrected and was very good. Bianca was our server and she was so great it made the experience much more pleasant. Hopefully everyone in the restaurant follows her example.

Reviews.Author: Anthony P.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 I love coming here when near Santana Row. The food and drink have always been great, but I have to deduct a star because the food was not as good as I remembered it to be.  The Garlic Noodles were very oily and though the flavor of the California Roll was good, the rice did not have the sticky texture I like. My girlfriend claims that they have the best garlic truffle fries. I disagreed with her. I still think Montrio Bistro in Monterey have the best.  I ordered the surf and turf burger, which seemed like another forgettable burger. The GF got the  Macaroni and Cheese with chicken, wild mushrooms, cheddar, parmesan, campanelle pasta & truffle oil. The chicken was very bland and wasn't as cheesy as we would have liked.I really like their Black Velvet (pear cider with Guinness.) The drinks usually do not disappoint, however the espresso martini I ordered as a dessert tasted too much like vodka. Is vodka even an indignant in an espresso martini?Final Thoughts: I was a little let down by my last experience, but it is still a fun place to enjoy good beer and good company.

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: The Yardhouse is my favorite restaurant chain. I used to go all over SoCal when I lived down there. This one is huge and cool and has great TVs and all the great food and beer. I'm deducting a star because I think the wine list could be better. You say that it's a beer place and I shouldn't expect a decent wine list? Maybe. But this is not a beer hall. They can do better. One other small gripe, the server was not very knowledgeable about the beers, mispronouncing one badly and giving odd advice on others. Still, they could step up their game a bit but this place is still awesome enough to overlook all that.

Reviews.Author: Lynda N.
Reviews.Content: The wait here is always re-donk-u-lous (aka ridiculous) ... but in their defense, we don't go there with groups less than 15 people.  So for large parties, be prepared to wait 1-2-3 hours for a table.The up side?  The location is Santana Row so you can always walk around, do some shopping, grab a drink at their bar or any where else in SR.  AND their food is really good.Love love their truffle fries, truffle garlic noodles, truffle... ANYTHING!!  But I did find that the Chicken garlic noodles were too greasy so I sent it back... eeek!  Other than that, everything is really great!

Reviews.Author: Desmond T.
Reviews.Content: A great place for drinks and a selection of appetizers during happy hour. I love the huge selection of alcohol; it makes me feel adventurous. I really like the Belgian Shandy. It's a pretty light beer so if you want something pretty easy, yet still tastes pretty good, get this. It's smooth.This place gets so freaking crowded though. They don't take reservations and gets heavily packed around dinner time and happy hour. I am not sure if it's quite worth it. The entrees here are pretty average. A bit pricey for something that's mediocre. I do really like their truffle fries, onion rings, and pizza.So yeah, just grab a couple drinks and appetizers and you're good.

Reviews.Author: Amisha P.
Reviews.Content: BEST Happy Hour deal hands down!Would recommend getting the nachos as well as the sliders--anything*Plenty of options for vegetarians as well

Reviews.Author: AJ M.
Reviews.Content: Server Yolanda was great.  I had the green enchiladas.  Food was tasty.  I would come back again.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: BEER IS GREAT; FOOD IS.....CAN WE JUST TALK ABOUT BEER??Overall: C+Return Again: YepI've been here about 4 times.  Twice to get beers and twice to eat (and get beers).  Both times I've eaten here the food has been okay but the service is subpar.  The waiting staff gave us rolled eyes to split the bill, f'd up the totals, and hardly checked on us.  I recommend heading right to the bar.

Reviews.Author: Sean D.
Reviews.Content: The food here is pretty good.  I like the Lettuce Wraps and the Southern Fried Chicken.  But let's be honest, I'm here for the beer!  So many selections on tap, I'm like a kid in a candy store.  I wouldn't recommend the half yard unless its happy hour.  I say that because two pints is cheaper than the half yard and is more beer.  The staff is usually good here not much complaints there! If you're looking for a place to grab a drink with some buds I'd recommend yard house.

Reviews.Author: Yaz U.
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent restaurant to eat, hang out, or grab a drink! I like to call this place beer heaven... they have so... much... delicious... beer *drool*My usual beers are...Youngberry Chocolate- bitter chocolate taste followed with a sweet raspberry aftertaste.Timmerman's Strawberry- light/medium reddish pink beer with a really nice strawberry flavor.Raspberry Cider- so delicious! must try!All of their food is delicious as well! I've never had a complaint about their food and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu!I've tried and loved...Spicy Tuna RollFrench Onion SoupSeared Ahi Steak Sandwich x3BBQ Bacon Cheddar Burger x2Classic SlidersI highly recommend all of the above. It's all just so damn good and I find myself craving it all the time. I would also like to give a shoutout to one of the servers whose name is Tyrone. I believe he has been my server 2-3 times and and he makes my Yardhouse experience THAT MUCH more enjoyable. :)I love this place so much and wish I could come every week!

Reviews.Author: Amadeo D.
Reviews.Content: Impressive draft beer selection.  Mediocre food and horrendous customer service.We sat at the bar.  We ordered pints and lunch from a bartender.  After about 40 mins we had to flag down another bartender to ask about our order because our original bartender had disappeared and our lunch had not yet arrived.  During this time another couple seated shortly after us had finished their appetizer and was working on their main dishes.  15 mins later our order was hand delivered by the manager, but the order was wrong.  Finally after our lunch was corrected, and the manager had apologized profusely, our original server reappeared after a 45 min absence.  She chose to further demonstrate her ineptitude by professing she had 'no idea what happened with our order', and that right before she left to take her break, she saw that our food was 'up in the window'.  WTF, you couldn't run one out more order while the food was hot before you take break?  The manager never gave me a straight answer about what exactly went wrong, even though I asked directly.  During the hour of time we wasted leading up to our lunch I had to ask ask for the Giants game to be put on the TV 3 times, and the first time I asked, the bartender gave me attitude.About the food..... the fish tacos were sort of bland.  The guac was spicy, which would normally be interesting, but I wanted to taste the fish.  Should have just gone to Dia de Pesca.  I would have been in and out in 1/4 of the time.  I also tried a pork belly taco, which I'm sure would have been much more delicious if it had not been cold when I ate it.  When we finally got them, the chicken wings were soft and luke warm (I prefer mine crispy and hot, but what the hell do I know). To the YH credit, their manager comped our entire bill, and tried very hard to be friendly and ensure we left satisfied.   I'm afraid I don't think it's worth a return visit though, as there are too may other options in the bay area to risk returning to a place that has already demonstrated such gross negligence.Lastly, it's been about 2.5 hours since our 'experience' and I'm starting to feel queasy.  Ech...

Reviews.Author: Alex J.
Reviews.Content: This not only is the worst Yard House I've been to, it's one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. Was told it would take 20 minutes to get seated. Ended up taking an hour. Server was disingenuous and rude. Was training an employee and demonstrating such behavior to a new hire. Not worth the time or money. Much better places all around Santana Row.

Reviews.Author: Denise L.
Reviews.Content: i am so excited that we're getting a Yard House! I thought it was just a So Cal thing, and was so surprised to see the signs in Santana Row for it! They open this month, and on the corner, across Valley Fair.I think of it as an upgrade to BJ's, much more selection of beer (although I'm not a big beer drinker) and an Asian twist on some of their foods. Their chicken lettuce wraps are delicious (although hard to go wrong) and a big fan of their Macaroni and Cheese squared. Bacon and mushrooms in it, very yummy! All their appetizers are good too, and I remember their best dish being the jerk chicken with shrimp stack. ask for a side of tortillas, and you'll have yourself some yummy tacos. i dont know if this layout will be the same, but I like how the bar's an island in the middle of the retaurant, with chairs all around. TVs with sports are all over the restaurant as well.Can't wait!

Reviews.Author: Cindy C.
Reviews.Content: Got there around 920ish and went to the bar & watched the sharks game. Luckily, one of our friends knew one of the waitress who was able to hook us up on getting some drinks. The bar was super full, and no one would budge because the big screens were right there. Pretty chill night crowd, it wasn't too loud of an atmosphere. Took about an hour to an hour and a half to get seats, I couldn't tell because my phone died :/I got half a yard of pear cider, and it was really clean and crisp. Best cider I've had in my life. I tried a sip of the raspberry cider, and it was way too sour and sweet for my taste, a lot like ice tea a lot of my friends commented.We sat down in a booth, which was meant for six people and there was say 10-12 of us.. but we weren't aloud to stand on the side of the booth because its a fire hazard... but the service we got from our waiter was really good. Which is the main reason I'm giving this place four stars instead of three. Because I'm quite impatient and the wait took FOREVER, and I felt that it was difficult to get the attention of the bartenders.So we get seated and our drink orders are taken right away, Tom really seems to know his beer, I asked him about the Linderman's framboise in comparison to the Timmermin's strawberry beer, and he explained the fermentation process etc. I was quite impressed. I went with the float with the Linderman's framboise because I was having a sweet tooth tonight. at least for ice cream. Tom also got me a taster of the Timmermins, which was wonderful too, not as sweet and sparkling as the lindermans, but a subtle beer thats nice to kick back with.Then came the food, lobster garlic noodles. DELISH. it was quite pricey 21ish.. but hey why not splurge every once and a while, it was my friend's birthday. every bite had a kick of flavor! It definitely exceeded my expectations. Hopefully it keeps up to standards because places that are good like this, tend to go downhill after opening.

Reviews.Author: Ashley Q.
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to the Yard House last night! I took a group of 11 friends/family this time. Everyone LOVED it! :D My hubby and a friend got their mac 'n cheese and it literally made me drool because it smelled so good. The edamame beans were great and my mom was really excited to see them on the menu because she is on a diet, so she was able to have a tasty snack and enjoy herself. Our waiter was also super helpful with picking out a low-cal wine.***Tip - if you want to get a table, but don't want your party to wait outside in the freezing cold, send one person ahead to get the buzzer and wait then call you when the table is ready. (Treating said person to a few drinks will more than make up for the effort.)***

Reviews.Author: Angela D.
Reviews.Content: Had a perfect lunch here today with five girlfriends. The place was packed... so I was worried that we were going to have a long wait. Luckily we were able to get right in since we weren't waiting for a booth. Everything that I had from my Pineapple Express (cocktail) to my house salad and especially my Lobster Garlic Noodles was really good! The service was great! And the atmosphere was lively. This was the second time I've tried Yard House.... my first time was in Waikiki. Both experiences were great. I definitely will go back again because there is so much more on the menu that I want to try!

Reviews.Author: Kien M.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is the newest hot spot on Santana Row. I have to say that this place is pretty darn cool. Decent bar food and lots of beers on tap (+100). I've been here twice for Happy Hour. Good thing we get here early because this place gets pack especially if there is a Sharks gmae.Food: 1) Classic Sliders: Taste like White Castle but not frozen. I can snack on like 20 of these. It comes with thin shoestring fries which are nicely crisp.2) Poke Salad: A little saltier than I like but not bad.3) Fried Calamari: Crispy batter and decent portion.4) Pastrami Sliders: Classics are way better.5) Chicken Nacho: Big but not enough chicken.Beer:1) Guinness: Can't go wrong!2) Belgium Six Pack: Do not underestimate these beers. Most of them are sweet but they pack about 8%-10% abv.  3) Traditional Six Pack: These beers are more of what I am use to but with ridiculous names like Grand Teton Bitch Creek and pursuit of Hoppiness.

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: Yardhouse! I have been to the yardhouse several times now and the hype of this place continues to build as it is crowded allday errrday that i have been to this spot. It really depends on when your there but i still see the wait line from 1-2 hours and people wait! It is good that it is in santana row because for that long wait you can get alot of shopping done. This update review is just to update some of the food that i have tried here at the yardhouse, - Chicken Nachos- Super bomb! Try it, i know nachos are simple but this nacho is simply delicious to mee. Great with beer!- Cheddar Bacon Burger- This was a really good burger that was cooked medium and was soo nice and juciy! Great with beer!- Appetizer Ribs- These ribs are flavorful but there was a lil too much sauce for my liking of these ribs.- Chicken & Avocado sandwich- This was a simple sandwich and i thought tasted like most chicken and avocado sandwichs i have eaten. They use a wheat bun which i think would go more better if they used a better bread but what do i know because i aint no chef so that's just my opinion.I've been here several times with newbies that wanted to check out the hype so i wanted to add that the service the most part is good but depending how packed it is your service can be badddd. But for the most part the service is nice and accomadating.

Reviews.Author: Vinitha R.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the SD yardhouse and the bay area one is about the same. Great beers with tons of variety, good happy hour deals, and average food. The food is pretty typical bar food- sandwiches, pizzas, and lots of appetizers- nothing fantastic, but it will satisfy a craving. I do like that the waiters/waitresses know about the beers and are able to make recommendations. I recommend against getting a martini- the strawberry field was so sweet I couldn't drink it. It seriously tasted like cough syrup. The espresso martini was tasty but nothing fantastic. In general, they all need more alcohol and less fluff. Still, 4 stars because of the beers and happy hour deals.

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: From the outside, yardhouse stands out, it's really hard not to notice when passing by.  upon a closer inspection, it has actually in a really nice building with cool decor.But what I really like about this place is their happy hour! I decided to give this place a try after a game night around 10PM, there was a slight wait but the waiting process was well managed and the hostess was very friendly.their happy hour menu selection is fairly decent. food is made just right and the portions are good.  I HIGHLY recommend their calamari and fries (from the sliders).They have great beers on tap and a large variety.  And of course their specialty, the "yard of beer" or during happy house, the half yard of beer is a signature drink.  Their mixed drinks aren't bad, but they aren't the best either.yardhouse is officially added onto my rotating list of places to drink at and has my stamp of approval.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Long wait especially during playoffs for sports. Service was good, drinks are good and only a dollar cheaper than other spots at SRow. Nice booties on the waitresses..just kidding. Food was ok. If you go, go during happy hour. Oh do try the beer floats!Cool spot to chill for drinks

Reviews.Author: Ling H.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice and I love the vibe, but maybe it's because I went both times with awesome people :)Seriously though, I don't understand what the big hype is especially if you've ever been to SoCal, it's every where. Great beer selection for beer lovers, big screens for all you sports buffs, and loud music for those who like yelling at the person next to you to carry on a conversation to imitate the mood of a club.The first time here, we ordered the Cuban Pork Roast dip. It was flavorful, but the dip was super salty -_-  If you are to share anything though, definitely get the truffle fries! Those things are damn good. I also tried my friend's chicken pot pie which looked humongous, but it was just the top pastry dough layered on top of the bowl itself that made it look that way. Great presentation, but the pot pie itself was bland. The chicken wasn't dry though! Plus.For SR, I guess price is reasonable, but will only come for HH!

Reviews.Author: Richard F.
Reviews.Content: I know I am stingy with my 5-star reviews, but this one is defintely a great place to try out.The first one in Northern California opened just shy of a month ago and since then I have been there 3 times and the wait has never been shorter than at least 2 hours.120+ Beers on tap, great food, and all-around very friendly staff that works hard despite the massive amount of patrons milling just about everywhereif there are any negatives at all, it is definitely the wait, but this is a great place to drink, eat and hang out with friends

Reviews.Author: Tung T.
Reviews.Content: Now i should really be giving Yard House a 1 star rating for all the times I've tried to go to Yard House but ended up in failure due to long wait and wrong happy hours time/date. But after finally going to this particular Yard House, I do not have it in my heart to rate it anything less than 4. Now I've been to Yard House in the past, especially the one in San Diego in which i feel is still a lot nicer and bigger. This Yard House have a different feel to the others. A lot more like a big bar with little tables and booths around it. But still a great atmosphere for a fun time. My roommates and I came here on a Monday happy hour. There wasn't a wait and we were even able to pick our tables right in front of the big screen TV with the Heat/Celtics game on. SCORE! But beware....of the SHARKS...as when there is a Sharks game on...this place  will be packed to the top. OK i should have said this earlier, but this review is only based on my happy hours visits. I feel that Yard House prices are way too high but their Happy Hour makes this place a great deal! Now their beer selections are amazing and better yet their Half-Yards are just amazing to drink..i mean who doesn't wanna drink their favorite beer in a half-yard glass. Now on to the food.Stand outs:Bernaise sliders (comes with fries!)Jamaican Jerk WingsSpicy Thai PizzaTruffle FriesNot so great:Spicy Tuna Roll (not sushi at all, its more of a 7 layer dip...with chewy tuna chunks...not my favorite)But yea...try their house beers...grab some good food....and enjoy your favorite game!

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: Yard House is a nice little spot in an area within a pool of saturated watering holes for the rich and super-rich. The ambiance is just right and you can get a comfortable and fun seat if you happen to get a person in early to reserve a table.That said, the drinks are a little on the pricey said (Happy Hour is great, but tends to still lean on the pricier end), and the service is pretty good if you don't end up waiting 1+ hour outside due to coming late or in a ridiculously large group. Seating, friends, is not this place's forte.However, if you're just looking to grab a couple of beer with a group of friends, I highly recommend this spot due to its ease of entry, considerate service, and snappy lookin' decor.

Reviews.Author: Hashim A.
Reviews.Content: Been to this location and it's not bad. The food is decent, but their main thing is the beer...and they have lots of it. I can't speak to it because I don't drink, but the setup is impressive. As far as the dishes, the turkey pot pie is HUGE. 2 people could split one. Same for the grilled romaine appetizer salad. Their portions tend to be large. Not as large as Cheesecake Factory, but close. Food is better at Yard House though...there's no comparison. Other things I'd recommend are the Chicken Enchilada Stack, Ahi Poke, Truffle Fries and the Onion Ring Tower. If you like pastrami their pastrami sandwich is pretty good as well.Service has been decent every time I've come here too. Just avoid the dinner hours and you will be fine. I've sat at the bar area a few times and the service is good there as well. The bar area gets very crowded though, and unless you come early, it can be very difficult to get a seat, especially during happy hour. Forget about finding a seat at the bar at dinner time. You will be lucky to find a place to stand. You will probably have to wait 10-15 minutes for a bar seat during the weekend afternoons though.I had to deduct a star because of the ridiculous wait time. I noticed them being VERY inefficient at turning around tables. Many tables were sitting idle for a good 20 minutes before a new party was seated. That no doubt added to the wait time. I also witnessed a couple people squat at a table as another group left..sitting at the table with their drinks before that table got bussed. They even got served food while they sat there. None of the staff noticed (or cared) which is weird since it was a party of 3 sitting at a table big enough for 6. It was also weird since I noticed staff kicking people off other tables that had been bussed.If you come, make sure you avoid the Friday and Saturday evening time. The wait is 2 and a half hours at a minimum then. Plus, by the time you finish eating dinner you won't be able to order dessert because the kitchen will be closed. They usually start shutting down the kitchen about an hour before closing so be aware.The wait is usually 30 minutes to an hour at other times. They will not accept call-aheads if it gets too busy either. If you insist on dining during dinner hours, your best bet is showing up BEFORE 6PM and putting your name on the list. Anytime after and you probably won't be seated for at least 2 hours.

Reviews.Author: Rachel J.
Reviews.Content: FINALLY!  Went here for a late lunch to take advantage of happy hour specials and the fact that most people aren't off of work yet at 3:00pm. Me and the husband were seated immediately at one of the huge booths near a window.  I was there for the food.  The husband was there to try their pour of Guinness.Being happy hour, we ordered items with the intention of sharing.  We had the half price appetizers of classic sliders, substituting truffle fries (+$1.00) in place of regular, the traditional buffalo wings, and a lunch sized portion of the mac and cheese.Classic sliders:  the beef patties had a good flavor and were tender.  The garlic aioli was very light in flavor and added moisture to the patty.  I would order these again, but try out the other variations.Truffle fries: I was slightly disappointed that they were shoestring fries, and only because I'm more of a fan of thicker cuts.  The taste was comprised more of the parmesan cheese for some bites, and more truffle-like for some.  Don't get me wrong, I am a fan of these, but I think I would do some things differently like a little less parmesan and a little more parsley for a fresher taste to complement the earthiness of the truffle oil.Traditional bone-in buffalo wings:  crispy, hot (temperature), and spicy, everything a good hot wing should be.  I was surprised to see what looked like cracked black pepper on them, but whatever.  It didn't ruin it.  The sauce was spicier than expected out of a traditional buffalo sauce, and that is a good thing.Just when I thought I was satisfied and content with sitting and waiting for the husband to finish his second round, the dessert menu arrived at the table.  The first half of the offerings were small portions and cost less than $5.00.  We opted for the creme brulee.Creme brulee:  two caramelized banana pieces beside a cute little ramekin of deliciousness.  The crispy top-shell was executed really well; it was evenly brown and had a great crunch sound as I stabbed into it with my spoon. A perfect portion for two to taste, but I was slightly put off by the chocolate bottom "crust."  I wasn't really in the mood for chocolate and this just happened to be there.  It wasn't bad, but I preferred to be rejoicing in the vanilla/caramel/banana goodness.Overall, service was prompt and attentive, and the restaurant was busy but not slammed.  I will be revisiting this place in a while after the newness wears off.  I liken Yard House to a more upscale BJ's Brewhouse.

Reviews.Author: Rachel M.
Reviews.Content: The Santana Row location is great and perfectly situated for happy hour - and the giant bar is definitely a draw. Have been by a few times and the line is always insane - finally went early one day for a basketball game and got seated right away (before 5 pm) and got to enjoy the happy hour specials and pricing. Happy Hour is definitely bang for your buck and the food comes out quickly and nicely plated. Service started a bit slow for our boothful of people but then came at a steady clip after we got our server's attention. She was great with us constantly adding more dishes as more people joined our party. I also appreciated her making arrangements to change the channels on the TVs around our booth so that we could all get ESPN instead of the NFL channel (which was running a history lesson) ~ bonus points. My friends all got half yards while I got a pint of the Lagunitas - which turned out to be a smart choice on my part b/c the half yards, while entertaining, proved somewhat unwieldy for them to manage while packed into a booth like sardines.Until the hype dies down, I don't see myself going and waiting in line for a regular dinner (the food itself is pretty normal/average) but it's a great place to go and meet up w/people for a little down time if you don't mind the wait.

Reviews.Author: Deep S.
Reviews.Content: Yardhooooosaaaaaaaaaa as I call it, this is what we call the big (but better) brother of BJ's Restaurant and Brewhouse.  This place is always crowded like a DMV line on a Saturday Morning.  This place has like 100 different types of beers, none of which I have ever tried because I don't drink Beer :(   Food here is really good, especially the appetizers.  They have happy hour from 3-6pm and almost all appetizers, pizzas, and sliders are 50% off.  I really like the Turkey Sliders, Chicken Nachos, and the thin-cut fries,  you can't go wrong with either of these.  For entrées the Vodka Pasta is really good as it has a real distinct taste, maybe it's the alcohol they put in there?...who knows real good though. The SHANGHAI BBQ RIBS are really good also, just make sure you get extra sauce as they bring them out with limited sauce. Yard house is great for a day out with friends to catch or even watch sporting events, only CON for this place is the wait :(

Reviews.Author: Jennifer N.
Reviews.Content: I don't drink beer and I hate classic rock, yet I found myself at the Yard House on Sunday afternoon for an early dinner. Blame it on the fact that my boyfriend and I skipped lunch and it's the first thing we saw as we pulled on to Santana Row or the nostalgia factor (we used to go to the locations in San Diego and Irvine with our friends back in the day when we lived in Southern California)-whatever it was, we ended up here. Which wasn't necessarily a bad thing...just an odd choice.However, I wasn't disappointed. The decor and loud factor are the same at this place no matter what location you go-you either feel it or you don't. For a Sunday at 4, it was slightly subdued, therefore bareable. Their menu was impressive-I believe it's expanded since I last went to a Yard House-there is an entire vegetarian section (WIN)I opted for the Meditteranean veggie sandwich-I didn't want fries and asked for a side salad instead. They gave me a nice mixed greens with balsamic vinigrette. So, tip, ask for something other than fries with your sandwich and they'll oblige (it doesn't state it on the menu). The BF got the seared Ahi sandwich. We were both pleased and it was worthy of a super late lunch splurge. The portions were pretty huge-I took home half of mine. Service was nice, wait wasn't too long. They had said it would be 35-40 minutes but it turned out to be only 20. However by the time we left, the crowds were forming.It's alright-nothing I'd go out of my way for but it does the trick.

Reviews.Author: Jiyea C.
Reviews.Content: I was slightly skeptical of this place since I'm not a beer fan, but after reading the Yelp reviews and hearing about Yard House from my friends had me curious enough to venture out to Santana Row to try for myself. I came here during the evening happy hour twice and the wait wasn't too bad considering. We just ordered from the bar and took in the crowd while we waited for our table. I tried the Pear Cider, which doesn't even taste like beer (perfect). Once we were seated, my friend and I shared the turkey sliders, which were good. On my second visit, I tried the pastrami sliders, which were not bad either, though I would recommend the turkey. I also tried the sweet potato fries (they're not on the happy hour menu but they're only $3 so why not) and really enjoyed the sauce they came with. It had bacon bits and maple syrup so it was sweet and salty at the same time, yum!Calamari was also done well but it would have been easier to eat if it were chopped into smaller pieces. I would not recommend the Spicy Thai Pizza. Maybe it's because I don't expect my pizza to be super spicy. Also, we asked to have the cilantro removed from the pizza, but the pizza still tasted like cilantro, which was a minus.  Service seems to be pretty good. It was a little slow on the first night i was here, which is understandable since it was the Sunday before Memorial Day. When I came back the night after, our server was super friendly and attentive.I will be back to try their lunch specials.

Reviews.Author: Angelic L.
Reviews.Content: I came here twice before and was never able to get a table. Third time's a charm? The wait was about 35 minutes for two people on Memorial Day for lunch. I'm assuming it was a shorter wait than usual because everyone was off at the beach soaking in the sun.I ordered the garlic noodles, and I was super excited because I wanted to compare it to Xanh's garlic noodles. I was pretty disappointed though, especially after hearing so many good things about it. For a dish that included a lot of my favorite ingredients (shitake mushrooms, edamame, asparagus, etc...), it wasn't very good or flavorful. It almost tasted like nothing. Granted, Xanh doesn't really put anything in their garlic noodles to make it a stand-alone dish, but I still love the flavor much better. Even though the Yardhouse has chicken and tofu in their noodles, the pieces are cut so small that it looks like ground beef, and tastes like nothing. Their noodles are much thinner than Xanh's noodles too, which I'm not a big fan of.My friend had the mac and cheese. It was good for a few bites, but an entire meal of just cheese and truffle oil gets sickening. Don't get this dish unless you're sharing!The host stand is not very helpful sometimes, but the servers aren't so bad. Our refills were prompt, which was nice. Other than that, the service isn't memorable.I still would like to try some other dishes that I saw on the menu, but maybe in a year or so when the hype dies down because I'm not down to wait over an hour to eat and chill with my friends.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer T.
Reviews.Content: Nothing against Yard House because I really do like them [well only their happy hour]...but I can not wait til the hype of this place dies out so everyone can just enjoy it.I used to live in So-Cal where the wait for Yard House is definitely NOT 3 hours!!! ...but it's understandable....it's new to nor-cal........i'll give this place a higher rating once the wait is less than an hour like normal yard houses....Happy Hour Recommendation: Spicy Tuna Roll!! soOoOooOO delish!! I think the food is a lil overpriced for the quality so YH is only worth it during happy hour :)

Reviews.Author: Tram T.
Reviews.Content: Totally overrated and sooooo not worth the wait.  I'm already not big of a fan of Santana Row just because the patrons there are not really my cup of tea.  But I had heard good things about it and wanted to try it out.I got the bacon cheese burger with truffle fries and it was just ehhh. Nothing special about it at all.  I was just so disappointed.The two stars are for:1) The size: the place is HUGE and would actually be a fun place to sit at the bar and watch a game if it wasn't so crowded2) Wide range of beers on tap

Reviews.Author: Stine H.
Reviews.Content: Two words: Creme Brulee.The creme brulee is really small, but so good! It has caramelized bananas on top, and some on the side. I love creme brulee. Oh yeah, great place to hang out during happy hours and knock back a few beers...or half yards.

Reviews.Author: Vivian H.
Reviews.Content: HUGE menu, and  just about everything we tried (like 10 items) was delicious. The stars were the jambalaya (get brown rice), mac n cheese, penne. Burger was too salty for me. SO much beer.. will have to come back for happy hour.We were able to get a table almost immediately at noon on a Saturday, think we got there in time. But I have heard people waiting for hours and never getting in. Yikes. And our server was great but they kept bringing out the wrong drinks and missing things in our order (like dressing on the side). A little pricey but it is Santana Row, and the food's pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Natalia H.
Reviews.Content: Came out here for lunch a couple of wks ago. I had the jambalaya. Friend had their shrimp stack. We shared a hummus for appetizer. Why hummus? I have no clue, she ordered before I got there :P Service was excellent! Our waiter was being followed by a waiter-in-training but it wasn't awkward at all! They came by often to check up on us, but it wasn't annoying :) When my friend's ice tea was half-way empty, the guy came by with another refill for her w/o her asking! Woah. I was impressed with their service. This was also during busy lunch hour! Food was not bad either. Jambalaya was spicy which made me happy. I love the sauce! Humus was meh nothing special. I had a bite of the shrimp stack and it was really really really good! I wouldn't mind coming back here!

Reviews.Author: Enza P.
Reviews.Content: This place has been open for months and it's STILL hard to get in even now! My friends and I came here for happy hour at 4 in the afternoon and it was pretty full inside already. I don't even know how crazy it would be at 7PM! People keep telling me stories about how they waited 2-3 hours just to eat/drink here.Although the wait is crap, I've learned to go when it's not busy so I avoid the crap =) The menu was HUGE. There are so many things to choose from. It's a bit overpriced but hey -- it's santana row. On top of that, I just get a cool vibe, it's generally always a good time hanging out here.Off the happy hour menu, I ordered the Chinese Garlic Noodles, which is similar to the Chicken Garlic Noodles minus the chicken and asparagus. I asked for no cheese and my dish came out a bit more buttery then it should've. Maybe they were trying to make up for flavor? The food was cooked well though, minus the buttery-ness and I love butter so of course I finished my plate pretty quick. My friends all ordered REALLY tasty looking dishes. My friend had a chicken marsala that I tried and fell in love with. The happy hour menu is pretty good. If you go during lunch/happy hour, you're spending a typical price for lunch. I also ordered the goblet size of a strawberry flavored beer that the waitress described to me as more of a hard cider but has a higher alcohol content then the beer. I really enjoyed that drink. I believe it's a really popular drink. I'll update this review when I think of the name.Overall, I enjoyed myself as well as the food. I would definitely keep the same drink for next time and change up my meal and try something new. All my friends had a great time as well. For now, it remains 4 star. I haven't had any bad customer service/wait time instances. Remember, for a crazy crowded place like Yard House, if you're gonna go at peak times, be patient! If you're like me and know you can't wait...go at 2 for a late lunch or 5 for an early dinner and TRUST ME you'll have a much better experience. Besides, eating dinner earlier is better for your digestive system =)

Reviews.Author: Bryce B.
Reviews.Content: When it was announced that the Yard House was opening in San Jose at Santana Row, I was incredibly excited.  I have been to the one in San Diego on a few occasions and was so pleased an outpost was opening here.  Yard House represents a game changer for the South Bay, as there is simply nowhere else one can experience such a wide variety of beer.  Well, I wasn't the only one excited about this opening.  It took nearly 3 weeks to get inside.  Typical wait times (they do not take reservations) were 2-3 HOURS.  No joke.  But, by now, the initial buzz has passed (and so have the NBA and NHL playoffs, which were in full swing at the opening) and it's easier to get in with minimal wait.  I imagine, though, that on Friday and Saturday evenings, this place is a madhouse.The quality of the beer list is unassailable: 110+ beers on tap, with rotating and seasonal taps from Lagunitas, Sierra Nevada, Samuel Adams and Blue Moon.  They have everything from Bud Light to Arrogant Bastard.  I always marvel at the sheer scope of the plumbing system used to deliver the beer from the keg room to the bar.  The beer list is nicely organized by style, with a short description of each style.  That's a nice touch, especially for those looking to try something new.While I am thrilled with the beer selection, the food is often hit-or-miss.  Twice I've had one of the burgers.  The meat was tasty, but it was perched upon a very soft and doughy bun.  I prefer a heartier bun, one that can stand up well to a big, juicy patty. The menu, though, is nearly as expansive as the beer list, so there may be better selections I have yet to try. Service is generally pretty good, although it can be a little spotty when the place fills up.  I also notice that some servers are not as knowledgeable about the beer list as they should be, but that might be attributed to only working there a few months.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the fuss about this place at least food-wise. The first time I came here for lunch with some friends. We had to wait a little - understandable. The service was mediocre and it didn't bother us too much. EXCEPT when the fire alarm went off. I understand that it's a new restaurant in a new building and you have kinks to work out. But I promise you the alarm went off for a good FIVE minutes and nobody came by to say anything about it - to evacuate or that it was a kink. GRRR' so frustrating! On a more uplifting note - come for their beers and their happy hour specials.Other than that Yardhouse is a just more expensive Bj's

Reviews.Author: Carolyn S.
Reviews.Content: This place is probably the only decent place in Santana Row, in my opinion! They have tons, and I mean tons, of beers on tap here, so you could go here every day for a year and always try something new!This place gets packed at night on the weekends, so don't go here then planning to have a sit-down meal, unless you want to wait a really long time. It's a fantastic place to grab a beer and hang with your friends, as long as you don't mind standing until you can snag a place at the bar. On weekday nights, you can easily find a place to sit, so go then if you want a sit-down meal.I was here when the Sharks beat the Kings in the playoffs, about a week after the place opened, and let me say, the atmosphere was fantastic! I love the fact that it was packed with people all enjoying themselves. Overall, a great place to go for a drink.

Reviews.Author: Louisa T.
Reviews.Content: Good food (fairly priced), lots of beer to select from, long wait......  That pretty much sums it up. I'm not sure if the food and tables are really worth waiting for. Most of the time I just walk in, go to the bar and order drinks with a few friends, stand around and chat then call it a night. I do however like the atmosphere because of the good amount of tvs they have playing sport channels and how crowded it is here. =) Great for happy hour. If you don't want to wait and hour + for a table, keep in mind the bar seating is free for all, first come first serve.

Reviews.Author: Kim L.
Reviews.Content: Depending when you come the wait is either short or long. I usually try to come on Sunday nights or at 3pm when happy hour starts.I've only had one beer from here, which is the snakebite. Which I wouldn't mind getting again next time I go here. Its more of a sweet beer since it's half pear cider. My favorite appetizers here are the Hawaiian poke, garlic noodles, thai pizza and wings. Their Kona Sundae is awesome!! :)

Reviews.Author: Hayne P.
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Definitely became my go-to place when I have no idea what to eat with my honey and want a cheap bite.I always come here for their happy hour. I'm still going down the martini list, but so far they're all great. I was a little sad though, that the amount they give me varies on the date. I noticed that there was just less in my glass on Sunday than on any other day. We usually get one or two dishes to share, and often we'll end up with leftovers. Delicious. I would avoid the chicken garlic noodles though. Their appetizer garlic noodles seem to taste much better and more flavorful. Plus, it's cheaper and it's still a very good serving. Seriously though, you really can't beat their happy hour menu and pricing. Pretty happy with everything I've tried here so far. Some of the servers give a little attitude though, and sometimes are IMPOSSIBLE to flag down. I definitely remember a time they forgot to serve us water. My friend's boyfriend had to go to the bar to get water on his own.

Reviews.Author: Angela L.
Reviews.Content: FOOD DRINK:1.) Mac Cheese = mm! Thought it was going to be just super simple mac n cheese but it was really well put together. And there was real chunks of chicken!! And mushrooms, and I guess truffle oil... haha2.) Firecracker Rib Appetizer = mm this was really good too. Kind of an Asiany flavor, with the small papaya salad. (I've never been a fan of papaya salad haha)3.) Bock's & Sam Adams Summer Ale - Tasty beers!!*Food completely exceeded my expectations! No wonder this place is always poppin'! Thought it was just the hype of a new place, but it must be the quality that gets people coming back. Also the variety of so many yummy beers. mmm... SERVICE:Penny was great. Their team was great, bringing out all the food and drinks. And Penny checked up on us a lot :) This place is ALWAYS so packed! 1.5 hour wait for a Thursday evening. ATMOSPHERE:Casual, open, spacious, nice with lots of tv screens. Mostly comfy booth seating, a big bar area in the middle. Santana Row to walk around in the area to kill time before our wait time is over. Great place to chill with either one friend, or even a bigger group :)

Reviews.Author: Jimmy D.
Reviews.Content: Ok now.. Yard house was a much needed watering hole for the bay area.  There's a good selection of beer on tap (I think its 100+)  for you to drink from.  Food is pretty good but I wouldn't say its great.Since this place is pretty new, it does get quite crowded.  It's also in the prime location of Santana Row.I hope this place will educated everyone on beer more.  I'm in San Diego now and it's made more a beer snob.  When I go home to San Jose, it was difficult to go find a good beer on tap somewhere.  Thanks to Yard House, I can now get my fix when I get home.Keep a lookout for "Original Gravity Public House" coming to downtown San Jose later this year.  There will be plenty of good beer without the feeling of a restaurant chain.

Reviews.Author: Khanh T.
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan! Yaaayy.I enjoy the food here and drinks/beer here are great!Burgers are cooked to perfection, Garlic Noodles are freakin delish, Mac and Cheese is oily but yummah.I had their Ahi Tuna Stack or something and that tasted a little funky, so I didn't enjoy that one as much but the BF was hungry so he killed it.They don't have certain hard liquors in house to make you shots/drinks that you want (which is understandable because they're known for their beers). Which means... no LC's... but they can give you 3 Wisemen :D or 4 Horsemen if you're daring.. or feel like dying..I suggest you eat their delicious food before you do that though. Don't be crazy.

Reviews.Author: Aryan O.
Reviews.Content: Finally San Jose gets a Yard House. This place has a nice selection of beer on tap. I always go for the Young's Double Chocolate Stout. Very good try if your looking for a chocolate flavored beer. Well this place is on the corner of Santana Row and this place pops at all hours so good luck trying to get a seat, especially during the hours of 3pm and 6pm on weekdays since that is happy hour and a lot of people coming off work come through. I would though not be discouraged of the wait because it is worth the wait especially of a long day of shopping or just hungry as hell, you need to stop by and get some food and beer. Tried a couple of items here: tried the Seared Ahi which was really good, appetizer was the lobster, crab and artichoke dip which was really good, especially with the baked pita mmmm. My plate was the Jambalaya, mmm exceeded my expectations. It was so good, really hit the spot. Every restaurant I go to I look for Jambalaya on the menu and Yard House does have it and they do have a good one.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie B.
Reviews.Content: Alright, my food review.I'll keep things simple because I've already reviewed this place twice before.Appetizers & snacks are DELICIOUS!Seriously, just drink and have your simple appetizers.Blue Crab Cakes- Two little cakes, but they're so flavorful!Deviled eggs- Delicious and I love the salsa twist.Calamari- Can't go wrong.Truffle Fries- A MUST get, so tasty and it's a nice amount.Sandwiches are terrible.OK, maybe just the two I tried.  The seared ahi steak sandwich is so boring, no flavor.. it's actually a little bitter.The pastrami sandwich was cold and dry, not much flavor either.I was actually disappointed.  Maybe next time I'll order their house specialities or something.  I'll definitely stick to the simple snacks and appetizers.  I would give them 2 stars for their sandwiches, but 5 for everything else.

Reviews.Author: Alice C.
Reviews.Content: A nice place for happy hour if you enjoy beer. I came by at the start of happy hour (3pm) on a Friday and there were a good amount of tables open.The happy hour menu includes beers (pint or half yard), well drinks, martinis, and some appetizers at good prices.The beer selection is relatively comprehensive, which is great. I was able to try the Snakebite (Woodchuck pear cider and Harp), the Belgian Shandy, a blueberry beer, and the chocolate stout + vanilla ice cream float. All were enjoyable-- the float was especially tasty (even though I usually stick to lighter beers).The restaurant itself consists of a rather large dining space with a large bar in the middle. Service was subpar-- our waitress seemed really oddly out of it and exhausted. She also took a long time to get our beers and water to us.. shouldn't be that difficult. Also hard to flag down at times.I'm never in this area, but I will probably have to make the float at home myself from now on. A new way to add calories while drinking, huzzah.

Reviews.Author: Phuong T.
Reviews.Content: The good:- Great place to watch sports games with all the TVs and different channels available.  You could try and position yourself strategically for the best views, but you wouldn't really need to with the number of TVs around.- Huge selection of beers, wines, and spirits.  There's something for everyone!- Pretty good selection of happy hour appetizer specials!  The pizzas are not bad either, good if you like thin crust pizzas.The bad:- Wait times can be rough.  You could wait at the bar, but with the times I've been there, it's hard to get a spot to wait at the bar area.- Service is spotty, also due to the large crowds that come here.  The servers seem to do their best, though... they just seem overwhelmed.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey A.
Reviews.Content: I like a wide selection of beer because I like beer. Any restaurant that offers this many choices of beers gets at least 3 stars in my book. I like their happy hour specials too. Half price apps are a total deal; we got chicken nachos (HUGE portion) for a steal at like $4. Beers are $4 at HH as well. :D Srsly, you can't go wrong with that. As far as my DISlikes, I'm not a fan of the actual selection of beers. Most beers are readily available and I love me some hard-to-find, rare brews, which Yard House doesn't really have on their menu. Which is still cool, but not amazing. The place is freaking HOPPING, a line out the door at the entrance to Santana Row? It's ultra modern and ultra hip, which is not the type of place I find myself enjoying some nice brews usually. You can barely hold a conversation with the person next to you without losing your voice the next day-- yes, it's that loud. So, although there are some things I dislike about Yard House, I will probably find myself coming back again for Happy Hour for sure!

Reviews.Author: DanThu D.
Reviews.Content: Yard House- a new place to hang out in Santana Row. I like the big portions with very reasonable price they have there. The environment here is more like fun than glassy. It is good for group hanging out either for dinning or just having a beer while watching sports. The portions are hugggeee. I love the nachos appetizer and salad there. I don't drink beers, but I know they have many different beer types on TAP..

Reviews.Author: Samantha L.
Reviews.Content: Yard House down in southern cali was the only chain i actually liked.  It's usually large, dark, full of beer, and open late!  I was excited when they opened this particular Yard House in NorCal. I was ecstatic that they had one of my favorite beers - Boddington's.  Creamy yet clean. Two pints later and their Steak salad made me a happy customer.  Slices of steak, cheese, green beans, avocado, potato chips, and peppers. I get it every time and am never disappointed.Their beer menu is extensive and walking in you can see how many they have on tap. Their bar encircles the huge selection leaving plenty of bar seats for people. The flat screens everywhere make this a great place to go and watch a game.  I enjoy watching people drink the half yards.  It's a bit awkward in a booth (due to arms swinging and the size) but it reminds me of oktoberfest.  Yard house is suitable for families as well!

Reviews.Author: Alice W.
Reviews.Content: Pretttttty good,  but could be better. Downside: Price. Entrees are a little too steeply priced for what they offer. I don't like their imitation asian stuff, it's just NASTY. Last time we got the spicy tuna, and while it was probably my bad for not noticing that it's not spicy tuna rolls but spicy tuna ROLL (one giant mass on a plate).... I just really wasn't digging their attempts at asian. Heck, american food places that try the asian thing almost always fail. Stop trying. Please.We usually get the mac cheese2 (squared), but it's one of the more expensive things on the menu. Pretty dense entree, not thoroughly impressed...Anything else? Er...Drinks are okay. I'd probably just come here for drinks and appetizers in the future. Still, their mixed drinks are not the best I've had. To give them credit, this place does have pretty good ambiance and is always pretty poppin'.

Reviews.Author: Glenn L.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Yard House a couple of times for their happy hour!My friends and I decided to stop by here after a friend's birthday dinner. We were still pretty full from dinner, but we just couldn't pass up on their happy hour! Not much of a wine person, but I do enjoy a good beer or two! Service was really good thanks to our server Bernardo! We ordered our beers and some wings, onion rings, and truffle fries for appetizers. Food was alright.....!The other time we went here was ehh... so-so. We went here for a late dinner/happy hour! Our server was nice enough to let us know that their kitchen is going to stop serving food in fifteen minutes, which means "HURRY UP AND ORDER!" lol... I really appreciate how she TRIED to sound nice about it, but her facial expression said it all!  Once again we ordered the usual appetizers and beer! I was pretty hungry this time so I also got the shiitake garlic noodles (recommended by a friend.. it was pretty good, ...maybe I was just really hungry!)...4/5!

Reviews.Author: Janet T.
Reviews.Content: Come during happy hour, especially for a late lunch (starts at 3pm).  Otherwise, pass and go somewhere else!  Since it was HH, I was more inclined to splurge, so I tried the Pear Cider and Raspberry Ciders by the pint (Rasp is sweeter), the Turkey Burger Slider (made of ground turkey, not deli slices), the BBQ Chicken (which had an Asian zing to it because of the cilantro), and the Chicken Lettuce Wrap (perfect sweet and saltiness and tofo bits to balance it out!).  Let's just say for two people, we were full and had more than half a pizza of leftover.  All for a grand smackin' 30 buckeroos!Traffic and parking are key things to keep in mind, especially on Fridays.  Anyway, it's worth the first try for those who haven't been to YH yet :)  I didn't have to wait since I got there when the clock struck 3.  And the waiters were patient enough to let me move from a round booth.

Reviews.Author: Shanna K.
Reviews.Content: Eh.  I'm chalking this one up to another mediocre Santana Row experience.  I had a couple good beers here (Delerium Tremens and Back in Black IPA)... and boyfriend and I split a filet mignon that was tasty enough (Filet Mignon w/ peppercorn cream sauce, asparagus, roasted carrot and parmesan mashed potatoes) but it wasn't really worth the money when you take into consideration the overall experience.Service is excruciatingly slow because they are so busy.  Food is tasty enough, but too pricey for the large, loud, glorified sports bar atmosphere.   And there's no way in hell I'd wait in line here.   It's pointless.  There's plenty of less obnoxious places in the southbay to get an excellent meal and a well thought out cocktail or beer. All things considered, I might come back on a late Tuesday night for a happy hour snack and a drink but that's probably about it.  It is helpful that they are open late, but they are definitely not a destination restaurant, by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Author: Roselina R.
Reviews.Content: "If you build it they will come". . . I hear you Kevin Costner!  LOL.  Working with beer and wine aficionados turns my workplace into an alcohol-centric hive mind, and since the Yard House opened, the one constant foodie uttering has been, "We should check out the Yard House".Well, the opportunity finally arrived when it was time to choose a venue for our annual Halloween lunch.  Hello?!!!  A restaurant with tons of beer??  Perfecto!!**Reservations Lost**Reservations were made three days ahead for a party of 16, but unfortunately no reservations for us in the computer when we arrived.  This could have been a miscommunication though.  When I originally made the reservation the manager I spoke to mentioned a mandatory 18% gratuity that I had thought he said was an additional tax (he didn't say tax, I was just tired that day).  After the reservation was made I replied, "If this (18%) is a problem, I will call back".  I replayed the conversation, and I realized immediately that I probably misheard him, so I called back and asked the gal I had originally spoke to before being transferred to the manager if the 18% was a gratuity and she said yes.  No problem though.  The restaurant wasn't crowded, so they were able to seat us immediately.  Five stars for the quick fix!**Glaring Light**We were seated at a long table right in front of the booths facing Stevens Creek.  The unfortunate individuals, including myself, that were seated with a view of Valley Fair across the street, were treated to an absolutely annoying bright glare.  Something, possibly the cream colored building across the street; or the water fountain outside under the windows, was reflecting bright dispersed light into our eyes, so it was difficult to look directly at the person sitting across from us.  Noon glare in your eyes while you're trying to enjoy good company and a meal is no fun!The **Strawberry Lemonade** was fab and very welcome since I was dressed in a stuffy bear costume.  :)  I ordered the **Classic Cheese Burger** that came with fries.  The **Shoe String Fries** yum!  I was surprised, because I don't normally like thin fries, but these were good.  Unfortunately, the burger not so much.  The flavor of the burger was missing, but the singed burnt taste was unfortunately present.  For a medium-well burger, it was more on the dry side.  I liked how the roasted garlic aioli sauce was on the side, but I couldn't taste the flavor of the sauce whatsoever.  It could have been masked by the burnt taste though.  Several others in my party absolutely enjoyed their food.  The **Staff** here was super friendly.  They even took a group photo of us outside.  I think if you build a venue with the allure of beer as its draw then people will definitely come, but making an impression for repeat business is another story.  Maybe if I drank alcohol I would be persuaded to come again, but I don't, and unfortunately the entree I chose was not memorable, so no foodie cravings to draw me back here.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: Being that this is Cupertino, and that there is absolutely nowhere else to go, expect a longass wait in order to get seated or to be crowded to suffocation. The food and beer are great! I particularly like their belgium sampler, which consists of six different belgium brews that will fit any beer connoisseur's appetite. There is also alot of Tv's so you can catch just about any game that you might be interested in watching. All in all, this place is a great catch just too bad everyone goes here.

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: Food is ok here...nothing that blows me away.  The truffle fries were yummy.  Crab cakes were ok.  Firecracker wings were not spicy.  We did receive wonderful service from Katelyn though.  I enjoyed the raspberry and pear cider.  I would recommend ordering the pint and not the half yard stick.  It's hard to drink out of it...although it makes for a pretty photo.

Reviews.Author: Jay G.
Reviews.Content: Bird house, dog house, road house. I just found another house that people go to for happy hour. It's called Yard House. I needed to kill some time at Santana Row. Yard House came to mind and I had to see what this place was all about. Happy hour was happening and i was down for that.The place was pretty empty around 4pm on a Wed. No one was sitting at the bar so, I got to sit in front of the flat screen TV.  Brian was the bartender that assisted me. Very cool and attentive. I asked him about the happy hour specials since, it was my first time here. In no time he pulls out the menu with all the HH specials. For those of you know me, I can't drink beer. This day I decided to do so since I had my medication already. I went for a glass of a black & tan. I used the house ale instead of the seabass with it. It tasted delicious too me. It's been so long since I had one of these. As for my HH meal, I went for the pastrami sliders with garlic fries.Paying no attention to my food time, Brian informs me that my meal was running a little late. I was stuck on the football highlights on the TV. When my food came out it was hot and fresh. The meal came with five stuffed sliders. Brian also got me extra garlic fries for the long wait time. No extra cost for the extra fries. WIN! The sliders were hecka bomb! The pastrami was very tender. The cheese on it was nicely melted. The fries weren't over powered with garlic. They were just right. I was definitely happy with the HH at Yard House! I got to make it back here again. Brian, You are the man!

Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: Mac N Cheese! They should call it Crack N Cheese! So good I have dreams about it. Savory chicken, mushrooms, bacon, and drizzled with truffle oil. Everything else is peasant compared to this. I've been meaning to try the lobster garlic noodles... one day I'll get to you. Most every beer on tap to suit your fancy. I'll have a light crisp Boddington's plz.

Reviews.Author: Sally C.
Reviews.Content: The night was going well at first and after waiting the 1 hr and 15 min at the bar, my friends and I were finally seated. Food options looked eh, but we ordered and were out the door in prob 30 minutes.But OMG something must have gone horribly wrong with the ahi tuna sandwich I had because shortly after dinner, I was getting the WORST stomachache in the world. Pretty soon, after walking around for a bit in Santana Row...my dinner finally ended up in an ashtray in front of Urban Outfitters. I feel disgusting.

Reviews.Author: Jenann P.
Reviews.Content: Truffle fries, Hawaiian Poke, Beer, happy hour = yesBlue Crab Cake Hoagie = noAh yes, yardhouse! The environment of this place is very young. Definitely a place to kick back with your coworkers after work. Overall, the food here is good. There's a lof of variety. Kind of like BJ's but a bit more on the pricey side. I decided to go with something a little more affordable and tried the Blue Crab Cake Hoagie sandwich as suggested by the waitress. It was overly oily and not memorable. I got sick of the taste after four bites. On the bright side, they have lots of drinks! Rose Gaarden is tasted like juice! Perfect for women like me but they also have hardcore manly drinks for those bros too. Definitely check this place out!*Note: it does take over an hour for a large party on busy days unfortunately but that's expected of any restaurant this popular

Reviews.Author: Marlon T.
Reviews.Content: Happy hour is the time to go--so cheap.I ordered 2 good imported beers, Mac & Cheese, and Garlic Noodles, all for about $20. The pizzas were alright. The sliders were OK. The Truffle Fries weren't amazing. I would for sure, 100%, get the Garlic Noodles and/or Mac and Cheese. Get both since you'd be here during happy hour!The wait can be a while but maybe it was just busy when I went because it was the day after Christmas.Our server, Renee, seemed kind of pissed off for some reason. It didn't really affect us but I just got that vibe from her.

Reviews.Author: Cat P.
Reviews.Content: Ok so i'm upping my review of this place to 4 stars because of my last couple of experiences here. Once again, great selection of beer.  My faves are a blueberry one and the sunset wheat, which is like a lighter version of blue moon.  Sometimes I'll do the sampler and try out 6 different beers for a very reasonable price...which also gives u a goood buzzz. =) The food from the happy hour menu is pretty good and is also very affordable if you go during happy hour. Otherwise I probably wouldn't want to pay full price for some of these items.  And the regular priced items are all mediocre so I'd prefer not to order those.So to sum it all up, the best time to go to this place is happy hour, especially for the drink discounts and the happy hour dishes.  Or if you want a place to just chill on some beers, hang out with friends, and watch some sports, that works too.

Reviews.Author: Tina T.
Reviews.Content: Being 21 is bad for my liver. I've been here quite a number of times, especially during happy hour :) Drink and then feast!They've never failed me on the service part so far - everyone's been extremely nice and attending (for all of the times that I've been here, I've never had the same server twice)So far, for food, I've tried:- Chicken Lettuce Wraps: Love this stuff! - Buffalo Wings: MM! I love wings. These had the perfect amount of sauce on them and were very flavorful- Shittake Garlic Noodles: Had this twice, the first time it was good, the second time, the garlic was EXTREMELY overwhelming, but still good- Turkey Burger Sliders: DELICIOUS :( My Bestie introduced me to this one and I love it- Hawaiian Poke Stack: Their ahi did not taste fresh; I don't recommend this one. Maybe it was on a bad day though. I'm not sure- Truffle Fries: YUM!- (Mac + Cheese)2: Maybe because it was overly raved, but I didn't feel like it was very special. For drinks, I've had:- Wynder's Raspberry Cider: (Half Yard) Refereshing and fruity- Timmerman's Strawberry Beer: (Goblet) One of the beers that I will actually drinkOverall, I like Yard House. It can get pretty darn busy though, but not as bad as when it first opened :) TVs all around! Catch the game with good food and drinks; you'll leave full and happy :)

Reviews.Author: Lynn H.
Reviews.Content: I previously complained about an extra charge being put on my credit card by Yard House - turns out it was my fault. Kristi from the Yard House contacted me and researched the charge and figured out that I had "rounded up for charity." Because that money does not go to Yard House, it appears as a separate charge. I feel kinda like a retard. But it goes to show that this place has pretty amazing service. I appreciate that they took the time to research the problem!

Reviews.Author: Deanna Y.
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 9pm on a Saturday - estimated wait time of 1-1.5 hours for a party of 3. They don't take reservations, so arrive early if you don't wanna wait around! After my friends and I shopped around a bit to pass the time, we came back after an hour and they already called our name, but they still seated us next. Started off with an order of truffle fries - delicious! Thin-cut fries with a delightful outer crispy coating. I was expecting truffle shavings instead of a mere drizzle of truffle oil over the top, but nevertheless I wasn't disappointed. Still a good deal at 4 bucks a pop. I ordered a caesar salad, which was excellent - perfectly seasoned and dressed with homemade croutons and homemade parmesan chips - and the (Mac and Cheese)2 - campanelle noodles with cheddar and parmesan cheese, chicken, smoked applewood bacon, some earthy mushrooms, and truffle oil. Pretty good, but not amazing. The pasta was a little oily, but overall the flavors worked well together and the dish was satisfying. Our server was great as he helped me pick my dish after I asked him for recommendations (they have an extensive menu), checked up on us every once in a while, and our glasses of water were always full. We were seated right next to the kitchen though and had to deal with a constant stream of flustered waiters rushing by, but I did manage to catch a glimpse of an attractive looking onion ring tower that I think I'll be ordering the next time I'm here. Dimly lighted place, VERY loud atmosphere. I felt like I was shouting across the table sometimes. Not a good place for a date. With tax and tip, the meal was about $25 a person (no alcohol). Yard House is nothing to rave about and the menu is a bit overpriced, but they have some unique menu options and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. If I was in the neighborhood I would come back.

Reviews.Author: Mimi T.
Reviews.Content: What there left to say? Awesome happy hour, located in Santana row, and plenty of TVs to watch the games! Strawberry beer. Mmmmmm must try for those who don't drink beer very often but just wanna have a drink with friends. It gets loud in there so I wouldn't suggest going on dates here, it's not really romantic.

Reviews.Author: Lan N.
Reviews.Content: I guess with many restaurants there are hit and misses with certain entrees.A big miss was the hawaiian pizza the last time I went. Being bar type food, I thought it might be pretty safe to try. It was just sucky. No bubbling cheese. It looked flat and rubbery and shiny. Tasted like it too. Pretty unappetizing. I might have to say it was worse than little caesars. Just pass on it and get something else. I just felt sad eating it.Other dishes are good and plenty of beer to try. I'll be back, but never getting the pizza again.

Reviews.Author: Kelly T.
Reviews.Content: Nothing spectacular pertaining to the food, but it's a great place to come to for a get together. The food itself though is better than average like their chicken garlic noodles, their jambalaya, their Mac and cheese, their appetizer dip, and their sliders. Also, the surf and turf burger is yummy too.The drinks are what many come for. I've tried the snakebite, strawberry mojito, linderman framboise, blueberry sea dog and a few others.Its very worth it for their lunch and happy hour specials!

Reviews.Author: Anand A.
Reviews.Content: Great venue to hang out if you are in/out of town and don't have time to go out to the other nightspots. Yes, it's in a mall.... but it's a solid place.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: Happy hour is after 10PM on Sun-Wed nights only!!Otherwise they have plenty of beers on tap with entertaining yard-long beers!I would stick to appetizers and drinks, but if you decide to have a dinner here then the entrees are satisfactory.It gets super busy so don't get too mad at the servers if they take a while to get your orders. :)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: I don't think Yard House is that big of a deal. Sure, they have like a million beers on tap, but considering that I'm not the biggest fan of beer, it doesn't really matter to me.I feel like the food can be a hit or miss here. I've gotten the pastrami sandwich a few times, and I remember on one occasion the bread was soggy. It had never been soggy before, so I assume that the server left it out for a while before he/she delivered our food to us. Kewl dudes.My boyfriend and I have also had a number of dimwitted servers who have managed to completely forget about us, resulting in my bf having to flag down some other random in order to get the check. I know it's busy all the time, but it doesn't mean that it's okay to leave us hanging forever!I'll admit that I love their truffle fries, but I mean, I can't not love any kind of truffle fries.Honestly, for now, I think I'll stick to BJ's.

Reviews.Author: Jade W.
Reviews.Content: "Here's your pinot and your cranberry vodka....you should do an Irish car bomb" without eye contact and disappears behind the bar said our amazing waitress. My friends and I looked at each other shocked and were like done.Wine is $2.00 off during happy hour, beer starts $2.50 and cocktails were half off. And some of the tapas are half off. I tried the malbec, delish! and the pinot noir, great! The chicken bbq pizza $5 and all 4 of us ate well and the shitake garlic butter noodles - come on amazing!  Really how can you go wrong when your goal is to get smashed on a late Friday afternoon?

Reviews.Author: Josh K.
Reviews.Content: My friend said it best, most other bars in the burbs tend to be extra divey except in really trendy downtown areas (see: San Mateo, Palo Alto, Redwood City), and don't have great beer selections. So the usual bad taste in my mouth that I have for going to a chain restaurant isn't there because most Yard Houses bring class to otherwise classless locations.The bar appetizers are pretty good, though I wouldn't get dinner here. Nothing seems frozen so that's another plus considering it's a chain.It was surprisingly packed at 9:30pm on a Wednesday night... and kind of a sausagefest. But hey, Silicon Valley. This place is the only game in this part of town that isn't a windowless dive bar in a strip mall or a Cheesecake Factory (yecchh.) So kudos to you, Yard House.

Reviews.Author: Leslie Q.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night after a very (very!) stressful week with the boy and his relatives. It was way busy since it was a Friday night so we were looking at a 1 1/5 to 2 hour wait, including wait for the pager itself! Fortunately for us, we were able to get seats for the 7 of us about thirty minutes after we received our pager. The interior is dark with very dim lighting and the atmosphere is super loud. We were seated right next to the bar, and our waiter was a guy named Nigel. We were able to sample up to three beers per person, so I was able to sample (through double-dipping):- House Honey Blonde- Kilkenny Irish Cream- Timmerman's Strawberry- Sea Dog Wild BlueberryI'm not very fond of beer but have been trying to get accustomed to the taste so I stuck with a goblet (pimp cup) of Timmerman's Strawberry. Super fruity and barely any beer flavor. Also, the blueberry one tasted like muffins. I ordered the Bearnaise burger with sweet potato fries along with my beer and it was quite yummy! The entire table was able to share two orders of truffle fries, though the one on our side disappeared within seconds... ahah. Service was good and food/drinks were good so I would definitely come here again to try their beer floats!

Reviews.Author: Zachary C.
Reviews.Content: Went here for drinks and snacks. The place was bustling, we were planning on sitting at the bar, but with a group of 4 it was easier just to get a table. The waiter was super nice. He was helpful with the beer list and was very friendly. If I was going to Santana Row again I'd be willing to go back here again to try more of their menu and drink more of their beers.

Reviews.Author: Agustinus T.
Reviews.Content: Pricey but delicious tacos (carne asada, pork belly, veggie). Sweet potato (with delish and truffle fries were both good. Chicken tortilla soup was better than French Onion Soup which was pretty weak and watery. Onion rings were of the thick variety which I like.Mac & Cheese was quite creamy with a touch of truffle, nice but heavy. Chicken rice bowl sounds boring but turned out to be quite delish (because of the sauce). In contrast to fancy sounding lobster garlic noodles which people thought were just okay.Reserved for 12 people and got seated within about 15 mins wait during a week night.

Reviews.Author: John P.
Reviews.Content: We decided to go for the second tried. This time much better than the previous.  I ordered lobster garlic noodle and  gf had spicy jambalaya they were so delicious love it. the service was pretty good and faster didnt wait too long this time.  I would give 5 stars if the price little lower ( I know it's Santana row ) over all worth the money. definitely go back again soon .

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: I only eat her during the day when my company takes us out to eat.When I leave work sometimes I see lines at this place.For a chain place this place is good.And only in San Jose will people wait eat at a chain place.

Reviews.Author: Tee K.
Reviews.Content: Food isn't great.  Flavor isn't there.  The only good thing is the ambience n beer.  Beside that I don't recommend the food.  Seems like bar food with a high price tag...not meeting requirements.

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
